Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice staff, perfect if you want to be in Miami but not into the craziness”
Reviews.Author: ElenaUdin
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the nice hotel in the downtown part of Miami . The rooms are comfortable and quiet, with a nice terrace. Overall is pretty clean too. I love it because is out of the busy area of south beach. Inside the hotel there is a fantastic Japanese restaurant. We totally raccomand it and we will for sure be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint of heart (or wallet)!”
Reviews.Author: aisha1601
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a Kimpton hotel before so I knew a little bit of what to expect but this hotel exceeded my expectations! Overall, this was a good hotel for my purpose (precruise overnight stay in Miami, close to the port). Service Christian was on point! While standing at the front desk waiting to check in, another couple walked right by me and up to the counter. Christian (who'd just brought my bags in) observed this and immediately went around the counter to check me in. Less than 5 minutes later, I was up in my room getting unpacked. That's service! The entire staff seemed really responsive and I never had to wait long for anything. A few times I was greeted with "Mr. So-and-so" over the phone but this was rare (I have an ambiguous name!). Food Some of the best room service food I've ever tasted!! I didn't have time to visit the restaurants but other hotel guests were very pleased with their food as well. Noise Level There was a surprising amount of noise from above and beside me but absolutely NO noise from the hallways or the pool - which was right outside my balcony. Also, I had the dreaded room-next-to-the-elevator but didn't hear a peep! Amenities There was a full service spa and the poolside guests had their choice of both restaurant and bar menus. Speaking of the pool, there were plenty of cabanas/lounge chairs and even a separate sitting area in case water isn't your thing. Location Right on the water but slightly dodgy. I would have qualms about walking around there alone at night. Also beware of game night for the Miami Heat - the hotel sits very close to the Arena so the traffic can be a bear once the game is over. Extra notes There were only two negative things about my stay - there's a faint pet smell in the room which didn't bother me a whole lot but might set off someone's allergies and the hotel seems to sit in the flight path for an airport (international?) so planes fly overhead all day and night. Again, this was only a minor nuisance. The EPIC hotel is a splurge. Although children are welcome, it's not what I would label a "family" hotel. They seem to be aiming more for the 25-40 yr old set or the "It's only money" folks. For $200/night though, it was actually a pretty good room. If given a choice, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are 40 and under~ this is your place!!!”
Reviews.Author: DairyDancer
Reviews.Content: The thumping rap music accompanies far too many hours to appreciate this property in any way unless you are a fan of such perpetual pounding noise. Booking a Club Level ocean view room to enjoy the view and relax was impossible with the blaring sounds of the the pool below.. Enjoying a quite dinner outside at their Area 31 restaurant impossible!! The food is fabulous but the noise is unbearable. In all fairness it is a perfect spot for a certain age group ~ but not for a young at heart senior citizen looking for a nice relaxing week-end. We come to Miami several times a year and ths will never be on the list again! We love Kimpton properties but definitely Not This One !!! Staff in Club level. Exceptional but this cannot take away the anguish of having to stay in your room and still hear the pounding sounds of the horrid "music?" !!!

Reviews.Title: “EPIC hotel - how EPIC”
Reviews.Author: travels4fun_10
Reviews.Content: Awesome - a great hotel in a great location. Absolutely no complaints! Excellent staff, room service and room. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mainman200
Reviews.Content: First of all - the bell staff are among some of the most educated and pleasant young men I have met at ANY hotel. Christian and Matt are exceptional!!!! You guys make me feel as though you are my personal valet! Area 31 in a world class restuarant - thank you for making my business trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley P
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home in Washington, DC after a fabulous 2-night, 3-day stay here at the EPIC. Everything about this trip was simply amazing, and we cannot say enough good things about the hotel, from the attentive staff to the wonderful accommodations, to the divine food at the upscale, Area 31 restaurant. Upon check-in, we were greeted by the lovely Stephanie, who made sure everything was in order before explaining the hotel lay-out, and area attractions. During our stay, we dined at the Area 31 restaurant where we experienced the most incredible food, and were served by the ever-attentive staff, including Ryan, our wonderful server (his wine suggestion was delicious!!). The next day we were lucky to be able to lounge by the pool, and we were served by several incredible people, including Phillip, who was fabulous! and Christian, who was so accommodating! The next day we had lunch again at Area 31, and while it was very different from our dinner experience, it was delicious, and the service that John, our server, provided was exceptional. All-in-all, this was one of the most amazing stays that we have ever had, and we feel so lucky that we were able to find such a gem of a hotel, and have such a truly, unforgettable experience!! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Joshua K
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great rooms (We were in room 2412). I was slightly disappointed with the view at first (the Viceroy is directly across the river from us), but the deck is big enough that we still had a nice view of the ocean (the view grew on me after a while). We were also able to see the pool from our room, which was nice. Pros: The service was excellent, though sometimes you would be transferred 3 or 4 times before getting to the right department. The wine hour was a nice touch, and is worth checking out for the free mini-appetizer if nothing else (get there early there seems to be a limited supply). Within walking distance to Tobacco Road. Cons: My only real complaint is parking, which was a nightmare. During the busiest times it seemed like people were waiting 30 minutes or longer to get their cars, which is completely unacceptable if you're paying almost $40 a night for parking. You can save yourself the hassle by calling the valet about 15-30 minutes before you leave so your car is waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Jet-Lag Reduction”
Reviews.Author: SJCWHUK
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Miami from London and stayed in a suite here (#2701). Lovely big living room, bedroom and bathroom with nice views over the river to the sea. Only drawback that despite being on the 27th floor we arent the only building that high. Opposite on the same level is a fitness centre which allowed them to gaze across at two overweight men in ill fitting dressing gowns. Would have been better if that view was hidden for both us and them1

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: DocRobert2000
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with everything one could ask for in a hotel. A beautiful view, gorgeous lobby, great rooms, comfortable beds and first class service. We stayed here for a few days before leaving on a cruise and it was perfect. The location is great, yes there's a bit of traffic if you want to head over to South Beach, but I'd take this hotel over any in SoBe. The food was excellent and the service perfect. We stayed on the club level and the open/easy access to the club was well worth the extra cost. I would stay here again anytime and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: GothenburgProfessor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Epic hotel in Miami. It is a beautiful hotel with an ok downtown location, approximately 15 minutes by taxi to South beach. Our room was great and included everything that a five star hotel should include (among other things a very quiet air condition). Our rooms where on the 25th and 26th floor and as a consequence we were not disturbed at all by the traffic. A continental breakfast was included which was nice and the staff in the restaurant were very attentive. The pool area next to the hotel was spectacular! My only small complaints have to do with the fact that I had to remind several times before my Kimpton membership was acknowledged and that one or two of the front desk staff could have been a little bit friendlier (a smile would have done all the difference).

Reviews.Title: “The best experience!”
Reviews.Author: Vanu71
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Epic Hotel was the best experience I've ever had. The Hotel has breathtaking water views. The rooms are fantastic, The pool area is out of this world.The food in Area 31 was terrific. But the best part was the service. I felt as they treated us like family.I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property ..Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CAD4321
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property downtown Miami -- this is also in a great location. The staff is very service oriented. I organized a small meeting here and found the staff very accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Ptd1069
Reviews.Content: Lavish, clean & very friendly... Valet was off the chain too. Front desk hooked my son up with his own gold fish and bowl. Views were dynamite and bedding was sooooo comfortable. And the pool was just stupid good. Poolside food was fab and ate dinner at Area 31. No doubt a ten star establishment!!! Hooked on Area 31 & Epic when I'm in town from Beantown...!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimo”
Reviews.Author: Laurie1986
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure to stay at many Kimpton Hotels, but I have to say that my stay at the Epic Hotel in Miami was without a doubt the most outstanding service I have ever received. From the moment I pulled up to the front of the hotel to my departure several days later I was impressed with everyone I came into contact with. The decor in the hotel is very warm and inviting, the amenities were superb. The room had a picturesque view of the bay, which in my books is extremely important, as I love to have room service in the morning and soak in the surroundings. The location to downtown was ideal for my adventures to find good restaurants off the beach scene. I was very impressed by the staff at the front desk; upon my arrival I was suffering from a little jet lag and feeling under the weather. They offered an immediate room for me although it was before check-in time. Their politeness and compassion for me goes beyond excellent customer service. I will definitely return this year and highly recommend your hotel to everyone I know that is traveling to the area. Thank you EPIC

Reviews.Title: “exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: duchess13892
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the hotel, the staff, and the surroundings. I stay at Kimptons frequently and know that each is unique, with a consistency of service. I did not expect this! It was, big and luxurious with a personal touch. I would love this to be my new home away from home! Loved the wine, loved the view, loved my stay. Higly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Hotel = Epic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Katie F
Reviews.Content: Totally worth the visit, I would recommend this hotel to anyone! I'm a Kimpton loyalist and this is by far my favorite one. Beautiful hotel with a panoramic view. The pool is nothing short of amazing, if you didn't feel like you were away from home, the pool will do just that. I was on a business trip and having an appetizer by the pool was just enough time to regroup. The staff is so welcoming and reall go above and beyond to ensure your stay is perfect. I'm not a fish eater so I didn't love the hotel restaurants, but I can always find something, I just wish they had more options. Enjoy your stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Epic”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel! great pool and amenities. probably the nicest hotel I've stayed at period! staff was excellent, particularly the Head Concierge, Sonja H.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Vacation”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: What an incredible hotel. Took our family of five for a week and found the Epic Hotel to be extraordinary. We love Kimpton Hotels but found this one to be the very best ever. The service was extraordinary. The rooms were delightful with layout and the panoramic views stunning. Would recommend this hotel who want to experience Miami at its finest. Make sure to join the guests for wine hour. This is a very nice touch. You get to mingle with other guests enjoying complimentary wine.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Hotel. Epic Staff. Epic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Around T
Reviews.Content: My friends recommended this hotel so I decided to spent my birthday weekend and it couldn't be better. Since the moment we arrived they blew us away. There was a wine tasting when we arrived which seems to happen everyday and its complimentary. Then the staff who checked us in apparently read my notes about my birthday and welcomed us in such a special way, plus the warm amenity that was waiting for me in the room. Accommodations were top notch. Can't wait to come back! Thank you Epic!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Gracy A
Reviews.Content: I just want to comment on what a wonderful stay we had at the EPIC. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I really want to shout out to Farrah, Christian and Jeysa. They made the stay at the EPIC even more enjoyable. We will definitely stay at the EPIC again when we are in Miami. Love it!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “COOL!”
Reviews.Author: willclee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late January, 2012. Had a room overlooking Brickell Key. The room, lacking any other descriptive, was ultracool! My wife pronounced the bathroom as perfect, with a bathtub that you could soak forever in. The balcony was large, and although all we had time for was room service for breakfast, it was very good. In fact, it was sublime - what a great way to spend time in downtown Miami! This is not a hotel with worn furniture and a tired decor (a circumstance, unfortunately, that I'm seeing more of than in the past). Service is young, friendly, efficient and helpful. These kids make you feel welcome. I'm thinking, this might be the perfect spot for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business”
Reviews.Author: Iris17
Reviews.Content: Was there for a business. We had some problems with aircon, but all in all really good. Rooms were perfect, very contemporary, pool area was too close to business area, so I changed location for the weekend. Excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjpino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on a recent trip to Miami. We chose this hotel because we used to live across the water from it, so we knew the location and that it was new. The fact that it was pet-friendly was a big plus. The hotel is located in Downtown Miami, which makes it centrally located to all of Miami's hot spots. When I booked the room, I told them that we were bringing our dog with us. There wasn't an extra charge, which I thought was amazing, especially for Miami. Upon arrival, there was a water dish, biscuits and a welcome sign with our dog's name on it at the front door to the hotel. What a great first impression! The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean and trendy. Our room was decorated beautifully and there was a dog bed, food bowls and dog waste bags waiting for us. The bathroom was cool and the view of the city was very nice. This is a great hotel and we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June of 2010. Everything, from your first step, to minute you step out the service is outstanding. Beautiful Decor, good size balcony, a hot night club in the hotel. Everything about this hotel is great except the location. It's quite off from Ocean Drive and South Beach, a 15 Min drive.

Reviews.Title: “Epic stay at the EPIC”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler9724
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the EPIC last week and were very happy with this beautiful, new hotel. It used to be you had to go to South Beach to find fun in Miami - not anymore! One of the best sushi restaurants in the city is in the hotel, and I can't recommend enough the outside cocktail lounge overlooking the yachts docked nearby. Area 31 (on the 16th floor next to the pools) serves a reasonably priced breakfast and lunch, and is quite the party space after dark. The pools were very warm, and the crowd around the pool was mellow. Rooms and bathrooms are lovely, and wifi is free if you join the customer loyalty program. We liked it so much we looked at the apartments and townhouses located in the tower - very pretty and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but overrated and pricey”
Reviews.Author: Evhsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the club level where personal attention at the reception was great. However during our whole stay the receptables in the bath room did not work despite twice having called in engineering. One day we tried to get lunch on the terrace of Area 31 adjacent to the swimming pool area. We bypassed the normal entrance and they just let us sit there for 25 min although they passed us several times. It showed a lack of respect for their customers. At least they could have indicated that we needed to follow the proper entry. I would not say this was indicative for the overall service level because many others were really trying to give the best of themselves. However for the price paid the value was not there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: love2travel040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Epic for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. From the moment we arrived, staff was very attentive and made sure that all of our needs were met. Quiet rooms, comfortable beds, luxurious bathroom, wi-fi, beautiful view...it all added up to a fantastic experience. The only downside of this hotel is that it is the location. We like to get out and walk around to experience the city and find great shops and restaurants and there is not much around the hotel to enjoy. We ended up taking cabs to South Beach and the Brickell area to find the atmosphere that we like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for spending time in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Torsten-Maehle
Reviews.Content: I'm 24 yo andspent there one amazing week. The stuff is very polite, the rooms are very modern, clean and there was an amazing ocean view. The room service was excellent, they served ice and water the whole day without asking. The pool on the rooftop ist nice too. You can relax there, enjoying the great view and getting food served at your place. In the evening you can have excellent food at the restaurant Zuma or having a nice party night at Kyma-Lounge! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: tiglao
Reviews.Content: I am a Kimpton Fan. This, by far, is the best one we have stayed at. The bed was luxurious. Room is kept clean. The bathroom had a great layout. This time the robes aren't leopard/animal print like all the other kimptons had. Room service was excellent. We ordered Eggs Benedict and the Continental Breakfast (which included coffee and OJ) that cost us $38.00 which was worth having breakfast on the porch overlooking the pool and the bay. I was considering looking for a brunch place with a great view around the area (thinking that room service almost always is too overpriced), but we ended up enjoying the room service - no driving around and looking for parking. It was very stress-free - which vacations should be. The valet was always busy though. Try to call ahead in your room beforehand.. it helps to expedite it. Epic Hotel was perfect.. from Check-in to Check-Out.

Reviews.Title: “Return stay as good as first”
Reviews.Author: WhiteRabbit73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, clean, and modern. It is close to beaches, but must take a $20 taxi to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: mscg2000
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by saying that this was my first stay at the Epic. I have stayed at other first class hotels in Miami: Ritz Carltons at Key Biscayne, South Beach and Coconut Grove, and one stay at the Four Seasons. Some aspects of this hotel exceeded those of the above named hotels, and others fell short. 1.The employees. The good parts: I really enjoyed the attitude of the employees. They were friendly, helpful and engaging without being smothering or overly formal. It's a fine line between feeling comfortable in your conversations with employees and feeling like they are treating you just a bit too formally. I thought the Epic employees had it just right. In particular Christian, a bellhop who assisted me when I arrived, seemed to effortlessly understand how to be personable and helpful. He anticipated my needs perfectly, helped me choose the perfect room, and gave me several tips about he hotel as we first visited the Club lounge and then went to my room. He wasn't too formal or deferential, just a nice guy who was enthusiastic and thoroughly pleasant. The other employes were also excellent, but this one employee really stood out. I personally prefer this style of employee to that of the RitzCarlton. There we're no negatives regarding the employees. 2. The rooms. The positives; I stayed in a water view Club level room on the 30th floor (top floor). The view was spectacular and the balcony was huge. Very nice. The room's decor is modern, tan and white, very current in style. Furniture was nice. In particular, the lighting fixtures were exceptional, much more interesting than why you generally find in a hotel. The bathroom is large, with a very deep soaking tub. I think the Epic's rooms are as nice as any I've stayed in. The negatives: When I wanted take a soak in the nice deep tub, the water temperature was simply not hot enough to really enjoy it. This was in the morning and when I checked the water temperature later in the day, it was was plenty hot. Too many people using the hot water at once? Also, the TV is not up to par. The reception is not equal on all the channels. Fox was basically not watchable. I called the maintenance man, who arrived within 2 minutes. He worked on the TV for over an hour but he was unable to fix it. I was offered another room but I declined as it was too much hassle. Later in my stay I mentioned this to an employee who told me that "It's always like that. We tried to watch the Heat one day and the reception was awful." I expect better from a hotel of this caliber. 3. The food: I only ate in the restaurant, Area 31, once for lunch. I had the fish tacos and they were acceptable but not great. The prices were actually less than what I expected. I ordered room service once and the food was very good in general. It could be improved by including a glass of ice water instead of a bottle of room temperature water. The roll included was very average and there was not enough butter for the roll. The steak was very good, cooked exactly as ordered. 4. The Club lounge. The positives: The employees were great, very accommodating, offering to refill my drinks. Breakfast was very good; Salmon, bagels/toast, fresh fruit and whole fruit, granola and other cereal, a few pastries, juice, coffee/tea. Lunch offerings were also tasty: two kinds of sandwiches and two cold salads. Evening snacks: little crab cakes, egg rolls, cheeses. The negatives: The lunch offerings were exactly the same both days I was there. They were good, but some variety would help. The evening snacks were not as good: hot foods were not hot and the quiches were just plain lousy. There were no crackers for the cheese, only pita bread that came with some humus. Overall, would I stay at the Epic again? Absolutely! The ambiance is friendly, classy and cool. The rooms are very nice and the water view is great. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: funChicago
Reviews.Content: Sharply appointed. Clean. Wine served in PM, coffee in AM. But getting a non feather blanket up to my room took 3 calls and 1.5 hours.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: sideshow2
Reviews.Content: If able, I would give it a 4.5, but have no problem upgrading them (as they have upgraded me on both of my stays). The location is great with much to do in relative walking distance. The lobby is impressive. Check in and service is always first rate. The beer, wine, and food in the Bistro is considerably above par. The rooms are awesome with ample space, modernly elegant decor, and huge bathroom. The balcony is equally impressive with plenty of room, large chairs, and amazing view of the waterfront. The fitness center is well equipped. Who doesn't love a hosted wine happy hour in the evening with snacks? Only downsides: we like our bed just a tiny bit firmer and the ceviche is not quite 'all that'. Whatever, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: jimd1202
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Miami on business and stayed for 3 nights at the Epic hotel. The place was great! It was in a great location with awesome views from the room. I really enjoyed the morning coffee and evening wine hour it was a great touch and very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well located”
Reviews.Author: medox_de
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference at the Epic. Excellent and stylish rooms with a stunning view on the harbor and Miami skyline. The service is quite inconsistent from 'ok' to excellent; some stuff did not see when service was required on their own and just reacted when being asked to do so. Where the hotel gets marked down is the management of the venue facilities: The conference room was way too cold for 2 of the 3 conference days despite of multiple complaints. Some speakers suggested to burn the furniture to stay warm or asked the attendees to bring their blankets ;-) From a top notch conference hotel I expect to get such things fixed within hours but not days. Bottom line my perception is one of a very good but not a top notch hotel, although charging as such. Therefore I don't see the the high fees justified yet. They can get there but there is some service and facility management homework left to do.

Reviews.Title: “Business or relaxation; the best of both worlds!”
Reviews.Author: Sgoudeseun
Reviews.Content: I hosted a Board of Directors meeting with a group of about 20 people. I received nothing but praises from this discerning group! The rooms were modern, clean, and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurants was top notch and other restaurants are within walking distance. As with all Kimpton properties, there are evening wine happy hours which adds a nice touch after long days of meetings. I'd recommend giving it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our cruise and to be honest in hindsight I would have rather stayed at the Epic than go on the cruise....but that is another review in itself :) I loved the room, it was clean and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was really nice with double sinks and an amazing overhead rain shower head. My only complaint would be that the bed sheets were not soft enough. The staff was helpful and friendly and quickly upgraded our room upon realizing the one they sent us to was not ready. I would definitely recommend and return!

Reviews.Title: “very modern motif and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cliffview12
Reviews.Content: The Epic has some great amenities. They have a wine reception every evening and coffee and tea available in lobby each morning. We ate dinner in the restaurant on the 14th floor. The inside area was way too noisy. We asked to be seated outside and it was much better (ask to be seated by a heat lamp). Food was good, not great. There is no gift shop in the hotel but there is a CVS pharmacy two blocks away. There is also a nice walk/run you can take out of the hotel and around Brickell point. The hotel is very modern looking with sleek lines and very clean. We did have room service which was prompt and good. The staff was always willing to help and direct. I took the yoga class in the spa and it was fairly hard. I have been doing yoga for a few years and we travel a lot. Usually yoga classes in hotels are geared for the guests and aren't too hard. This class had a lot of locals in it and was pretty hard (level 2 plus). So, if you are new to yoga you might want to pass. I was ready for an easy class and had to amp up my energy level! Anyway, it's a nice hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel if you are a GQ model, 4 star for everyone else”
Reviews.Author: BulldogMatt
Reviews.Content: I would love to give the Epic 5 stars but I just can't. Not yet. I would return here again in a second, though. I stayed for one night and had wonderful service from housekeeping and valet. Thank you Housekeeping for cleaning my clothes last minute. The rooms are great and I had one with a wraparound balcony on Biscayne Bay. It was fantastic. Heard the planes land at Miami Intl and it sounded like they were landing on the roof. Why not 5...Front Desk was a bit standoffish as was the restaurant hostess. When I checked out, they had one Front Desk agent and about 15 valet attendants. The hotel is not in South Beach but a wonderful area with tons to do. I love Kimpton but am hoping they can improve here to 5 star level.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Kulwant P
Reviews.Content: The Junior Suite was nice but having traveled practically the world except for Australia and South America, found that the hotel provided nothing for free despite the very high room rate...not even a cup of black tea (which cost us $12 for room service!). Even the parking is $32 ans they insist on Valet service. Had to wait for 20 minutes for car and they was a congestion mess at the front of hotel..seemed very disorganized.So I say 5 star facilities with 10 star prices and 2 star service! Haven't had the breakfast yet... afraid might get disappointed! Like my wife said, even the cheapest of hotels provide a kettle with tea and coffee packets!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: frequentravelertwo
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, magnificent views, wonderfully professional staff. Would definitely go back. One thing to note: there aren't many restaurants or shops in the immediate viscinity, so had to hop on the monorail or take a cab to get to these. Otherwise, had a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: Delveling
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the EPIC. Room was a bit small but very trendy. Bathroom was excellent also big compared to the rest. Bed was OK, did not really sleep well in it. There is free internet in the room on a computer that is installed there. The best about the hotel is the pool terrace - open until late in the evening. The pool water is heaten and loevly to swim in under a starry night! the view and the atmosphere are absouletly fab! And also the free WLAN everywhere (you nedd to register as Kimpton member fisrt though). Location is good if you want to wak to bayside (only 20 minutes away on a really nice walk along the sea). Taxi to South Beach is around 25-30 USD and takes about 15 minutes. There are a few restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the number 1 Spot”
Reviews.Author: Scuder85
Reviews.Content: Got a corporate rate at the EPIC for 2 double beds and city views. When we arrived, the staff graciously upgraded us to a water view king. just as other kimpton hotels, the staff is friendly and professional. the room was large with a large balcony. we ordered food service one day for lunch and it arrived quickly and was good. the housekeeping staff was ontime and did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: TropiCAL2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre-cruise for three days in December at the Epic. A colleague had told me it was her favorite hotel in Miami. My husband said this is the nicest hotel he has stayed at. We had booked a water view room and the first one did not meet that expectation which they asked us to remain in the first night. We were moved to another room the next day and it was everything I had anticipated it would be. The room we moved to the second day was quiet without city noise and banging in the pipes we had experienced the night before. The balcony views were enjoyable. Rainshower was great. Bed was wonderful with comfortable sheets. Customer service was top notch. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very good. We had dinner one night in the Japanese restaurant on the bottom floor (and found out later it was not part of the hotel); it was overpriced and not much food - there were only a few things we liked so it was disappointing and we would not recommend eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Epic experience”
Reviews.Author: ordinarymind
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Kimpton properties. This one is a bit different from the typical Kimpton (which is often an older property redone to be an interesting place at something of a "value' rate)-- the EPIC is new, high end, full of "beautiful people" (who maybe have had some work done and maybe shouldn't be showing quite so much skin!). As a result, the experience is different-- this is "luxe" on a large scale with a lot of celebrity "wannabes". The pros here are: fantastic pool areas on the 16th floor, good gym/spa, wonderful views of the city and the water (we paid a bit of a surcharge to get to a really great junior suite on the 27th floor). The cons: the hotel was extremely full during our visit (due to a convention and the Miami marathon) and frankly seemed to be straining, and the place ain't cheap (at least this weekend). The elevators weren't working right, lines at the checkout and the front desk were long etc. All in all, the experience wasn't as "intimate" as the smaller hotel Kimpton experience. I was also of two minds about the restaurant on the property (Zuma-- very popular, very loud and seemed to have a bit of a "cooler than thou" attitude).

Reviews.Title: “oasis”
Reviews.Author: jolles
Reviews.Content: Because of an unexpected medical emergency we had to travel to Bascom Palmer eye institute in Miami from our Caribbean island residence. Based on Tripadvisor rating and an earlier experience in Kimpton Chicago we tried your website and found an excellent offer on dec 23 for the next few days; from the check in we were treated very professionally and friendly; because of our experience and the medical need to stay in Miami we had to extend our stay a few times and were given the same friendly rates for a total stay of 15 days.The room was spacious and offered a beautiful view. What we also liked: Area 31 Restaurant: superior food, very nice service, magnificent dec 31 dinner, very good wine recommendations by the waiter, sommelier Jose and the manager, who gave us his card but his name escapes me on the moment. On top of this we received nice discounts on our restaurant bills via "Open Table"; some dishes are engraved in our memory and will be tried to be resurrected back home; we have sampled 2-3 michelin star establishments in other continents before but this restaurant was the best.. Frontdesk and concierge: Not being allowed to fly back to st.Maarten and not being able to get cruise reservation, we were rescued by Andrew of your concierge desk who booked us our return to St Maarten via Navigator of the Seas. We are back in st Maarten and would like to express to all off you our appreciation. I'm sure we forgot to mention a lot of highlights but be assured that we have not experienced any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Is there anything more to add?”
Reviews.Author: renisans
Reviews.Content: I decided to go for it, reserving a room here for two nights instead of other excellent options like the Mandarin or the JW Marriott across the street. It was terrific. Great views. Excellent amenities. Free wine tastings in the afternoon. It definitely made my first visit to Miami a memorable one. I only hinted to my wife that this place could be good. She was impressed, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kskathome
Reviews.Content: A great looking hotel with wonderful staff. Extra bonus..A great location, especially if you like to run. Gorgeous scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: lcking82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic for two nights in January 2012. I was there for a meeting. I arrived late in the evening on Friday to a hopping hotel lobby with a busy bar and ridiculous amount of traffic. I was a bit overwhelmed at first by the expensive cars and scantily clad club goers, but checking in was actually very fast and I had a room overlooking the pool on the 23rd floor. The only way to describe the room is unbelievable. I was in a King room. There was tons of room to spread out and the room decor was fresh and modern but still inviting and warm. Floor-to-ceiling and wall-to-wall sliding glass doors led to a balcony with canal/city view. There was a tub and separate shower in the bathroom and double sinks, although not much counter space. The bed was very comfortable. Different types of pillows to choose from and a nice throw at the bottom, perfect for napping. There is an opening with a movable shade between bedroom and bathroom, arranged perfectly for watching television while soaking. The toiletries are even especially nice! A very good hairdryer is also available. Hotel amenities are nice too. Try the strawberry mojito at the bar and don't forget the wine hour from 5-6pm in the lobby! The pool is amazing and I only wish I had had more time to lay beside it! The fitness center was well-appointed. Even nicer than the fitness center was the fact that Brickell Key was within walking distance and it has a lovely running loop around it. Overall, this hotel was luxury defined. The price is high, but you get what you pay for! The only cons were the massive number of "status cars" in the drive made it hard to maneuver and the large number of glam club goers in the hotel bar. But really, it's Miami, and those things are par for the course. The rooms are all high enough that you don't hear the noise in your room. If you have the cash to drop here, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Miami Hotel a great value”
Reviews.Author: pgfla
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Epic in Miami and enjoyed everything about this hotel. Great restaurants, nice pool area, great gym and spa. You won't go wrong staying here. The rooms are nicely equipped and clean. Our room had a balcony with water view. The traffic noise was a little bad, but everything else made up for that small negative detail.

Reviews.Title: “How soon can I return?”
Reviews.Author: DCguy72
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels have never let me down, and this is one of the best. Beautiful hotel, lovely room, great staff. We were lucky enough to get upgraded to a fabulous corner room, with great views of the city and ocean. I just wish I'd had more than one night there!

Reviews.Title: “excellence with a family feel”
Reviews.Author: jwatsonusa
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. We always check with tripadvisor before we book anywhere and this property was rated #1. It did not disappoint! the front desk was very accommodating and the bell hop was energetic and friendly. We got up to our room on the 28th floor (the only floor that does not allow pets) and when we opened the door we saw a spotless, fresh room. As we opened the drapes and went on the balcony we had an incredible view of the Miami waterways. We had asked for a mini fridge and microwave (we were on weight watchers and didnt want to be tempted with the minibar) but they were not there. No worries, our bellperson contacted the front desk and within minutes both items were set up. The room had it all including an in room pc, flatscreen, huge rain shower, safe, nice bedding, etc. Our first room was part of two rooms that adjoined. In the next room were kids just being kids but the the front desk person could hear them through the phone when I called in. There were staying there a few days. One night I could have dealt with it, but not all week. They moved us down the hall to a room that did not adjoin right away. It was peaceful and very quiet!! We slept like rocks. There were many families there as it was Christmas break week. We upgraded to their concierge level that included access to a separate club room and 5 food and beverage servings a day. You couldn't get a steak to order but all the offerings had amazing fruit, cheese, cold cuts, breads, salads, and wine. Even with our diets we were able to get plenty of yummy things to eat. It was so convenient to not have to decide where to eat and how to get there three times a day. The staff at this club room was super service oriented. We did have a complaint. On a couple of occasions, there was a family with kids. Obviously different cultures deal with their kids differently but basically the room looked more like preschool- kids climbing on the furniture, yelling, running out, etc. The staff tried to be great babysitters, but there were several other couples and we just looked at each other in total frustration. Action needed to be taken. It was kind of like a hangout place for bored teens as well but we would upgrade again because the food was so convenient and fresh. Our suggestion to Epic is to put an age limit on the room of 16 years old and give the families with young ones a different place. The pools were top notch. They have the coolest furniture and the pools were kept at just the right temperature. Pool service was fantastic. We rarely had to look for anyone to help us. The restaurants were great. Some of the best sushi ever. We did drive to South Beach and got on the beach. Rented chairs. Nice. Hated paying $16 for a mojito that was less than tasty. But things were convenient considering how crowded it was. We had the best lunch at Havanas. Some of the best food ever, not just of the Cuban places we've eaten at, but any kind of food. After checking out the strip and some of the hotels we were thinking about staying at, we were very glad we stayed at Epic. Some of the nicest hotels were located right next to sidewalk bars that were sleezy. I'm so glad we didn't have to walk through that every morning. In the other hand, if you are a spring breaker on a budget, you should go for it. The area around the Epic was nice. Brickell is a few minutes away- shopping and food. Even closer are drug stores, wine stores, clothing shops l like Marshalls if you need an emergency pair of flip flops. It is safe and beautiful. You can walk around the promenade and see some amazing boats. Our only other complaint was that it is very, very pet friendly. Now, we own pets. We rescue cats and dogs. But they only have one floor out of a dozen that don't have pets. Problem is for me that I am allergic. It takes me a couple of days to get used to an animal and even then, I still have to take an allergy tab. So even though we upgraded to concierge level (29th floor), we had to stay on the 28th floor as it was the only hypo-allergenic floor. We didn't see too many pets. Just a few droppings by the sidewalk but those are really the fault of inconsiderate pet owners. There were no dogs at the pool or anything. One place I did run into one was at the spa/message place. As I got out of the massage room nice and relaxed a small dog that was off leash was barking at me. I didn't feel threatened but it was bad timing. I'm writing this more not to discourage anyone from coming but hoping that Kimpton will read this and make some adjustments. The gym was very well equipped and everything was working nicely. The staff is so friendly. We got to know many of them by first name and it was like we got connected with family members. Doesn't happen that way for us most of the time. The question always is: would you come back. Answer: YES YES YES

Reviews.Title: “Great view night and day.”
Reviews.Author: jotaemebe
Reviews.Content: We had a senior suite in the corner. The room had a huge bed and an all around window. Great modern bathroom and a very comfortable sofa that turned into a bed in the living-study room. The best thing was the view from the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SandraCRS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic from Dec 27th through Dec 31st. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, spotless clean and yet, comfortable. Service was polite, prompt and efficient. Even though the hotel was in a frenzy, packed with foreign tourists (like me), I did not have a single situation of distress. This is a hotel that I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the #1 ranking”
Reviews.Author: TetanusCreek
Reviews.Content: The Epic is wonderful. The new building is beautiful, with a spectacular pool deck overlooking the city. The staff is wonderful, as at every Kimpton property, and the rooms are huge and luxurious. The giant soaking tub in my room made me feel like I'd booked a spa rather than a room. It was exactly what I needed the night before the Miami marathon. There are great restaurants in-house as well. The only knocks are the neighborhood (meh, not many alternative food and bev places within walking distance) and the prices. But everything in Miami is high. You can pay 30% less for a room that's 80% worse. If you're on a vacation for pleasure (or have an expense account with no one paying close attention) book the Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read too many reviews. Just go!”
Reviews.Author: quattromd
Reviews.Content: Still here while writing this. I read a couple of reviews before booking this one. Like any other place, if u read too many reviews you'll end up reading things that will turn u off. I decided to go for it considering it's #1 rating overall. We stayed from Jan13 to Jan17. We were on club level floor 29. I must say the best part was the good service, cleanliness, the pool, views, and the Club Lounge and the staff their. Racquel, JP, and now Chris have made this trip really enjoyable. Club Level, I believe, is worth the upgrade. Zuma attracts lot of 1% ers. Area 31 had great burger and sandwich. A lot of great restaurants are at a walking distance. Hard to go wrong with this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! one of the best”
Reviews.Author: DanySar
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after seeing ratings on tripadvisor and was not disappointed! Words do not describe the quality and service of this hotel, excellent in every way. I am a frequent traveller both for business and pleasure and stay in nice hotels often, but the service here was unique in my opinion. The pool area is also beautiful and water was quite warm and comfy for an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: mickeyway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business conference. We got an amazing rate for this incredibly chic hotel. But beware on the valet parking after 9 pm as it is nuts! Beautiful people all arrive in evening due to three uber-hip restaurants and bars in hotel. Quite the scene after dark. Fortunately rooms are quiet and security is strong. Loved the large balconies and bathrooms. Free internet with personal computer in every room.

Reviews.Title: “The staff deserve 6 stars”
Reviews.Author: JHE
Reviews.Content: We are a Swedish Family that travel frequently and tend to choose a bit higher standard on hotel, We have been at more luxoriuos hotel but we have never been at a Hotel where all Staff was so passionated, comittet and eager to help you, they had a fingertop feeling when , where and how they should give you the service, we stayed at 30th floor and in the price we got access to a private lounge with dedicated concierge and great service minded people they really njoyd to help you booking restaurants servicen fantastic breakfast and small dishes and drinks in a balanced environmenmt. In the hotel they have 2 good restaurants one normal so to say Area 31 and one Fantastic ZUMA ( better than Nobu in S. beach) Rooms was big and spacious and service was great, we had one failure during our stay ( 7 nights) roomservice was relatively quick and 3 of us ordered Burgers with fries but my wife ordered a pasta, the Pasta was dry and really not up to standard, we called down and made a compalint and they changed it emidienly, however i decided to go down and talk to teh chef in charge not to make a heavy complaint more just to point out that it was not up the standard of this great hotel to serve a dry pasta. he did now abouth this and he asked us to jpoin for dinner that night, when we sat down they came in with a glas off champagne and a starter on the house and teh chef himself came out and apoligized, when it was time to check out the whole roomservice charge was removed. fantastic-- let me say like this if you stay here there is no way that you will not be happy Pool area is fantastic with cabanas and enoug of sun beds, SPA and workout are great. Lean back and njoy EPIC in Miami

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve at the Epic”
Reviews.Author: Druscilla109
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clearly not staffed or ready for the busy New Year's Eve weekend. Upon checking in our room was not cleaned. After being told we would be moved to another room and a bellman would bring the new keys we waited without result. We had to drag luggage to the reception desk, stand in line, and make new arrangements for ourselves. No upgrade or breakfast comp was given. Breakfast on the 16th floor was another mess. We waited 50 minutes for our food to arrive without even having coffee refilled. Food was cold and incomplete, had to get up to "hunt" condiments. Also had to try and flag staff for coffee. It was pretty but I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service, fab experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mnerlinger
Reviews.Content: The staff were phenomenal, the hotel accommodations and amenities were top notch, and we could not have asked for more. The pool service is fantastic and the concierge was brilliant - able to help with every request for both luxury and budget services!

Reviews.Title: “The Epic was Epic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kate P
Reviews.Content: I absolutly loved everything about my stay at Epic Hotel! I felt amazing while staying there and I was treated like I was a queen. I love the attitude of the staff and the facilities of the hotel. Everyone works as a team and you can see how well managed the hotel is becuase of this. From now on when I book accommodation I will be looking for a kimpton hotel as the one in NYC was equally as good. Also, the roof top pool --- AMAZING!!! It's worth staying at the hotel just for the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Bleach thrown on me off balcony”
Reviews.Author: mikeyz2281
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Epic for business and was eating at their outdoor restaurant and tasted bleach in my food. I immediately ran to the restroom and saw bleach spots all over my clothes. When I returned outside I looked up and realized someone who lives there (also residences) was pouring bleach off the balcony. They did comp my meal and buy me a new shirt which was nice. Overall hotel is nice & clean- pool, gym & rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in the world of Miami Vice”
Reviews.Author: jasonbagua
Reviews.Content: As other commenters have said, the name is appropriate. The service is second to none, and you really never have to leav the hotel because the restauramts and bars there are exceptional. We were there for New Year's, and spent it at Zuma downstairs because there was no need to go in search of a better atmosphere or party. The pool area on the 16th floor is relaxing and full service, and I could have easily wasted days there. It was nice to have a balcony with our room to enjoy the mornings and evenings on, and the rooms themselves are more than adequate. It's pricey, but you really get your money's worth. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Epic? Not quite”
Reviews.Author: TheTub
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Epic for a one night lay-over in Miami. Didnâ€™t want to stay on Miami Beach for one night only and was torn between the Epic and the Mandarin Oriental downtown (prices were about the same). In the end, I chose the Epic because itâ€™s much newer and has received positive press, not to mention its top ranking on TripAdvisor. A bit underwhelming, I must say. First of all, the very first thing one notices upon entering the hotel is the pungent smell of chlorine coming from the decorative fountains in the lobby. Not helped by the unpleasant smell, the atmosphere in the lobby feels very cold, with nowhere to get a drink sitting down: there is a restaurant at lobby level with a bar, Zuma, but you can only have a drink at the bar as the tables are reserved for diners; there also seems to be a separate lobby-level lounge, which was closed on that night; Area 31, the hotelâ€™s seafood restaurant on the 16th floor, also has a small bar area, which was, however, occupied. Seems to me they should serve tea/drinks in the lobby itself (where they have a few armchairs/couches), which didnâ€™t seem to be the case when we were there. The room was fine: obviously new and with the requisite amenities (flat screen TV, fee Wi-Fi if you join Kimptonâ€™s loyalty program, which takes 2 minutes, a desktop computer, pleasant enough bathroom with separate bath and shower, Etro toiletries, etc.). Like the rest of the hotel, however, the room did strike me of a kind of cheapish luxury, if you pardon the oxymoron. Also, the towels were quite harsh â€“ odd considering the fact that they must be relatively new. All of this is perfectly acceptable if youâ€™re paying 200-300 dollars for the room, but decidedly less so if youâ€™re paying 500+. The one positive feature of the rooms is the large balcony which, depending on where you are in the building, faces the ocean, other downtown skyscrapers or a mixture of the two. As to service, the bell hop who greeted us upon arrival and showed us to our room was very good. However, the receptionists at both check-in and check-out were very much like automatons, repeating pre-prepared blurbs as if they were robots. Similarly, the hostess at Area 31 had left her charm at home. The only food I tried was at Area 31 for breakfast, which was fine. It did, however, cost $35 for a couple of fried eggs on toast with some bacon on the side, a cup of coffee and a glass of orange juice. The orange juice in particular was $6, which, to me, seems a bit steep considering it came out of a carton. Once again, like the rest of the hotel, the dÃ©cor of Area 31 felt rather anemic and generic to me. Didnâ€™t dine at Zuma but it was obviously very popular, drawing in the chi-chi crowd in flashy cars. Instead, we ate at the local outpost of Daniel Bouludâ€™s Bistro Moderne, at the Marriott Marquis opposite the Epic, which I can strongly recommend. The restaurant also has a fine bar with excellent cocktails and a much more pleasant atmosphere than any of the Epicâ€™s offerings. There is a reasonably large pool area on the 16th floor, which we didnâ€™t use given the weather. Had a stroll through it though and it seemed nice enough, with well equipped cabanas on one side (with TVs, etc.). Reminded me of the pool area at the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas, though not quite as nice. Also, I couldnâ€™t help but notice that quite a few of the mosaic pieces in the pool have come off; once again, quite odd considering that the hotel is new. As an aside, downtown Miami, at least the bit where the Epic is located, is even more dead than I had imagined. All you have is office blocks, residences and a few hotels (in the immediate vicinity are the Marriot Marquis and Hyatt opposite, and the Viceroy across the bridge; the InterContinental and the Mandarin Oriental are also nearby), with, literally, nothing else. I wouldnâ€™t want to be there any longer than one night, unless youâ€™re there for business. All in all, if I had to stay in downtown Miami again (quite a big if) and was willing to spend $400-500, I would certainly stay somewhere else (probably the Mandarin). The Epic is certainly not worth that much. P.S. The name is just ludicrous.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gmccar1
Reviews.Content: A smart modern hotel in a good location. Staff are switched on and keen to please. Area 31 restaurant a bit overhyped and menu is average quality and quite expensive. Pool is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Miami Chic”
Reviews.Author: FoxiBoxi
Reviews.Content: Such a fabulous stay at Miami's downtown Epic hotel. The staff was wonderful, the views were fantastic from our hotel balcony, and the food was amazing. You will likely need to drive to your other destinations, but we spent a great deal of time just enjoying the hotel amenities. The club downstairs was packed for New Year's Eve, so we just partied on site! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Restaurant and a Great Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: BensSaints
Reviews.Content: Before leaving on our cruise we decided after great recommendation to stay at the EPIC and it was EPIC. The Hotel was just beautiful, 2 magnificent pools, cabanas with the best views in town and a great staff to go along with it. The restaurant Zuma was amazing, as many people voted it as the top in Miami we had to try it. With great food and an incredible atmosphere at night it was a spectacular evening.all in all out of the many Miami hotels i have stayed at this was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to end the year!”
Reviews.Author: maudedog6
Reviews.Content: We came off our Amazon cruise and stayed at the Epic Hotel for the New Years. What a great place. The Hotel staff were fabulous, the location was perfect for seeing the fireworks and the facility was pristine. One particular staff member made our stay special. Christian Betancourt dropped off our bags that had arrived late to our room. He showed us how the room worked and all it's particularities. Later, he was helping us at the front desk with directions and recommendations for dinner. Our last encounter he spent 20 minutes on our cell phone giving directions to our shuttle driver who was lost and he still managed to get other guests taxis, direct traffic and help load and greet guests as they arrived. Exceptional service which was typical for all the hotel staff we encountered. First trip to Miami but not the last. Paul M

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: malbecblue
Reviews.Content: First the positives - on arriving at the hotel, you can't help but be impressed. The hotel is in a lovely location next to the water, and has a beautiful grand lobby. The check-in was easy and the bellhop helpful with the luggage. The room itself was also very large - much better than I was expecting, and has the feeling of a boutique hotel. My only negative comment on the room itself is a lack of shelf space for clothes. There's plenty of hanging space, but if you are staying for a few days and want to unpack, then there's really nowhere for flat packed clothes. (Which is surprising given the sheer size of the room). What was also good was the terminal in the room with free internet access - though it regularly crashes even browsing CNN. At this point, I was impressed and could understand the superb rating it has on this site. However, now for the not so good. It seems as soon as something isn't quite right, the staff don't seem to know how to respond, and so they let the whole hotel down. Call me old fashioned, but I kind of hope my room is thoroughly clean when I move in, so don't really like seeing another person's nail clipping on the floor next to the bed (which stayed there the full 3 days- so they obviously don't clean very thoroughly at all). As well as this, I also reported two broken lights in the room which weren't fixed during the stay. There were many lights in the room, so it wasn't a huge issue - I would just have hoped, given such stellar reviews that the hotel has, that it might have been fixed at some point during my 3 days there. The worst aspect for me was the valet service, which seemed a bit of a shambles. I only hired a car for part of my stay, but was disappointed with a 15 minute wait in a long line of cars on driving into the hotel for the valet. Also, for collecting the car they suggested calling down 15 minutes before needing the car - which I did, and when I got downstairs the car wasn't there. I had to wait a further 10 minutes for a valet to go and get it as they didn't know I'd called down. I complained to the valet to ask what I needed to do, given that I'd called down, in order to get it quicker next time. He apologised and said it was due to a trainee answering the phones who didn't know what to do. If that's true, then it's appalling they let someone answer the phone with no training. When I commented to front desk at the end of my stay about the poor valet service I'd had, the lady just smiled at me and said "there are always problems with valet services". Not quite the service recovery I might have hoped for from such a quality hotel. I'm glad I didn't need to use the valet for my whole stay - it would have driven me insane. Finally the concierge - although very helpful, when I asked a question he answered my question to my friend rather than to me, which I found a little rude. A minor point perhaps, which I wouldn't even have commented on had it not been for all of the other disappointing aspects, but it was another aspect of liaising with staff that I was disappointed by. Good service for me comes from maintaining good eye contact with the person asking the question! So, the hotel is stunning, and if you have no need to interact with the staff, you would be hard pushed to find a better appointed hotel- and it really is very beautiful. But in my case, some of the staff let down what could otherwise have been a 5 out of 5 review. I hope it improves so that the hotel can really deliver to its high potential.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markZoom
Reviews.Content: Many people have left reviews about this hotel so I'll keep this short. A fantastic hotel with great facilities, fab rooms and friendly helpful staff. The waterfront rooms have the best view. If you are visiting Miami then you must try this hotel. Absolutely flawless in every way.

Reviews.Title: “ROYALTY”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I was extremely impressed with this property. From its staff, restaurant, pool, views, to bathrooms in room, top notch. The quality of the front desk staff was exceptional! I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalsaDancer77
Reviews.Content: After a harrowing experience at a rental home, The Epic welcomed all of us (my kids and Chewy - our border collie) with open arms. I was a bit of a mess and asked the bellman to get me to my room as quickly as possible - and he did just that. My room was spectacular and I wish I could have stayed in that bed for days - next time I will. We were treated as if we were part of "the family" and that was welcomed by all. The concierge in the club room, as well as the staff, went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. There were a few bumps during our stay. However, a wonderful manager, Brent, apologized and made everything right. I travel for business and will definitely make The Epic my home when I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: nirav01
Reviews.Content: As my title reveals, i had very mixed feelings about this hotel. Even though i booked this hotel with the positive reviews i saw on this website, i would have hoped i could say the same. Things didnt go well from day 2 as we were shocked to see that our rooms was not made up and nothing hadnt happened till the 3rd day EVENING. This was notified at guest services and they werent able to give any explanations. Day 2 Breakfast- To our dismay we came across a very rude and ill-mannered waiter, who seemed to take out his personal problems to work and show them against other guests. It was quite noticeable that he was quite a depressed man who wasnt enjoying his job. I was with 2 young kids and was on holiday so i didnt really say much except have my breakfast and leave but did make it a point how dissapointed i was with the waiter who eventually was shouting across the breakfast room to me and embarrassed me in front of other guests. This was told to the manager at the time but as i thought all they could do was apologise in behalf of his staff. I definitely would not be staying there again and neither would i be suggesting this hotel to any of my friends/families. I chose this hotel with great expectations/ maybe i expected too much, but i totally was not impressed. I so wish i could agree with the majority of the reviewers of how good this hotel is and service.

Reviews.Title: “The best concierge ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ekeinde O
Reviews.Content: As advertised, the hotel has nice views, a wonderful in-house restaurant, cool lounge spaces and bar. Still the best thing about the place was the service, and most especially the concierge Glen. From the day we got there he was so helpful with giving us information about where to eat and shop and how to get around town. We were expecting a package which was to arrive the morning we were to check out. Glen was on the phone with them all morning, tracking it down like his life depended on it. The package arrived after we left for the airport, and he hopped in a cab and brought it to the terminal for us! The best service and customer care ever. Thank you Glen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for High Class Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: bengals09
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, excellent rooms, and great views. The staff goes over and above to make sure every need is met. We enjoyed the food and the ease of access to South Beach. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel best professional service”
Reviews.Author: savvas189449
Reviews.Content: We were making our honeymoon,i just mailed the hotel of telling them to make us a reservation at the zuma restaurant inside the hotel.a lady jenifer hernadez that work there made our night like a dream.all the staff knew we were in our honeymoon and they treat us perfect.they gave us a corner magical suite with view of the miami skyline.the room is with very high quality products very modern as all thehotel is.the room had a champagne from thehotel for our honeymoon.the zuma is thebest restaurant in miami.modern crowd and very nice fusion cuisine.we didnt want to live the hotel and theroom sure we return back cause everything is perfect.the staff too.thank you jennifer and thanks to anyone in kimpton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unique experience !”
Reviews.Author: georgios m
Reviews.Content: the place - the view - the rooms - the staff - the details - the customers - everything was great

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here and again, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: rachelnyc23
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. My husband and I love to drive to Miami while visiting family in West Palm Beach and stay at this hotel, just for a night. The people at the front desk are just so helpful and wonderful--they truly want to make your stay perfect. We were upgraded to a better view instantly---why shouldn't a hotel upgrade you if they have the availability? More hotels should do this! As for the room, it was perfect, spacious and clean. Unfortunately it was very windy so we didn't exactly enjoy laying out by the pool but the employees at the pool was very helpful as well. I plan to stay at the Epic everytime I'm in Miami--no reason to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Miami”
Reviews.Author: sbajaj621
Reviews.Content: The staff here is impeccable. I came by myself for a single night for the Masquerade Motel music festival in March (during Ultra). My initial hotel overbooked and I was left without a room during a time when every hotel is booked! I frantically called every hotel in Miami and was very fortunate to have called Epic and was told that I received their last available room as someone just cancelled a few minutes earlier. I am familiar with Kimpton hotels but from what I came across....WOW! Gorgeous property in downtown Miami. Beautiful rooms that I couldn't have asked more from. Looking forward to the next time I can visit this area and this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Epic time at the Epic...”
Reviews.Author: P0cketAces
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic recently for a few days and had a great time. The staff is friendly and helpful. They have a nice bar on the 16th floor which was fun to visit. We upgraded to a 1 BR suite which has amazing water view. The parking which people rightfully complain about isnt so bad. We always called 15-20 minutes ahead and the car was always waiting for us. They do a good job of reminding you about that as well. We used the spa and the massages were very good. All in all it was a great trip, however we would probably try another place next time as there was nothing especially memorable about the visit, and we saw plenty of other places that appeared nice. Our reason in choosing it was mostly the high rating on trip advisor

Reviews.Title: “Attended awesome wedding, stayed for wonderful 2 days extra.”
Reviews.Author: Elena K
Reviews.Content: Attended a cousins' wedding on November 27th at the EPIC. We were greeted by the most personable staff in their grand lobby. Our rooms were luxurious, with extremely comfortable and luxurious bedding and amenities. The wedding was beautiful.The preparations to every detail by the staff and their attentiveness to the guests and the bride and groom, were evident throughout the night. We stayed for 2 days extra because the health club, quality of their pools and pool area, fit our needs after an exhausting Thanksgiving weekend. Would love to try other Kimpton Hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “The second time around....”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Is better than the first time. We just returned from a 3 day weekend at the EPIC. We had been there about a year and a half ago and I also rated it 5 stars although there were a few kinks to work out. Well, work them out they did. The rooms have extremely comfortable beds, the cleanliness was incredible. I ran out of complimentary water and I asked a housekeeper and within minutes she had 4 bottles at my door. The bathrooms have a great rain shower and beautiful sink vessels. Complimentary coffee and tea in the morning at the lobby along with a wine happy hour are just bonuses. We ate at Area 51 and I can't say enough about the new chef. Gym is awesome. Even the valet was great. From the moment we got there until we left everyone, especially front desk outstanding. Don't go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel (and great for bf/gf to relax by the pool)”
Reviews.Author: Charlie C
Reviews.Content: What a perfect business hotel. This was about 10 minute walk to my office in Brickell and a nice walk at that. The room was super comfortable, great features with the bath leading to the bed and a wonderful power shower. The pool was gorgeous, the upper level is a nice touch and the guys around the pool are super-attentive. The food is delicious by the pool (especially the chicken wings!!) The free wine event in the evening is also a nice touch. Great location, but not a holiday / party relaxation hotel. Just perfect fro business. I can't wait to go back there on my next business trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: Firizarry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! But beyond that I have never had such service in my life. From the front desk to the asst manager of houskeeping there were personal touches everywhere. I travel significantly for business and this will be the hotel I stay in from now on in Miami. Plus the room is huge!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gallivanter152
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Epic Hotel in Miami. I felt like the service was excellent from every one I came in contact with. The room was very spacious, very clean and very comfortable. Very nice bathroom soaking tub! I loved the view from my large balcony. The pool area is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diann C
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the EPIC Hotel and found the staff to be very attentive and friendly. The location was great for taking relaxing walks and the views were wonderful. I travel every week and this hotel is one of the best out there.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Basel stay”
Reviews.Author: billtstudio
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Epic was absolutely perfect. Clearly the management of this hotel has very high standards and trains their staff accordingly. Aside from the physical luxury, the personal treatment by everyone working there is exemplary â€“ a lovely combination of friendliness, professionalism, and enthusiasm. One could never leave the premises and still have a highly rewarding stay in Miami. The pools are incredible, great yoga and exercise facilities, and both restaurants are top notch. Its location makes it convenient to both the Wynwood area/Design District and also the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annette S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kimpton for Art/Basel and we were delighted with our room. It was over the Miami River and we had a great view of the city at night. The service and friendliness of the staff, especially in getting taxis, was genuinely helpful . It turned out to be a good location as the parallel events like Scope, Red Dot and Art Miami were in Wynwood and the convention center is in Miami beach across the bay. So the hotel is in the middle location. For us, being way over 21, it was great -- at the end of the day -- to get away from the crowds. There's even and excellent Exhale spa!!! If you love the Kimptons like we do, there is a new one in Miami Beach that is in the noisy excitement and on the beach, with a pool and even its own art event!! Something for everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the end of November, the front desk staff and concierge were amazing. The Area 31 restaurant was great, very fresh seafood. I wish I could have stayed through the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay at the Epic again!!!”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodGeneral
Reviews.Content: First of all, we've stayed here many many times and yes we are Kimpton in-touch members. Have always loved this property and been loyal guests since the day they opened. We became very close with the staff. One young lady on our last stay was so happy to see us that she ran out and hugged us.At the end of our stay she gave us her cell# and asked that we either call the front desk and ask for her or call her cell and that she would be booking our stays personally from here on out. GREAT!!! I called her months ago. Told her that we were surprising our daughter for her sweet 16 as well as a Christmas present for our children, by bringing them to Miami for the first time and letting them experience the Epic as we have. She said that she thought this was soooo great! Told me what she had available and the cost. She also said that this was a "special rate" that she had her general manager approve. I said we'll take it! She never texted me back. I have been calling her cell and texting her over and over. Finally I called the hotel and asked to speak with her. She's ALWAYS on lunch or just not in, so I'm guessing she has told the other staff at the front desk to tell me this. I finally called in and talked to another staff member and told them that I was only trying to book the room and need some assistance. I told her the price that this young lady quoted me(which she said she had approved by her manager) and she said no way and doesn't undersatnd why she would tell me this. So now we are stuck rushing to find something for my daughter's b-day because of your employees dishonesty. I guess I'll send her one last text thanking her for ruining my daughter's sweet 16 and kids Christmas and be done with the Epic,unfortunately!! Hopefully she's not doing this to any other guest as you'll begin to lose lots of valued customers as you have lost us.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Fontainbleau in Miami Beach but have ventured to a few other hotels on our recent stays. We had a great experience here Labor Day weekend of 2011. We did a kid-centric weekend this particular stay: Children's Museum, Seaquarium, Coral Castle. The rooms are gorgeous. The first night we had a regular room which had amazing views of the river and the second night we moved to a huge suite that was gorgeous. The concierge was very helpful in getting us both dinner reservations and a nanny so we could grab a late private dinner one of the nights. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a GRACIOUS GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: drjjobi
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my conference only required a one night stay at this elegant facility. The entire staff demonstrated the 'can do' and 'my pleasure' attitude at every opportunity. Having lived in Miami in the past I can truly say this is a destination for those travelers seeking the very best in accomodations and service.

Reviews.Title: “Epic lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: Dukes24-7
Reviews.Content: 7night stay September 2011. Fabulous hotel, great rooms, great service, in particular Marcus at the front door and Andrew at the concierge, but all staff were awesome! Were were upgraded as part of our honeymoon and also had champagne and strawberries on arrival :-) Pool area was lush, pool attendants really look after you, food good, and has Zuma restaurant in the lobby (the spot to be) 20min taxi ride to SOBE around 30$, so was a bit out of the way, especially as not a lot to do downtown area, but epic great just to relax. Capital Grille across the road so definitely make sure you visit there. We had a couples massage which was nice, but slightly overpriced at around 350$ for both of us. Thank You For A Great Stay Epic!!! Only slight negative was that hotel does not have its own car, so you have to grab a cab, but not too much of an issue...

Reviews.Title: “A true 5-star experience”
Reviews.Author: SKfromCA
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. The property is beautiful and incredibly well-kept. The staff are incredibly helpful and make you feel welcome and valued.
