Gene, the concierge, goes above and beyond to make sure you get the most out of your experience. Our room was incredibly beautiful and had a gorgeous balcony. The pool is absolutely stunning. Plus all the great Kimpton benefits if you join KimptonInTouch - free wine hour, free wireless internet, free raid the mini-bar coupon - ! Don't forget to ask for your pet goldfish while you stay with them, it makes the place just like home except way, way nicer. The only downside to the Epic is that it's not on south beach, but the experience they provide more than makes it worthwhile to hop in a cab. Plus, who needs the beach when you have a pool like this?!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad it was only for one night”
Reviews.Author: Jeis0n
Reviews.Content: We spent one night only at Epic, but IÂ´d sure come back for more. ItÂ´s very well located in downtown Miami. New contemporary architecture and interior design along with a calm atmosphere bring a sense of comfort and wellness. Truly excellent accomodations with a breathtaking view of the bay. Miami has a lot to offer in hospitality, but I feel tempted to stay at Epic Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Matched all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Normanzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights following caribbean cruise. I chose the hotel after studying previous reviews. We stayed in a beautiful room on the 29th floor club level with a waterview one could die for both day and night. The club concierge christopher and gene were extremely helpful. In fact all the staff were great. The location is excellent easy to get to, quiet but near enough main sights and highways. Not cheap but value for the money. This is my first time at a Kimpton hotel. With this quality i'll definitely seek out their hotels for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: KazIsrael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic for a long weekend a couple of weeks ago as part of a 25th anniversary trip. We stayed there because of rhe reviiews we saw on Tripadvisor. From the moment we arrived we enjoyed our stay. From the entrance with the hotels own private docking area for private yachts and the cool cars parked outside, to the welcoming staff who greeted us at reception. Everyone we encountered believed in service with a smile. We had a one bed roomed suite with a view like no other. amazing. Close to downtown, and Bayside market area, plenty of places to eat out and hang out. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “High End Hotel for HIGH END People”
Reviews.Author: PaintedCanvas1975
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Cab, and the entrance was jammed up with cars. We checked in, which was easy, and the person that checked us in ask if we were celebrating anything. I told him we were there to celebrate an early 35th birthday for my wife. He had me fill out a paper to get some complimentary strawberries and champagne. The elevators are fast, and got us to the twenty floor quickly. The room is Beautiful. The bathroom was large (double sinks and Large tub, and shower stall), and the bed was comfortable. The balcony was huge, and we had a great view. We changed and headed back downstairs. It was raining so we took a cab to a Mexican place about 5 blocks away. We spent some time checking out that area, after it quit raining and headed back to the hotel. We tried to go into the club in the hotel, and I was told I wasn't dressed for the club. So I went upstairs to change, as my wife and friends waited for me. We decided to check out the Asian restaurant bar, but it was too packed and we head back to the club. We were then told there was a private event and we couldn't get in. Everyone was very upset and annoyed, so my friend and I walked down to the Walgreens, 3 blocks away to get alcohol for the room. My wife and her friend went and said something at the front desk, and the person at the desk (the same person that checked us in) went over and said something to the door man, and when the desk person return, he said there was no private party, and we could go in. We DID NOT return. I would never set foot in the EPIC hotel again because I should never be made to feel like I am beneath the door man. We partied in our room and had a good time. The next day, the black out curtains in the room worked well. The shower drained a bit slow, but overall everything in the room was great. My wife and her friend got a massage together, and they had a great time. Only negative was my wife's friend got her nails done, and the girl gave her a guilt trip about giving her a tip on the credit card, so she called her husband to come down and give her a cash tip. While they were at the spa, my friend and I went to rent a car at Advantage rent a car (dirtiest car I have ever rented) To park the car at the hotel is $32 a day. CRAZY. We ordered room service together, and they brought the champagne but never brought the strawberries. We went out to explore Miami more that evening. When we checked out on Sunday, I told the front desk person that the drain was slow in the room, and that we never got the strawberries, so she ask if it was OK to comp me the room service that we received the first night. I said yes, that was fine. Cool feature is there is a door bell for the room, and if you have the privacy button turned on, the door bell will be red, and no one can ring your bell.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: asnpcwiz
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just got back from a 4 day long weekend in Miami. We stayed at the Epic Hotel and have to say that this is definitely one of the nicest hotels in Miami. To be honest, I've only stayed in 1 other hotel in the art deco district and my wife has stayed in a couple more than me. Either way, we both found this to be the best hotel we've stayed at in Miami, and one of the nicest hotels we've ever been to. We've stay at many Kimptons, and enjoy the luxury accommodation with the friendly service that comes with Kimpton. This is the nicest, and largest Kimpton we've ever been to. It's amazing to pull up to the front and see the huge yacht's that are at port. There are also some beautiful cars that stay/visit the hotel, we say Porsches, Ferrari's, Lambo's, Bentley's, Rolls Royces, R8's, etc...all within 4 days! Again, my hats off to the staff members here. They treated us like royalty even though we pulled up in a cab from the airport. Great poolside service each day as well, these guys were on point with laying out towels, refilling water, and with food service. We will definitely be staying with the EPIC again!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, sophisticated, elegant, clean, lovely”
Reviews.Author: Davcan
Reviews.Content: This hotel, and residence, offers excellent customer service and a clean, lovely, chic environment. The room wasn't ready when we arrived at 3 so they sent us to the terrace bar on the 16th floor. It was a Sunday afternoon and just lovely. Our room, when ready, was larger than most NYC apartments. The view was incredible, the soaking tub enormous, the bed clean and comfy, the balconies inviting. A nice touch is coffee in the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuskokaTraveller32
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels. The service is the best I've ever had, rooms are great, amenties are amazing - Beautiful! The pool lounge area is excellent, fitness center is perfect and they even have an infared sauna in the ladies area and a co-ed sauna available for use. I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and would strongly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, again”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoPAntunes
Reviews.Content: It was our second time in Epic, now with our family. The rooms remains excelent, very clean, nice bed and shower. It was a very good experience. Best hotel in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: me0102
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a while ago, before a cruise, and it really was the best!!! My favorite hotel that i've stayed at so far! It's beautiful! The staff was so friendly and helpful!! When I got back home, I called and spoke to the manager to express how amazing my experience there was. i said something like, "even the kimpton pens are really cool!" To my surprise, a few days later, I got a small package in the mail from the Epic Hotel. It was a thank you card and a lot of kimpton pens!!! how great is that??? i will be staying there again soon! i can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: cjarp3789
Reviews.Content: Treated like a queen, luxurious room, staff was incredible, restaurants some of the best in Miami, and excellent spa! Couldn't have asked for more out of my stay in Miami! Can't wait for the next time at Epic!

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Dianne A
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say about perfection is "AWESOME". The room was big and clean, the bed made me want to take it home. We had the ocean view w/balcony and we watched the sun come up, very romantic. The staff was friendly and helpful and made you feel special, especially Christian who went above and beyond the call of duty. Can't wait for my next visit. Dianne M. Atkins

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and well positioned for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HerefordSniper
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the Epic for a few days prior to a cruise. We have never been met by a a more professional or friendlier staff. They made us feel at home immediately.. The double room was beautiful with a sea view. We had a little problem opening the balcony door and the i- player wasn't working. These were fixed within minutes and we were gifted a bottle of wine for our troubles. We returned post cruise to find complimentary champagne for my wifes birthday. I cannot fault the staff at what was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. If I had one minor minus point, I felt it lacked a more "relaxed" less " formal " bar to have a night cap in,( but thats just me) Fab stay, and only 10 minutes walk to Miami's "Bayside", a shopping , drinking and eating location. (including Hooters and the Hard Rock cafe )

Reviews.Title: “Truly Epic”
Reviews.Author: buttarcup
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the best hotels that we had ever stayed in. From the moment you get out of the cab in the lobby, you are greeted kindly. We felt younger (in out 20's) and under-dressed for this elegant hotel, yet we were still treated like royalty. Gene was a wonderful concierge- he was very helpful in creating itineraries for us and helped us make reservations for restaurants, planned out our jet-ski, vespa rental, and even had our itinerary slipped under our door once he was done. The pools were very nice with adequate amounts of chairs around, and the wine hour was amazing! They had a different selection of wine each day to try. The balcony was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. This hotel definitely felt more than a 4.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Was Brill!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic for 5 nights, it was only 20 mins from the airport, cab cost 25 to 35 dollars including tip each way. Check in was very quick, very helpful staff. Our room was city view on the 22nd floor. The super fast lifts got us there really speedily!! Room was large, two double beds, big flat screen TV, IPod docking station, computer, big bathroom with two separate sinks and a lovely deep bath!! There was a separate rain shower. The toiletries smelt gorgeous. Air con was good and not noisy. There was also a big balcony with two chairs and a table. Our room overlooked the Hyatt, residential pools and the Wells Fargo building. It was quite noisy out on the balcony with the traffic below, but once you shut the sliding doors it was silent. We had breakfast included, which we had in Area 31 on the 16th floor. This was buffet style, coffee, orange juice, cereals, fruit, yogurts, muffins, oatmeal, bagels, toast etc. If you wanted to pay extra you could have pancakes, eggs benedict etc. You could sit either inside or outside on the terrace with amazing views. Also on the 16th floor was the spa and pool area. The staff at the pool would find you some loungers or a bed!! They would lay your towels out for you and bring over a couple of glasses of ice cold water!! You could order drinks and food around the pool too. The pools were heated, it can get a bit windy up there, so this was a good thing. The views from the pool terrace were great, overlooking the cruise port and surrounding skyscrapers, the parks and the main road leading into downtown. The concierge were very helpful, providing maps of local area, restaurants, things to do etc. There is eating places within walking distance, aswell as a CVS pharmacy, Starbucks a couple of blocks away, but main places to eat are at Bayside Marketplace, which is 10/15 mins walk or 6/7 dollars taxi ride. Just south over the bridge is Mary Brickell village with eateries. Also Little Havana where there are numerous places. We went to Aventura Mall for shopping, if you want to do this, it's a fair distance in a taxi, the concierge and internet said it could be 60-80 dollars each way, therefore if you get the local bus it is 2 dollars each way!!!! Walk up to the junction with the Starbucks and the No 3 or 93 bus goes there. Also the S bus via South Beach. The whole environment of the hotel is relaxing with great service but not pretentious. Nothing is too much trouble, for example ringing guest services from your room. I requested a coffee maker which was then delivered promptly!!! Room service was very nice with big portions. Another feature was coffee in the lobby in the mornings, with take out cups. Also wine hour in the early evening, nice extras!!! I liked to see that this hotel welcomed pets, and they had lots of extras for them too, providing beds, toys, food etc!! Even a little welcome sign for them in the lobby!!! Overall we had a great stay, and would recommend it!!!! Tip: Use Miami Tour Company for trips to Everglades, and city tours!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: You realize you're about to experience something different when you walk through the front door. From the warm and friendly staff to the room designed for comfort my stay was a perfect kick off to my vacation. Will absolutely be back hopefully sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: WomeninPR.org hosted their inaugural summit at this wonderful hotel over the course of 3-days. The ambience of this resort-like hotel is pure tranquility. The staff is kind and look forward to serve your every need. Every evening around 6-8pm a maid rings your doorbell to offer you anything from water - toiletries. The entire hotel is clean, slick and fresh. For my summit we utilized the meeting rooms which were also nice. After our workshops were complete I noticed the staff was preparing for a wedding reception in the ballroom next door and I had to take a snapshot of the beautiful set-up (which you will see attached). The hotel is in the center of a lot of local shops like Bayside Marketplace. They also have a very spiffy yacht parked on the side that you can rent. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Chic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rnladyg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. Staff was great and friendly. The room was nice--clean. I loved having spacious bathroom with the double sinks.

Reviews.Title: “Not sold on service or comfort”
Reviews.Author: Kurt D
Reviews.Content: I recently was in Miami with my wife to stay before I went down to a wedding in Kew West. We stayed at the Epic hotel for two nights mid week and left on Friday morning, The hotel was nice, the bed was uncomfortable and not level (I think the box spring was broken upon arrival but was my fault for not calling the front desk to switch). The service seemed great when we first arrived, we were greeted by the staff and had a very helpful bellhop help us with our bags and show us the room and features. I was also told about the complimentary (or so I thought) continental breakfast on the 16th floor. The next morning we attended and asked to be seated even asking if this was were the complimentary breakfast was. My wife proceeded to get some outmeal and a banana and I picked up a croissant. When the waitress asked what room we were staying she had informed us that the breakfast was not included with our stay and proceeded to charge us $30 for the items I listed previously (most expesive croissant, banana and oatmeal ever!), I paid and figured I would straighten everything out with the front desk. When I told the front desk about the mix up they said that my room didn't include the breakfast and they apologize for the mix up in telling me at my arrival that it was complimentary without offering to reimburse me! I thought it was unacceptable and didn't understand why they did not credit me for the breakfast but I did not make a big stink and just walked away and figured I would include it in my review. I am far from cheap and this was a matter of principle but really put a damper on the stay. Another thing to make note of is that there are many corporate events held nightly at the pool so don't expect to be hanging out down there in the evening. On a positive note the bathrooms were very nice with a double sink and overhead showerhead. Overall the hotel was aesthetically pleasing but I wasn't crazy about the service or beds.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelBermuda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic pre-cruise for 2 nights on October 21, 22. I loved this hotel. It seems that each Kimpton hotel that I stay in has it's own special features which makes the chain really unique in the market. The Epic was flawless. From check in to check out, I did not have one complaint. The staff are uber attentive, the room clean, comfortable and soundproof. I LOVED the tub. What a relaxing way to spend 2 days. My friends who were staying at the Marriott joined me at Area 31 for dinner. What an exceptional experience. One friend exclaimed that it was the best meal that he ever had from beginning to end. That was a big statement from him who is a serious foodie. I am looking to stay at the Epic again in January. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Epic / Klimpton!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place for conferences and vacations. Right in the heart of downtown Miami with great views and rooms. Looking forward to going back sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time to spend here!”
Reviews.Author: abumbolina
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stopover in Miami during our journey from London to Nassau, Bahamas. We were going to stay at an airport hotel since our flight arrived at 4pm and the next flight was at 8am the next morning. We decided to stay downtown at the last minute and what a great decision it was. A cab took about 15 minutes - even the following morning during the morning rush. We arrived just in time to have a free glass of wine at their wine reception. Up to our room to be wowed. Huge room - gorgeous views from the balcony and amazing bathroom. There was even a computer station with free internet access in the room. We walked to Bayside Marketplace for dinner. It was about a 15 minute walk but it was enjoyable and had nice views. Due to jet lag, we woke up really early so we decided to use the fitness center. It was like a smaller version of a proper gym. I wish all hotel gyms were like this one. Breakfast was really nice - good for a hotel buffett - with attentive staff. We did visit the pool or bar area but it looked pretty cool from our room. The only downsid was the temperature of the room. If you open the balcony door, the air automatically shuts off. Even with the balcony door closed, our room seemed hot and the temperature would not change. Other than that, this is a stunning hotel that we hope to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: DanJamesBath
Reviews.Content: Absolute pleasure to stay at Epic. The staff were the highlight of the experience, so friendly & helpful. Stayed in a suite on the 24th floor with my wife & two kids. Room was fantastic - spacious & had an incredible view. Pool area & gym were both excellent. My only regret was not staying in a club level room - breakfast in Area 31 was not great (& quite pricey), would have been happier with the continental breakfast included as part of the club package.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line rooms and customer service”
Reviews.Author: bookseller123
Reviews.Content: Upon arivial we were greated by no less than 5 people. 2 valets, one for each door, and 2 bellmen to take our baggage. Also, the assorted manager or 2 oserving. The checkin was fast. We had a suite that was amazing, not only killer views, but the room was great especially the bathroom!! Huge japanese style tub, 2 vanitys, seperate comade and shower, even a small balcony. The restaurants were all top of the line...watch the Japanese restaurnat in the lobby...the prices are very (VERY) expenive...but worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0529
Reviews.Content: We came to Epic for our wedding night and were totally enchanted by it. We left early the next morning to catch a flight so perhaps we didn't spend enough time there. But we opted to stay there again the next time we were in Miami because of our wonderful experience, and we were disappointed in getting to know the hotel more. Positives: The room is spacious and well decorated - modern, but still warm and chic. The people at the reception desk are friendly. The bellhop and the servers at breakfast were also very nice. Negatives: We had issue with the valet. I have to spend $20 a day, there's no option for self-park, which is fine if I didn't have to wait close to 30 minutes for my car every time I wanted to leave the hotel. This makes a 5 minute stop to a nearby drug store or grabbing a quick lunch out tedious. I had to make the effort of coming down early enough to make time for valet. However, if you happen to have a luxury, up-scale automobile, no waiting for you! They will happily park your car right at the curb in order to decorate their hotel with rich cars to enhance their image I suppose. So these visitors didn't have to wait, while we had to for a half hour just because of the kind of car we were driving. Of course, this is a trend that some hotels do, but I don't like the elitist attitude that seemed to be more prevelant at Epic. When we first arrived in our car, they were waving for us to pull up, then they spotted a luxury car behind us and held up our hand for us to stop and waved for that car to come ahead of us. So we had to wait while they took care of this visitor. And I'd just like to add, we own a luxury car but opted to drive in a less nice car that week since we were doing a road trip. So I am not talking because I am bitter I don't own such a car. Another thing that got on my nerves were the exorbitant prices of everything over there. We've stayed at plenty of luxury hotels and are acquainted with the expected higher prices, but Epic takes it way too far. Breakfast cost me alone as one person almost $40. Their "buffet" consists only of cereal and bread. If you want eggs, you must buy that separately. And if you want toast to go with your eggs, you must buy that separately too. Everything is priced separately on the menu, so that by the time you put a meal together, you're shelling out quite a bit for an average course meal. It's to the point where it's not elegant, it's just plain cheap and stingy. Anyway, the point is, the room itself is lovely and the reception was friendly. But the valet is painstakingly slow and the food costs you an arm and a leg. Better to stay there only if you intend on walking or using a taxi to get around, and mostly eating out.

Reviews.Title: “TopHotel in Miami Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jan U
Reviews.Content: it was everytime a pleasure to stay in the epic, absolutly recommendable, also amazing dining with a great view on downtown miami in area 31 is a "must do" if you stay at the epic, courteous staff and rooms with view on brickel key, port of miami and the bay, great pool area and valet parking in the hotel is offered

Reviews.Title: “The Essence of Miami”
Reviews.Author: Johann&Sandra
Reviews.Content: You probably don't need to read through all these reviews to see that the Epic hotel is highly regarded on TripAdvisor. Out of 804 reviews, 753 of them are either Very Good or Excellent. We are frequent travelers and stay in a lot of hotels all over the world, and there are a lot of times when the reviews on TripAdvisor, particularly for expensive hotels, are considerably overhyped in our opinion, but we'd stayed in Kimpton hotels before and had very good experiences, so we were cautiously optimistic. As it turned out, the reviews were right on the money. This is a first-class hotel that exudes Miami from every pore - from the constant flows of Porsches, Bentleys, Ferraris and Lambourghinis coming and going from Valet, guests dressed to kill, trendy restaurants, and stylish design to the gorgeous views of the downtown skyline and harbor. The only thing that was atypical for Miami was the service - the typical rude, snooty, indifferent staff we've consistently found in Miami was nowhere to be found. In their place were overtly friendly, polite and professional staff that put a smile on our faces throughout our stay. LOCATION - The Epic is located on Biscane Blvd Way, along the river, downtown. It is about 15 minutes from the beach and airport. Shopping and tourist activities are nearby at Bayside Marketplace. There are not a lot of things within walking distance, but you have everything you need at the hotel, and taxis are readily available. It is not easy to find - you have to drive south on Brickell Ave before you see it on your left. Look for the Area 31 sign in the window. PARKING - Valet parking is a whopping $32.00 per day, so unless you really plan on being out and about during your stay, taking a taxi might be more cost efficient than renting a car. The valet was always packed with people, lined out onto the street, took some time to leave and retrieve the car. AMENITIES - There are all the typical 5-star amenities here. The pool deck is huge, stylish and overlooking the river with skyscrapers all around. There is a fitness room, spa, board rooms, two restaurants and a lounge. The lounge unfortunately is closed on Sundays, the only day we were seeking to go there. Area 31 restaurant is on the 16th floor, and has dramatic skyline views from the balcony. Food was very creative, this chef is not afraid to take chances, service was outstanding, prices are high. Closes at about 10:00 PM. Area 31 is mostly a seafood restaurant, so if you don't like seafood you might head elsewhere. Zuma is on the ground floor and ultra-trendy as well. One of those "see and be seen" type of places. Serves outstanding Japanese food at exorbitantly high prices. Make sure to make reservations for both places well in advance. CLUB LOUNGE - The 29th floor is the club floor. The lounge has a private concierge and complimentary snacks and beverages of all kinds. The views from the floor are dramatic and the lounge is comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and really nice, though they were often nowhere to be found. The continental breakfast here was plenty good enough for us each morning of our 4 night stay. Nothing fancy, but sufficient. If you want the snacks, you have to get there immediately as they serve them because they never freshen them up. Hours later, the same previously hot snacks are still there, ice cold. They serve the same ones every day too, so hopefully you like them. Everything was deep fried, nothing fancy just croquettes and popper-type things, only two deep fried snacks and hummus with veggies. The beers and wines were always hidden, you had to hunt someone down and ask for wine, we found that strange especially when all the other alcohol was readily available. The coffee was rarely refreshed, so if you got it out of the pot it was cold, but after you found a staff member they were happy to get you fresh coffee. The staff was really nice, but the overall lounge experience was pretty lackluster compared to other hotels of this caliber - that's probably why we never saw more than one or two other people there in our 4 days. BUSINESS - Epic is clearly geared toward the leisure traveler, but it works for business too. There is free wi-fi only to Kimpton rewards members, so make sure to sign up, it's free. Otherwise you have to pay for wi-fi. There is a computer in the room, filling the only available workstation, so it was awkward to move the computer out of the way to be able to use our laptop. There is only room for 1 person to sit at the desk, which was also awkward for us as we had two computers. The computer is nice for the leisure traveler without a computer (free internet access, but with an annoying browser), but what business traveler travels without their laptop these days? There are all the usual conference facilities as well. ROOM - We stayed in a Club-Level Water View King Premier room. Dramatic floor-to-ceiling windows gave you a great view particularly in the evening where you were surrounded by the city lights of the neighboring skyscrapers. The bed was cushy and comfortable, the bathroom featured double sinks and a standalone tropical rain shower that was great. Mini-bar, a high-quality iron, big flatscreen tv, computer with free internet access, balcony with a small table, and a spacious 475 square feet. We thoroughly enjoyed the room, and the bed was like heaven after a 6-week stint in Peru and Bolivia. Everything we expected, very nice. STAFF - The most impressive thing about the hotel. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, the entire staff knew our names, and even knew it was our anniversary. Smiling, engaging and friendly, from the bellman, to the valet, to the club room staff, to the front desk staff, to the restaurant staff. Nothing was too much trouble. We had a great 4-night stay at the Epic, further enhancing our already good experience with Kimpton hotels. We've been to Miami many times, but this is by far the best experience we've had with a hotel in the city. Well done, Epic, very well done.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel We Have Stayed at in Miami”
Reviews.Author: nicmac_houston
Reviews.Content: Headed to Miami for a week long relaxation trip and stumbled across this hotel on TripAdvisor. After reading up on it and seeing all of the Eco-friendly principles they adhere to, I decided to book it and give them a try. We were not disappointed, this place is beautiful, with modern contemporary decor, understated but elegant, and, super comfortable. Up front I must say that this was my first time and we chose to stay on the Club Level floor, so my experience only takes into account the rooms on Club level. We stayed in a Sea side facing room, 2905 to be exact, and when we walked in and saw the view of the Miami Harbor and Brickell Park Key, it was amazing. The room was very large, very clean decor and provided a very relaxing place to do nothing. The balcony was very large, with a table and 2 chairs for relaxing. I chose a room with the see-through wall into the bathroom. With the blind pulled up it made the room seem much larger and more open, and the view into or from the bathroom was fantastic. The bathroom was top of the line, with smart, practical placement of everything, yet beautiful and very upscale. The Club Lounge is of the medium size, but very well appointed and setup in a way that accommodates at least 10-15 families, if they all decided to enter at once. While we were there, we did not see more than 2 couples at any given time. The snacks and drink assortments were first class, with top-shelf liquor choices. The Concierge and Host, Christopher, were very professional, friendly and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. They have this great table with a 36-42 inch plasma/LCD screen laid flat on it, that is a Windows Touch screen computer. It has Chess, Checkers and other games that can be played in life size mode, which was one of the coolest things I have seen in a Lounge. You could also browse, look up directions and a number of other things, that was a really nice touch. This isn't your JW Marriott Singapore lounge, with lots of people, noise and waiters running all over the place. It is comfortable, somewhat like a room in your home where you would go to relax. It was a very pleasant experience, as we spent a lot of our time either in the room, at a restaurant or in the lounge. The hotel has two very distinctive restaurants, Area 31, our favorite (I did a separate review on it last week), and, Zuma, a Japanese Sushi fusion place. Zuma is supposedly the best of its kind in Miami, and was very hard to get reservations (I also did a review on them). The hotel bases its principles on sustainability, but does it with very high-end, upscale designs, materials and decor. The atmosphere is one of calm, instead of the usual din of noise that accompanies most hotels. The colors are very calming and areas throughout are peaceful, it feels like a Feng Shui approach. One interesting thing that we found, is that all of the hotel doors were very solid and took some strength to open and close, especially the room entrance and patio doors. We knew that it was strategically done that way, but didn't know why. I asked and found out that they are designed for hurricanes. That made me feel a lot better, considering the fact that they are directly on the water facing the Atlantic. All in all, this was one of the best hotels I have stayed at, and their principles of helping the environment, using sustainable products, serving sustainable foods, and generally caring about the world in which they do business, was the overwhelming factor for my wife and I. Going forward we will look for Kimpton hotels first when booking a trip anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: milanvora
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the epic. - Staff was helpful - Hotel is beautiful. Lobby is impressive. Views are great - Rooms were equipped with most modern amenities - Pool was lovely On the poor side - Room walls are very thin, and you can hear the neighbouring rooms - Getting the car from valet was a long process

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC and AWESOME are just two words....”
Reviews.Author: kissgodz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here at the Epic with my mum and brother before heading on the KISS Kruise, and picked it based on the really positive reviews here at Tripadvisor, and let me just say that FANTASTIC and AWESOME are just 2 worlds to describe this hotel and its staff. We were totally blown away with the cleanliness of the hotel and the ambiance. We were put onto the 28th floor and WHAT A VIEW!!! Unfortunately, we only spent 2 nights there, as we would've loved to have stayed for weeks. If we are ever back in Miami, The Epic will be our choice for sure. The bed and pillows are to die for and the bathroom is delivered from Heaven. This hotel deserves 6 stars.

Reviews.Title: “DIDN'T MEET EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: revjo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending six days at the Epic in Miami. We went with very high expectations, based on the hotel's website and comments on Trip Advisor, about it being the number one "luxury boutique hotel" there. The lobby itself was impressive, sparkling clean, spacious with comfortable seating, orderly and nicely decorated, but our room was a disappointment. It was crowded, with two double beds (albeit very comfortable), and cluttered with all the 'stuff' that most hotels display. There was not nearly enough drawer space for the things we had brought for a six-day stay so it became even more cluttered as the days went along. The bathroom was the room's best feature: double sinks, large walk-in shower, lots of towels and a small separate space for the toilet. We had asked for a king-sized bed and aids to help with accessibility problems - e.g. bars in the shower and around the toilet. When we were offered an upgrade we assumed that these would be in the upgraded room. Unfortunately they weren't. The only reason we could see that the room was an "upgrade" was that you could see two small bits of Biscayne Bay in between the abundance of nearby highrises. We had anticipated how much we would enjoy sitting out on our balcony but in fact we could only tolerate the excessive noise for a few minutes at a time: the noise from the traffic and drawbridge below our room (2318) was relentless and deafening; add that to planes taking off overhead and you get the picture. We were happy to see a safe in the closet but unfortunately it was on the floor and impossible for one of us to access. The room also had a desktop computer with internet access which was a bonus even though it operated very slowly. Meals at the hotel were expensive and tended towards Mediterranean so we only ate there a couple of times. Breakfasts were best with granola, topped with yogurt and fresh blueberries. You can ask to have a coffee maker brought up to your room but if you order room service, it will cost a total of $12 for a small pot that held four small cups. The first night we were there we were tired and ate dinner in our room. It arrived within a reasonable time and was hot and delicious. One thing about the Epic particularly impressed us and that was the staff. From the moment we pulled up to the entrance we were always greeted and treated like royalty with wide smiles and offers of help at every turn. While this could be said about most hotels to a degree, the Epic staff was exceptional. They made the disappointments much easier to live with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: AngelaL770
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights with my husband at the Epic for a business trip. We travel internationally frequently, and I have to say this is one of the best hotels we've stayed in for comfort and quality. We loved every moment, from the friendly welcome, the dramatic sweep of the lobby, and the efficient reception staff who offered us an upgrade for $20 a night to a water view room. The room was very large and the bathroom sumptuous. We had a very pleasant lunch and chat with our Italian waiter. The bar and restaurant in the evening has an energetic vibe. Our conference lunch was also good, though sadly we were not able to enjoy it on the panoramic terrace due to the weather. The breakfast buffet is good and less pricey than other similar hotels. But what really impressed us was the bellboy as we left. Christian Betancourt treated us like VIPs and clearly loves working at this hotel. His attitude is the kind of publicity that money can't buy. He deserves to go far and Kimpton merits every success. We will certainly be back, and we'll always be looking out for a Kimpton hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAL15
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I agree with some of the recent posts. My wife and I travel frequently and are very picky about where we stay. We gave this place a shot out of mere curiosity and I'm glad we did. The service was top notch. We ate at Area 31 with some friends and every single one of them was impressed by not just the food, but the staff. Our server (Robert) was incredibly knowledgeable and attentive. Just to give you an example about the service at this hotel, I called the concierge (Glenn) to make a reservation late in the afternoon on Sunday (it bears mentioning that Glenn had no idea I was a guest at the hotel, as I called from the car, and he still made the reservation) and not only did he get us a table for 6 with short notice, but got us seated in our own private room! It was an amazing experience. The food the view. Everything. One thing to be aware of. They have a very active nightlife. There is a very trendy lounge downstairs. It didn't affect our stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: TBTr
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a five night stay at the EPIC i Miami. And it really was epic! The hotel is beautiful, from the area outside, to the pool area, the reatuarants and the rooms. Our rooms were great (we had two rooms) and very spacoius. The bathroom was beautiful and with a nice size. The service was amazing, the staff was so friendly and polite. Andrew, the concierge, was very helpful and gave us a lot of great tips on what to go in Miami, and also we got coupons for some of the big attractions. He really was a great help to us! The guys that work by the pool was so friendly and quick to make up sunbeds for us. Every morning there was cofee and tea at the first floor. And in the afternoon there was wine a little snacks. A great extra service that made our stay even better. The breakfast at the restaurant was very good, and with a nice view. The location is good, if you're not planning on staying at the beach. It's great that you can walk to the Bayside Markedplace with a lot of shops, boats and restaurants. So for us, travling as a family, the location was great. I would definitly recommend this to all of my friends and family, and I will definitly try to come back if I'm visiting Miami agian. But there were some small things that could have been avoided, and that's why I'm not giving the stay a full score: we had booked two rooms and asked if we could have them on the same floor. The girl at the desk fixed that, but my boyfriend and I got the a room build for handicapped guests. When I called down to ask if we could get another room, the girl at the frontdesk didn't seem as if she knew that that room was build for handicapped. Not very good if people with special needs would have checked in and we were in that room. We got a new room straight away, so that was not a big problem. But I do feel I need to mention it. We booked rooms with sea view, but you couln't really see that much sea from the room. At least not my parents room. I would therefor recommend that guests that want to have a sea view ask for a room above the 18th floor. My parents also had a room just above the restaurant on the 16th floor. One of the days there was a party there, so there was a lot of noise outside until midnight. So if you want a quit room, ask for it not to be above the restaurant. Also: you all have to check you bill carefully! We got the bill early the morning we were checking out, and that was a good thing. We had two cars on valet parking one night, but had been charged for 4 or 5 nights! And we signed up for the Kimpton membership and could take stuff from the mini-bar for 10 dollars without being charged, but we still got charged. After a lot of time at the frontdesk we worked it out, but it shouldn't be necessary to to all that in such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: NY_ShoeGirl
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype of this hotel. The food was Garbage-eat out every day! I took my brother to Miami as a graduation gift and I thought we were getting a top shelf hotel and I have to say...big disappointment! The staff was just ok, nothing impressive at all. They will tell you something is complimentary and then it will appear on your bill. There was no mini-bar and the toiletries are not a brand name. The beds were comfy and the rooms weren't cleaned often, I always had to ask for the room to be cleaned. I just didn't like this place and would never stay here again. Stay at the Four Seasons, this pay is a wanna be 4 and 5 star and doesn't cut it!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, overpriced, misleading. Don't be fooled by the hype.”
Reviews.Author: skygirl12
Reviews.Content: 1 My check-in process was botched 2 My room, a jr suite at almost 500 a night, looked directly at a parking garage. No "city view" at all. No view at all period! 3 The bar staff on the first floor were rude and uninterested and told me that no restaurant in the hotel was serving food (it was 11pm). After going to my room to Google where in Miami I could get food at 11pm, I was directed to the sushi restaurant...inside the Epic. Sure enough they were still serving. Back down I went. And by the way, I had a great meal and great service. 4 The plug in my bathroom didn't work 5 The jets in my tub would turn on randomly.... while I was not in the tub 6 Did I mention how incredibly intolerable my view was????

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bentaylor21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Epic hotel with some couple Friends and found it to be a good hotel in a good location to explore Miami. The food and drinks were reasonably priced and on the whole service was excellent. Our only small criticsm was the current set up with the Valet situation. Even when you call down, it quite often takes a while for your car to be brought to the front!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: alex m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect on this points: location, sea view, cleaness, overall conservation (furnitures, elevators, hall, etc). They only fail about their front desk staff: when you arrive at the hotel, some good-looking girls think they are more important than you and your family, they do not give you enough attention and are always with a "blaze" face when you ask something to them. Except for this problem, the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee180
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a conference next door at the Hyatt in July and was really glad I did. The room was well-appointed and had a great view of the waterfront. The fitness center and pool were sharp and clean- I believe the pool may be heated, which was a nice touch. Would easily choose to return to this hotel again, with or without a conference next door!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Amy E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a layover in Miami on our way back from St. Lucia. The hotel was absolutely beautiful and the large yachts docked outside were amazing. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, we were afraid they might be a little stuffy as Miami has a pretty posh crowd. We were celebrating our Anniversary, we had champagne waiting for us in our room and a personal card. We stayed in room 2806, amazing view and amenities. We had dinner at Area 31 and the food was amazing and our waitress was so friendly. The pool area on the 16th floor was so beautiful, we had to leave early the next morning and were sad that we didn't get to take advantage of the pools. We will definitely return to the hotel in the future when we have more time to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: jaguar65
Reviews.Content: We booked our 3 night stay at the Epic for our visit to Miami based on reviews that we read on Trip Advisor. This hotel was beautiful, well located and had some fantastic features (complementary coffe in the mornings, complementary wine in the evenings). The rooms are spacious, with a fantastic water views of the Miami River and Brickell. the pool is out of this world. The only Con:The AC in the rooms is annoying, But It's Miami! The Area 31 restaurant is located in the 16th floor, the food and the service were great, we had breakfast and also ordered room service. And that was our surprise! Any hotel staff that can put up with our craziness and never ending demands, and keep smiling deserves a top rating. We were impressed with the staff, Megan from the restaurant (I belive is the Manager) and Vanesa from in room dining in particular, she was very attentive, polite and always willing to go the extra mile . Thank you for taking such a good care of us, THUMBS UP!!! We'll be definitely back and would recomend this Hotel to anyone visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “The reception people truly let you feel that they are your home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Epic11
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and views of the city and bays Bar is awesome on 16th floor

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful venue at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Epic for two nights during a convention. The room was great looking, well appointed and looked like new construction. I was on the 28th floor with a balcony overlooking the water and enjoyed sitting on the balcony while I handled my business calls. I would go out of my way to stay here the next time I need to travel to Miami. Having a separate shower and tub made the room features even better. This felt like a much more expensive room than I was paying for. Great!

Reviews.Title: “The EPIC is absolutely Miami and definitely home / one of the hottest and coolest places in MIA”
Reviews.Author: Tansu78
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank your wonderful friendly staff for showing me your incredible property last week. I am out of words, your property, your staff and your location = everything just perfect. I normally stay on the beach, I had a meeting in downtown in the late afternoon, was passing by and walked in...I was warm welcomed at the door and esprecially in the lobby with a glass of wine from Sunshine who is a real sunshine and her colleague, forgot the name unfortunately ( a revenue manager - very friendly as well). Jacky & Felix, both outstanding, very very friendly and funny made me feel home right away.They took their time to show me a few rooms/suites. You have wonderful rooms, I could picture myself there - best style & comfort, very clean & top technical facilities and the views - unbelievable!! Your pool area is great and the view is perfect too. I am looking forward to staying with you next time! Especially to Jacky & Felix, thank you -- you guys are wonderful!!! Thank you again and I see you very soon, best regards from Munich - Tan

Reviews.Title: “You've got to stay here”
Reviews.Author: RayIvey
Reviews.Content: The Epic is a class act all the way. Unlike most hotels which categorize themselves as "boutique," the Epic is expansive and spacious. It's in a great waterside downtown locaiton, also, adjacent to the bridge that leads to Brickell Avenue. The staff is spectacular. They are scandalously attractive, for one thing, and I am shallow enough to admit this added to the pleasure of my stay. They also have been beautifully trained. All interactions I had with staff were pleasurable and productive. My 27th floor room was large, and extremely comfortable with a great bed and a terrific bathroom. And did I mention the large private balcony? I also highly recommend Area 31 Restaurant on the 16th floor. Great service and great food, for a price. The pool area on the 16th floor is also stunning, and sometimes is quite the party scene. While this hotel seems party-oriented rather than business-oriented, as a business traveler I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I'm so relieved I didn't have my hotel changed to the nearby Courtyard. My stay at the Epic was worth the loss of Marriott reward points!

Reviews.Title: “There is no other choice - in Miami, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bazingaLV
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days September - October 2011, while waiting for our Downtown Condo to be ready (moving from Las Vegas to Miami). We were treated like family - just a stunning property: The Pros: - Worth the 5 stars - this place is heaven on earth. Comfortable furnishings, beautiful pool and spa - great customer service from EVERYONE! Hard to believe that this is also 1/2 residences! - We stayed in a one bedroom waterview suite. A MAZE ING, totally worth the money! - Beds are very comfortable, soft sheets, fluffy pillows, perfect blanket. Robes and slippers as well. - Sofa in living room is very comfortable - felt like i was home - Wifi - if you are a kimpton intouch member (its free) then the wifi is FREE for your stay, and you can access it everywhere - we had no problems with it at ALL during our stay - Room service is quick and VERY yummy - remember, the service charge and gratuity is ALREADY included in the bill, so dont freak when you see it costs more than the room service menu - Housekeeping - what an amazing troupe! Our place was spotless, they understood we were on an extended stay - even refilled our ice buckets for us in the afternoon and evening since we were both working from home - Concierge, Valet, staff in general - wow, what personal touches - everyone treated us like we were long lost family members - they made us feel like we were the only people in the hotel! - Conveniently located to Brickell area (over the bridge) as well as downtown Miami - few minutes we were at Bayside Marketplace on foot. - It is upscale, and it is NOT cheap, however - it is VERY MUCH worth every single dime. Our stay came to a little over $2500 for 5 nights including everything - and we loved every second of it. When family and friends come to Miami, we will def be suggesting the Epic as their first choice. Area 31 - WOW, just WOW - you MUST dine here at least once during your stay - if you don't, you are totally missing out on one of the most amazing experiences ever!!!! - If you smoke, get a room with a balcony! (I have a review of it posted separately) - We plan to always look for a Kimpton property when we travel in the US - we were THAT impressed - You need to ask for a coffee pot in room. The bring a krueig machine for you (yeah!) and since we were working all day, they threw in more coffee, etc. (I wound up running to Publix to pic up some more, off of 8th in Brickell at the back of Mary Brickell village). Can also take the Metro Mover (free) from a stop a couple blocks away that will leave you off a block from Publix. - We always received a smile, coming or going - that is a HUGE difference to the hotel experiences we have had in Vegas - we felt like a member of an elite group, in on the special secret, access to privilege, you name it - THAT is how awesome the Epic in Miami makes you feel! - They also cater to PETS!!!!!!!!! The Cons (nothing to keep you from staying): - no power outlets next to bed in 1 bedroom suites, very inconvenient for phones, etc. Some outlets throughout room were behind sofas, etc. When you have a lot of electronics (ipads, iphones, itouches, 3 computers, etc.) a few plugs just does not cut it - The safe, at least in our room, was located in the bedroom closet, about 12 inches off the floor, sideways - totally difficult to see and get stuff in and out of - very very awkward. - Noisy hot water pipes and auto lock on door would cycle through itself noisily every 20 minutes or so - $32 per day for parking - would expect less $ if you are a Kimpton member and/or staying in a 1 bedroom suite - we could have parked down the street for about half, but were lazy and did not - Room service menu - seriously, written in like 9 point font - LOL - great for the young ones, but for us "older folks" needs to be a wee bit bigger :) - Valet area - the only thing about the whole Epic hotel that I did NOT enjoy - wow, someone was sleeping on the job when they created this - between the guests arriving and departing, the residents coming and going, no sidewalks for people heading out to the street - a nightmare is putting it mildly. We were almost hit a few times walking out to Biscayne Blvd Way to head out for the day/night. This problem is exacerbated on Fridays and Saturdays as the restaurants and lounge attract everyone. The area is about big enough for 2-3 cars, one way in and out - just a mess. - Mini bar never got cold (2019) even when they replaced it with another one - TV system is a little screwy - once again, you expect a little more - Water facing is NOT Bay/Ocean view - it is the intracoastal for the most part. - Balconies - facing the river is great, look to the side to get a bay view (from where we were staying) BUT because of all the high rise buildings, noise is AMPLIFIED (traffic, the bridge warning going up/down, screaming bridge lady, boats, people) if you spend a lot of time on the balcony, as we did, it is VERY noisy. Also, the noise from Area 31 and the pool is also very loud (especially at night) - HOWEVER - if the balcony doors are closed, you don't hear anything!! - Housekeeping does need to go out on the balconies and wipe down the tables occasionally - no one ever did this while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: Cory C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the EPIC Saturday, Sept. 24. Aesthetically, the hotel is gorgeous. It's also a great location. The service was top notch. Best of all was the comfort of the room. I slept a solid 10 hours in sheer bliss, something that never happens. Thanks, EPIC. I hope to be back one day!

Reviews.Title: “1st class experience with great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: After long hours of searching online for hotels in Miami with exceptional views and a great location, we came across Epic Hotel. We stayed there for 4 days and we couldn't have been more satisfied with our stay. As soon as we drove up, there was a valet guy opening our door and welcoming us to the hotel. We walked in the hotel and were immediately greeted with a big smile by the front desk. As soon as we arrived to our room, the bell guy was waiting with our bags at the front door. We walked in the room and were immediately impressed by the spectacular view of the bay. We took a quick tour of our room and couldn't have been more satisfied with our decision! The room was very clean and the bed couldn't have been more comfortable! All in all I would recommend Epic Hotel to anyone who is visiting Miami looking for that 5 star experience with exceptional views!!! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, avoid room service”
Reviews.Author: ridgeberry
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, beautiful hotel, fantastically pet friendly (the main reason I stay here). Just avoid room service (they never get it right -- haven't since htey opened), eat at one of the other local hotels for breakfast and lunch (again, they never get it right. Dinner is somewhat better than breakfast and lunch but why take the risk? The view is worth it only if you are having cocktails outdoors and don't mind cigarette smoke), and eat in the Japanese restaurant downstairs which is exellent, and you will have a good experience. Spa services were average. The pool is lovely. Lobby is lovely, front desk staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outraged!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rock B
Reviews.Content: To all and anyone who is planning a potential stay at the Epic hotel. Take my advice, DO NOT DO IT!!!! But, if you would like to have the absolute worst hotel experience possible, be my guest. First and worst on my list is the room service! A bib salad with romaine lettuce. When I called informing them that it wasn't butter lettuce, a very casual " sorry we should probably change the menu" reply. Secondly, black burnt grilled cheese sandwiches, a rare ordered steak frites comes back well done like a hockey puck, and no frites, but roasted potatoes. Morning coffee order never arrived. Restaurant waitstaff constantly engaging in nonsense chat with me during my meal. Whoever is running this show needs to go back to management school. To top it all off with the cleaning vacuuming outside my room door at two in the morning waking me up from a dead sleep. When I asked him to stop, he didn't understand english and kept on vacuuming until forced to call the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, but definitely caters to high society”
Reviews.Author: ARL2601
Reviews.Content: Overall, my boyfriend and I had a great long weekend stay here. I read the reviews before booking, and everything already said is true. Good location, great view from waterfront rooms, very clean, good service, quality restaurant, gorgeous pool area. I would definitely stay here again. But...a few minor things keep me from giving a 5 star rating: 1) DJ playing obnoxious and loud house music pool-side on Sunday afternoon. Really? People don't get enough of that out clubbing at night? So much for my Sunday nap under the umbrella. 2) The staff, including concierge, were a little out of their element with our questions regarding public transit. Not to say they didn't try to help us, but I think most of their guests ask about limos. FYI for other travelers, the C or S bus can be picked up in front of the Bayside shopping mall a few blocks north of the hotel and this will take you to South Beach for a mere $2, rather than a $30 cab ride. Also the FREE metromover light rail has a stop two blocks from the hotel and will connect you not only to other C and S stops, but also the metro train line if you're heading down to Coconut Beach. 3) The entrance is a cluster-f *** and not safe for pedestrians. A very short driveway, cramped turn around area, separate entrance to the resident parking garage, and no sidewalk, all combined to make a traffic jam almost every time we came in or out - all times of day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort first class!!”
Reviews.Author: Sfdjohnny456
Reviews.Content: Epic is a beautiful hotel in a great location and the service is second to none!! We had an ocean view room overlooking the pool and biscayne bay. Area 31 is a good restaurant, and the sushi at exuma is incredible!! Epic is centrally located in downtown and close to activities.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ileana d
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on South Beach when i travel to Miami, but staying at the Epic was WONDERFUL. The hotel is spectacular, the rooms are beautiful and spacious and the service is exceptional. I did not mind traveling to the beach although the bay is very close and the hotle has a very nice pool area as well. Highly recommend if you want to get away from the South Beach traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are true! I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Stasteek
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just got back from our miami trip (9/22-9/26/11). We booked this hotel base on the review on tripadvisor and the reviews are absolutely true. We booked the club level city view and was very please with the room. The room was clean, nice and gorgeous! The club lounge had different snacks and appetizers throughout the day. From 7-11 they had continental breakfast (ham, turkey, pastries, oj's, coffee, milk, cereal). from 11-3pm were more appetizers ranging from fruits to stuff shredded beef in eggroll shellss (it's very good!). and there are just more food throughout the whole day. We were totally full from eating at club level and didnt' even eat much outside. Zuma lounge was very romantic and elegant, the food was great and the ambiance was very cozy later into the night it also turns into a really cool lounge. Loved it!! At club level we had so many friendly staff: Lucia, Oscar and some others that i can't remember their names but they were all so friendy and accomodating. Oscare helped us out by telling us where to rent cheap cars, where to go and etc. They are very please to help us and always have a smile on their face. I love this place and would totally book again and recommend to my friends. Thanks Epic for making our trip so EPIC!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time ust as great”
Reviews.Author: RossOrpington
Reviews.Content: I first visited this hotel in December 2010. My second stay was as good as the first. The room was superb, spacious, excellent bathroom, very comfortable bed. Not the greatest of views from the balcony (room 2433) but that was the only negative point. The internet terminal in the room worked well, allowing me to complete much business during my stay. The room was always cleaned early and to a high standard. It had a mini-safe and the TV swung 360 degrees so you could watch in bed or from the sofa. The shower was good - roomy and lots of hot water. I never tried breakfast but ate in the Area 31 restaurant one evening - it was excellent. The happy hour from 1700-1800 in the Reception area was good - free wine of a reasonable standard. Every night my bed was turned down with a bottle of water and glass placed by the bed. The staff were fantastic. Always eager to serve you and semmed genuinely to care. Highly recommended - one of the best in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Business trip -Brickell area”
Reviews.Author: Marybel13
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel for business or leisure travel if you need to be in downtown /Brickell area. This was my first stay at the Epic and enjoyed it overall. I would probably never stay here except for business as there is not much to explore in the area and I would think that most ourism go to South beach and more touristy bits of Miami. It wasn't my first choice but had to book last minute and Viceroy was full. The Good: - spacious room and bathroom with separate toilet, shower and lots of towels; large closet; complimentary water bottles and fruits upon in room upon arrival - great bayside view from the room that I had; enjoyed the sunrise and sunset every day directly from the room - tasteful modern hotel - nice pool area with various style of lounging chairs, complimentary magazines and water - excellent food at both restaurants (Area 31 and Zuma) - your own goldfish in the room to keep you company - overall friendly staff throughout the hotel and follow-up to minor complaints (see below regarding movie and waterbottles) - little extras such as coffee/tea offered in the morning and wine between 17:00-18:00. I usually had meeting outside so did not make use of these but had the impression that plenty of people did. Having said this, there was no coffee or teamaker in the room. Maybe because it's offered in the lobby in the morning? - broad selection of amenities in the room or that can be ordered; very useful since my suitcase did not arrive with me! - convenient location to Brickell ave for business travellers; it took me 15' to walk to the office. It's a very pleasant walk but some mind find having to cross the bridge a bit of a bother (especially when it's open and you have to wait). Next door is Viceroy just on the other side of the bridge making it perhaps more convenient and slightly closer to most offices down brickell ave The Bad : - limited roomservice: stayed for 10 nights and got a bit boring after few days having to choose from small menu. Concierge can provide takeaway menus but I had to wait too long for this to be brought up so ended ordering roomservice again - Zuma does not provide roomservice and not possible to go down and pick up the food yourself either. Dissappointing! I was told that this was because of US litigation risk (raw food)...and Zuma also operates separately from the hotel - none of the HD movies can be played. They are aware of this issue but nevertheless keep the HD movies on the menu. I had to call reception, wait for technician to show up only to tell me that he's aware of the problem and nothing can be done. I was assured that the movie, that I could not watch, would not be billed but this still ended up on my bill when checking out - open water bottles (even if almost full) would be removed and thrown out by housekeeping; irritating. I was told that guests expect this to be cleared up??! After complaining the second time this happened I did receive lots of complimentary bottles - food offered at poolside is the usual snacks, nothing special - less choice for the leisure traveller in walking distance Conclusion: Overall great experience with minor complaints and might stay again at the Epic for business but will try the Viceroy next time. Would not choose this hotel for leisure travel. Highly recommend trying the Zuma restaurant. The Area 21 also had a great 3-course lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mushette
Reviews.Content: We had a club level room giving us access to the club lounge where the staff (particularly Jean) were exceptionally helpful, friendly and efficient, making our stay very enjoyable. The hotel is nicely designed (modern) and room very spacious. Pool area was really cool, very glamorous and had a cold pool (normal temperature) as well as a hot pool (too hot to swim lengths in but fine for posing!). The pool was noisy (loud music with a dj) on one day but it was labour day weekend so not sure if this is usual. Location downtown was fine, easy to buses (although everyone recommends not to use buses, we used several and were fine). Well worth getting a club level room for the lounge where they are very generous with complimentary food and drink (alcohol included).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: ALISTER2
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say that has not been said already. The Hotel Epic was our first stop on an east coast tour of America and it was the best hotel of the trip, and started our Holiday with a plus. First of all they upgraded our room to a sea view room as it was our anniversary, so a big thank you to the staff for that. The Staff are very friendly and helpful and even though this is a high end hotel, you never feel as though you do not belong or that you are being looked down at. The rooms are fantastic, large and clean and they have a cut out in the bathroom wall to the bedroom so that you can soak in the bath and watch TV at the same time, so cool. We only ate once at the hotel but the food was great and yummy. As per a previous review the valet parking is quick and simple, and although I did think it was expensive I soon learned from the other hotels we stayed at on our tour that actually it was reasonable. We will definatly be back to MIami and will stay at the Hotel Epic, and will now really consider Kimpton hotels in other locations. Thank you to all the staff for making our vacation very special.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Janet176
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel partly because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and partly because we have also stayed at the Kimpton in San Francisco - which we also found to be a great hotel. There's not much I can add to what has already been said - this hotel is definately one of the best we have ever stayed in! As a Kimpton member we were upgraded to a Bayview room - and what a view! We arrived after a long flight from London, our car was swiftly taken away for parking and we were checked in with courtesy and efficiency. The room was enormous - and spotless. We went down for a drink in the bar and then took a drink back to our room and ordered some room service. The food was good and arrived quickly. We were only in Miami for 2 nights so didn't get to try the pool or attend the drinks reception but throughout our stay I have nothing but praise for the service we received. I think the secret to the Kimpton is the staff. Sometimes you feel in some hotels that staff are being polite because it's their job - well it is - but here we felt that they really wanted to help and ensure that you had a good stay. I can only say that if you're going to Miami then don't hesitate in booking The KImpton.

Reviews.Title: “Epic=Excellence”
Reviews.Author: j k
Reviews.Content: This hotel stands out in excellence in every category. The cleanliness, roominess, functionality, lovely decor and comfort of the rooms make for the most pleasant of stays. Every single person on the staff had a smile and warm greeting. The door people were especially helpful and cheerful. The front desk personnel are happy, knowledgeable and in control, making everyone around them feel good. Valet service was quick and easy. The Exhale Spa is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel have everything”
Reviews.Author: BR2468
Reviews.Content: This hotel have everything, in fact you don't have leave on less you want to see a little of Miami. The service and the staff are absolutely wonderful, hte room was big, clean and had everything what would be expected in a room. The bathroom was perfect and so clean. The pool area is very nice adn unless you love sand betwin your toes, stay there. The food at the hotel is very good: I felt I had very good value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: discretetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Epic hotel every week since June. I spend a few days in Miami each week and tried a few hotels ... The EPIC wins hands down. Like all Kimptons it has style and panache. I just enjoy walking into the hotel, and the greetings from all the staff are amazingly warm and welcoming, this occurred from the first visit on and gets better and better - they feel like family. The rooms have everything you need and all spacious and well maintained and most important comfortable, with many having spectacular views of the Bay. They have not one but two 5 star restaurants and service and food are fit for foodies. Pool areas, and gym and spa also top class. Hard to say more a great place to stay one time or week after week and the welcoming gratis wine party each evening is a treat rarely found.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: YORDY_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a most. Great service inside and out on pool deck. Area 31 has spectacular food, we took advantage of the Miami Spice menu.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Epic experience”
Reviews.Author: Da_Burge
Reviews.Content: Travelling while pregnant can make a lot of places wary, but not the Epic - definitely upgrade to the Club Level to be treated extra special. great pool, didn't get chance to try any onsite restaurants but they looked lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sigrid G
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful weekend get-away for my husband and I for our anniversary. Super trendy hotel. The staff was super friendly from check in to check out and so welcoming and could not do enough for us. We did not say anything about celebrating our anniversary and Sesso at the pool overheard when someone gratulated us and brought a bottle of champagne I have never experienced that in any other hotel and we stay in excellent hotels a lot! The pool area is fantastic and super hip. Matt the belman helped with checked in and check out of our room and was super nice. Loved it. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service @ the Kimpton EPIC”
Reviews.Author: Felix S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, I would say, the best of Miami (at least the best I know so far!) Perfect location at the Marina, beautiful building, rooms and spa area and a dream of a swimming pool or rather 5 pools on both sides of the building in the 16th floor. Very friendly and helpful staff, regarding postal services, help with the infant, an additional crib in the room and with the luggage. Very much recommended, although of course luxury has its price - parking at $ 40 per night is quite a price.

Reviews.Title: “More than EPIC stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkNorthantsUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. Stephanie who checked us in was wonderful gave us a free upgrade, free mini bar voucher and a voucher for the spa what a great start!! The room was wonderful great view and amenities. All the staff were so helpful from the pool boys to the cleaners. Another special mention is to Juan (Chelsea) from Area 31 we would talk to him every morning when we were having breakfast. We were celebrating my fiances birthday and he arranged champagne and a birthday cookie to be sent to our room for her birthday very nice touch. We ate in Zuma Fantastic all so had the spice menu from Area31 with was also fantastic. loved the location plenty of taxis and buses to get every were. So were so impressed by the hotel we are already playing to go back next year. Thank you so much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly brilliant with NO FAULTS”
Reviews.Author: szkut
Reviews.Content: Most has already been said. It is brilliant! It is in Miami, which some may say is not the best location. Bit it is a short drive to the beaches, which if you have a car is no issue. Also being in Miami there is not quite as much to do as down at South Beach area. Pay the little extra for the club room as it is worth it. Breakfast, small meals and night drinks! The restaurant is also great for dinner. Highly recommend here as it is truly faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, Amazing service, can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, superb service (best I've ever experienced at a hotel), and very reasonably priced. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: After reading all the excellent reviews about the Epic, My wife and I were very much looking forward to our stay. After a very personal welcome to the hotel from Taylor I knew were in for a great stay. The hotel & service were both excellent during our stay. Three things that I would say made it exceptional to a normal hotel stay. 1) Very personal welcome 2) For breakfast there was a very pleasant & helpful guy in a suit (Sorry can't remember his name) helping all the restaurant staff, ensuring all the guests were well looked after. (i.e. topping up your orange juice !) 3) During the cocktail hour, the staff were happy to join in and mingle with the guests. Will recommend to all our friends. Stay was end of June. From England.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service...you must visit!”
Reviews.Author: solitaire8868
Reviews.Content: This is THE hotel to stay at when you visit Miami. It was my first trip as an adult to the sunny city. Epic did NOT disappoint. I went to celebrate my 30th birthday. Front desk concierge Taylor was especially kind and courteous. She even sent up a bottle of sparkling wine. A huge thanks to the entire staff at Epic. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rgoldhar
Reviews.Content: Wow! That word does not describe the incredible service/ stay my family and I enjoyed at our recent stay with the EPIC. From the moment we pulled up and Chirs opened our van door, to the front desk, bell hops, private concierge on the 29th floor to your hotel operations staff there is no better place I have ever stayed than EPIC.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Santiago De Los Caballeros, Santiago, Dominican Republic
Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: microboop
Reviews.Content: We decided to honeymoon in Miami, and found an amazing value at the Epic. Since it's in a great location downtown with lots to do within walking distance, we were never bored. My husband and I stayed at the club level floor and were immediately upgraded to a gorgeous oceanview room, which I suspect may have been because I talked him into becoming a Kimpton InTouch member before we booked it. The dedicated concierge team on the 29th floor was everything we could ever want in terms of service, friendliness, and just plain good company. We received a lot of information and goodies thanks to Mark, Ruben, and Lucia especially, although all the concierges were really great. When the concierges found out we were on our honeymoon, they made sure we got a complimentary bottle of champagne one night, which was awesome. When we ate at Area 31, our waiter comped us each a glass of champagne also when we mentioned it was our honeymoon. We got discount cards for the Exhale spa twice during our 10-night stay, and did get to fit in a couples massage while we were there, which was amazing.
