The doormen were always very friendly, and had a sixth sense when we needed a cab--I think we only asked once or twice since they always seemed to offer when we needed one. I never thought I would feel so welcome at a large hotel, but the people working there always seemed genuinely happy to see us. We loved our stay so much that we will likely return at the next available opportunity. I don't think we'll ever stay anywhere else in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Miami”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler11595
Reviews.Content: First, hotel is simply beautiful - very modern and grand. Very good service. My favorites (as a female business traveler) are the fitness center and the Exhale studio - teachers and classes were superb! Rooms feel very "homie", but elegant at the same time. The balconies with water views are incredible too. Overvall, one of the best hotels I've stayed in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: midatlantictraveler1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Florida for a weekend, taking advantage of a Kimpton sale on suite rooms in this property. Both of us were absolutely floored at the ultimate luxury of the suite we were given. The hotel itself is "sandwiched" between residences both below and above the hotel. You'd never know that unless you were paying close attention. Floors 2-13 are residences, 14-30 is hotel, and 31-42 is more residences. This fact is unobtrusive to hotel guests, however, since residents have their own entrance and elevators. The professional nature of all the staff, and more importantly the efficiency and caring they show impressed me. The staff at the pool will help you settle in by assisting with towels, a cool glass of lemon water, or adjusting shades. The concierge in this hotel was so efficient at making restaurant reservations (even if the restaurant you want is not on their "list") that the whole process took seconds, rather than minutes. I was stunned! Take a walk along the Miami River and Biscayne Bay towards the port, walk left to the park, at night. This is a wonderfully romantic and nice thing to do in the evening! The view from the balconies themselves (that's right, two balconies, even the bathroom in the suites have their own balcony) are totally amazing. It's fun to watch the draw bridges open and close as barges and different watercraft come through the channel. The bedroom in the suite had a floor to ceiling bow window on an entire wall overlooking the city! Beautiful... beyond words. The pools are amazing, one being a warm pool, the other being a chill pool. So you can go back and forth, or stay in one or the other, depending on what the weather is like. Dinner at Area 31 was exceptional, and not overpriced for fine dining, with their special prix-fixe menu. The caring of the chef and wait staff as to the quality of our meals, and experience meant a lot to us. Valet parking is on the expensive side, but it was worth it considering it was one less thing we had to worry about. Service is prompt too. The resort manager Jacqueline made our stay extra-enjoyable, and to her I am especially grateful. Other hotel employees worthy of mention for outstanding guest care are Gene (concierge), Paolo and Mark (pool area).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every sense!!”
Reviews.Author: RAECambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children (aged 13 and 11), who stayed for 3 nights at the Epic Hotel. We loved it!!! The service was excellent. Staff could not be more friendly or helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Our room was on the 32nd floor, which the children loved. It was quiet, had a huge bathroom, a fridge, very comfortable beds and was cleaned daily. The pool scene was fantastic. Plenty of towels, chairs and waiter service. The pools were on the 16th floor with great views. My one complaint would be that it got a bit windy and the sun disappeared around 5pm on the terrace - but hardly the hotel's fault!! We loved the 5-6pm wine hour!! Complimentary wine by the pool...definately worth being back in the hotel by 5pm!! We didn't eat in the hotel as we thought it was quite pricey. The hotel is situated right by the bay, so is in esay walking distance to restaurants at night. I would recommend the hotel and definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Epic”
Reviews.Author: E_Shay
Reviews.Content: The Epic Kimoton has definitely earned it's #1 rating! The views are stunning, and the hotel staff are superb! The area 31 restaurant inside of the hotel is excellent as well! We stayed on the club level and were treated the best that we have ever been treated at ANY hotel. I was celebrating my anniversary and could not have picked a better place. This was my first time in Miami and because of this hotel, I did not want to leave! I would like to also point out how attentive the bellman staff were. Especially Christian. He was awesome, very friendly and made us feel very welcome! I loved it! Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for conference”
Reviews.Author: Je_and_Ja
Reviews.Content: The facilities and ambiance of this hotel was perfect for our team meeting. The rooms are stunning - bathrooms like a high class Spa and pool deck perfect for drinks reception. All food and service was excellent and I would love to return as a tourist to check out more of this part of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, elegant, modern, LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneM_Dallas_Texa
Reviews.Content: Fantastic friendly service, fabulous views, great staff, and then the room decor is modern elegance and extremely comfortable. The spa is great, wine selection perfect and there is a hot spot at night. The hotel rooms have a computer monitor and keyboard so no need to drag a laptop, and the shower head is the BEST. Huge tubs, gorgeous hardware, vessel sinks. The hotel pool is on the 17th floor and has a great view as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: jillliebean215
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap, but IT IS WORTH every penny. The pictures on THEIR website (not just the traveler pics on this site) really do match what the hotel looks like. The bathroom in our room was like a trip to the day spa. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel which had fabulous food. Again, not cheap, but a wonderful dinner. My boyfriend and I stayed here after taking a cruise from Ft. Lauderdale, and it was a spectacular way to end our vacation. We laid in a cabana (free) by the pools and ordered from the restaurant/bar outside and it was just so beautful and relaxing. One note, it is a relatively new construction, so in 2 different times when we took a cab around the area, the cab driver did not know where he was going and tried to rack up all these charges for driving around. Make sure you keep the address and if possible, a little map with you so that you won't have this experience. Also, this hotel is in downtown Miami. It is not in South Beach. A cab ride from the hotel to South beach is about $20

Reviews.Title: “an epic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Design-Family
Reviews.Content: Adding to what others have posted, the key to this outstanding hotel is the people who run it. Brent McNally and Danys Cervantes, along with Reuben at the concierge desk, went out of their way to make our stay smooth and comfortable. They are working with a true gem - the hotel is beautiful and is fully kitted out with everything that one would want - fantastic rooms, a great location, a gorgeous pool deck with views, a superb gym with classes, and Zuma (fabulous!). Trey greeted us upon arrival in the most gracious way, and it our stay only went 'up' from there. Bravo to a team that really seems to enjoy their work, who really know what they're doing, and who make you feel like you're at home (no easy feat in a large hotel of this size). We're looking forward to returning in a few weeks ... it will definitely be our home away from home over the next few years as our son attends college at the U!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to stay here or somewhere just like it again; very soon!!”
Reviews.Author: caligirl3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, great view of city and the bay, topnotch customer service! The only complaint is that room service didn't offer milkshakes.. :( Also, they tack on lots of fees for room service and any other waiting service offered... But that's all over Miami! Also, it be great if they offered a shuttle to some of the local attractions; since its sort of lonely in the downtown area.. Also, you should eat at Area 31, had some pretty epic food for dinner and breakfast from their restaurant on the 16th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Number one on tripadvisor? Depends!”
Reviews.Author: Baba1956
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an excellent stay. And a friedly rate. Super friendly staff, very flexible and autonomous, and empowered. At frontdesk as well as valet parking. Interior design of the hotel, including its impressive lobby area is very cool. We were having a comfortable room, with great bed, balcony, and spacious bathroom. Room itself not too big, but more than ok. Unique is the computer in the room, never experienced this in a hotel before! Do i prefer this hotel more than other 5 star plus hotels in Miami? Depends. W at south has the same service level, and their poolarea is more comfortable, plus their location at south beach is unbeatable. Next to the beach! The Viceroy is having a way larger pool , and great service. So indeed , it depends..

Reviews.Title: “Miami Beach and EPIC Hotel: a wonderful combination”
Reviews.Author: Evanise P
Reviews.Content: We choose the EPIC hotel at first just because it was very close to the conference place. But as soon as we went to do check-in, we could realize how amazing this hotel is. It starts with the entrance: so charming. The view from the room is gorgeus. While my husband was in the conference my dog and I had so much fun there. The food is delicious and the staff were very polite with me and also with my litlle pup. While I was at the gym or in the pool area they were taking care of him. They also offer a transfer to go wheterever you want in the city. You can choose between have a driver or drive to yourself. But the hotel is so amazing that my husband and I used to stay in the room (which is large and very confortable!) contemplating the beauty of the city. My laptop was stolen in the airport but that wasn't a big problem, because they offered me one. The only litlle problem is that the fone from our romm wasn't working very well. You have plans to come back as soon as possible just to enjoy at EPIC !!

Reviews.Title: “Revolting”
Reviews.Author: DRCR506
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself if nice, but the room service is terrible. One night they took almost 30 minutes after we ordered to call us back to say they were out of our choice of entree. The next morning they did not pick up the breakfast card we hung on the door. When we called down, they said they would "rush it". After almost an hour of waiting we called again, and "it was on its way". We cancelled the order and left our room hungry (and cranky). But the worst was the next morning when my girlfriend felt something under the covers and then jumped out of bed screaming. I have no idea what the "thing" was (see pictures below) but it is the most disgusting and revolting thing I have ever seen. I do not want to share a bed with this!!!! We called the cleaning staff manager and she just looked at it, and said "I don't know what this is...I'll have them change your linens". Change our linens??? For the price of this hotel, I expect my linens to be changed before I check in! and for the room to be clean. Spotlessly clean. When we checked out and got the usual "how was your stay", the staff member (Indira) was very nice and seemed a bit more concerned about our bad experience, and promised to send us a complimentary stay, etc., etc. I got an email asking for our address, which I sent them almost a month ago, and have not heard a peep since. I don't mind paying top dollar for a hotel, but I do expect to get top dollar service and cleanliness in exchange!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: gretchin50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent four nights at the Epic. (Aug 14 -Aug 18) Due to our work schedules, vacations come far and in between so I spend hours searching the Internet and reading TripAdvisor to ensure the right choice for a little R & R. Two years ago, we had the pleasure of staying at a luxury hotel located in BAL Harbor and loved it immensely but for this trip, we decided to stay somewhere more centrally located. I always book our trips through Expedia and discovered an Epic special; book three nights, get the fourth night free. I took the advice of a TripAdvisor reviewer and selected the Club Level as well as a room with a water view and my husband and I both agree that we could not have made a better choice. The property is beautiful! We arrived around noon, greeted by warm smiles and much to our delight, able to check in early. Our bell hop, Christian, a pleasant and jovial young man escorted us to our room, explaining every nook and cranny and then, on to the Club Lounge, where we were introduced to the Concierge on duty who was equally cordial. He asked if we would like a glass of champagne, to which we happily accepted. Our room on the 29th floor was immaculate, spacious enough and had a lovely view of the bay and downtown. From the balcony, we could look below to the 16th floor pools and the outdoor sating for hotel restaurant, Area 31 That first day we dined there for both lunch and dinner. The food was fresh and tasty but dinner selections were limited and a tad over priced. After dinner, we went for a stroll along the bay. The Epic is situated near a few other hotels, office buildings, condos, restaurants, and the Bay Marketplace (shopping for all budgets and affordable eating). If you love the water but donâ€™t necessary need or care for the beach, this IS the place. That night, we returned to the Club Lounge and finished the day with yet more champagne. The next day we took full advantage of the Club Lounge, which offers continental breakfast, a light lunch, healthy snacks, evening hors dâ€™oeuvres, and desserts from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. Coffee, bottled water and soft drinks are self serve as well as the bar featuring premier liquors from 6pm to 11pm. In addition, you can request a drink anytime during the day and the staff will graciously get what you desire. The Lounge staff is absolutely phenomenal and they have the knack of making each guest feel special. I would be remiss if I did not mention our concierge, J.P. and our waiter, Mark H. Wow! I can not possibly say enough about how each of them helped to make our vacation a memorable experience. As I said before, we took full advantage of the Club Level amenenities so instead of sitting by the pool in the intense heat; we spent our afternoons in the Club Lounge. Most of time, we were the only guests there and we were treated like royalty. Mark waited on us hand and foot. He kept our glasses filled and personally made us some of the best mojjtos weâ€™ve ever tasted. Through conversation, Mark discovered my husbandâ€™s love of food and cooking and from that point on, had numerous suggestions on where we could eat as a local and even shared some recipes of his own. J.P., one of our concierges was equally helpful; from making a delicious watermelon mojito, dinner reservations for us, arranging transportation and great conversation as well. On our last day, we were a little mournful as we prepared to leave; it felt as if we were leaving new found friendships behind. Before we hugged Mark goodbye, he had us sign up to become Kimpton InTouch members so that when we return (which we definitely will do), we will receive even more perks. Once again, many thanks to the Epic staff for providing an excellent vacation spot with a homely feel. Much appreciated! Greta and Allen J.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome and I highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: LiberalElitist
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Epic Hotel from Thursday - Sunday in a club level room. Club level service is outstanding. Each day there were two staff members present in the Club Level Lounge, one staff member in particular Mark H., provided outstanding service and great recommendations for local restaurants. In addition, he made us some pretty good mojitos. I would definitely pay extra to receive club level access. In addition, the food at Zuma located in the lobby of the hotel was okay but expensive. A meal for 2 including drinks was $249 (mandatory gratuity incl.), now mind you the portions are small and we may have over done it with the drinks, but it can still be expensive. Zuma is a very popular restaurant, but there are other options. Kyma is the lounge located in the lobby and it's a nice venue plus the drinks are reasonably priced. Our stay at the Epic was great and we'll go there again sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “sweet”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler33212
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a great hotel after our cruise, so we picked the Epic great deal so we booked the Lounge floor, didn't know what we were going to get until we arrived. It was wonderfull the room was large, top floor view of the river and the city, and I love a large bathroom, the lounge was for drinks and 5 times a day appetizers. If you wanted a full lunch or dinner there was the Miami Spice menu for $22 lunch and $35 Dinner for the month of August all over Miami which provide 3 courses. The concierge: Gene, Oscar, Mark, Lucia,and Raquel did a wonderfull job at taking care of all our needs. We will return next year if the cruise leave from Miami

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kuprasm
Reviews.Content: During our three weeks stay at Florida, only Epic earned five star rating. Other hotels that we booked were just as the Epic, at their top five tripadvisor list (see our travelmap). But Epic is really amazing. Lobby appearance is especially at night modern and exclusive. If you book a club level room with Biscayne Bay view than you get something speciall. Add a Private conciÃ«rge (Reuben is a trully professional), private lounge area including free breakfast, drinks wine and wifi. You got the feeling to be a VIP. And the price is not substantially higher than other hotels offered. Rooms are good, bathroom had the best shower of all the hotels. Swimming pools have a surprise; one is heated the other one is delicious chilly. For our TopGear fans, at our arrival a RollsRoyce, Lambourgini en two white shining Audi's where parked. If you want to impress your partner go for it and book Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better with every stay”
Reviews.Author: erocksteady
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from the bayside shops. You will feel like your home with the grace and genuine faces of the Epic hotel. From the ease of checking in to the deluxe rooms you won't want to leave this place. The pool was awesome but I have to say the staff was the best part of the stay,they made my trip a complete dream come true. Thanks Epic

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: guaman
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful views from bay side rooms, nice size rooms, nice baths, well appointed, beds too soft, service not up to standard of hotel. Wonderful sushi restaurant, nice pool with good view.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: peasha e
Reviews.Content: I would like to say my trip to the Epic hotel was such a great experience, The customer service was excellent I called to tell them it was my honeymoon, Which wasnt a guarantee for anything special. When I arrived we had our room upgraded to a suite, Champagne sent to our room, we were surprised and elated......A very classy hotel...Thank You so much Epic For making our stay there wonderful.. we enrolled into your program to earn rewards, we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: Nwamre
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - excellent service at the pool!! The rooms are very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer care experience I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: Dinitri D
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the club level of the hotel. We experienced the ultimate in customer care. I would definitely stay in the hotel again, and take advantage of the additional amenities afforded by a stay on the club level.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: g0lfer69
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the reception was not very welcoming, and did not explain anything regarding the rooms, how to use the elevator with the card, etc. I was not impressed with the lady, because she acted oofstandish. I believe the reception represents the hotel, and is a big factor in determining how your first impression will be of the place you are staying at. That being said, I had to ask all the questions myself, and when I did, it was met with a cold indifference, and as if am being a bother. Did not appreciate being treated as if I don't matter. Went to stay here for a week on spring break, to look around Miami and the beach which is 20 min. by taxi, sometimes longer. The hotel itself is ok, but not what they make it out to be. Something weird is with the room. Every night, I woke up with a sore raw throat. I started to think that maybe it has something to do with the dogs being allowd to stay there. The rooms are carpeted, so maybe the dogs remains are left, and not cleaned properly. I had to turn down the air-con, so that we could feel better, because the air blowing in was making us all feel allergic. ? No clue why. All in all, it is ok, but I don't think for a family. Better for business people and their meetings.

Reviews.Title: “World-class hotel in world-class location”
Reviews.Author: grungtheep
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the EPIC Hotel in Miami, FL on business. What a hotel! The building itself is located directly at the waterfront. Starting with a stunning lobby it just got better. My room was facing the water, had super-spacious bathroom (with shower, bathtub and a separate water closet) as well as an amazing bed. To top things a balcony was attached to the room so I could also enjoy the sunset. You will find an amazing pool on the 16th floor of the building, with attached bar and lots of lounge chairs. The views from the pool are just stunning with nice lounge-music in the background. One evening I also tried out the gym which is free for residents. There are lots of almost brand-new machines available as well as water, towels and another little pool in front of the gym, just in case you do want to cool down after your workout. The only downside was the WIFI was charged to the room. Not sure why a hotel in this price-range can not offer free WIFI where nowadays almost all hotel-chains can. All in all however I was thoroughly impressed with this hotel and I would certainly stay there on my next trip to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: cafguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Miami for our anniversary and stayed at Epic after reading the reviews posted here. Epic did not disappoint. A very well maintained property with excellent amenities (fantastic spa, try the deep tissue massage if you are a fitness buff who has some nagging injuries or 4 hands massage for pure luxury) and service. We stayed on the 30th floor (club level) and recommend the upgrade as the service levels and the perks such as food and beverage were very much worth the extra price. Concierge Oscar and guest services provided by Lucia and especially Mark Haskell were unparalleled! Our room was clean and the rain shower was fantastic! Front desk and hotel staff were very well trained and the pool area on the 16 floor was both awe inspiring and sexy. I would NOT recommend this hotel to people with children but children were well taken care of and the hotel staff were very accomodating to guests who brought them. (I say this because the hotel is very luxurious and sexy and the amenities are definately not geared to children. The location is a cab ride away from most places but if you like to walk as we do (1-2 miles) and don't mind doing so in a city then Epic's location is perfect. We really enjoyed our 4 night stay...(40 yr old couple from Toronto, Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Simple the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: FabianaBarranco
Reviews.Content: Epic is the best hotel i ever stay in Miami . The staff, the Room , the pool, the japonese restaurant!! You have to stay here !!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: SidCupLondon
Reviews.Content: Had read good reviews of the Epic but having been misled by great reviews before I was keen to see if it loved up to expectations. Staff were keen to help and genuinely friendly, the young bell boys got on very well with my daughters(!) and provided great advice. And right in the middle of downtown Miami we had two great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Miami Downtown”
Reviews.Author: MarcusLima
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel. Good service and a busy nightlife on the premises. Downtown Miami is back! My first time in a while... Breakfast is not so good, but fair enough. Good fitness center and pools. Good restaurants downstairs: great for a escape with wife/partner.

Reviews.Title: “Always top shelp”
Reviews.Author: TNSA
Reviews.Content: The Epic is an amazing place to get away and do business.... The staff is the key, from the front desk, Seth, Farah, etc. always remember the smallest details, to the wonderful location and venue. Top shelf gym, spa, rooms are excellent! A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nybor07
Reviews.Content: I have been to Miami, FL twice in the last 9 months and during each visit I stayed at the EPIC hotel as this hotel is truly EPIC! I love everything about this hotel. From the gracious welcome I received when first stepping out of the the taxi to the reception area, to the hotel room itself. I travel quite frequently and am not crazy about staying in hotels as I'm very picky about cleanliness. I never stay in anything less than four stars and have found that sometimes five star hotels can leave something to be desired. However, I have never had to worry about cleanliness at this hotel. The beds are clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are luxurious, but most importantly clean as well! Although most of the nightlife and action is located in Miami Beach, this hotel is located in Downtown Miami. However, for me the short taxi ride back and forth is worth all the amenities and comforts this hotel has to offer. The advantage to staying at this hotel versus one comparable to it on Miami Beach is the significant cost savings and being "away from the party" atmosphere." I love, love to party and most nights am out until at least 6 am (or later if I've been at Space), but I want to come home to peace and quiet, not more partying. Although this hotel is billed as great for business travelers, it is also ideal for singles, groups of friends or a girl's weekend. There are plenty of young people staying at this hotel to mingle with at the pool or perhaps share a cab ride with to Miami Beach (although there is never a wait for a cab, except on New Year's Eve). The hotel inside and out is absolutely stunning. You will never tire of all of it's various views of downtown Miami. Service is impeccable with pool boys available for your every request. Sometimes, they'll know what you need, before you do! Both on site restaurants are excellent and are highly recommended! However, I did have a not so pleasant experience at the spa. I booked a pedicure service and the technician was over 40 minutes late getting to me. I brought this to the attention of the spa director who offered to charge me only half of the cost. I accepted this concession, but was still disappointed as I expected to be wowed in a manner consistent with the rest of my hotel experience. However, I would not let this isolated experience ruin my overall experience at this hotel. Overall, great hotel. Do not hesitate to book your reservation, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I Always Return!”
Reviews.Author: ThePinkSuitcase
Reviews.Content: Whenever I return to Miami -whether it is for business or pleasure- I always stay at the Epic. Bonaldo is the absolute best and deserves his promotion to Front Desk - even though I do miss him in Concierge. Gene always delivers 100% and he definitely deserves the Les Clefs d'Or. Bonaldo has been replaced in concierge by Lucia and she always delivers excellent service. While several boutique hotels where advertising lower prices for the weekend of my stay, I am glad that I returned to the Epic because of the hospitality! I always feel wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views”
Reviews.Author: ParryFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked three days at the EPIC Hotel in downtown Miami as I wanted a changed from just doing beach hotels, also my daughter has never stayed anywhere with high rises before. Took a bit to find as the directions on my sat nav seemed to be a block out. but I was glad that I found it in the end. The hotel is quite stunning, we were on the 21 first floor with a view over down town rather than the bay, which is perhaps why it was cheaper. But we thought the views were quite breathtaking. Our room was very large with a die for bathroom. We had a minor problem with the safe which was fixed within minutes of phoning reception. The swimming pool is on the 16th floor with the gym both of which had great views, bit odd being in a swimming pool that high up. The first night we had dinner in the hotel which was a tad expensive but very good. they did a children's menu which help keep the cost down a bit. The other couple of days we ate out partly because of cost and it was the week end. At the week end the hotel is full of people dressed to the nines whilst we were dressed to the four and half. About a 15 minute walk from the hotel there is the bay-side area which is full of shops and restaurants. I was over charged by about a $100 which they didn't apologise for, not too sure if was a tax on being a bit too common. But having said that I would happily stay there again and recommend it to anyone, even common rabble like me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: notadq
Reviews.Content: Clean Modern and fabulous. Pool a bit small. Lobby has a somewhat vacant feel. Dinner at Zuma was quite average and small portions. 500.00 plus for family of 5 and we were STILL hungry. Really lovely and helpful staff. Room frig absolutely did not work at all despite a repair. On a personal note hate the all Pepsi selection for soft drinks...yuk!!! Hate that brand exclusivity crap. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton Hotel with amazing customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Bosley02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom over Memorial Day weekend to visit family in Miami. This hotel was great from the minute we arrived. The ambiance is hip Miami contemporary style, and the customer service was great and reflective of the quality that has given Kimpton its stellar reputation. I have to give a shout-out to B at the front desk, because he was incredibly helpful and attentive despite our super late arrival. He walked with us several blocks to ensure we were pointed in the right direction to get a late-night dinner. He even followed up with us later in the weekend. We were totally impressed by his courtesy and he is doing a great job of representing the hotel staff! The room itself was lovely, and the bathroom was amazing...spacious and luxurious. And what a view from the balcony! I wish we had more time to spend at the hotel! It was also quiet despite there being several large groups staying down the hall from us. I loved the gym and the breakfast in Area 31 was also great--again, staff was extremely courteous and pleasant. We were just so happy with our experience overall, I would definitely recommend this to my friends and would likely come back here again. The only downside to the whole thing was the price, but given the quality of everything else, I would rather pay to stay here than pay comparable prices at a possibly sketchy motel on Miami Beach. If you're patient there's still good deals to be found through the travel websites. Stay at Epic, and I don't think you'll be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it especially the view.”
Reviews.Author: smaya1993
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed on the 25th floor in a 1 bedroom suite, the suite was gorgeous and very room we also requested a roll a way bed and it was delivered promptly, the view was amazing, the master bedroom was roomy, floor to ceiling glass windows and the bathroom was big with a balcony, the living was roomy also with another balcony. Again wonder water and city views. We enjoyed our stay here nothing to complain about, room service was prompt, staff was always helpful, and we had no problems getting our car they always brought it within 1-2 minutes. Surely we would be back.

Reviews.Title: “The most GRACIOUS STAFF I have ever encountered!!!”
Reviews.Author: wemusttravel
Reviews.Content: So before booking this hotel, I went to TripAdvisor to see what the reviews were about this place. Most of them raved about the fantastic customer service and I must say everything about those reviews were true. This place has the most gracious, hospitable, accommodating, go-out-of-my-way staff I have ever met; they met and exceeded my expectations. Definitely one of the friendliest hotels out there. I got a room facing the water which was absolutely beautiful. The bed has to be one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept on. The room was huge, it had a huge bathroom and big balcony. I had the best time at EPIC even if I was only there for 2 nights. I need to single out one of the staff members who accommodated me the most, this young guy named Christian, thank you so much, you've been such a great help!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay at a hotel. "Ever"”
Reviews.Author: TMayola
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I along with my best friend and her 2 kids - 28 and 24 stayed at this hotel based on the reviews we read here on tripadvisor. We had 2 rooms on the club level and my friend was upgraded to a junior suite on check in. The views are awesome! The service from the staff in the club lounge is superb! I wanted to rent a car and it was arranged for and i was called and given the information after all the arrangements were made. Was even told to remember to get a receipt from the taxi so that it could be reimbursed by the rental company. The bathroom is one of the largest I've seen and my fiancee and I had no problem being in there together. The table and chairs on the balcony were a nice touch for morning coffee and evening drinks, which by the way was provided by the hotel. This is definitely a luxury hotel at a discounted price! We all agree that the Epic will be the hotel for us whenever we visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Miami”
Reviews.Author: Pips_14
Reviews.Content: Off my family went for another cruise around the caribbean, this one leaving from Miami. Â Due to our schedule we arrived late at the Epic around 1:00am. We had taken a limo from the airport to the hotel and were greeted at the hotel entrance. Â  Now I get the part that it's Miami andÂ that clubbing is all the rage but wow... the night club is literally right at the front entrance of the hotel. Â The music is beyond loud! So loud that you can hardly hear the desk clerk. Â  We checked into a city view suite. Â However,Â Â my teenager wasn't Â happy when he discovered the sleeper sofa had used sheets from the a previous guest. Germs and I do not get along so an instant call to the front desk resulted in both a desk representative and Â house keeping arriving promptly. Â They seemed very embarrassed by our discovery and asked if they could move us to an upgraded water view room which was very beautiful. Â The room had the most amazing bathroom I had ever seen in a hotel. Â Also, itÂ was very nice to walk out on to a Â large balcony and see the water and the swimming pool which was dazzling! All in all the staff was very friendly and eager to help which was nice since the hotel is kinda pricey. If you're going on a cruise this is a great place to stay as the ports of call are close by. Â

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: VilmaQ
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff was very knowlegeable of hotel and its amenities. Loved the recommendation for dinning at their restaurant Zuma. Hotel has amazing views of city from 16th Floor terrace. Dining at their other restaurant Area 31 outdoor terrace was just wonderful and our waiter was incredibly knowlegeable of wines. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LVPets
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one evening just before taking our cruise out of Miami Port. Loved it! I wish more hotels were similar. Check in/out were both quick and efficient. We loved our suite #2001. Balcony off of room was amazing as well as view. We received a great rate (I did feel it was very fair compared to other places I've stayed) during an online sale ($200+/-) and I am so happy we didn't opt for a hotel near the airport offering shuttles service to port with free breakfast. Cab ride to the port only took minutes in the AM after we ordered our breakfast via room service (delivered promptly). We could even see our ship in port from the balcony! Would stay again in a heartbeat if ever in the area again, thanks Epic! Also, we do think our dinner at Zuma (restaurant on 1st floor) was amazing too......we tried their mid-range priced tasting menu and all three of us loved it! Thanks for getting our vacation off to a great start!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Seiun
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel; rooms are unbelievable, the view is breathtaking, and the staff are the nicest we've ever encountered in any hotel around the world. This is number one for a reason, in fact MANY reasons! You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive and we won't be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Ravouth
Reviews.Content: I know I have seen pretty good review on the Epic but maybe we were not lucky... First of all, I did not get the connecting rooms I requested and I did book months ago directly through the hotel ; pretty easy to have separate room when you have two young children! But the most unacceptable thing is that I discovered in our room pieces of broken glasses which could have hurt us. Furthermore, I found the service quite average depending on the waiter/waitress. I spoke to a receptionist manager who apologized for the inconvenience. But I do not give a second chance to the hotel. We definitely will not be back! We switched to Fontainebleau. If you are demanding like me on 5* star hotel, I will not recommend the hotel. Appearance is nice but service is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Only been home one night & I miss the Epic already”
Reviews.Author: roslynpines
Reviews.Content: Dramatic lobby with warm welcoming staff. What an amazing combination. Extra large rooms with extra large beds. A sea of luxurious white linens. Terrific terrace with views of the city, Miami River & Biscayne Bay. A desktop PC hooked up and ready to use, at absolutely no charge. I could go on and on about the bathroom, almost as large as the bedroom. Two Vessel sinks, a deep soak tub, separate shower and water closet and more towels than you could use. (One tiny caveat, the air conditioning is motion sensor controlled, it can get a bit warm during the night or if you have been out of the room for awhile). Complimentary coffee service in the lobby every morning. There is also a wine serviced from 5-6 every evening on the 16th floor pool deck. We could not have made a better decision for our Miami stay. Kimpton never disappoints but the Epic exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in a beutiful city!”
Reviews.Author: dfillos
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spatious with a balcony and large bathrooms in marble stone. The two swimming pools at the 16th floor were perfect especially the one with the sea view. The water temperature was regulated and you could just sit there all day enjoying the perfect view of the surrounding buildings and the sea. The personnel was very very friendly and helpful and they reccomended trips to the everglades and to the city. The breakfast was poor compared to European Hotels (they only offered fruits, cornflakes, toast and cruassants, coffee and juice) but at an additional cost you could order eggs, ommelettes and bacon... At least they offerd some breakfast compared to other hotels that did not!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: sb1London
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic, modern, high end hotel in the downtown area - which is a good and bad thing. Getting to South Beach is either a $25 can ride or a dubious trip on a local bus. If you're due to start a cruise, this hotel is ideal as it's right next to the port, but if you want some Miami Beach glamour, think carefully before you stay here. Otherwise, the hotel itself is great. The pool area is stunning and the food at Area 51 good. Service was outstanding and staff enthusiastic. We were upgraded to a corner suite which was huge and great value considering the room rate. Negatives - we booked a "every third night free" offer via Kimpton's website, which at first wasn't honored and we were charged for the entire stay. However, the front desk was quick to rectify it, which is all you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutetly Gorgeous Hotel with a South Beach Vibe”
Reviews.Author: pvillar810
Reviews.Content: We've been to the Epic Hotel twice now and truly love our stay each time. Its right in the heart of downtown walking distance from Bayside, Shops and lots of restaurants. We checked in and had a great experience with Jessica the front desk clerk. She was extremely helpful, knowledgable and very sweet. We upgraded to a water view room which overlooks the bay and the port of Miami, it was an incredible view. The room is breathtaking with marble all over the bathroom and modern decor and the Balconys are nice too. The pool is out of this world with Cabanas and cocktail waitresses. We had appetizers at Area 31 that left us wanting more but we had to go to a concert. Epic hotel- Thank you for always making out trip so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a BIG E”
Reviews.Author: AlbertoAJAC
Reviews.Content: Booked a double/double room but had an upgrade to a waterview one bedroom suite (with a little extra payment...;-)). From the beginning till the moment that we left the service that we received was very very good. The room was beautifull. The last day after we checked out we want for a few hours to the pool. Even then the service was excellent. Thanks to Ruby who made us feel millionairs for the rest of our stay. Do not know how the Club Level is, but the "normal" levels are alrady extra ordinary Everbody reading this review.....Do not look any further. When you are in Miami spent a little bit extra money and book the EPIC!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will be back”
Reviews.Author: TJBF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club level city view room with 2 young children. The reception when we arrived was quick, friendly and helpful. It was late in the evening and the lobby was packed from the club but as you got past that, it is a lovely hotel. The rooms were modern and nice. The club level is highly recommended. Gene, Peter and the other staff working there are great. Gene is so helpful, and can give you many tips, he tried for over 1 hour to help me web checkin our flights as we were having problems with the airline's web checkin. A fish in a bowl was brought up to our room, the kids loved it! Zuma is awesome, will try Area 31 next time. We extended our stay for an additional night as we were having so much fun but our room rate was much higher than what we had paid by booking in advance, disappointing but obviously based on availability, etc. The hospitality here is 2nd to none, you will love it. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Conways70
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate to book this hotel, it's fantastic. Beautiful comfortable rooms, fantastic staff, nothing to much trouble. The view from the water rooms are superb, but all the views are lovely. The Club Lounge is brilliant, we were totally spoiled by Lucia, her and the rest of the staff go out of thier way to make your stay memorable. We can't wait to go back - the sooner the better, Miami is a brilliant part of Florida, we only stayed 3 nights, but will return for a week in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination”
Reviews.Author: Brucedeeroach
Reviews.Content: Loved the Epic! Pool area was esspecially nice. We had great service and food. You will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: JcAjA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at multiple Kimpton properties in the past and stayed here a few times. If you are seeking a hotel within striking distance of the night life but still provides the necessary get away from the hustle and bustle the Epic is your spot. If you wanna chill by the pool, check out the premium cabanas. The Club Floor is incredible. The sushi at Zuma's was impeccable. Overall experience was very intimate and personal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & play”
Reviews.Author: Bella306
Reviews.Content: We had a great time @ Epic, it is situated Bayside - and is a short walk of 5 min to the water, and 10 min walk to some fun restaurants and shops. The Hotel is just gorgeous, and we paid a little extra for Club Level, which gave us access to the Club Lounge, where the Concierge - Gene & Mark were amazing... Club give you breakfast, morning tea, light lunch, wine hour and desert hour.... The rooms are roomy and the bathrooms have plenty of room to house 2 girls spreading all their goods out... The beds were super comfy and the room had plenty of space for all our shopping... I would stay here again - in a heartbeat..

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: BogieC
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived, the Epic staff ensured that we had an excellent stay. Our flight had landed in Miami at around 9:30 am and we arrived at the hotel around 10 am. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were allowed to check-in. We were escorted to the Club Lounge on the 29th floor for a private check-in and was offered to take advantage of breakfast which was on-going until 11 am. Our room was located on the 30th floor and was very clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. We had a city view (as supposed to a water view) and loved it! The Miami skyline was beautiful at night! The in-room computer was also useful since some sites were not able to load on our tablets as they required Flash. Being a Kimpton inTouch member was also an added bonus as we were able to connect our devices to the hotelâ€™s Wi-Fi with no charge. The Lounge offered 5 food servings throughout the day: Breakfast was continental (with excellent smoked salmon being served on some daysâ€¦ I think itâ€™s weekdays only), lunch consisted of light sandwiches and saladsâ€¦ with wine, beer or champagne upon request (the black bean and corn salad and the potato salad were both amazing), healthy snack consisted of fruits and granolas (the fruits, the entire assortment, were super sweet. It almost seemed that they were hand selected.), cocktail hour consisted of top shelf liquor and appetizers (the beef and mushroom skewers were delicious) and dessert was usually a chocolate-based concoction along with dessert wines. Coffee, water and sodas were available during Club hours. Needless to say, we were very big fans of this upgrade. It was totally worth it! Lucia and Mark were both very attentive, going the extra mile to greet you by your first name and provide truly personalized service. Our experience at the pool was equally as pleasant. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an attendant who sets up our chairs and towels for usâ€¦ and then follows up with a nice glass of ice cold water or coffee! They also constantly monitor to make sure that our glasses are filled and that we had everything we needed. Zuma, the Asian restaurant located in the lobby, was PHENOMENAL! Itâ€™s a definite must tryâ€¦ thatâ€™s IF you can get a reservation! We were lucky enough to score a 6pm seating for dinner on a Thursday night as they were fully booked for the remainder of the weekend. Another option would be to go during lunchâ€¦ the menu is the same as dinner and the dress code is not as strict. The beef skewer and the king crab skewer appetizer had such awesome flavor and were very tender. The spicy tuna is equally as amazing, the tuna was so fresh that it just melts in your mouth. They also have a cod on the menu (unfortunately they do not have it on their online menu) that is out of this world! All their meals are meant to be shared but seriouslyâ€¦ this is a â€œno-sharingâ€� dish! Another dish that I consider to be â€œno-sharingâ€� is the green tea and banana cake dessert with toffee sauce, toffee bits and coconut ice cream. Iâ€™m not big into chocolate desserts so this was perfect... if you would prefer something in the chocolate family, the special chocolate with vanilla bean ice cream was also delish. It had a slight bit of hazelnut in there.

Reviews.Title: “This will become an annual vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: pzinn
Reviews.Content: The Epic Hotel in Miami, a Kimpton property, was the perfect place for my husband and me to spend a long weekend together. The staff was welcoming and more than willing to help us get comfortable. The room was perfect -- clean, well furnished, great sense of design. And the view from our room was breathtaking. We stayed on the Club level, floor 29, and the Club level staff was incredibly helpful. Not only did they accommodate all of our requests, but they were genuinely interested in us as people. And the hotel's restaurant, Zuma, is worth trying. It was one of my favorite meals during our stay. We'll definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pools, great staff, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: clk2011
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a four-day stay at the Epic Hotel and it surpassed all of my expectations. We spent a lot of time lounging by the incredible pools - less crowded in the morning, although even on a packed Saturday it didn't feel full. The pool staff - especially Jose and Paulo - work their butts off. They truly don't stop and are always bringing towels, tidying, serving drinks and food, and clearing up. They made us feel welcome and comfortable the entire time. Food and drinks at the pool were reasonably priced and tasty and the staff keeps you well-hydrated with ice-cold water with lemon/orange slices. I also liked that it wasn't too "sceney" at the pool -- there were young couples, older couples, singles, families. It wasn't a meat market. The rooms are fairly spacious, with a great, soft, comfy bed; a private patio and a lovely bathroom with a rainshower; a computer with slow internet and a wall-mounted flat screen TV. The hotel is NOT on Miami Beach, and it is a $25 cab ride to get there. If you plan to spend a lot of time on Miami Beach, then stay at a hotel there. We did some walking, but unless you have a car, get ready to fork out $$ for cabs. (**cab warning -- almost all of the drivers said they didn't carry small bills at the end of the ride and could not make change for us. We quickly learned to stock up on $1, $5, and $10s for cab rides.) Every morning, there is coffee, tea and iced coffee in the hotel lobby, and free wine/sangria between 5-6 pm on the pool level. The hotel also had a Twitter/Facebook summer promotion with a secret "password" to give at the check-in for a reward. We got a $50 credit at the pool bar! It's worth following them on Twitter if you plan to go during the summer. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A service-oriented, beautiful, luxurious, relatively affordable hotel that's also family and pet friendly?! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_FLPopes
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our relaxing weekend at the EPIC Hotel in Miami. We were there just to relax by the pool and have some quality time with family. It was perfect. We knew that the reviews had been excellent, but we were even happier than we expected to be. First of all, the fact that it is a pet-friendly hotel, is amazing. We have English bulldogs who we love to travel with, but rarely can. We had tried to find a pet-sitter when planning our trip, but we couldn't find anyone. Imagine our happy surprise when the first ranked hotel on TripAdvisor was actually pet friendly (with no weight limit or fees!). Well, as if that wasn't nice enough, when we arrived, there was a chalkboard sign out front that had a cute caricature of a dog and said "Welcome Daisy and Cappy" with a container of dog treats and a water bowl! What an amazing and thoughtful gesture that made us feel so special. The hotel staff from the front desk to the valets were all so welcoming, not only to our dogs, but to us and our two young kids. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were initially surprised because it was such a hip place with a decent night-time crowd, yet the staff did not make our family of children and dogs feel out of place in the lobby. Our room was impeccably clean and comfortable. We stayed in a "city view" room, which I'm used to in some hotels being a view of a building about 10 feet away, but it was a beautiful view of the city. I'm sure the water view is lovely too, but we enjoyed our view of the lights of Miami at night. The bathroom was very large. The dimmer switch was great to keep some soft light on at night. The kids loved that they could see the TV from the great bathtub. I know this is going to sound superlative, but the shampoo and conditioner in the room were amazing. My hair is softer than it's been since we moved to Florida and it began its subjection to constant sun, humidity, and chlorine. I used it all up during our stay, and now I'm kicking myself that I didn't bring the tubes home with me or retain the name of the brand! I meant to bring them home, and not doing so is my only regret! The pool area on the 16th floor was gorgeous. We all loved looking at the view of the river and Biscayne Bay and the boats, especially my 2-year old daughter. When we first got to the pool area both days, the attendants brought terry cloth chair covers and towels, as well as ice water. Then we just relaxed at the pool all day! The poolside food and beverage service was great. There is nothing better than sitting in the pool with a mojito, and the yummy chicken quesadillas hit the spot for lunch after a morning of sun and swimming. When we first got to the pool area in the morning, we worried a little bit that our kids (and my husband) splashing about would be annoying for the quieter crowd of adults / couples who were reading and sunning before lunchtime, but we tried not to be too noisy, and the number of kids and families definitely picked up by afternoon. We didn't feel like we were too loud or out of place for more than a few minutes (and nobody at the pool made us feel like this...I was just being hypersensitive, since I also value quiet relaxation when I'm traveling without my kids). The poolside food and drink service was intermittently a little slow, but the politeness and friendliness of the attendants more than made up for the wait. It was busy, both the pool area and the adjacent bar, so it was completely understandable that there was a bit of a wait....and the attendants were all clearly working very hard (and as for it being busy, we never felt like there were people lining up wanting our chairs or that the pool was too crowded, at all....it was just busy, not crowded). We never had any trouble getting chairs, but if it had been more crowded, we would have probably opted to rent one of the many poolside cabanas with comfy couches, some with flatscreen TVs. One thing we loved about the pool (that perhaps avid sunbathers would not) is that the sun goes behind the hotel midafternoon, so one of the 2 pools is more shady at that point. There was a lovely breeze, and we had gotten so much sun all mornng, the shade was welcome and allowed us to enjoy the pool for the rest of the afternoon as well. On to dinner! We had what my sister-in-law has dubbed a "beautiful dinner' at Area 31 restaurant. Again, we were 4 adults with 3 kids under 5 years old, yet they didn't make us feel out of place or unwanted at all, despite that fact that it is not necessarily the type of restaurant that we would go to with kids if we were home....it would be a "get a babysitter" type of restaurant, which is why we so appreciated how welcoming they were of our kiddos, since we didn't have a sitter with us in Miami. The children were pretty well-behaved, and loved the food (my son told us, "I like fancy dinners" afterward). Everything was delicious, and our waiter made excellent recommendations. I may have to return to the hotel if not for all the other good reasons, but just to have the amazing polenta side dish again! Sunday was checkout day, and we were so sad to leave. Once again, the hotel was incredibly accommodating and allowed us to have a late checkout, so we could enjoy the pool a little bit longer. When it was time to go, our dogs once again got an energetic goodbye pet from many staff members in the lobby, our children sadly waved goodbye, and it was time to go. We will certainly be back, and we were so impressed with the experience that we've decided to stay at only Kimpton hotels when we vacation in DC and NYC this fall! I hope other locations might use the same brand of shampoo and conditioner, and I'll actually remember to write it down this time! I use Trip Advisor all the time to pick hotels, but I've never written a review until now....the EPIC inspired me to do so! I'm so appreciative of the nice weekend we had there, I have been recommending it to everyone I've spoken to since we got home last night!

Reviews.Title: “Great building, patchy service”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyingmytrip
Reviews.Content: Very nice facilities but the staff are not reliably qualified. Had a very good welcome arriving late one evening with lots of luggage, rental car, and 3 year-old. The junior suite with city view (actually view of the Marriott facade) is big, tastefully furnished, good bed, large bathroom. Pool on 16 th floor is lovely. One day we ordered food and ate by the pool, no problems, extra tip, very nive pool attendant.The next day Jose told my wife she cannot have food because he is all by himself and too busy clearing up. He changed his mind after some questioning and my wife's suggestion that she would inform management. By that time she had lost her appetite. The elevators need a room key for the guest room levels and must not be stored next to credit cards or mobile phones. Fine. But they are unreliable. It can happen that they don't work on the elevator but if some else rides up with you, thereby giving you access to your floor, the key still works for the room. So the key has clearly not been magnetised by my phone but still does not work in the elevator. Today when I wanted to change the room key because it failed again in the elevator, a new problem presented itself. According to the receptionistI had apparently checked out on day 2 of my 3 day stay. Well, NO! Instead of fixing her useless booking system the robot receptionist asked for my ID and whether I had made 2 bookings, treating me like I am the idiot. Lastly, room service cannot identify the dishes on the room service menu even if I spell them on the phone. Depressing, if the hotel makes you think about the capabilities of the systems and people who are supposed to make your stay nicer and not aggregate you. Lovely building though.

Reviews.Title: “Best service (also check out Club Level!)”
Reviews.Author: TBRL
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is great. The staff is friendly and helpful. We stayed at the 29th floor which also included Club Level access. Be sure to make a reservation for club level because then you get the best service (5x a day drinks and snacks), and you get to meet Mark and Lucia. They will take good care of you. The rooms are big and clean. Great bathroom. Slow internet access though. Sign up for Kimpton In Touch program for free Wifi. They also have a great gym and nice pool on the 16th floor. The hotel is situated in Downtown so make sure you rent a car/bike (depending on how far you want to go) if you want to make a trip. Otherwise you'll have to spend a lot of money on cabs. Public transportation in Miami is terrible and walking long distances in that weather is not an option. Cab to south beach is 25 dollars for a one-way trip. A great and affordable restaurant located near the hotel is Ceviche 105, an authentic Peruvian restaurant with a great atmosphere. Also check out Garcia's for some Cuban seafood. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Epic Hotel is the best ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: allaboutjuanita
Reviews.Content: Let me start off my saying, I am not easily impressed. It takes a lot to impress me. The Epic Hotel impressed me from the moment I got out of the taxi. We arrived by taxi and were greeted and escorted in with our luggage. The bellman stayed with us while we checked in and stayed with us until we reached our room. Once we were in our room, he showed us where everything was located and showed us how to work everything. He then escorted us the the Concierge Level and told us about the 5 daily meal presentations, the open bar and happy hour. We went back to our room and looked stood on the balcony which over looked the water!!! It was beautiful!!!!! The room was clean and beautiful, the bed was comfortable and don't get me started on the shower. It was awesome. We signed up for their Intouch Loyalty Program and was allowed to use the laptop which was in the room for free!!!! We were also allowed to get $10 worth of items from the mini bar (for free) just by signing up for the loyalty program. The 5 meal presentations were great!!! The last presentation of the day were deserts. I had the best lemon meringue pie ever. I can honestly say that was the best lemon meringue pie I have ever tasted. The pool was really nice and beautiful. During happy hour, I had the best Sangria ever! I enjoyed the meal presentations, sangria, the room, the view and the list goes on. What stood out to me the most and truly impressed me was the service. The Epic has the best service that I have ever experienced. Everyone was so eager to meet your every need. Upon check-in, we were asked if we were celebrating anything. We told them it was our anniversary. We returned from dinner and found a nice bottle of Champagne and a beautiful card congratulating us waiting in the room. My review is all over the place but I want to make sure I don't leave anything out. We were going on a cruise and were not allowed to board the boat until 1:30 so we were granted a late check-out. We enjoyed our stay so much, we wanted to cancel our cruise and stay at the Epic the entire week (true statement). We reluctantly went on our cruise. Upon returning from our cruise, we had several hours to spend in Miami before our plane departed. We called the Epic and they allowed us to bring our luggage to the hotel to hold it for us so we would not have to carry it with us and we could enjoy more of Miami. Everyone must experience the EPIC Hotel!!!! A+++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. Would do again!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine11
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will let you know that I'm a hotel snob. The Epic was a very good choice for my BDay weekend! Stayed on Club Level floor. Room was nice and spacious with great views of the water and pool. Rooms very also very clean. Kind of got the W Hotel Vibe, but not quite. Club level needs a little more tweeking, as far as snacks constantly being out, but they were good when available. It would of also been nice to have the Club Level on the other side of the hotel overlooking the main pool. Even though there is a pool below the club level, no one was there during our stay. Maybe the hotel should considering making this another bar area to spread things out even more. If you wanted something that was not there, the staff would promptly get it for you. However, it's has some work to get to the level of the Ritz's club level. Food was good here also. Was there for the NBA playoff season and was a nice walk to the arena to watch the game. I've decided that if I was not staying at the W South Beach of Setai, that this would be my option when going to Miami!!! I will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - one of the best we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: KingDoody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EPIC Miami for 7 nights at the end of June. We had a water view Club room on the 29th Floor. In summary, the stay at the hotel was fantastic in all respects with very little to criticise. The main good and not so good points are summarised below: GOOD POINTS Hotel service was amazing, staff were attentive, friendly and very helpful without exception. Mark and Lucia in the club lounge deserve a special mention - nothing was too much trouble. Room quality was very good, ours was a club suite so we had loads of room, very well equipped with a large balcony. Room cleanliness was also excellent. Food and drinks from the club lounge were also superb - to be honest if you're not that hungry you can snack in the club lounge all day for free without needing to spend anything at restaurants - we did this when we were based around the pool. Pool area was lovely, lots of varied seating and lying areas and pool temperature(s) were just right for me Views from the hotel across the bay were amazing. Value for money was about right I'd say given the quality of the room and free access to food and drink Restaurants in the area were good and varied (Indian, Peruvian (highly recommended). We didn't try the hotel restaurants - they were quite expensive. Also we really enjoyed the Blue Martini bar in Mark Brickell area (happy hour 4pm to 8pm)! NOT SO GOOD POINTS Location was fine but would have been nicer to be closer to South Beach. The only practical way to South Beach from the hotel is by cab forabout $25 ($50 return) therefore making it pretty expensive for frequent visits. Definately worth a visit though.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great restaurants, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alasorte
Reviews.Content: The Epic, a new high-end hotel in Miami has it all. Fantastic waterfront downtown location with amazing views of Biscayne Bay and the city skyline, the friendliest and most accommodating staff I have yet experienced, terrific cutting edge architecture, comfy beds and rooms. My wife and I live an hour and a half away in West Palm Beach and have visited The Epic half a dozen times already this year for weekend getaways, and we intend to go back as soon as we can. We have stayed at many of the high end resort hotels in Miami and Miami Beach (South Beach) and have had good experiences nearly everywhere we have stayed. But The Epic really is a level above the rest, in my opinion. One of the nicest perks is the automatic upgrade feature if you join their free Kimpton-In-touch program. We paid the base room rate for our stay last weekend but got upgraded to a roomy suite with amazing views. And it even came with a free $10 credit to raid the mini-bar, free wine each evening and a $25 gift certificate for the spa! (In case you haven't guessed yet, the spa and gym are first class.) And a special shout out to Ashley at the front desk, who makes us feel like old friends every time we show up.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: steffreen
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the 28th floor and it was SO worth it! Our view was beautiful and we loved sitting on our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: toronto_natie
Reviews.Content: The Epic exceeded our expectations! We were two girls, looking for a fun and relaxing trip, and that is exactly what we got. The hotel is beautiful, modern, spacious, and well-located in downtown Miami, by the marina. Our room was excellent; large, well laid-out; the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The bathrooms are large with a shower and bathtub (from which you can see out the balcony!). We were in a city view - beautiful sights in the evening. Breakfast was included; good selection of fresh fruit, breads, spreads, cereal and coffee/tea. We ate on the concourse - you can't ask for a better way to enjoy breakfast! By the pool, we snacked on civeche (exceptional!), chips and salsa (very tasty) and local ale. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Paul @ the bar, Ruby and Jose @ the pool area, and JP, the concierge! A short walk (or an even shorter taxi ride) will get you to Mary Brickell Village for shopping, dining, and a bit of partying. The streets are quiet and safe, even in the evening. South Beach is a taxi ride away ($16-22 depending on traffic and time of day). More shops, eateries, people watching, chic hotel lobbies, clubs, and, of course, the beach await you! It was great to be at a lovely hotel with gorgeous pools during the day, and close enough to SoBe to party at night. Epic also has a great resto/lounge on the main floor that attracted a great crowd on Friday and Saturday nights; it's called Zuma.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Manuel Antonio National Park, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TulemarDave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic during a long layover at MIA......mainly to check out the architecture....design and ambiance.....plus to experience a top rated hotel.....I wasn't disappointed.....but I wasn't blown away either.....first, the service.....valet (no greeting)....the person who opened the door....very nice....front desk.....good....the bellman who became my "best friend" and knew my name was excellent (Tyler/Tyson?).....the concierges in the club floor lounge......the woman in the afternoon had the personality/warmth of a door knob.....the gentleman who worked that night was exceptional.....the woman the next morning was friendly and helpful......the room was great.....loved the design/amenities.....and large balcony......my TV wasn't working....but after a phone call the repairmen was there IMMEDIATELY and fixed the problem......my only real complaint was the view.....I was on the 30th floor....ocean side.....and didn't see much of the water.....I did enjoy the architecture of the surrounding buildings and the beautiful yachts moored below.....but the view is more "waterway" and urban than ocean.....I do think some of the photographs are misleading.....I would stay here again.....for a layover....but I think I will experience another hotel for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: martinmasllorens
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the hotel, and enjoyed every minute of it. Excellent location, with acces to the I95 just one minute away; beautiful sight from the room; very comfortable room, bed and bathroom. Internet connection ok, and received a gift for the minibar (nice touch). But the best was the superb attention from everyone of the staff, from the girls at the reception desk to the guys attending the pool. (BTW, do try and relax at the pool). Very warm, fast in their responses, and exceeding expectations. Also, don`t forget to try the restaurants. Finally, the atmosphere is unique, completely different from what I experienced in other hotels, making us feel at the same time as if we were not at an hotel, but very much like home, with all the benefits of a superior attention and comfortable and nice surroundings. Definitely would stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: travelindiva96
Reviews.Content: We checked in around noon and we were wowed from the moment we walked through the door. The staff was particularly friendly and offered advice on things to do in the area. The actual hotel is breathtakingly beautiful. Our room was on the 26th floor with a bay view. We could see the cruise ships from our balcony. The balcony is HUGE, great place to relax with a drink and watch the sunrise There are 2 pools which were never really crowded. The cabanas are also a great place to relax.. There is also a computer in thee room which was very convenient. I am so over Miami Beach. Whenever I return to Miami, I will only stay at the Epic, No other hotel measures up..

Reviews.Title: “Luxury ..we felt spoilt!”
Reviews.Author: Ken500500
Reviews.Content: As three 60 somethings who've been to most of the continents and experienced 5 star service in Singapore, Vancouver and Thailand, we loved this hotel. The service was superb: from fetching your car and giving you iced water while you waited a couple of minutes; to the superb breakfasts delivered to your room promptly. The location and views from our blacony were amazing. We never did dinner at The Epic as the menu was interesting to me, but too adventurous for my wife and her sister. A lovely 3 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Am i ever glad our conference hotel was sold out!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrbarile
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was recommended by a nearby hotel where an international conference was being held and I most certainly got a superior hotel experience at Epic--all staff were amazingly over-the-top gracious without obsequious or intrusive behavior. Room design/layout was non-standard and pleasing, contemporary architecture, low key but very glamorous restaurants and fabulous spa with outdoor heated pool on 16 floor. In a neighborhood that access downtown and nearby islands for walking, with gorgeous garden landscaping and landmark sculpture along the riverfront. What a way to be introduced to Miami--couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice/facny boutique hotel...”
Reviews.Author: WeinaFD
Reviews.Content: My girls and I stayed over the place for a bachlorette party. We had a car, initially it was a little confusing trying to get our car valet because we landed pretty land, almost 1AM, the night club/lounge there was definitely pumping. Once we got that all taken care off, the check in was a breeze. We had a really nice room with a balcony facing the city, would probably have been nicer if we were so cheap to upgrade to the water side view. Anyway, we were on the club level, which was an awesome floor to be at. They had club lounge access where they serve you food 5 times a day 7 days a week, drinks included. So if you ever go to the epic hotel, remember to upgrade yourself to the club level, we think it's definitely worth the money. The people working there were very friendly from the club level to the swimming pool attendees, (it's a little windy at the pool). OH, for the car valet, just call them before you head down, they are super fast as well, unless if you lose your claim tag :p We would highly recommend the hotel, already did to my parents, my in-laws and my relatives. One more thing, in the spa, they have both the sauna and steam room, added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the Epic”
Reviews.Author: Ekoi
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and friendly hotel. If you want to eat at Zuma or Area 31, I suggest that you make a reservation ahead and wear proper attire. The food in both restaurants is a delight with well trained and polite waiters, not the kind to inquire about your first name and origin, which is so tacky in so many restaurants and hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews Don't Lie, Just a Couple of Quirks”
Reviews.Author: doctorgooz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel pre-cruise based mainly on reviews I've read on Tripadvisor. This really is a very nice place - has a bit of the "W" vibe, although much brighter and cheerier. Nice location just across the river from Brickell. Great pool area (the attendants were outstanding), and the Area 31 restaurant, while not cheap, was good and the outside dining area was great. The strange part - we arrived the day the Heat were playing in game 6 of the Finals. All the employees were wearing "Go Heat" shirts, and the hotel was serving as the media center for ESPN and Dallas media (from what I could tell). So, we asked where we could watch the game, and were steered to a couple of the bars in the hotel. After dinner, my wife and I wanted to catch the 4th quarter. One bar was closed, and the other didn't have a TV! Very strange for the media center hotel. Plus, if there are no TVs, just tell me, okay? And other than some "attitude" in the restaurant, everything else was great. Give this place a try!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing and amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DMDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon before heading out to sea on a cruise. This hotel can be described with two small words: The Best! Aside from the hotel being top notch top to bottom, the employees take this hotel from being wonderful to someplace truly special. Example: when we mentioned that we were on our honeymoon Farah was quick to congratulate us and explain everything we needed to know. She was about as warm and kind as anyone i have ever met! After settling in our room we went to dinner at the in house restaurant (superb), we returned to our room to find a hand written congrats card from Farah, a bottle of champaign and a very delicious dessert! Again, an amazing amazing person. The Restaurant on site, again, great, but beware the drinks are a bit on the strong side, no complaints here though. Pool = beautiful and the service here is on par with every other part of the hotel You're waited on hand and foot. My conclusion, you would be crazy to stay anywhere else, or even consider it for that matter. This property has it all, amazing employees who actually care about you, rooms that are a step above heavenly, food to write home about (or email) and a pool experience that is second to none. It's obvious why The Epic is #1. Only con = Me (for taking almost a year to write about our amazing experience)! We cannot wait to return! Thanks, David

Reviews.Title: “Special 49th anniversary weekend and we're looking forward to our 50th with Epic”
Reviews.Author: pattijjean
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, comfortable beds, and exquisite view from the large balcony. We happened to mention when booking, that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. Upon arrival the check-in desk clerks all congratulated us. When we got to our room there was champagne and strawberries waiting for us. Room service was prompt and delicious. We were spoiled at the pool with Cabana Boys attending to our every need. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. Can't wait to go back for our 50th next year!!

Reviews.Title: “The best time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: antitruster50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the EPIC Hotel in Downtown Miami on 06/21. Upon my arrival I received a warm welcome at the doors and proceeded to check-in. Oscar, I believe was his name, went out of bounds to accomodate and make my pleasure trip an unforgettable experience.
