He arranged for a great view and a special welcome wine, chocolate and strawberries when I told him I was bringing someone very special for only a couple of hours. Sure enough I had the best day of my life. It sure made me a loyal customer for life. If I could rate it over 5 stars I would do it. Keep up the great work, it sure pays off...

Reviews.Title: “We cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: stephcapone1
Reviews.Content: The Epic Hotel in downtown Miami is absolutely amazing! Everything is so beautiful and the views are great. All of the hotel staff were beyond friendly and accommodating. It was so nice to always have someone smiling at you and asking if you need anything. I definitely recommend upgrading to Club Level because they offer small snacks throughout the day. It was also nice to be on a private floor with key access only. Definitely visit this hotel if you are looking for a relaxing getaway just 20 minutes from South Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: NotherOne
Reviews.Content: We selected the EPIC hotel based on recommendations from Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We loved the service and our room with a view. We also liked the location because we were interested in exploring several parts of the city. We were able to hit the Design District, Coral Gables, Little Havana, and Coconut Grove in addition to spending the days at South Beach. We did not have a car - we used taxis the entire time. Our favorite things were how friendly and helpful the staff was, the pool area with a wide variety of loungers that included traditional pool loungers, comfy outdoor living room-type furniture, futon-style beds, and cushioned chaises. We never had any trouble getting a spot and we did not run down early to "save" them. We were also incredibly impressed with the food at Area 31. We enjoyed both our breakfasts and an amazing dinner. Dining out in Miami is expensive and this was no exception, but at Area 31, we got a much better meal for the money. The innovative cuisine at dinner was especially memorable - among the best meals I have had anywhere recently. Being at the EPIC and in Miami made us feel like we were worlds away, but with plenty of conveniences and all the comforts that Kimpton Hotels are known for.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Tips_AB
Reviews.Content: Best service ever. The staff was amazing, and went of their way to make sure we had a great time. We went for an evening swim after the pool station closed, and a nearby housekeeper brought us all some fresh towels. I requested an in-room coffee maker when I checked in, and it was sent up within 15 minutes. The room service was also extremely prompt. It was a bit of a trek to get out to South Beach, where we spent most of our time, but the hotel was worth it. If you're exploring the area around the hotel, be sure to walk along the waterfront over to the Bayside Marketplace area - it's much more scenic than cutting through the city.

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotels were like this!”
Reviews.Author: Davidob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic for three days before joining a cruise. Not a lot to add to other reviwers other than to say I agree that this is a great hotel. We had a club water view king room which was perfect, great view, great bed, lovely bathroom, free wifi and computer (why don't all hotels do this?). The staff in the club lounge were exceptional, making our stay perfect, particularly Mark and Reuben, who really went out of their way to make us welcome, and were really helpful with recommendations for restaurants etc. I would definately stay in a Kimpton hotel again and I would have no hesitation in recommending the Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: masingha
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on our first year anniversary. My wife mentioned it we our anniversary and they upgraded us to a suite. My wife being my wife, didn't like the room, the staff happily gave us another one which was to her liking. Youâ€™re in downtown so south beach is about a 20 minutes away, we hired a car 3 days about 120$. Cabs will cost you much more. Room was spacious and clean all the mod cons had a bar and restaurant down the way. To be honest we didn't stick around the area and spent all the nights in south beach where the parties were.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a city where it's hard to find”
Reviews.Author: VaCavalier
Reviews.Content: What makes Epic stand out is the friendly and accommodating service throughout the property (except the overhyped, overpriced, phony & pretentious Zuma Restaurant off the lobby, which is leased by a third party and not under Epic management's control). I enjoyed a water facing Club Floor room on the 29th floor and it was spacious, though from Epic's vantage point one views more high rise nondescript buildings than actually viewing Miami Bay (the Bay front views from the Mandarin Orientel are better). The friendliness and welcome one receives by the staff at the Club Lounge is outstanding. I thoroughly enjoyed Chef E. Michael's Reidt's superb, creative cuisine the hotel's Area 31 restaurant on the 16th floor. The health club's last appointment is 8 PM and it closes at 9 PM, so no saunas after that hour (too bad for late arrivals). All in all, you won't be disappointed. Way to go Kimpton (free internet for members of Kimpton In Touch, which is free to join).

Reviews.Title: “Third year and still perfect”
Reviews.Author: CEMCRAIN
Reviews.Content: This was my third year at the Epic, same club floor, same suite, same top service, new faces. My wife and I are celebrating our 20th and out many destinations we picked Miami, and out of many Hotels we picked the Epic. It is a great all around hotel, and the service of the staff from the parking to the room is what sets it apart. We saw old familiar faces like Gene the club concierge and Bonaldo who was promoted and is now down at the front desk we were happy to see that. We met new people and made friends, Oscar club concierge was superb and Lucia and Mark servicing the club lounge were amazing, my wife said management really hires great people who understand customer service something we did not see at other hotels in Miami like the Rtiz or the Viceroy. Bravo Epic you are on top and know how to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kbmarco4
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this wonderful hotel and while I did not have the view I had on my first stay, I was still very impressed. Beautiful rooms, great service at the pool, front desk, etc. I chose this hotel for our meeting based on my stay in November 2010. My coordinators could not thank me enough for allowing them this treat. It really was great and I would recommend this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Service, Stylish, all you need and want in Miami”
Reviews.Author: jreinoso
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic Hotel in Miami, FL (Brickell Ave.) June 2011 and it was fantastic. Very Trendy, Clean, Stylish, Fantastic Service and Great Food. The front desk personnel was very kind and informative. The ambiance was outstanding and the rooms were very clean, open, wonder views just superb!!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates style, great service and wonderful ambiance. Trust me you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djhallett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a top choice if you are staying in Miami.We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early May 11. Superb location for downtown Miami, 20 minutes to South Beach,quality rooms,very good staff. You can't fault the hotel. Reuben the "Conceirge "was fantastic with advise for tours and local eating places. We would recommend without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at another Kimpton Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JAmerican2
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me for my birthday and booked a suite on the club level (29th floor of 30 floors) at Epic! It is located in the heart of Miami with gorgeous views of the Miami River and the downtown area. The room was well appointed with desktop computer/desk in the livingroom, flat screen tvs in both the bedroom and livingroom, rain shower and tub in the bathroom, and a balcony in the bathroom and livingroom! The view from the bedroom was amazing! The bed faced a wall that was a full window from the ceiling to the floor! It faced the rooftop of the JW Marriott next door, which had a pool! We were tucked away in a corner room, so it was very quiet, with no noise from other guests' rooms. We had the feeling that we were in our own little world! The club level has a lounge where we could get snacks and breakfast in the morning. We had a full breakfast at the hotel restaurant downstairs, but we did have some of the chocolate that was laid out the night before...yummy! There are two pools, sitting next to each other. One is heated, the other is not. We used the heated pool and it was just wonderful! Service at the pool was just ok! The server apparently dropped a few things on her uniform blouse and didn't bother to change, so I didn't think it was a good look for such a classy hotel. Also, although there were just a few people at the pool, our server took a bit of time getting everything together-from having us place our order to delivering the order, etc. Also, as well, my husband had to send her back to find out what kind of cheeses were on the cheese platter. She seemed content to tell him she didn't know when asked. I'm thinking the proper response would have been, "I'm not sure, sir, but I will find out for you." Also, I ordered the chips and salsa, which came with chips, salsa, and sour cream. I later asked for more salsa and she never bothered to ask if I'd also like more sour cream...It seems picky, but those are the things that stand out to guests, especially one like me, that writes reviews all the time. It's the little things and attention to detail that make a difference. Speaking of the service...My husband was not pleased, since he'd made arrangements to surprise me the month before and even drove down to the hotel to make sure everything was just right. Everything was confirmed several times, yet, when we arrived, the room was not ready, the Club Level attendant seemed confused as to whether we had a reservation or not, and the champagne and birthday treat was not in the room when we arrived, as was previously discussed and confirmed. I had a massage at the spa, which was really relaxing and nice! They have a sauna and a steam room, which I used before the massage. The steam room was a bit different. It didn't get that foggy, steamy, like others, instead it was just a really warm room, with very light steam. There was a waiting room, which had lounge chairs and complimentary water and tea, plus neck pillows that were in a warmer and felt so good on my neck! I thought that was a nice touch! My massage therapist did a good job. I had a deep tissue, but she did it more like a deep swedish, which was fine, since it was so relaxing. Overall, I had a lovely time at the hotel and would rate it higher, if it weren't for the service. I kind of had the feeling that they were relying on the fact that the hotel itself was so nice, that no one would notice anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveholsandfood
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the location was great. The staff were really friendly in the hotel, Oscar checked us in after a long flight from the UK, and booked us into a room with a amazing view. The bed was very comfortable and each room has its own computer which is free to use. Thank you Epic

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camelus
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 3 nights although we had planned for 9 (urgent family matters made us return home) but the time we spent there was fantastic. It's arguably the best hotel in the US we have been to. The room was top, with a fantastic view of the bay, the pool(s) was great, and the restaurant at the 16th floor was just stunning at night. I can't imagine better service in a hotel. We will surely return probably this coming fall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but the EPIC team made all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah48324
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know where to begin to tell you how appreciative I am of the amazing team at the EPIC! We had an event there the last week of May, that was, well, perfect! Due to some challenging economic times, at one point after we had been working with your team, but prior to the event, they almost cancelled the event due to budgetary constraints. We pleaded that the value of the event would far outweigh the cost, but as a result the pressure was on!!! We had to create a flawless, meaningful event, and with the help of the EPIC team, we did just that! The property, itself, is lovely and classy. I was proud to have people pull up to such a beautiful place. However, it truly was the people at the EPIC that made the event so positive and meaningful. From the doormen to the concierge to the front desk to housekeeping, and especially the event staff (conferences, banquet, etc.) everyone was so kind, patient, helpful, and went out of their way to make you feel welcome and as if their whole world revolved around you! During the closing of our meeting, we surveyed our attendees to gather their feedback. Some of the comments sharedâ€¦ â€œEverything was perfect!â€� â€œKeep it in Miami!!! This was a wonderful hotel!â€� â€œMake Miami an annual destination.â€� â€œSame location â€“ great in so many ways.â€� â€œLocation, location, location!! Great job!â€� Thank you. Thank you for such a wonderful experience. Thank you for making me and our leadership that fought to not have the meeting cancelled look good when it truly was your team that excelled! Thank you for hiring the best people! You have a special team working at your property. I say team because they truly work together, helping each other, doing whatever needs to be done to ensure a great client experience. Being in the service industry, I wanted you to know how much I and others recognized and appreciated that! You are a first class organization with top notch people. You should be proud. I know that I was very proud to be working with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AmAstley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights on the club level. Gene, Mark & Lucia were a delight to meet, we felt safe with Gene around he is extremely good at his job and very organised. Mark is one of the most hardworking and pleasant people we have met, very attentive and Lucia was a lovely lady. The hotel is very modern, good location and very clean. The club level was worth the price, the breakfast had everything you want, and even the lunch time offering had sandwiches. We are not night owls so decided to stay in the lounge in the evenings and it was very nice to be able to relax on the balcony with a drink. It was great for us; we just popped out early evening for a meal then spent the rest of the evening in the club lounge. It worked well for us. The only problem we had was that my husband did take the time to email ahead of our stay to request a room without a connecting door, but of course it had one! So we spent all three nights sleeping with ear plugs in! On hindsight we should have complained and moved but we were on the road a while and I got scared driving in South Beach (due to the hip hop week it was extremely busy) I just wanted to relax and didnâ€™t have the energy to complain about the connecting door! I donâ€™t know why hotels put them in so many rooms, you may as well just share a room with the people next door you can hear everything they say and I didnâ€™t fancy listening to the TV at 4am in the morning! Kimpton hotels are such a good chain, we stayed at Vero Beach earlier in our road trip and that was such a different hotel compared to the Epic which is nice when itâ€™s all part of a chain. We did a city tour and an everglades tour during our stay it was well worth it. The Everglades trip was very enjoyable and exciting. Thank you to all of the club level staff who made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the U.S. as far as i'm concerned”
Reviews.Author: Coface
Reviews.Content: Since i have an office in Miami, i travel there quite often. This was my first stay at the Epic and i can tell you it was the best experience I had in my 18 years in traveling. There is always something to do weather it be at night or during the day. The roof top pool and the night life is amazing. The view of the harbor and the city is amazing. The roof top pool is immaculate and a wonderful place to relax after a hard day of working. I would recommend anyone who travels or just looking to get away to stay at this hotel. It will be hard to top this hotel. Classy, friendly, comfortable and spectacular views of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER IMPRESSED EVEN WITH HIGH EXPECTATIONS FROM THE START!!”
Reviews.Author: center2511
Reviews.Content: Immediately upon arrival, we could tell this hotel was going to be special. The outside/lobby area was amazing. Every single member of the staff was super friendly, attentive and would cater to any request we threw their way. We stayed in the waterview king room on the club level floors. The club lounge had complimentary breakfast, small lunch, cocktail hour, etc. It was WELL worth it. The price is such a steal for the quality of hotel this place is. We spent 3 days lounging and drinking at the pool. We ate at both restaurants (Area 31 and Zuma) and both were amazing. We also had a couples massage at exhale spa. Once again, another amazing service provided by the staff at Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: VnKy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when my company had arranged a 3 day event in this hotel. The hotel rooms were very spacious, clean and had a wonderful view of downtown Miami. You could walk to Bayside-market under 5 mins from this hotel which made shopping very accessible. Most of downtown clubs are within a mile so makes it a favourite hotel for late-night birds. Food was awesome and they have a very good spa, will recommend deep tissue massage. Very friendly staff who go all the way to make your stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking room, exciting stay”
Reviews.Author: harrycarayChicago
Reviews.Content: A work trip and corporate travel planner delivered my colleagues and me to the EPIC hotel in late May/early June 2011. I'd had pleasant stays at Kimpton properties previously, but this one was the best. The room was tremendous, with great views of Miami's high-rises and waterways, and the accommodations were classy and comfortable. Service was outstanding, friendly and eager to help. There was a buzz about the lobby, especially in the evening, that actually made the stay enjoyable -- Miami is a lively city and this was an exciting place to stay. But sleep was easy to come by on the quiet floor where my room was located. Have traveled to Miami many times and rarely have had memorable hotel experiences. This one at the EPIC changed that tradition. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AmyECleveland
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel; wonderful staff; fabulous restaurants. Will stay here again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “An OUTSTANDING experience, again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Macmartirossian
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the EPIC. The property is beautiful with a great pool on the 16th floor. The staff and the associated service are world class. Many of the rooms have outstanding views of the Bay or the City. Situated in the Brickell section of Miami, you have no need for a car, and can walk to many restaurants and bars. It is the staff that make the biggest difference with a warm welcoming and throughout your stay. We will be back, again and again, in fact this coming September!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great rooms & exceptional service on the Club level! Good value too”
Reviews.Author: DaveTJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic (club level) for three days in Mid-May after spending the previous days in South beach. We contacted Epic ahead of our schedule to confirm a couple of special requests and the Resort Manager, Jacqueline Ploettner, was exceptional in responding quickly and confirmed all our requests. Jacqueline and all the staff we had contact with in the club level were outstanding, even better than we expected! A special thank you goes to Gene, Mark and Rachel (I think thatâ€™s her name) for being so helpful and meeting our vegetarian dietary requirements. The views from the room are nice, especially if you are facing the bay. The rooms and bathrooms are of a good size. The bathrooms have his and her sinks, shower cubicle and most have a deep soaking tub too. The balconies are nice to sit out on and view the boats coming to in to the bay area. The beds were large and very comfortable and soft, as were the 6-8 pillows â€“ a great place to relax after a long day walking/driving around. The continental breakfast in the club level is nice, although there is a bigger breakfast selection in the hotelâ€™s main restaurant. We had a hot breakfast one day and the food was very tasty. The club level food at the 5 daily food presentations is nice and tasty, and the ability to have continuous free drinks, spirits and soft drinks is a real benefit and worth the extra for the club level The Club level concierges are helpful and knowledgeable on tourist information as well as local information (with recommendations for dinners etc) and there is a real personal touch in the Club Lounge. The hotel is located on the bay, and is on the waterfront. There is a pharmacy within 2 blocks (i.e. 2-3 mins walk) and the metro/monorail station is very close by too. Biscayne Bay market is about a 10 minute walk and has some touristy shops and places to eat. Brickell Village is again about a 10 minute walk and has loads of great restaurants and bars and a really nice place to go for an evening stroll and have dinner â€“ we went there every night and the atmosphere was great â€“ well worth a visit. It was completely safe to walk there at night time from the hotel, but as with anywhere always be vigilant and aware of your surroundings. For those wanting to go to South Beach, its probably about a 15-20 min drive max (unless youâ€™re going in rush hour). We didnâ€™t get a chance to use the spa or pool, but both looked welcoming. We used valet parking and it was generally quick but its worth calling down to tell them to have your car ready if you are in a rush. All in all, the hotel and staff are great, and service is exceptional. Given the price we paid, we would say its very good value for money, especially compared to south beach and would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay down town. A couple of tips - if you want to go see the aligators at the everglades, we'd recommend using Coopertown - they were really good. Its about a 30-40 min drive to the everglades from the Hotel and worth it. Secondly if you want to go to the Keys, its a good 3.5 hour drive to Key West. We drove through Key Largo and stopped at Isla Morado for lunch with a sea view - amazing views and food!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Beautiful People”
Reviews.Author: kellymckean
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has every amenity you can think of. Our room was so beautiful - huge bed - bathroom with open window to the room - the decor was modern, sleek and comfortable. Our balcony had a breathtaking view of the canal towards South Beach. When my husband saw the room, he said - honey, I feel like Paris Hilton. The lobby was packed with models in stiletto heals with slinky dresses. The restaurants and bars were hopping. The food excellent - beautiful food for beautiful people. Room service delivered a microwave to our room for us to keep for the remainder of our stay. The mechanic came up to disassemble my daughter's bike and then went out to CVS to buy some super glue for me. The front desk staff are truly genuine happy people. Join the Kimpton Loyalty club for free wifi and a $10 mini-bar credit. The Epic was like floating in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: helendodi
Reviews.Content: A really excellent hotel. Couldn't fault service or cleanliness and staff extremely friendly and helpful. If we ever go back to Miami, we will definitely stay here again as it made our stay truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “When can we go back?”
Reviews.Author: fpiesiec
Reviews.Content: I was here on a convention in January 2011 and reviewed it then. This time around, brought the hubby. With some trepidation, I was wondering whether my recollections and expectations of the " fabulosity" of the hotel would be dashed as I had repeatedly told my husband he would love, love, love it. I didn't have to convince him at all as the concierge at the front desk (sorry, I'm bad with names) escorted us to the Club Lounge on the 29th floor, introduced us to MARK (5***** asset to Kimpton) and then to our room. We were in a hurry to make it to our reservation to Zuma as our flight arrived 3 hours later than planned. Since we couldn't stay around for cocktails, Mark brought 2 flutes of bubbly to our room to welcome us to the hotel. We managed to change clothes in time, and before we headed down to the Lobby with the champagne in hand, stopped by the Lounge to thank Mark who then would not let us go down until he topped of our glasses. Zuma, in turn continued the great welcome, as the restaurant manager that I remembered from January immediately offered to pour our bubbly to Zuma's own flutes; I was ready for the usual "Sorry, you can't bring that in here" routine. What a great beginning to a wonderful 3 nights at the Epic--all done so smoothly and so well orchestrated. Mark gave us gems of recommendations to our first Peruvian restaurant (mostly locals) and a very local seafood restaurant by the river. We wouldn't have found these on our own. He would have to tell you the places himself as I don't want them to get too touristy and to lose that local flavor. My husband is already looking ahead at this schedule to see when we can come back...

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay when in Miami”
Reviews.Author: g-w-r3
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, and the only place we will stay. They are so attentive to your needs, they remember your name, and well, just "Kiss your Butt". The rooms are beautiful, Food is great, Spa wonderful. If you have the opportunity to stay here it is well worth it. "B" you are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its trip advisor rating!”
Reviews.Author: cjh25
Reviews.Content: We arrived slightly concerned having two young children in tow to this trendy city escape, but these fears quickly vanished as soon as we had handed over our keys to the valet and made our way to the dedicated check in for club level guests. Although we cant compare to the standard rooms, i would whole heartedly recommend upgrading if you are able to. The level of service, food, drinks and ambience we experienced was like no other hotel we have stayed at anywhere in the world. The team on the 23 rd floor work tirelessly to make you feel at ease and our children felt at home straight away. We were upgraded to a suite and received champagne and strawberries as a suprise from the hotel for our recent wedding in nyc, which was much appreciated. The pool area was very swish and trendy and my wife and daughter loved the pool, which is not really geared up for kids but managed to fill a few hours. Computer and free wifi was a great touch also. The area was great for us and although our first trip to Miami, was prefferred over staying near south beach. The nearby harbour shops were great for a family. We will return to Miami and we will be back to the Epic every time!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Epic!!”
Reviews.Author: slicnic17
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was "Fantastic"!!! I stayed for three days during Memorial Day weekend and did not want to leave!! The staff greeted us each time we left and returned to the hotel, they were friendly even at the oddest of hours, and answered every question we had with a smile. I can't begin to describe how amazing the room was!! We had a view of the pools and the harbor that was picture-esque!! We can't wait until next year: We wil be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Tripadvisor reviews said - and more”
Reviews.Author: PJJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 14 nights in a Club Level room -much longer than most guests because we change our travel plans - but enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel is great but the concierge team and staff who looked after us at Club Level just made the stay that special. Rooms are spacious and well fitted. It was the first USA hotel where we have been able to sleep with the A/C on - its so quiet. Some traffic and river noise, but didnt keep us awake. The pool deck team were very good. Unfortunately the sun moves off of the 16th pool-deck by 3pm at this time of year, so you might want to get your rays in the morning. Area 31 restaurant had a new chef and new menu and whilst dinner was good you certainly need to order several courses. The outside dining area has good views down Brickel Ave - 16 floors below, but sadly it doesn't face the ocean. I was concerned about the hotel's "Downtown Miami" location, but need not have been. Lots of restaurants within easy walking distance or short taxi ride

Reviews.Title: “This is simply an amazing hotel......”
Reviews.Author: cjhubbard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for memorial day weekend 2011 and once I stepped in the front lobby, I knew I was going to have an amazing experience. I came with a group rate and I couldn't pass up the offer as regular rates are pretty high. I also didn't want to stay in South Beach and deal with the foolishness that goes on over there, at the same time be close, have a bit of R&R and enjoy myself. First, I stayed in a city view room and the I was still able to see the ocean and the landscape of Brickell. Although it was a little noisy due to traffic and the boats during the day, it was okay as you can either close the balcony door or sit outside and enjoy the weather. The hotel was so good that I changed my flight and decided to stay an extra day just to soak in the rest of the experience of the hotel. When I return to Miami, I'm definitely returning to this hotel to stay. This was one of my best hotel experiences yet.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern and some of the best Miami views”
Reviews.Author: jrkmills
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to The Epic and we were overwhelmed with the gorgeous architecture, the staff and our room. We enjoyed touches like free internet (once you sign up for their program at check-in), the $10 'raid the minibar' and $25 spa credits. The view from our Jr. Suite was spectactular, the room very comfortable and we loved the balconies outside the bathroom as well as living room. Both hotel restaurants were terrific, hotel service was excellent and the staff were amazingly professional and friendly. They are environmentally concientious with their Earthcare program and promote charitable organizations which I applaud, I would definiitely recommend this hotel and will stay at other Kimpton's when travelling based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “How do you improve on perfection?”
Reviews.Author: Littlejohn
Reviews.Content: In my view the entire Epic team should be very, very proud of themselves and their hotel. This property starts from an enviable position - located in a stunning city, in a wonderful location right on the waterfront, with beautiful views, rooms and facilities. It is however the staff who make this hotel stand head & shoulders above the competition. Every single member of the team we dealt with were 100% engaged and involved with their guests. To single out people I'd mention Andrew on of the concierge team on the Club level - he confidently suggested we try a local Coconut Grove, Thai restaurant which he loves - we did and guess what, we loved it too. Also our waiter in Area 31 had the best knowledge of any menu and cooking process that we've experienced - stunning. This level of involvement is what makes places special - Epic management - you've done well, make sure you keep your team! We've only been home a day and have already recommended the Epic to 4 different people!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, and high quality property!!”
Reviews.Author: Hall_B1974
Reviews.Content: I was actually doing business at the EPIC and met many of the staff at all different levels and the feeling I got from each one was the same - they are truly proud of this property and go out of their way to make their clients comfortable there. It is a high quality faciltiy run by a high quality company.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- only the Kimpton Group could be this stylish”
Reviews.Author: Toutpartout
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during for the Thanksgiving sales. Had stayed at Kimpton hotels before so knew that hotel would be of a high standard. Hotel is in downtown Biscayne so you would have to drive through the maze of over- and underpasses to get there but it is suprisingly close to the airport( 15-20 mins on a traffic free morning) Room was huge and there was a jacuzzi and shower as well . Internet access was free ( I am a Kimpton InTouch member). Had asked for a crib for my infant son and it was ready and waiting along with the rail guards ( one of the few hotels I have stayed at which provides them). The neutral colours and the calm decor really made a difference. Lobby is very minimalist in design and the hotel tries hard at not being just another tower of concrete in the Biscayne area. The view of the marina was great. THe pic of the pool looks like this when there is no one around. Also, the restaurant is a bit pricey as the breakfast menu is al la carte - there was no buffet. THere is only valet parking. Despite the trendiness and the posers at the (hotel's) nightclub next door, it is really quiet and child-friendly!! All in all a great stay and would stay again. Love the Kimpton hotel groups- their hotels are so original in design and gastronomy!! No need for me to post photos because the pics of the hotel and rooms are the real deal which is nice!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher50
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly, we were all amazed. They remembered the smallest things, including putting a welcome sign at the entrance to the hotel for our little doggy. The decor, ambiance, cleanliness and cool vibe all contributed to making our stay top notch. I would go back in a minute! Thanks everyone at the Epic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbarlow85
Reviews.Content: The Epic hotel in Miami is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff was so welcoming and helpful. Our room was huge and had a gorgeous waterfront view (which we were upgraded to without even having to ask!). The restaurant is great and the pool deck is beautiful. Nothing bad to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An Epic Stay - WOW!”
Reviews.Author: cammieBaltimore_Md
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel from check in to check out. The entire staff is very friendly and professional. The club level services were awesome as was the club level staff. Gene Ruotolo, our concierge, e-mailed us prior to our arrival and greeted us by name each time we saw him. Lucia, Mark, and Raquel at Club Level were also great. Lucia makes a great cappuccino! She also made a tasty margarita for me on Cinco de Mayo. Gene arranged for us to visit Jungle Island (love that place!) and made reservations for Zuma (a hard place to get into last minute). The room was spacious and a desktop computer was available in the room - nice touch! Our room was on the 30th floor which afforded awesome views of the water. The hotel pool was very relaxing and there are enough options for lounging to satisfy everyone. The Mountain Lemonade (44 north rainier cherry and huckleberry vodka, muddled berries, and homemade lemonade) was to die for. I was there for Mother's Day and made use of the spa -- very relaxing. My husband really liked the fitness center, which is open 24-hours. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jmhalo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! It was right near the bayside, which was nice! The bayside area had live music every night and the restaurants and stores there stayed open much longer than the regular downtown area. The room had an amazing view, and the hotel lounge zyma was extremely nice! The overall environment at the hotel was extremely nice and I would definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Calitomiami30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month for a company function and I had to go back! I just got back from a 4 night stay here and this place is breathtaking! The service, the rooms, the views, everything is amazing! Its in a perfect location in downtown Miami! Close to everything! The rooms are kinda pricey but it Is definetly worth it' trust me you will not be disappointed ! If I go back to Miami again u will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel, but avoid the 28th floor...”
Reviews.Author: MrR0bin
Reviews.Content: ...since the 29th is the club lounge/restaurant and our room was very noisy. Chairs and tables constantly scraping across the floor (our ceiling) from 7am till after midnight, ugh! Other than that, the service was good and the staff friendly. The rooms were decent sized and clean and the overall facilities were great. I would recommend the hotel to someone needing to stay in the immediate downtown area, and away from the party / more lively areas in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: tomgreatorex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and couldn't have enjoyed it more. We had an amazing room on the 27th floor overlooking the port of Miami. The room was very luxurious and had everything we needed including a computer and wi-fi which came in really handy. The hotel itself is very modern and clean and the staff were really helpful. The location of the hotel is also very convenient. It's in Downtown Miami which we really liked and the AmericanAirlines Arena is within walking distance so we could just walk home after the game. The hotel has two really nice pools, both are a great temperature and the staff bring you towels and ice water throughout the time you spend at the pool which was great. All in all I can see why this hotel is number 1 in Miami and we certainly won't be staying anywhere else when we return!

Reviews.Title: “It is true this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: N7CHAP
Reviews.Content: Ok the first part of this review is the usual blah blah blah you usually get on TA, but read to the end as Iâ€™ve saved the best until last. We loved the hotel and were made to feel very special over our 3 night stay. We booked a room on the club floor which I would recommend as the club lounge is one of the best attractions of this hotel in my opinion. First impressions of the hotel were not great as due to bad traffic we were dropped a couple of blocks away and had to drag our cases up past a group of hotel staff who were stood chatting at the front entrance and not one offered to help us even though we made it right to the front desk. We had just arrived from the UK so this was a shame as we wanted to be wowed as soon as we stepped on to the premises. The room we were allocated was perfect, great views, large and very comfortable with all the usual 5* conveniences you would expect to find. What makes any hotel different from the next is its staff and Mark in the club lounge was exceptional, while I had a little moan early on about our arrival any negative thoughts quickly evaporated as Mark made us feel at home right away and feel comfortable using what the club lounge had to offer. Mark was a fountain of knowledge and any question about Miami we had he either knew or would find out for us. Mark also has the ability to make good cocktails and we enjoyed the kir royales in celebration of that lovely royal wedding he made. I should also mention Reuben who also was invaluable to our restaurant booking requests, both of these members of staff were some of the best we had experienced and are a credit to the hotel. Thank you to both you for such a memorable stay. While the hotel is not cheap it had the X factor which is worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “PRAISE FOR THE EPIC”
Reviews.Author: Henry1967-09
Reviews.Content: I'm a Kimpton In Touch member. I was given a great price for a club level room. We were on the top floor (30TH) and the lounge is located on the 29th floor. The hotel is gorgeous, the room was spacious and airy. Although I was on a business trip I was able to enjoy some time off and take advantage of the 2 swimming pools. The lounge offered 4-5 services a day: from a very good and generous breakfast to "tapas" throughout the day. The assistance of Mike and Lucia at the lounge was corteous and friendly: not enough nice words about these guys. Great Job!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: kettro59
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the location was great. The view from our room was awesome and the staff were really friendly in the hotel. The bed was comfortable and each room has its own computer which is free to use.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: MrPaul-Boston
Reviews.Content: I may be a little bit bias since I'm addicted to Kimpton hotels (is that even possible?) but the king water view suite I just had this weekend could be the best hotel experience ever. I'm lucky enough to have been able to stay at a decent number of nice hotels for work that cost more than most Kimptons. Don't get me wrong a lot of other hotels are nice in an old money, pretentious "allow me to change into my smoking jacket before you hand me my my brandy and pipe" sort of way but Kimptons have a different and better feel with the same level of luxury. I've never had a bad experience at one of their hotels and each trip reinforces why Kimpton is one of the only companies I feel any loyalty to at all. The staff always goes out of their way to do whatever they can to make you feel like they value your business and the people at the Epic hotel are no exception. Like I said I had a waterview suite at the Epic which was an upgrade for being a loyal customer. It was on the 28th floor and overlooked the bay. It had two balconies including one in my bathroom... what hotel puts a balcony in the bathroom? These guys do, just cause they can. It also overlooked the infinity pool (which is on the 16th floor and also has a view of the city/bay) this is where the free wine is served from 5-6pm. And as I already mentioned the entire staff (valets, front desk, pool concierge, resort manager, etc) all went above and beyond before (welcome email when I booked), during (nice welcome from Elisa who also gave me a late check out) and after (follow up email by the resort manager) my stay. The location is in the business district of Miami so it's a no brainer if you're there for business. And if you're there for fun it's a 10 min cab ride from South Beach. I've already have my next Kimpton hotel (Eventi) booked for business next week and my girlfriend and I are planning to come back to the Epic later on this year.

Reviews.Title: “Epic went out of their way to make us feel special. Exceptional service with a fantastic view.”
Reviews.Author: millerohio
Reviews.Content: Epic was by far one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. My wife and I did not want to let our honeymoon end so we chose to stay a night in Miami on the way home. I booked on their website and was impressed with the govenment rate. I also mentioned on the comments section of the reservation that it was the last night of our honeymoon. I thought at the time it would receive zero notice, but I was wrong. When checking in they excitedly remarked that it was our last honeymoon night and were genuinely excited for us, especially "B" who told us he was able to get us a room upgrade. We headed for the elevators but were stopped by Danys, who checked us in. She asked if we'd be interested in a complimentary massage. Uh yes, who wouldn't? She also asked what time our flight was the next day. I told her 6pm and was hoping to have a place to keep our luggage after check-out. She said how about a 3pm or so checkout instead? I couldn't believe the lengths they went to make us feel special. We were amazed at the views from our 22nd floor suite. The floor to ceiling curved windows in the bedroom gave an unbelievable nighttime view, as did the balcony off the west end. We enjoyed a quiet outdoor seafood dinner at Area 31. The waiter, Robert, was superb with explaining each dish and attending to us. When he heard it was our honeymoon, we were again surprised. This time it was a complimentary glass of champagne. He was in no rush to get us out of the restaurant even though it was past closing time. The next morning we we had room service breakfast. When Bruno heard later it was our honeymoon, he returned with two complimentary mimosas. We could not believe the attention paid to us throughout our short stay and the thoughtfullness to make our last night so memorable. We enjoyed the outdoor pool area with drinks, soaking up the last bit of sun before heading back to colder weather. We will be heading back to stay here again when we are in Miami. If you are going on a Caribbean honeymoon and don't want to rush home, stop here for the night on your way home. Also, be sure to sign up to be a Kimpton Intouch member prior to making your reservation. The least it gets you (that I knew of) was a complimentary drink plus free wi-fi during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Epic!!”
Reviews.Author: BMJ226
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I've stayed virtually everywhere in the Miami/South Beach area and the staff at Epic was absolutely superb. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will be returning again!”
Reviews.Author: Lignog
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice at Club level and find the service excellent. The staff are always extremely welcoming and accommodate all your needs. I would strongly recommend this hotel to other people visiting Miami either on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “â€œ5 starsâ€� for the property and â€œ2 starsâ€� for the service”
Reviews.Author: JTears
Reviews.Content: I recently decided to stay at the EPIC hotel for three nights while en-route to the Caribbean, basing my decision mostly on the stellar reviews that the property received. Itâ€™s possible that the hotel was having an off weekend, but in general, my stay did not reflect the other high ratings and accolades in previous posts. As my title mentions, undoubtedly the EPIC has wonderful facilities and is an excellent property, but the service standards need to be seriously improved if it is to call itself a true luxury hotel. The strengths of EPIC were in the facilities and general plant. EPIC is a newer property and the attention to thoughtful design is evident throughout the hotel. The lobby is airy and spacious, modern yet inviting. Hallways were well-lighted, and even though my room was at the end of the hallway, it was never too far a walk from the elevator. I had the opportunity to stay in a one bedroom suite on the EPICâ€™s club level. The suite was extremely sizeable and well designed, a large balcony facing out toward the Brickell business corridor and another smaller balcony off the bathroom facing inland. Bedding was of high quality, and the room was well furnished. Soundproofing was sufficient, but I could hear music pulsing from the restaurant downstairs on some evenings. My major issue was with the cooling system. The suiteâ€™s bedroom faced northeast, and with floor to ceiling windows, it meant the that bedroom was extremely warm from 1pm onward. One has to set the air conditioner to a very low temperature (60 degrees or so) to cool the bedroom properly. This meant that oft times the living area was very cool while the bedroom was always slightly too warm. Service, as I mentioned previously in my post, was wildly uneven, and more often bad than good. Probably the worst on the scale were the valets and bellman, who I often think of as the front line hotel staff, more so than the front desk. More often than not I had serious service challenges with the valets and front door staff. Cars took a very long time to be retrieved â€“ usually 15-20 minutes. After calling down for my car, and taking 10 minutes to go downstairs, I found myself waiting an additional 10 minutes for my car to be retrieved. The phone operator manning the valet station placed me on hold for so long on one occasion I had to call the front desk so someone there could relay a message to the valets to have my car brought up. The one occasion out of 12 that my car actually showed up by the time I got to the driveway, the valets parked my car on the far opposite side of the parking circle and just handed me the keys, leaving me to dodge incoming cars to get to it. Lastly the only time I could remember a doorman opening the door and greeting me was on the last day of my stay. There are basic service standards not being met, and I would recommend that hotel management take the time to observe the operations of the valet and door staff and make necessary improvements in service level training. The club, which should be the epitome of high service standards, was also very unevenly staffed. The continental breakfast during the weekend could only be described as chaos. Tables were not serviced, so guests were standing around waiting for seats; coffee, juice, and milk were gone by 9am and were not replenished; staff were so overwhelmed in the small back kitchen they were not available for other guest requests. I became so frustrated that I decided not to visit the club in the mornings again, other than to grab a newspaper. Overall my sense was the club was not sufficiently staffed for the volume of guests â€“ one concierge simply was not enough to service all the guests. As a point of reference, most club lounges of similar size to which Iâ€™ve been usually have 2-3 concierges on staff. I was not able to have a basic perk of the club, which was the ability to check-in and check-out of the hotel at the club lounge, simply because the concierge desk was often overwhelmed. I would not recommend potential guests to pay extra money to stay at the EPIC club level unless the hotel management made improvements in hotel staffing. I do have to recognize the good service from one of the concierges on staff, who was there both on the Saturday and Sunday nights of my stay, who really provided exceptional service. The housekeeping staff generally was good, but again, there were some areas that needed some serious attention. Dirty dishes left by guests in the hallways often remained there for most of the day, picked up only at the appointed room servicing times. While from an operational efficiency standpoint I can understand why that was so, but it was really unpleasant to see dirty dishes sitting in the hallway for half the day. Probably the strongest link in the service â€œchainâ€� were the front desk staff. Overall I found them to be highly professional, courteous, and efficient. More often than not, when I had a problem or need, I would call the front desk instead of the club concierge, simply because I knew that they would be far more responsive. If only hotel management could extend the quality of service I received at the front desk throughout the hotel, it would truly be a winning property. Again, this review is my personal experience, and it could have been an exceptionally busy weekend that deviated from the norm, but overall I had a disappointing stay at the EPIC and could not recommend it to fellow travelers until the service standards are seriously improved.

Reviews.Title: “Totally surpassed our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovebooks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the epic for a conference and we were completely impressed! The building itself is beautiful and the staff are more than friendly without being fake. You are going to pay--it is not inexpensive-- but in this case you really do get what you pay for! The room service breakfast was delicious and dinner at Zuma was also very good. The spa is fairly small but the facial was excellent. Only 2 chairs for a mani/pedi but you also have the option of having it poolside. I will say the pedicure lasted over a month!! Speaking of the pool--it is also very chic and the staff are more than helpful. The only slightly negative was that our room (jr. suite) did not get cleaned until around 5:00 p.m. We will be back in Miami on pleasure this winter and will be returning to the Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quite and lively”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: We had a "junior suite", which is a fancy name for a big room. The room was, indeed, very big, and the bathroom was huge. Being up high enough we did not hear much outside noise, but the lower rooms undoubtedly would. The room was impecibly clean. This hotel is located towards the edge of tthe business district; about all that is around here are other hotels. They make up for it with a very busy lobby and incredible service. The only reason this hotel deserves 4 stars instead of 5 is the bed - it is hard! Perhaps others enjoy sleeping on a slab, but, given that the rest of the hotel is so nice, the second class quality of the bed does not fit in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend at the Epic”
Reviews.Author: eghoops
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a nice place to celebrate our 25 wedding anniversary .A friend recommended the Epic hotel I did an internet search liked what I saw and made reservation's for the weekend. Upon arrival I was created by numerous friendly faces that made us feel very welcomed. Upon checking in again I was greeted by a staff members that was efficient knowledgeable and very friendly. I was asked if i was staying for business or pleasure and I replied it was my 25 wedding anniversary. From there all staff made it there business to ensure that my wife and I would have a very memorable stay. From my room to the lounge to the restaurants everyone ensured that we had a great weekend. We were so impressed with the Epic hotel family, that prior to checking out my wife and I checked into purchasing a unit in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, rooms, food, amenities and location.”
Reviews.Author: slmsr123
Reviews.Content: EPIC is a wonderful hotel. Have stayed there 2-3 times a year for past 3 years after having tried nearby comparably rated competitors. Service is unsurpassed. Addition of restuarant ZUMA a big plus. The only place to stay in Downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Style!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Salt Water Diva
Reviews.Content: We are reasonably well seasoned travelers and as such, it takes a lot to impress us. One hotel seems to resemble the next but this one is decidedly out of the box in every regard. We booked it in advance of a transatlantic cruise as it is very near the cruise ship port and I had read numerous rave reviews here on TA. It was quite a surprise that it will go down as one of our favorite hotel stays. In future, we will look for other Kimpton hotels as we were definitely impressed. Everything about this place is top notch from the minute you arrive. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, always calling you by name. I booked a Club Level room and was totally blown away by the Club Lounge on the 28th floor where five small food courses, i.e. tapas, are offered daily and anything you wish to drink is gratis including alcoholic beverages. A concierge is there to assist with restaurant advice and reservation assistance. Reuben was particularly helpful and might I add, physically pretty good to look at in addition. Our only small hitch was the snotty outfront man at Zuma, the restaurant in the main lobby who might benefit from a lesson in customer service by hotel staff. Could not hold that against the hotel, and the wait staff and food once in the restaurant were excellent. A great hotel stay. Strictly five stars.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, elegant and exciting downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: oscastro
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at this hotel, but I felt really welcomed since I arrived there. I received an invitation to the evening wine hour but since it has been passed when I arrived they gave me a coupon for a free glass of wine. Additionally, as part of the loyalty program I received free internet access and a coupon to spend $10 from the minibar (never seen before!). Rooms are full of natural light and elegantly decorated. Very modern and cozzy at the same time. With a very nice view to the bay and a balcony to enjoy it. It was a short but very pleasant stay. I do recommend to stay there if you are in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best chic hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: nne340
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I selected this hotel for our girls getaway trip. We the saw the reviews online and decided to take a chance. The hotel looks exactly like the pictures posted on their website. The hotel interior and exterior are both so chic. The rooms were clean and well designed. Also love the fact that it is an eco friendly hotel. We ate breakfast a couple times at the Area 31 as well. Food and service were both excellent. You would not be disappointed with the Epic. This hotel will now be my destination spot for when I need a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Miami business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: chibnik
Reviews.Content: I have to frequent downtown Miami for work and of all the hotels I've stayed at, Epic is the best. Their staff is effecient, courteous and friendly. I've stayed at other hotels in downtown and in South Beach, where I've felt like I was unwanted by the staff. The staff at Epic remembers who you are and treat's you with respect. I can visit other hotels and not even remember the staff at them, but at Epic, they treat you so well that I can remember their names. Benaldo, Macarena, Farah, Elisa and Jessica at the front desk are great! It's a sigh of relief to see them and the others after travelling for hours. Housekeeping was on the ball and assisted with any of my needs. Excellent service all around. Epic is centrally located in downtown and within walking distance to businesses and the fun of Brickell village. The hotel itself has great architecture. It is a local hotspot for nightlife, including Area 31, Zuma and now Kyma. The rooms are very modern and come with great views. They are well appointed for the business traveller, with plenty of desk space and equipped with computers. I've been to other hotels where I couldn't even set up my laptop to work. Epic is also reasonably priced as far as high-end hotels go, so it is cost-efficient to stay there for business. I recommend my co-workers to stay there. I'm going back to Miami next week and plan on staying at the Epic again!

Reviews.Title: “Sure was EPIC”
Reviews.Author: spur365
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the EPIC in a Club water view room. The service for the whole trip was just spot on. Everyone from the manager who helped us before we arrived, the very kind concierges to the pool guys all made our trip fabulous. The little details you just don't think of the staff excelled in them. Lucia, Jean and Marco in the club lounge made us so welcome, gave us wonderful drinks and had some great food laid up. I can't recommend the Club Level enough. Rooms were spotless, big bathroom and we had a great view of the bay on our balcony. If I come back to Miami I sure will be back to the EPIC. Defiantly worth it's No1 status and if ever i could pick a hotel up and move it I would!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay with some hiccups”
Reviews.Author: LovinMiami
Reviews.Content: The staff are super nice and friendly. They are very accomodating. Our biggest issue was that it took them over an hour to bring our luggage to our room.....which is not acceptable. The room wasn't ready when we arrived and when we were able to get to our room it took over an hour and a half for them to bring us our luggage. No one wants to wait around some more when they have already been waiting for the room. We just wanted to go down to the pool but because our bags were not brought to us for over an hour and a half, the sun was already going down by the time we changed and got our sunscreen. We also called multiple times to see what was going on, but it seemed like that only slowed them down since it obviously didn't speed them up on getting us our bags. Other than that, the food is good at Zuma, the rooms are nice, the staff are nice. But, it wasn't a fun way to start our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Dulcechula
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Epic was so friendly and efficient. They went out of their way to accommodate the customer. Plus, an added benefit are the complimentary bikes.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveladdict
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is amazing. The lobby, the rooms, the view, the restaurants, and ESPECIALLY the staff! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty and we felt so relaxed and at home. The location is perfect, we walked to Brickell village and had lunch and shopped. It was so close to a variety of activities. The room was perfect, it had everything you could possibly need and if you found something it lacked, simply call the front desk and they would send it right up. The beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious.The balcony was the best part, we did not even want to leave the room the first night because we enjoyed the views so much. We wanted to be away from South Beach crowds, but close enough to go spend a little time there. The taxi ride was only about 20 minutes.This hotel is perfect for that. It had a ultra chic vibe. I will be back soon for sure. Such a great weekend getaway! Book a facial in the hotel spa, it was perfection! Be sure to try the amazing cocktails at Area 31 and the wonderful sushi at Zuma. You will not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The EPIC hotel, a great destination”
Reviews.Author: nccu85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled from Washington, DC to Miami to stay at the EPIC Hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary. When we checked in, the staff had a congratulatory card, chilled bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us! What a pleasant surprise. The view from our 24th floor room was spectacular! Staff is friendly and very attentive. The hotel is walking distance to restaurants, shopping and a short drive to South Beach. Treat yourself to a stay at the EPIC...

Reviews.Title: “our stay at the EPIC was just that, EPIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: roxie_rae
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel from the lobby, to the downtown location, to the service, to the rooms, to the pool, to the restaurant Zuma, to the free wine hour. It is probably one of the top 3 hotels we have ever stayed at in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travl123
Reviews.Content: Everything is great at the epic, from the moment you arrive at the epic the first thing you will notice are the amazing cars like Ferraris, Rolls Royce, Porsches, and big yatchs in the main entrance of the epic, then after that you will see an amazing lobby like no other, the rooms are great with their own computer, they are very clean and have a new interior design style. About the pools they are heated and the spa also look amazing but unfortunately I have not try it. The club lounge is great with different foods all day, I recommend staying at the lounge if you want to have free food and free drinks by paying only a little more. Also this is great if you don't like to wait at the restaurants. Unfortunately we don't have time to go to any of the epic restaurants but I am sure that they are great like everything on the epic. About the valet parking the service was great and I don't care paying over $40 dollars for that great service. Every day we call for our car to be ready the car was there without waiting. Also the days that we have not called for our car the time we waited was less than 5 minutes, but who cares when you wait and see the best cars in the world parked at the main entrance of your hotel. Also you can go and view the amazing yachts only walking a few steps. What more I can say about the epic, everything was great and we have not a single issue that we don't like about the epic. I got free wifi internet access by filling a simple form of Kimpton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with awesome service”
Reviews.Author: chaibea77
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here early April after a conference in South Beach. I researched hotels on Trip Advisor and chose this one because of all the reviews. We were definitely not disappointed. We had a room on the club level- which is worth the price! The night we checked in, Gerald our bellman happily assisted us with our bags. We got to our room and Gerald noticed we did not have an water view. He immediately got us Another room with a beautiful view for no change in rate. He was so nice and hilarious too. Our concierge Glen was extremely helpful as well. I had documents to fax and he ran around doing this for me. Mark in the club room was very attentive also and fun to talk to. Racquel in the club room was so sweet- one day my fiancÃ© was asking about the pasta salad we had for lunch in the club room. They were not serving it the next day and Racquel went downstairs to get him a bowl and then delivered it to our room! The location is great- easy walk to the bay area with lots of shops and restaurants. We walked to Trulucks one night- which is a phenomenal seafood place. Zuma restaurant in the Epic had the best sushi and martinis we have ever had! The gym at Epic is also a good size and has free weights, treadmills, and other good equipment. The room was clean and bed was comfy. Our balcony was large with beautiful view. Good water pressure in the shower. Plenty of towels! We would absolutely stay at the Epic again and would definitely stay on the club level.

Reviews.Title: “For view of Miami”
Reviews.Author: mehbub
Reviews.Content: Rooms facing the sea are great feel for Miami feeling. Rooms within are brand new and with all necessary needs. The lawn in front was great and the resturant on 16th(?) floor was great. All in all great place to conduct business seminar and for leisure for those needs other than famous south beach of Miami. you do see some rich and famous around sometimes in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous hotel property”
Reviews.Author: jpet_11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Epic Hotel in downtown Miami....as a frequent visitor to south Florida and Miami Beach in particular, we had never considered staying in downtown Miami. The Epic is centered, on the river mouth, with outstanding views of both downtown Miami and Miami Beach. With a superb roof top pool(s) deck and service and staff that are impeccable, I heartily suggest any traveller to the this area to forgo the hustle and bustle of South Beach and park themselves firmly at this outstanding property and have a summer drink by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “urban chic in downtown miami”
Reviews.Author: DelfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. A few miles from the hotel and a short hop over the bridge to the beaches. Cool, modern, urban look, Zuma downstairs, great club lounge facilities including free drinks and snacks, staff really helped us with planning and bookings. Once or twice the staff were a little lacking or slow but on th whole very good. Excellent gym here is thats your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: 13boxers13
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The email a week before our arrival with greetings and a request for anything we might need to make our stay special from Gene Ruotolo the "Club" level concierge. I told them it was our first visit to their city and we'd be celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival we were escorted to a personal check in with Gene at the Club desk on the 29th floor. We asked him if he could get us a reservation at Zuma, the world renowned restaurant located in the hotel. He said he'd try but they were usually booked up 30 days in advance. We then went to our room and found a chilled bottle of fine Champagne and two flutes. The rooms were fabulous, beautifully decorated and appointed. Everything from flat screen HD TV, computer with free internet access, thick robes, slippers no detail missed. After a nice dinner at Area 31 their in house restaurant located on the 16th floor we went back to the club lounge and found a full open bar. We found out that the amenities of the club level include the open bar from 7 to 11, breakfast , lunch and after dinner snacks. Incredible!! We had after dinner drinks and a cigar on the patio overlooking downtown Miami, Biscayne Bay and the Miami River. I have to mention Raquel one of the great staff at the club lounge. She made us feel like royalty and I cannot compliment her enough. Throughout our stay her service and humor were the frosting on the cake of our visit. Gene Ruotolo our concierge gets equally high marks for service and attitude beyond the ordinary, By the way he managed to get us the coveted reservation at Zuma. As they are in but not part of the hotel that's another review. 5 stars is not enough for this fantastic hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait til our stay at the Epic......”
Reviews.Author: RMJohnson8960
Reviews.Content: Even though we are actually traveling to Miami in May for our 10 year anniversary, I am SUPER EXCITED. I actually booked our reservations last July 2010. Since, I booked our reservations (we are meeting our best friends who will be celebrating their 9 year anniversary) I have found price comparisons and they have matched the price with no hassle and we even upgraded to a waterview room. We also just found out that our travel agent with our cruise line lives around the corner. He mentioned that it was a great pick. So far all of my conversations and questions have been answered with a smile and no question is too silly for whomever I have talked to. Again, I am impressed and CAN"T WAIT for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, pet friendly hotel on the water and walking distance from great shopping/sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: goldilox057
Reviews.Content: We loved the EPIC Hotel in Miami! This was our first trip to Miami and our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel. We had a spectacular one-room suite with a view overlooking the sunset off one balcony and enjoyed a warm, sunny breakfast from another balcony the next morning. The staff was considerate, helpful and especially friendly and welcoming to our dog. They brought special treats, a clean, if not new, bed and bowls to our room for the duration of our stay and always remembered her name and pet her when she came through the entryway. Our family loved Miami and we would only stay at the EPIC when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic -- we didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: mkj1214
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at EPIC on April 8 before leaving for a cruise on the 9th. I booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews I had read, and we were not disappointed. From the second we got there, the staff was friendly and accommodating and even though we had an early flight and got in well before check in time, they did not flinch and got us into an amazing room right away. B at the front desk and Michael who brought our bags to our room were awesome and made us feel so welcome. The room was beautiful and the view was spectacular (waterview room). We spent the evening at Area 31 for both dinner and drinks afterwards and had both an amazing meal and exceptional service. The only negative I can speak of was one bartender who clearly was not happy to be there and liked to ignore us when we were waiting at the bar to order (a quick "sorry, I'm slammed -- I will grab you guys as soon as I can" would not have been that tough), otherwise everyone else was extremely friendly and customer service was fantastic. We did not have time to experience the pool or any of the spa services, but the hotel alone would bring us back to Miami in the future. We could not have been happier with our accommodations and not only will we be back to EPIC, but I will now seek out other Kimpton properties as a result of this wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry ,but wasn't impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: DafneJerusalem
Reviews.Content: but dissapointed... The most crucial moment for me in a hotel is my first impression and feeling I had at the minute I got into the room and see it for the first time. This time I was disappointed.Although we booked the simplest room with the city view(1 night prior to a cruise) it seemed different than what I expected .It looked smaller,the bathroom's floor all scratced seemed old ,the balcony not attractive since the "cityview" we got was a swimming pool of a building nearby,bed compy but simple (the big part at the back that the heads should lean on is not not a masterpiece criss-cross...) . We went up to check on the swimming pool and the whole area was a mess,not as a neat and a well maintained place should be.The pool's size was smaller than we thought we have seen on the web..And the whole athmosphere was more of a building filled with Miami residents rather than hotel guests.. The proximity to Bayside Market Place is nice although at night we somehow did not feel comfortable to go back to the hotel-it was dark and scary. Next time we will take a hotel in South Beach and take a short taxi ride to the Bayside Market Place.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, nice view, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: christinoua
Reviews.Content: Nice location in downtown Miami. Close to Bayside Marketplace and Brickell. Also A 15minute bus ride to south beach. Quiet location but also a busy hotel with restaurants and a pool. Waterview rooms are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing comfort in a first class venue...”
Reviews.Author: kellysig
Reviews.Content: My wife and 16 year old daughter spent 5 wonderful days at the Epic, and we could not have been more satisfied. Everyone, and I do mean everyone, was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our water view room was not available during the check in process, they upgraded us to a Jr. Suite the following morning. Location to nightlife and daily activities were perfect, a 30 second drive to I-95. Price to Valet was steep, but location dictates this... Loved, loved, loved Zuma, the restaurant off the main lobby. Also, the staff at the pool were utterly amazing, especially Cesso. Cannot wait to return...which we plan to do next December.

Reviews.Title: “ohmygawd!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: Ohmygawd!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The reviews on Tripadvisor are absolutely spot on!! Staying at the Epic Hotel was one of my best hotel experiences ever and I am quite particular and well travelled. The location was fabulous and the hotel was luxurious and contemporary without being pompous or stuffy. The rooms [concierge level] were beautiful!!!!! - spacious, well designed, esthetic and urban/uber- chic with a large bathroom and comfortable bed; not to mention spotless. Free computer in-room was provided on the concierge level - a great amenity. The five servings of food in the concierge lounge were terrific as was the specially made coffee, but best of all, the staff there went out of their way to insure you were well served and happy. Especially Lucia, Oscar and Mark!! The reception desk staff were also great. Seth McDaniels, Assistant Front Office Manager, helped me with a problem with a Tripadvisor reservation and was patient, persistent and successful in resolving my problem. He even gave me hugs!!! The pool and restaurant area were out of a movie - tres chic. The whole experience at this hotel made my stay and time in Miami a true delight. When I return to Miami, I will stay at the Epic and would encourage all travellers to do the same. An outstanding experience all around!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service On the Club Level!!!”
Reviews.Author: TomRitucci
Reviews.Content: If you stay on the club level you will be greeted by the kindest people and be treated with the BEST service as if you are a king! I have been staying at EPIC for the past 3 years in a row since it opened. Every time I return I am greeted by a familiar face who recognizes me. If your lucky you will get to meat Oscar and Lucia in the Club lounge, they are the nicest people and one of the main reasons I keep coming back. The entire EPIC staff works to meet and exceed your expectations and succeeds every time. The only thing I did not like about my most recent stay was how the pool deck is not open 24/7. Other than that not a single complaint.

Reviews.Title: “An Epic stay.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBob94404
Reviews.Content: The Epic is a Kimpton hotel...so I knew it would be great. However, it was even better than expected. Everything, including the view of the harbor, service provided by the staff, great balcony room and evening wine reception...was "top of the line". The proximity to the Port (since I was going on a Cruise) was extremely convenient. I would recommend the Epic to anyone who wants an outstanding hotel experience. Tom Bodette...eat your heart out.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of paradise in the middle of the magic city”
Reviews.Author: Bianche
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Epic for our friend 's wedding weekend. It was absolutely wonderful. The rooms are so well decorated and extremely comfortable with fantastic views of the magic city. The service could not have been better. Very friendly staff . Paulo down by the pool was great ! Our day of relaxation by the pool was perfect. I would highly recommend the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Cool Architecture, Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JDell_11
Reviews.Content: The room was great: Comfortable King sized bed, large balcony, state of the art plumbing fixtures. Would have liked more hooks to hang wet towels & clothes, jacuzzi bath would have made the room perfect. Area 31 did not live up to the hype: Over priced Average quality seafood, sub-standard service, took over an hour to get breakfat, 45min to get a drink at the pool, sitting with our finished plates for over an hour at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel name says it all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The moment I pulled up to the epic I was impressed by it's beauty. From exiting the taxi to entering my room my interaction with every employee was as delightful as it gets. I get this at every Kimpton I stay at but somewhere like the Epic where there are A list celebrities and very high profile guests I was still treated as a VIP. That being said I will be returning to the Epic the next chance I get.
