Reviews.Title: “EPIC stay for our wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: EMarchman
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t begin to express my gratitude to the EPIC team for such an incredible experience at the hotel. All of our guests were blown away by their stay. From the warm welcome and execution of the gift bags, to accommodating last minute extensions on nights and late check outs to the professionalism from bell staff to housekeeping, it was truly an EPIC experience. We had 60 guests stay at the hotel over the weekend and each one loved the rooms, views, pool, lobby and staff. Many experienced both Area 31 restaurant and Exhale spa and raved about the meals and treatments. If you are looking for a very special hotel that will take incredible care of your guests, EPIC is the hotel for a beautiful Miami experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Tanyaabrams
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the concierge floor and really enjoyed the lounge and the food provided. The staff there went out of their way to be friendly, helpful, and accommodating. In particular we would like to single out Mark, Oscar, and Gene for going the extra mile. Ashley in reception was always ready with a smile and friendly hello to welcome us when we entered the lobby. All in all a most enjoyable stay and we will stay there again next time we are in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Customer Service and Personal attention while staying at the EPIC in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Leroy112
Reviews.Content: The Staff made me feel like they personally knew me. Very cordial and they took care of every request I had. Their Exceptional employees are their most valuable asset. I am looking forward to traveling back there again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little disappointed"”
Reviews.Author: TrueTravel19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Epic hotel 4/7/2011 for only one night before my cruise. Booked the hotel in January and paid $288.00 which included tax. Best things: Location is wondeful just a 10 minute walk to the Bayside Market. Taxi ride to the cruise terminal took about 7 minutes and cost $8.50. View was awesome from the 22 floor. Staff was very friendly. Room services was excellent and fast. Breakfast was very tasty, hot and fresh. Bathroom was just amazing with both shower and tub. Plenty of fresh towels. Water pressure was great and hot. Sheets very clean and pillows nice and fluffy. Fast free in-room internet. Nice flat screen televison with excellent stations. Excellent sound proof doors. Not so good: Room was not very clean. Carpet had speckes of paper on it. Phone was not clean. A little greasy and sticky. Work station was very dusty. Bed was not very comfortable and a little shakey. Sheets very clean which is good. Room was a little small because the bathroom and balcony are so large. Well that is it! I was very excited to stay and I did enjoy the view and the food but I will not return. The hotel is just not for me. Thanks Bruno (Anthony) for bringing my food so fast and with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms but poor & overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: Flynner13
Reviews.Content: By Miami standards, especially Miami beach which is populated with terrible hotels, this is a fantastic experiance. The rooms are excellent and the views, staff and hotel overall is top quality. One negative is the in room dining. Its very poor value and below expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely classy”
Reviews.Author: LP70
Reviews.Content: This is a very, very nice hotel. I had a quick stopover on a longer trip and would love to go back. The rooms are big, beds comfortable, large balconies off each room with nice views and outdoor tables and double-glazed so very quiet when you want to close out the world. Full minibar and great room service options. The bathroom is set up with lovely spa bath able to look out over the room, view and large plasma TV. All the staff were very helpful especially check in and out. The pool area is as amazing as everyone here says. All the amenities in room work beauifully and all involved appear to be rightly proud of the hotel. It's a touch groovy in the evening, plus lots of rich people with pets. But I'm neither trendy or rich and didn't feel out of place - OK, maybe once or twice in the pool area but that's not really the hotel's fault!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel embodies all the best parts of Miami”
Reviews.Author: melarobi
Reviews.Content: Stylish, swanky, ritzy, with beautiful people lounging by the pool. The customer service was excellent and they make you feel like royalty. It is definitely worth the splurge. I could spend a week just laying in the cabanas by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Epic really shows up a lot of 5 star world class hotels - it is exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in Hilton, Intercontinental or Marriott hotels in the US, and stayed in SoBe last time in Miami. This time I decided to try Epic on a heavily discounted rate. I was expecting a lot as I had read all the TA reviews. I was not disappointed! finding the hotel was a little challenging as my GPS lost lock in amongst the high rises but got there eventually. Valet parking attendant very abrupt but he did his job well, just not great on customer niceties if I had to be picky. Parking $32. Check-in very easy and swift, surprised to find my rate included breakfast (continental) which I was not aware of. Checkin staff told me that because I was checking in late and missed the free wine hour, that I would get a voucher and could claim it for wine at the restaurant later in the evening. Fantastic! My only let down was that I had requested a king bed room, and I got a room with two double beds - fair enough though as I was on a very discounted rate. Bed was still very comfy. Excellent balcony with massive double glazed glass so very quiet inside if you shut the door to the balcony. The bathroom is amazing - his and hers sinks, a bath that you can see the main TV from, a great shower with rain shower head. It had everything! Beautiful amenities, nice mood lighting. Large plasma TV with plenty of channels. The Heat were playing but couldn't find it on any TV channel which was surprising. I made a reservation at Area 31, the main restaurant - could only get in after 9.30pm which was fine, but take heed to book ahead if you want a main slot on a weekend. There is free wifi in the room (just have to join up to InTouch Kimpton) or $10 if you don't want to join. Great speed, eqasy to connect. They also have a computer in every room so you get free internet even if you don't have a laptop. Nice touch. There is an ipod dock sound system, but it only takes the ipod nano, and not an iphone unfortunately. Good blockout curtains too. Excellent fitness centre, with weights, cardio equipment and stretching room with balls etc. Beautiful pools (x3 I think) but didn't get to use them. Checkout was fine, they charged me twice for internet for 24 hours (I couldnt be bothered signing up for Kimpton so paid) but they were happy to remove one of the charges from the bill without asking any questions. All in all an amazing hotel, definitely 5 star, great location, great food, great bar, great amenities, great staff. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to have a fun weekend, stay at the EPIC!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerEnRoute
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Miami for two friends and myself for my birthday weekend. I chose the EPIC because I was looking for a beautiful hotel with a relaxing vibe and great people. After all I was having a milestone birthday! Based on other reviews, I booked a room on the Club Level. When I checked in, I was upgraded to a Junior Suite courtesy of Jessica at the front desk. She was fantastic and also gave us great tips on some things to do in the area. Thanks Jessica. The suite was beautiful and had a large bathroom which made my friends and I quite happy. :-) Prior to our stay, I arranged spa visits for my friends and I. They were fantastic! Melissa at the Exhale Spa gave me a great deep tissue massage. The icing on the cake for my visit involved two people associated with the Club Level. The first is Reuben. He was phenomenal! Not only did he provide fantastic recommendations for our in terms of night life and restaurants, he made sure we were able to dine in some wonderful establishments. He was friendly and thoughtful and made sure we enjoyed everything the Club Level had to offer, including the special food presentations which occurred multiple times throughout the day. He even made me a special smoothie because I'm allergic to pineapple! He went above and beyond! Thank you Reuben. The other person associated with the Club Level is Mark. Also, friendly and quite the connoisseur of a variety of beverages. He made sure there was champagne and chocolate waiting for my friends and I when we returned from birthday festivities! Thanks so much Mark! These three individuals provided excellent service (the rest of the staff was also quite wonderful) and truly made my birthday weekend special. At one point in time, we did walk around the surrounding area of the hotel. I'm not sure if that part of the city is in the process of growth, but it was quiet and the surrounding buildings looked as if they were in transition. Hopefully, by my next visit, things will be different. Thanks again for a great visit! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Service that surpasses all â€“ felt like we were in paradise indeed.”
Reviews.Author: shoelee
Reviews.Content: Our return to Epic Hotel in Miami; Once again we were very impressed upon arrival with the 5star greeting by the staff. We were delighted to be upgraded to a water view room â€“ which provided me with the tranquility I needed along with the comfortable beds. Epic has a lot to offer; ïƒ˜ Luxurious hotel for tourists(including kids), business travelers and even dogs. ïƒ˜ Some excellent dining (reasonably priced ) o staff occasionally checked to see that our needs are met ïƒ˜ Exceptional poolside service ïƒ˜ Valet parking ïƒ˜ Walking distance to bayside, shopping etc.. ïƒ˜ 10minutes ride to South Beach We believe the manager and staff at the Epic hotel makes their guests â€“ number one, on the priority list â€“ the highest standard of service any hotel can give â€¦thank you everyone â€“ we appreciate all you have done to make us feel special during our visit. We are looking forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! THATâ€™S WHAT I CALL AN AMAZING CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: LisaB-ActualizeGroup
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m passionate about a great customer experience. Iâ€™ve built my career in the Hospitality industry, traveled throughout the world â€œbench- markingâ€� world class customer experiences, and spend much of my time helping my clients create even better experiences for their customers. When an unexpected experience comes along that really knocks my socks off, as one did this past weekend at the Epic Hotel Miami (a Kimpton Hotel), I feel I really must share this example of excellence. The trip down to Miami started with long flight delays due to severe thunderstorms, and, following the cancellation of the flight, ended with an impromptu car rental and four hour drive. Upon arrival at the Epic, we were tired, frustrated, and ready to pack it in. However, there was just enough time to dash up to the room, change, and dash back out to our appointment. Thank goodness check in was fast and friendly, and the room was even better than expected. I arrived 30 mins. too late for the breakfast seating the next morning, and lunch seating wouldnâ€™t begin for another 30 minutes. Ah well, to the pool bar I went, hoping to round up something tasty. At this point I was starving and happy to munch on an orange wedge. We were greeted by Cesso, the attendant, who told us that breakfast had ended but that he would be happy to see if the Chef wouldnâ€™t mind preparing us a few eggs. Within minutes, Cesso had taken an ordinary poolside table and created one of the best breakfast experiences Iâ€™ve ever had . . . complete with omelets, pastries, amazing coffee, linens, and fresh fruits. Ok, that was pretty cool. He then lingered to tell us a little about the area and make sure we were satisfied with our meal. After breakfast, the weather had turned sunny and I decided to work by the pool. Cesso again appeared, selected the perfect spot, set up my chair cover, headrest, and umbrella, and brought over some fresh water. Within minutes of getting settled in, the weather turned stormy and Cesso was there in an instant. He quickly offered the complimentary use of one of the beautiful poolside cabanas, where I could continue to work during the rain. Once the storm passed, he set up new chairs by the pool and, not wanting to leave his great care, we ordered lunch in the afternoon. Here I was, in Biscayne Bay Miami, with hundreds of great restaurants within easy access, and I would up having lunch by the pool three days in a row. I know, it sounds excruciating. My point is that the atmosphere was beautiful, the food was excellent, and the service was amazing. The entire experience was so positive, I had no need to go in search of anything else (at least until dinner!) Over the course of my four night stay, I continuously encountered Kimpton staff members who went out of their way to treat me as if I were a welcome friend. The guest reception employees were warm and friendly, the valet and hotel front door attendants never failed to â€œwelcome me backâ€� or wish me a pleasant day, and I just canâ€™t say enough about Cesso. Happily buzzing around the pool area (and working his tail off), attending to each guest as if they were his only concern, he may have just set a new standard in guest experience. He may also be one of the Kimptonâ€™s greatest assets. I have always enjoyed staying at a Kimpton hotel, but this stay certainly sealed the deal. I highly recommend taking a trip down to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love with Kimpton Hotels because of the Epic”
Reviews.Author: sharonwhite333
Reviews.Content: The Epic is one of the nicest, warmest, fun and hip hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff is warm but professional, helpful, knowledgable and friendly. It is such a pleasure to stay at a hotel that makes you feel like you add to them by just being there. We have been going there since the Epic opened and the staff always remembers us. Now I try to plan all of my hotel stays at Kimpton Properties but especially the Epic in Miami. The only tip you need is if you need anything, just ask and it will be taken care of. I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. Sharon Winter park FL

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property full of gracious and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: jafox
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experience that I have had. The property is gorgeous. The amenities are quite satisfying. The in-hotel dining at Area 31 is very good. The staff goes out of there way to make one feel welcome and cared for. I have no reservations in reccomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Astonishingly good service & taste”
Reviews.Author: CarosassoneCH
Reviews.Content: Passed 4 nights in the EPIC hotel, together with a large group of colleagues. I was impressed by the overall quality of the hotel and the service (in most cases). Compliments to the chief not only on the 16th floor, but also for the buffets: reaching this level of quality for more than 100 guests is not an easy task! Only flaw: the quality of the housekeeping. Cleaning was "so so", and often all but on time (one day, they cleaned my room after 17.00, despite the signal "please clean room" switched on at 8.00.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Renadog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Epic in late January. He had a business conference in the area, and I just went along for some time away. He booked the room through Orbitz, and we didn't know until we checked in that we had a room on the "Club Level." This was such a surprising luxury! We loved the service in the Club Room; Lucia was wonderful, so cheerful and polite every morning, and great to chat with. I often stopped in for a snack or a drink while he was away at the conference, and I went about the business of my day. The Exhale Spa was great too; I got an amazing pedicure there (1/2 off with the voucher we received at check-in!) We even made it into Zuma one night even though there was a 2 month waiting list--we ate at the sushi bar, which was wonderful--one of the best meals (and sushi experience) we've ever had. Everything was very clean; the pool area was wonderful too, where I lounged and read during the day, and where they hosted wine hour in the evening. SO relaxing and luxurious! We were spoiled rotten, and I didn't want to come back to cold, snowy Boston. We easily walked to shopping during the day, and restaurants nearby at night, and saw a great live band at the Blue Martini. Great hotel, we always use Kimptons when we travel, and this one was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Candy311
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is AMAZING! Beautiful rooms! But the best part - CLUB LEVEL. Every single person from the concierge (MANY OF THEM) to the cleaning staff were absolutely amazing. The attention to details are amazing. And every single person there makes you feel like a thousand bucks. If you are in Miami, you MUST stay at Epic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom4364
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple went for a one-night getaway--the Epic is the perfect spot--sophisticated luxury in an exciting locale!...superb service...well-appointed rooms with wonderful water views...walking distance to excellent restaurants...great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSP
Reviews.Content: March 2011 brought my 4th business trip to Miami. My first trip, I stayed at another nearby hotel, but the past 3 visits, I've roomed at The Epic. I won't stay anywhere else. Period. The staff is always wonderful, rooms are beautiful and comfortable, everyone is always so accomodating, and you simply can't beat the feel of this hotel. This was my first stay at Club Level and Sonia and her group really spoiled me. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “OVERATED”
Reviews.Author: tatoweb
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Viceroy and this time wanted to give a chance to the Epic. Booked four nights and stayed only one. Lobby is awesome in size and decor, staff very friendly but my dissapointment started when I entered the room. I booked a Club Level waterview king and did not met my expectations. Viceroy does not offer "waterview suites" and have EXACTLY the same view on the one bedroom suites. The room has a good size, vey simple decor, nothing special for me. Went to the Club level to see the daily food presentations they offer and just found snacks you can buy at a convenience store. I payed $390+taxes for that room and I donÂ´t change it for the Viceroy King. On Valentines we ate at ZUMA and it was a great experience with great food and service. My conclusion: nice hotel, overrated on tripadvisor, overpriced rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I felt spoiled”
Reviews.Author: Bm0rebaby
Reviews.Content: The EPIC is a gorgeous hotel! My husband and I stayed for several nights as a last getaway before we become parents and we couldn't have asked for a better time. Who needs to travel all the way to some remote island when you've got the EPIC nestled in downtown Miami? The hotel is stunning. The rooms were spacious and gorgeous. We had a waterview, which was incredible to see each morning. The staff was attentive, polite, and very helpful in making us comfortable and recommending dining spots around town. We could easily walk just about everywhere we wanted to go but, to be honest, we hardly left the hotel except for dinners (and, PS, be sure you check out Area 31 for dinner!). The hotel was just incredibly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Everything smells new and fresh, hotel is very confortable and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Lindino_Benedet
Reviews.Content: Highly reccomended, good restaurants, nice pool area, real confortable and well decorated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: gdm1
Reviews.Content: Have been there for a 4 day trip - on the club level. Serperate check in lounge, dedicated staff and welcome drinks - what an outstanding customer service. The hotel is very stylish, but cozy. The room was huge and very well maintained. The lounge on the club level is offering breakfast, drinks and snacks. Of course they are superb. The lounge is a little to small though. The food at the Area 31 restaurant is very delicious and worth the money. The really only issue is the pricy valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing stay at the Epic”
Reviews.Author: bnk1256
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre-cruise for two nights at the Epic. The hotel is gorgeous. The staff was wonderful. The room was gorgeous (we were upgraded at check-in and given champagne and truffles because we were celebrating a birthday). The pool was amazing. My kids loved swimming there and we loved lounging beside it. We were expecting an excellent hotel based on all of the other reviews and we were not disappointed. We would not hesitate to go back to the Epic when in Miami and have told all of our family and friends to go there as well!

Reviews.Title: “An EPIC Experience we can't wait to repeat”
Reviews.Author: CVilleTravelers
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd or 4th visit to EPIC, and it was the best by far. Great room, over looking the pool area and view of the bay. Thought it might be too noisy just 2 floors above the pool, but it was fine, even at night with functions going on. The rooms are spacious with the most comfortable beds we have experienced of any Kimpton hotel. NOt sure if they are any different, or the surroundings made them more enjoyable. Check in was smooth -- Michael the bell captain told us everything there is to know about the hotel, got us hooked up to the free internet for both our laptop and for the mini-PC in each room (this is a great feature when you just want to surf the web and not be distracted by work emails and files on your laptop) Kimpton Hotels have a complimentary wine hour each night, but we found something even better. The bar was offering a Veuve ARound the Clock promo, $5 champagne at 5pm, $6 a glass at 6, all the way until 9pm. Not everyone at the bar knew the details of the promo, but they quickly accomodated the proper pricing. One of the great features of EPIC is their 16th floor pooldeck. The deluxe cabanas are built into the overhang and have a bed, chaises and a flat screen TV and very attentive wait staff. Nice view of the bay as well. On the bayside of the deck are more modest cabanas that face the pool, though you could spin around and view the water. We reserved one of the bayside cabanas one day -- I think it is $125 -- and the Pool Concierge greeted us and immediately escorted us to a Deluxe -- "We are not very busy today, so please accept the upgrade complimentary" -- Now that is good service. As we spoke with him throughout the course of the day, we learned this was his first week on the job. The people at Kimpton Hotels make the diffrence between them and the big boxes, and this was exhibit A. Only wish I could remember his name, but I did mention to the GM who we encountered at wine hour one evening. Dinner at AREA 31 was delish. Seafood was what we were after, and they did not disappoint. Tasty, simply prepared, very flavorful. Glad we gave it a try after passing on prior visits. The dining highlight, not just of the trip, but probably of the year, was ZUMA in the lobby. Internationally renowned, this place rocks. Booked solid on a weeknight, and it is easy to see why. Despite a major glitch in our reservations, a manager bucking to be the next Pierce Brosnan cut through the mess and got us seated straight away without so much as an excuse. Zuma is a must -- not just the food, which is an amazing twist on asian fare -- but the service was impeccable. Dinner was like a choreographed event, with no less than 7 different staff members doing something for us, all without missing a beat or being disjointed or awkward, but yet the same waitress came by with good frequency to check in on us. The BBQ pork bellies are a sin worth committing, as is just about everything on the menu. In typical Chinese style, the food is meant to be shared, so grab your friends and let the staff guide you. Also grab your wallet, we are talking $$$ to match the experience, but well worth the price of admission. The only quirks to EPIC is its blend of Kimpton and Non-Kimpton aspects. The lobby bar, Zuma and the Exhale Spa/Fitness Center are 3rd party operators, and sometimes it shows. Our Exhale experience was less than polished and the staff seemed indifferent. The Lobby Bar has a strong South Beach attitude about it -- got turned away for wearing sandals -- $250 sandals, but sandals don't cut it in their book. Zuma was fabulous, but we could not charge the services to our room account at the hotel. Also, the pooldeck is a popular function area, more so for outside groups than hotel guests it would seem. Several nights it was closed for private events, which is a drawback since lounging in the poolside furniture at night seeing the lights on the bay with a cool drink is one of the hotel's greatest attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best hotel stay I've had in a while.”
Reviews.Author: rachelnyc23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a one night trip to Miami this past weekend while visiting family in Palm Beach. We took advantage of my husband's corporate rate at Epic. From the second we walked in, everyone was amazing. B at the front desk couldn't find our reservation at first but eventually figured it out and even upgraded us to a water view. He was so friendly--I haven't met hotel employees that friendly before! He also gave us complimentary passes to the gym which we ended up using the next day. In addition to upgrading us, B sent up a complimentary fruit plate. On top of the service, the room was gorgeous, immaculate and the bathroom was huge. Oh--also the room had a desktop computer with free internet! Everyone about the room was state of the art. Besides the room, everything was really wonderful including the pool, wine happy hour (that we made sure to take advantage of), and the gym and spa at Exhale. Overall our stay was perfect and I'd highly recommend this hotel to someone wanting to stay in Miami but not wanting the hustle and bustle of SoBe.

Reviews.Title: “Completely overpriced and over rated”
Reviews.Author: Sadlady51
Reviews.Content: I rented a one bedroom suite with a balcony and view of the bay for $600.00 The bathroom had black hair in the shower. There was no coffee maker in the room. Free coffee was available from 6am - 9am ( this was even on the weekend). I was told by the staff to walk two blocks down the street to Starbucks to get coffee! Saturday evening, 12am, we ordered room service. There were minimal options for room service. Quesidilla's, salad, macaroni and cheese(which they were out of?), panini sandwich. The quesadilla's were overcooked and filled with more onions and peppers than cheese. I am sorry to add that they were the worst I have ever had. My salad was forgotten, so I had to call and remind them. The romaine lettuce was brown on the edges, definitely not fresh. We received one set of silverware for 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “better than the four seasons!!”
Reviews.Author: ellen888
Reviews.Content: if you are going to miami and plan on renting a car, which you should, stay at the epic! we were going to stay at the four seasons, but decided to give the epic a try and it was a good decision! service was impeccable, the room was beautiful and clean and location was excellent. stay on the club level - it is worth the tiny bit extra. the views from these rooms are wonderful and the staff on the club level are amazing! there was always something yummy to eat and the concierge, andrew, was so helpful and friendly. if you get lucky you will have lucia helping you out as well. she was wonderful and made our stay special! there is so much to do in miami besides laying by the pool, which of course we did every morning, and the staff at the epic will make sure you have all your options. the facilities at the hotel are stunning. definitely on par with a hotel like the four seasons. spend the extra money you save by staying here on some great food!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Consistent, Great when they are not busy, not soo great when they are sold out”
Reviews.Author: LadyLux123
Reviews.Content: The Epic is beautiful, modern, not pretentious, and has a very courteous staff. They really try to be a five star hotel, however after staying in places like The Four Seasons and the Ritz, I would say they just don't have quite the feel. If you are looking for a very modern, fun, hip vibe, this is the place for you..If you are looking for a very lush, relaxing, pampered feel, then stick to the Four Seasons down the street. My husband and I went to the Epic before and after our cruise this past month. The first day/night was incredible, they gave us an early check in, the luggage came over with us, the service was good at the pool, etc. It was a girl friends birthday who was staying in another room and the concierge Andrew was nice enough to run and get her balloons and flowers on a rainy morning! (Though he brought them to her in a cup instead of a vase, but he did really try which was impressive). Now for the second time around the following Saturday. We came in at 11am, the hotel was completely sold out. There was the boat show and several large weddings. The room wasn't ready, which was understandable so we just went to lay down by the pool. They told us they would call when it would be ready. 3:30pm rolls around, no phone call so finally we go to the front desk again. The girl at the front desk was completely overwhelmed. It really seemed like she had no idea what to do. After 20 minutes she found us a room and up we went. We were told our luggage would soon follow as we gave her the tickets to send it up. An hour later, no luggage...I call down and they said they were looking for it and asked who did we give the tickets to!! After another 30 minutes, still no luggage, so I finally ran downstairs. Apparantly the overwhelmed woman left for the day. One of the bellman went on the hunt for our luggage. After another 20 minutes my husband and I decided to peak behind the front desk and there was our luggage right up front! It definitely put a damper on the day as it was about 6:30pm by the time this was resolved! Never the less, they really do try and care which is 99% of it. I am sure they will be amazing in another 6 months or so. We ate at both restaurants, and the pool which were all impressive and delicious, though the portions at both Area 31 and Zuma were tiny. If you go to Zuma you must try the Alaskan King crab legs..TO DIE FOR.. Also the massage with Olivia at the spa was heavenly.. I felt like I was floating after I left! We loved the pool area bed's and furniture. The only thing we really wish this hotel could have is an outdoor hot tub. That would have been really nice on the cool afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Experience”
Reviews.Author: seeingplatinum
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay at Kimpton's Epic Hotel. I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of service I received from the staff, particularly the Front Office Manager, Brent McNally. His client service execution was extraordinary. I have accrued over 25 nights at Kimpton hotels over the past three months, my loyalty influenced in large part by the superior service that I have received from Kimpton relative to the other large hotel brands. Brent and the staff have managed to carry that level of personal service to a challenging environment at Epic, a world class hotel where everyone expects best in class. But they have met, and even surpassed that challenge. The front office manager, himself, reached out to me to make sure I was fully accommodated, saying "If there is anything you need, call me directly." That is the kind of service that only VIPs can expect from the very best hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “Prior to a cruise”
Reviews.Author: jensen2172
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel in a great location with great views. Wonderful service

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: cocccinea
Reviews.Content: Reserved the Epic for business travel and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was professional and attentive without being overbearingly polite. Extra pillows, no problem. I upgraded my room, spacious with wonderful view. After a long day of meetings, nice place to tone down the day and relax. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite the Kimpton Experience”
Reviews.Author: mr8tch
Reviews.Content: Ok. I admit it. I'm a Kimpton addict. I've had wonderful experiences before. I've bought the package. I expect the best. But this is Miami. Culture shock if you figure this Kimpton is going to square up to those hotels in NYC, Chicago, DC... To be sure, the service, attentiveness, friendly and inviting attitude of this staff is absolutely consistent with other Kimptons. As this was my first journey to Miami, I relied on the expertise of the concierge and desk staff and they were marvelous, spending many minutes with me in conversation about how to navigate the city. Ditto the cleaning and pool staff. If you are looking for amazingly good service, then this is your spot. Why can't Kimpton transport DC, or Chicago to Miami? I must be too old to appreciate the "clubbing" experience...Sit outside at the entrance..take in the costume sprawl and everything that is of excess. You will find it here.. Our room was, well, nice. King, with a view of the river, and you can peek at a portion of South Beach with binoculars. Smaller than DC/Chicago rooms, but OK. I get the Ar t Deco thing they are trying to avoid, but play into. Curtained window from the bathtub... Since this is a partnered living space (residents + visitors), you can't stay on the lower floors, so you will be somewhere between sixteen and thirty (those last two floors reserved for those of you who wish to delve into club-level status). Be prepared to keep your room key with you at all times. The elevators demand you swipe your key before proceeding up. 16 is the magic floor---spa/pool/fitness. I will have to say, the pools (there are 2) are amazing...warm and inviting. The staff ever attentive to provide towels and locations for you to spend quality time just chillin'. What's best? The pool stays open. A late evening swim was so relaxing, under a cloudless night. I manged to order pizza and salad and ate and swam and enjoyed. (Pieducks, if you are curious) So what was different? This Kimpton is dislocated...you can't walk out of the front door and expect to get most basic services. It's a three block walk to Starbucks (the only coffee place operating on the weekends), and downtown Miami is, well, still sprouting. Yes, it is safe to walk, but you will have to do that if you'd like a morning Joe other than that which is supplied in the lobby. (Flagler Street does have some interesting eateries--but not on the weekends) You will be a 10 dollar cab ride away from most places that would offer nifty restaurants (and about 30 if you plan to trek to South Beach). But this is Miami. As I was leaving, a photographer was shooting some kind of ad that was either for the hotel, or Porsche. Two models, in ridiculously wool outfits were riding into the hotel in a hot red convertible. It was fun watching this scenario play out, as the legions of cars transporting regular guests were interrupting the flow of this "shoot." It was just another example of the kind of distraction that makes Miami, well, Miami. Oh, and on that jaunt to South Beach, Lil Wayne was sashaying down Ocean Drive with his entourage. Golly, my trip was complete! I would consider this a great place to stay if you have Miami business. If you are trying to catch a deal so you can steal off to South Beach...well...reconsider... One other thing.. I choose not to bring my laptop because there is a computer in every room! But be prepared to wait. The internet connection is SLOW and you need patience if you are accustomed to FAST. The wireless (if you have your own device) works fine. This is a Kimpton that is a stranger in a strange land. It struggles with the conflict.

Reviews.Title: “Better?”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: 2nd longish business stay. 1st stay was during opening when service was paramount because hotel was sorting through final construction 2 years later it is a solid 3 star priced as a 4 or even 5 star. Staff is extremely pleasant and accommodating which is the norm for Kimpton .. make sure and ask for higher floors and lower room numbers .. rooms 1 through 8 or 9 have great views .. all rooms have balconies .. the hotel is immediately adjacent to a drawbridge and it opens and closes frequently 24/7 with loud clanging .. both nearby Hyatt and JW Marriott also experience the same noise so caution on either of those properties as well. The immediate walking area is a bit dicey and walks in the evening are best restricted to park areas because the 'downtown' section is rife with begging homeless and rundown shops and restaurants HOWEVER if you want local color it's there Epic uses what is now a standrard plastic card key system in elevators and it is very inconsistent. Unlike the usual in and out make sure you hold the card in the slot for a second or more or it will NOT work.. This is NOT a vaction property ..unless you like being off the tourist path. And it is a an excellant choice for business stays

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel. Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Buglo
Reviews.Content: I don't know what else to say. this hotel is fabulous, clean, excellent service, you feel like you are in the lap of luxury at a reasonable (but not cheap) price. I will definitely make the Epic my hotel of choice in Miami. I don't think you will find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “State of the art Hotel with old fashion luxury service”
Reviews.Author: 47thanks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic Hotel Saturday and Sunday night while we attended the Miami Boat show. The hotel is a modern, trendy facility that offers all the first class amenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The Hotel is located on one of Miami's many rivers and canals and the views are spectacular from a water view room.

Reviews.Title: “It was one of the most beautiful hotel experiences I have ever had!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sabaahbug
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Epic December 17-20 and the Customer Service was surperb and my Junior Suite with City view was beautiful and I will never forget my stay. There was nothing that I asked for that we did not receive with the best smile including white chocolate hot coco at 3am in the morning!!1

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: I went to the Epic with my division for a few days in October. All in all, it was a very good experience. The rooms are VERY nice and big and NEW and all have balconies - at the end of a stressful day of work this was a welcome escape. We enjoyed the pool and the bars/restaurants, too. The conference facility itself, though, was really the best part (I realize this sounds funny but read on). After years of sitting in awful boardrooms with low ceilings and no natural light, this big, airy room was exactly what we needed. It changed the entire mood of the event to have actual airflow, to be able to step outside on a break, etc. And the food was fantastic. The only drawback was that apparently the place had had some flooding issues or something so part of the hotel was closed. I'm sure they've sorted this out by now. And the location, while not in South Beach, is fine, especially for a work-related trip (kept everyone a little more focused on the job at hand). Was about a $10 cab ride into South Beach. It's also pet friendly! After having stayed there, as well as staying at some crumbly old hotels on South Beach, I think I might even stay there again on a non-work-related trip.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: JanetH39
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Miami Boat Show.. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels, however the customer service at the Epic, exceeds any hotel we have ever stayed in. From the front desk to the club level, it was first class all the way.. We had forgotten our phone chargers and called to see if they had a spare we could borrow, and an employee came right upstairs and GAVE us his.. We told him we wanted to borrow it to charge our phones and he insisted we keep his. The club level was worth every penny. Mark was the absolute best and made our trip worthwhile.. He even offered to print out an itinerary with the best restaurants, clubs, entertainment for our next trip... I have never encountered this level of consistent customer service, not to forget how comfortable and quiet the rooms were as well as the excellent dining... Will definitely be back.. 5 stars all the way

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Overall, But Misses on the Little Things”
Reviews.Author: DomFrancon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic while attending a conference. The rooms are decorated in a simple, modern style and are lovely. Mine (on the 27th floor) had a generously sized balcony with a beautiful view of the bay and the hotel's pools below. Improving on a few "little things" would take a good hotel to great: put a coffee maker in the room; audit the room before a guest checks in--mine was missing a luggage rack and I had to ask them to bring one; when someone orders a $45 room service dinner, don't make them beg for a glass of ice water, then bring them a tiny 4 oz. bottle of water; when you know your hotel is sold out, hire enough valets so the place isn't chaos, with your guests' cars sitting there completely unattended with the keys in and cars running (when I brought this to the manager's attention, he took care of it immediately and comped my parking charge, which I appreciated); perhaps most importantly, when a guest smokes near someone else who is eating in your restaurant, in violation of Miami's anti-smoking ordinance, MAKE THEM STOP. This really is a lovely hotel and it would be very easy to fix these things.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !!”
Reviews.Author: Levy_Abud
Reviews.Content: I was in Epic for 4 days when I was traveling back from New York. The hotel is very clean and well organized. I got a room on 30th floor, what allowed me to get to the Club Lounge, where they have a simple but nice breakfast, nice treats during the day and some fresh fruits after 09:00 pm. The view from my room was not so nice as I was facing the city, but the noise isolation in my room was very good, making it a very silent room. The gym is well equipped also and works 24 hours, what was important for me as well.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous new hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: khaug1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner suite on the club level. The suite was fabulous, decorated in a tasteful minimalist modern fashion. Its main balcony overlooked the Miami river estuary and Biscayne bay. There was always some activity on the water to capture your attention. Without exception, the hotel staff were warmly friendly and eager to do our bidding. The club lounge supplied five separate feedings each day, which were ample to provide breakfast and a light lunch. The open bar was kept well-stocked evenings with premium brands such as Hennesy cognac and Glynfiddich whiskey. We ate several times at the Area 31 restaurant in the hotel. The food was tasty and nicely presented, but we felt the menu was way too heavy on fish and lacking on other entrees. The Marriott across the street and the Hyatt a block away had decent restaurants within easy walking distance. One major problem arose: When I initially called to make our reservation, the person at the Kimpton reservation center refused to honor the "3rd day free" promotion advertised on the hotel's web site, and I had to email the Epic's manager to get that rate. Then, the person making the actual reservation asked for my credit card number via unsecured email. I declined, attempted to call her without success and finally completed the reservation with the Eic's front desk staff. Weeks later, I called to add a room for guests of ours, and discovered that our reservation had been cancelled! Fortunately, a very pleasant manager at the reservations center reinstated the reservation and all went well afterwards. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Epic and are making plans to return. A suggestion for the hotel, though: Put in a sundries shop (magazines, candy, etc) . Currently there is none, and the only alternative is to walk to a nearby hotel for what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent is an Understatement Here!!”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, my stay at the Epic was nothing less than sensational! Check-in was friendly and super fast. From the time we pulled up in a cab, we were poolside in about 20 minutes. It would have been faster if I wasn't busy gawking at the spectacular views from the balcony when we got in the room. The hotel itself is gorgeous. Rooms are immaculate and huge. The balcony is a great perk. The entire staff was incredible. We had most dealings with the pool staff, who were amazing. They could not do enough for you and were extremely pleasant. Special mention must be made of Brooke and Yuki. They greeted us every morning like we were family. They absolutely went the extra step in providing outstanding customer service. Food offerings were diverse and good. We tried room service, pool menu and Area 31. All were very good and rather reasonably priced. There was enough diversity that in staying there for 4 days we were able to find several new options to try. The surrounding neighborhood doesn't offer much but with a place like this, there is no reason to really ever leave the property. The crowd was mixed, but all seemed to co-exist perfectly. Families, singles, couples, old, young, etc., etc. The entire vibe of this place was just perfect for what I was looking for - relaxation in luxurious accommodations. I got home last night and already miss the place. I'm already looking forward to my return!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in heart of Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: jillv1701h
Reviews.Content: My family took a little extended vacation to Miami last month and the Epic was a fantastic choice. Located more in the business district, the hotel's style, ambiance and dedication to service charmed us all! Its certainly the first time I've stayed in a hotel and remembered the name of the houskeeper, Elizabeth, who was fantastic every morning. The hotel itself is extremely stylish and clean and the rooms were impeccable. The area surrounding the hotel is probably not the best area in which to go out at night but the nearby Bayfront Park had interesting shopping... The Miami Heat arena is within a 10-15 minute walking distance too so not too bad. This location is definitely not anywhere near South Beach so people expecting a nearby beach are SOL. It was 37 degrees when we were there so that wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been much better”
Reviews.Author: DavidandKim
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for a conference. I usually stay at the W or Hilton. This was my first stay at EPIC. It was great. Everyone was super nice. The front desk staff were extremely helpful-Jessica was there most of the time and was always pleasant. The conceirge was great every day. I used the running map and ran several days while I was there. I didn't meet any employees that weren't going out of their way to be nice. The room was nice and the balcony was great. There is a computer and complimentary internet in the room, which was very nice. The location was great for me. The conference was across the street-(I didn't know until the end that there is a walkway under the road by the water to the Hyatt). The hotel was within walking distance to a lot of places. I went to the Heat game one night and walked. Evidnetly there is also a wine event, but I wasn't aware of it. It was also nice there were apples at the work out room. It was a nice snack after a run. The only negatives I can think of were the workout room was temporarily located in a very small room. I ended up not using it b/c it was so small. And the ice machine on my floor wasn't working so I would go up a floor to get ice. Otherwise not much to complain about. I didn't have a car so didn't use valet.

Reviews.Title: “EPIC Staycation”
Reviews.Author: gzysuperstar
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am a big fan of the more intimiate guesthouse/bb type hotels... EPIC is grand, huge, luxorious and yet still a boutique. The staff was awesome and the service we encountered was impeccable (specifically by the pool),.. we were constantly getting water refills and even got some fruitkabobs. The rooms were comfy, cozy and the beds were cloudlike. I loved that although it was a city view, once you closed the sliding door all of the noise disappeared. :) The ONLY negative is the overnight parking... @ $32... THATS INSANE! Guests should be able to park for free... afterall, they are spending money in your hotel... Area 31 Breakfast was good and plentiful :)

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: smichw
Reviews.Content: During check-in, the front desk was pretty impatient; so we gave up trying to get an upgrade to a room at the club level. The janitors are friendlier than that receptionist. Our water-view king premier room is good in size and has good sound-proof features that shields away both street and hallway sounds. However, it lacks common amenity supplier such as mouth wash and shower cap. Parking is $32 per night but getting a valet has been difficult early in the morning. The gym equipments are moved to the Kidâ€™s room which is a bit small and crowded. The hotel is a bit disappointing given that it is about $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fab”
Reviews.Author: fpiesiec
Reviews.Content: Came for a Conference and did not want the fabulosity to end. I had a choice between the Epic at the Conference rate of $189+tax/night vs the Marriot at $179/night. No contest at which I chose as I knew that the usual rate for the Epic starts at $400+. Ended up with a King/Waterview room on the 22nd floor and I couldn't be happier. I expected the South Beach lux decor, vibe and ambience of the hotel and restaurants and have read the multiple reviews with superlatives highlighting the service but did not expect how blown away I was with the real thing. I have stayed at a lot of high end 5star hotels and lodgings and mostly in suites but the Epic, by far, blew all of them away. EVERYONE, from the valet, front door attendants, housekeeping, pool attendants, front desks, Area 31, etc, etc, etc and even at Zuma (though management is supposedly not directly the hotel's), every single staff we encountered were almost eerily, creepily sooo nice and were figuratively doing cartwheels for you in their offer to assist you in any way. Some of them also would carry on anecdotal conversation as if they had all the time in the world to make conversations more personal. I joked to a colleague that it felt like I was in Stepford Wives' world where everyone were so perfect but never once did the staff's approach not feel sincere or ever felt plasticky. High End Miami is known for snobby service; kudos and congratulation to EPIC for getting it totally right.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonshazam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a three night stay at the Epic. The hotel met and exceeded our expectations in every facet. Deservedly, the hotel is ranked #1 in Miami on Tripadvisor. I'd highlight a few points in addition to the comments made in other reviews. Club level: We stayed in a room on the club level and I would highly recommend it. Whatever nominal difference in price per night, you will get your money's worth and then some. At the club lounge, there are five daily 'presentations' of food and fare, including a great continental breakfast (the other four are light lunch, healthy afternoon snack, pre-dinner appetizers, and a pre-bedtime snack). Tons of drinks are available at all times from bottled water to coffee to soda. In addition to the drinks and presentations, there's a great staff up there that will literally take care of whatever you want (Lucia and Raquel are the best of the best). For example, during breakfast, they will make any specialty coffee drink you want (e.g., cappuccino, latte, etc). If you come in between presentations and want something, they will get a snack for you. They also put out a nice selection of top shelf alcohol and a nice selection of wines in the evening for an open bar, so you can pop in before or after dinner and have some drinks. The staff went all out and mixed drinks beyond the realm of totally simple (e.g., a White Russian). Other perks of the club level are a dedicated concierge from 7A-11P and dedicated check out. Again, I would HIGHLY recommend the club level - it was the highlight of our stay. Pool: The pictures on the hotel's website don't do the pool area justice. It is amazing, impeccably maintained, and well staffed. As soon as you get out there, a friendly member of the pool staff will set you up at one of the different poolside options ranging from outdoor sofas to conventional lounge chairs to yin-yang couches to day-beds. They'll bring you a glass of water with fruit and keep it replenished all day. The hotel even thinks of the little things. For example, there's a large selection of sunscreen so if you forgot to bring some or ran out, it's right there for you to use. The hotel's excellent free Wi-Fi works great by the pool, as well. Restaurants: We didn't eat at Area 31 because the outstanding food on the club level is based on the Area 31 menu. I would HIGHLY recommend Zuma, the Japanese restaurant in the lobby. Before eating at Zuma, I would have told you that Nobu in NYC is the best Japanese restaurant. Zuma blows Nobu out of the water! Pretty much everything we had was amazing, but I'd recommend the cod, chicken teriyaki, tuna tataki, and rice bowl. The sushi is so good it makes you say "Oh, so this is what sushi is supposed to taste like." The restaurant is relatively new and hasn't caught on among Tripadvisor reviews yet, but it is extremely trendy and popular. We were lucky to get a reservation for dinner on a Monday night at the last minute, but I'd suggest reserving in advance if you're planning to go. Staff/Logistics: Everyone we encountered from the front desk staff to the doormen were extremely helpful and very courteous. If a random member of the staff happened to be in the elevator at the same time, he/she would ask how our stay is going and whether there's anything they can do to help. We arrived just after 12PM and our room was ready. We requested a late checkout of 2PM and it was granted without a problem. We hope the staff at the Epic keep up the excellent work. We will most certainly return on our next trip to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the #1 Ranking Here....It's Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: The reviews here on TripAdvisor made the decision to book the Epic pretty easy, and they didn't disappoint. I'm not sure what else I can add --- I experienced the same fabulous service, beautiful room, and overall top-notch feel of the place that everyone else has. I wish the lobby level lounge had been open, but otherwise was completely satisfied. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE all true what they say”
Reviews.Author: mchlbianchi
Reviews.Content: We have returned from a quick trip to FL and stayed in this hotel whilst in MIA. The hotel is very nice and staff very professional. it well deserves the number one spot

Reviews.Title: “An Epic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mrttort
Reviews.Content: I took my spouse to the Epic to celebrate a special birthday. Her priority was a great view from her balcony and they delivered.. I recommend Room 3003. For her birthday, they gave her flowers and a birthday cake without our asking. The staff in the club lounge was fantastic. If you didn't see what you wanted in their food presentations, they tried to get you something you would. Everyone seemed to know our names. When you came back from a tour or activity, they asked how you enjoyed. They made you feel like more than just a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKJC
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly impressed with The EPIC before we even arrived. We'd booked a club-level king room with a water view. Weeks before our arrival, I emailed the hotel requesting a quiet room, away from the elevator and club lounge (after reading a review here) - our request was fulfilled promptly with a kind email stating our room had already been selected. What we loved when we arrived (1/14-1/17): - super friendly & courteous staff (not the least bit pretentious) - beautiful decor in lobby, common areas and rooms - large room and bathroom - free computer/internet - large balcony & beautiful view of river/port - very quiet room - great pool & gym We booked the club level primarily based on reviews on this site. JP welcomed us in the club lounge Friday, and he was great - had wonderful recommendations for restaurants and things to do around town. Lounge had a nice selection of light appetizers and drinks/cocktails (if they didn't have it, they went and got it). Two new concierges Saturday morning, who were also courtous and attentive - one got us into Zuma (the new, "it" restaurant, located in the hotel) that night. However, the club level lost some of its lustre as the weekend progressed. Perhaps the hotel chooses not to fully staff the club lounge during certain weekend hours, but we oftentimes found it completely empty - the club conceirge appeared to have been assigned to multiple tasks throughout the entire hotel (i.e. front desk, free wine hour). I understand this from a business perspective, but if we pay an extra $30/night for the service, we'd like to have someone available when we walk in - or at least maybe a note telling us they'll be right back? In general, it was nice to have snacks & drinks during certain times of day (continental breakfast was decent), but I don't think we'd do it again unless the weekend service was improved a bit. Despite the club level's slight deficiency, it was more than made up for by the service provided by Mark. Wow - this guy was great. Upon bringing us anything, he immediately asked "what else can I get you?" While we were there, he worked at both the pool and club lounge - always greeted us personally, offered us restaurant recommendations, and generally made us feel very pampered. Would definitely recommend a stay at The EPIC, and we'll be back...maybe just not on the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Most Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: rachitj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the EPIC Hotel for one night, and used the room to surprise my girlfriend and propose to her. To begin with, the room was incredible and exactly as advertised. I didn't have the time to use the pool, but wish I did. The hotel staff was eager to help with every single request I had, which include the following: 1. Late (5pm) checkout 2. Provided four easels to the room so that I could display some enlarged photos 3. Delivered a package I had shipped to the hotel right when I checked in 4. Pretended to check-in my girlfriend when she arrived at the hotel to keep the surprise going Overall - I would highly recommend this hotel. Their customer service can not be matched.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, a few things let in down and stopped it being excellent.”
Reviews.Author: ta2306
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic for 3 nights Dec 23-26. I have 90% positive things to say about it: The rate was excellent. Location good - close to the airport / cruise port / bayside / good local restaurants and easy to hop on a bus to South Beach or a mall etc. Nice rooms. Excellent bed. Great pool area. We stayed on the club floor, which I would highly recommend. Staff were helpful and pleasant during our stay - especially Sonja in the club lounge. Free computer in room - excellent, all hotels should do this! I have 2 complaints which stop it from being excellent - firstly the room I felt could have been cleaner... the bathroom was, on close inspection not cleaned properly (lots of dust behind the sinks etc and the bed was never made properly during our stay (the bottom sheet was never touched at all!), only a small thing in what was a great room, but I don't expect dust or to have to make my own bed in this standard of hotel. My biggest concern was we lost our luggae on the way out. Sonja was so very helpful in tying to help us locate it, but alas we had to leave for our cruise with it still missing. When we returned back to Miami we were staying in another location for a few days and we called the Epic several times to see if by chance it had turned up and each time was told no. 3 days the later the local delivery company provided us proof that it had in fact been at the Epic for at least 3 days! When we rang again and told them, they "found it" and used the excuss they didn' t have our correct phone number - this is rubbish as we gave it in when we chceked in, it is on my online record, Sonja has it as she called me on it and they also have my email! We were without luggage for at least 3 days when it was sat at the hotel and no one told us. This I am afriad, has made me mark them down as it seemed when we were there the service was excellent, but that stopped once we left and that, along with us not having our luggae is a real shame. The hotel itself is still lovely I just feel let down by the after service re our luggae....

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ParisPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Our pet was welcomed in a genuine gentle way and like royalty! We loved the room: very clean and nicely designed! Superior room with water view was large and very comfortable. Housekeeping was a bit slow to make our room...but this was a very tiny inconvenience actually. We had dinner twice at Area 31 (the rest of the Hotel) and the food was great. Will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “All the trappings of a high-end boutique hotel but lacking some of the spirit”
Reviews.Author: pentimento123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days at the EPIC. Nicely decorated, overall very attentive staff, good restaurant, pleasant spa but missing a beat in a whole hearted "guest comes first" attitude. Little things but ... I don't want a hotel employee to intrude into our room-service breakfast in bed to determine the minibar usage nor deal with a snippy hostess in the restaurant when I wish to sit in a place where the bar menu isn't regularly served, etc., etc. In a luxury hotel I expect first class service every time, every place. The spa is nice (and the treatments were very good) but I've been to others where there was more hands on client care â€“ tea, lemon-water to drink, scented pre & post treatment room with comfy chairs & dim lights.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Luxury in Downtown Miami - a Miami epic!”
Reviews.Author: henri_s
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from the Epic in downtown Miami having enjoyed a fantastic 9 day vacation. I am a frequent guest at 5 star hotels in Asia and rate this hotel superior to most of them - it's a true first-class hotel from start to finish! The building has a perfect location in downtown area and presents an ultramodern city skyscraper overlooking Biscayne Bay - with steel exterior and stylish balconies to all rooms. Interior design is Asian style. The lobby is stunning from the very first moment you step inside being high and spacious - and presenting beautiful details: complimentary corner with coffee and tea, fresh water containers with refreshing aromas (starfruits, mint leaves etc), water fountains, and a stylish lounge with chic divans and huge windows to the terrace of the Japanese restaurant Zuma and the Miami River. The service was second to none. Prior to this visit I have never experienced such kindness and professional touch with customers. We were a family and had booked 3 Club level rooms with a city view. Upon arrival lobby staff greeted us friendly and accompanied us to our private check-in on the 29th floor. Our flight from Europe was massively delayed and our luggage was missing so we arrived exhausted and hungry at a late hour - after long travels. Our hospitable concierge Gene gave us our room keys and assisted with necessary items (toothbrush, razor etc). Then in the lounge we were immediately offered us a glass of wine and beef kebabs - even though the evening food presentation was already over! Gene (the concierge) went downstairs to get some leftovers just for us! What a wonderful service here - thank you so much for this special welcoming gesture! Service was outstanding throughout our stay. The staff and concierges in the Club lounge were all so friendly whenever we saw them. Reuben took a lot of time to locate our missing luggage and took photocopies of papers, wrote a report upon arrival of the luggage etc - thank you so much! Concierges were very helpful and problems with missing luggage really point our why it is great to have such service! The Epic is also gay friendly which is an appreciated touch of tolerance and makes everyone feel welcome. Our guest rooms were spacious and all-in-all top-notch. Huge beds with soft linens, lots of storage for clothing, minibar, iHome for iPhone docking, ironing facilities, large LCD-TV, private computer with free internet access, wireless internet for free (as we were InTouch members) and guest services information, stylish two sink bathroom with separate bathtub, a separate shower closet and toilet - just to name a few... The balcony had a nice view to nearby towers with some sun in the late afternoon. The skyline at night was amazing. Noise isolation was very good and there was an ice machine right down the hallway. We had requested our rooms next to each other but the concierge could not arrange this as the floor seemed to be quite full for the holidays - this was not a problem though. My partner and I exercised daily during our stay. The Epic provides a free running map to all guests. The map has 3 routes in Brickell (to the south) which aren't very good - although you get an idea of the area and see some pretty private houses and gardens. There is a lot of traffic and you have to cross streets - and the skyscrapers make the routes quite shady. We ran all three several times but found out the best way to run outside it to take a taxicab or city bus to South Beach and go running there - with plenty of sunshine and pretty beachfront tracks and/or broadwalks. The gym is located on the 16th floor and is very modern with Technogym machines and free weights - each of the machines being equipped with a private TV screen, iPod docking station, joystick control to adjust your speed/pace. A very good gym with the latest machines - and a fantastic view over the residence side pools! The spa is on the 15th floor and has a free-of-charge hamman steam bath and an infrared sauna. The hammam unluckily didn't have enough steam - but looked cool with star ceiling and was very clean. We liked the sauna more - it had a private CD player/radio and you could also turn off the light to relax. The Spa had wonderful amenities (private lockers, towels, rubber flip-flops, hairspray, deodorant, mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, skin wash etc - all complimentary to guests). The spa was never crowded. The Epic pools are very stylish. Two large pools with water up to 85F, fab views to the bayside, chic sunbeds and polyrattan divans, complimentary suncreens with different protection factors etc. The pooldeck opens at sunrise and closes at sunset. During our stay the pool hours were inconsistent as on some days they opened the deck even before 6.45am, and on some days not until after 7am. As early birds we had to wait behind closed doors and there was so staff around or a telephone to call the front desk. The heater broke down twice during our stay so sometimes the water in the pools was colder which was a minor disappointment. We had luck with the weather. Staying from Dec 20 for 9 days we had sun everyday. Some days were cool due to an arctic blast in Eastern United States with temps dropping at night close to freezing. At daytime it was warm but sometimes the wind felt a bit too cool though. Pooldeck is quite windy on such days. There is a complimentary wine reception everyday from 5-6pm in the lobby or at the pools. The hotel invites for a glass of red, white or sparkling wine with tuna tartar. A true highlight of our stay was the Club lounge with its extraordinary staff! Thank you so much Lucia, Mark, Oscar, Reuben, Sonja, Raquel, Andrew, and Gene!!! You are the best!! The lounge has 5 different food presentations during the day starting with breakfast from 7 to 11am. Breakfast didn't have much variety but was of a good quality - including bagels and toast, quality cold cuts, cheeses, fresh tropical fruits, muesli and cereals, freshly squeezed orange juice, wonderful organic teas, and coffee. On request we were offered special things like cranberry juice, fresh raspberries and blackberries. Everybody learns your name easily and the service is very personal yet professional. Lucia quickly picked up my favorite tea and kindly brought it to me and always made the mornings special with her warm smile. At daytime you can enjoy yummy canapies such as small pastries, pasta salad, healthy foods etc. Also cookies and sweet cakes. In the evening there are more canapies and sweets, plus a complimentary bar service and you can order cocktails etc. The lounge staff are very courteous. My dad got sick during our stay with a respiratory infection so he was repeatedly offered hot drinks by Mark. I like energy drinks so Mark - again - got some for me - thank you so much for all of this! The lounge is very friendly in design and also good for families with kids - as there is a large iPad like table with games, maps etc. The staff pays attention also to kids. We spent many evenings here - chatting and spending a quality time together. I highly recommend paying the extra for the Club level - it's worth it - especially with the personalized service! Our stay at the Epic indeed exceeded our expectations. I recommend this property to everyone looking for luxury and quality time with family or partner/spouse, and as a city break away from your daily routines. We were not disappointed (even though the minor downsides I mentioned in the review) at all -but positively impressed - and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Reportedly Number 1 in Miami.. not so sure”
Reviews.Author: GaryCI
Reviews.Content: Havign arrived at the hotel after taking Tri-Rail from Fort Lauderdale and connecting metro service the front service was none existent. Althoguh I was quite clearly staying pulling a suitcase along, the porters/ concierge were more involved in meeting and greeting the many people arriving for dinner at Zumas in their flashy sports cars, therefore leaving me entering the building in the wrong entrance and taking several extra minutes to check in. However, on check in, Ashley at the reception made me feel very welcome and showed me personally to the lift. A tip if not a regular Kimpton guest. If you are not too concerned about he room type, select the lowest priced room and after confirmation they offer a standby upgrade to superior rooms at 50% discount. This is what I did and enjoyed a great room, with large baclony, overlooking Miami harbour and at small surcharge well worth the extra

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Indiboo Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel pre and post cruise November 2009 and could not have wished for anything better, the rooms were spacious and very clean we had a fab bathroom with twin sinks a large walk in shower with a bath tub. You could watch your flat screen Tv from the bath tub as there was a window (minus the glass) that allowed this, there was a blind that you could drop down for privacy over this window. We had Internet access, a fridge that was not locked a decent clock radio with iPod dock. Put it this way I would stay there again in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury”
Reviews.Author: RossOrpington
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 2219 for 5 nights. It was as comfortable as being at home. Massive lounge, bedroom and bathroom. Even had 2 balconies, though sadly time restrictions and cold weather meant I could not make good use of these. The room had free internet access, including its own terminal, so I was able to deal with all my emails and other tasks from the comfort of my room - I never travel with a laptop - rather than having to go to a business centre. Every day, between 1700 and 1800, there is a happy wine hour with free wine. Fantastic though it did not seem that well attended. There seemed to be no limits on refills! The staff were fantastic and do their best to ensure your stay is enjoyable. The location might not be great, being near downtown Miami but it is easy to get out and about by taxi. There are two restaurants attached to the hotel: Zuma (Japanese food and seems to be run separately from the hotel) and Area 31 (Mediterranean influence). Both were excellent. It is advisable to make reservations for Zuma as it is very popular. I was even able to extend my checkout by 1.5 hours free of charge. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely try to stay here again when I return to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Flier07
Reviews.Content: Based on previous stays in Kimpton hotels, I was prepared for an excellent experience at the Epic; however, they managed to far exceed my already high expectations. All levels of service were superb and the staff always went out of its way to ensure our needs were met, even before we realized we needed something. Our room overlooked the water, providing us a bird's eye view of the manatees and pelicans plying the river below. The room was quite large and well-appointed; it even included a desktop computer. Room service was timely and professional and the food excellent. The Area 31 restaurant, in which we dined three times, is stellar (see separate review) and rivals many, if not most, of the Michelin starred restaurants in which we have eaten. The location of the Epic is excellent and allows for easy walking to restaurants and shopping. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and would actively seek to return.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Divaflea
Reviews.Content: The EPIC Hotel was all I expected and more!!! We stayed overnight at the EPIC Hotel prior to a 7 day cruise I booked for my husbands 40th birthday. I had read all of the reviews on Tripadvisor and other sites. It was everything I expected and more!!! The front desk staff was great. They acknowledge my husbands birthday upon arrival and gave us two complimentary drink tickets at Area 31. That was totally unexpected!! In addition, I said the password of the month and recieved free valet parking!! So far so good. All of this, and we hadn't even made it to the room yet!! The Bellman ( I do not recall his name. Sorry!) He was a very nice young gentlemen. He was aware of my husbands birthday and after delivering our luggage to the room, he said "I'll be right back, I want to get you something for your birthday. When he returned, he two complimentary breakfast tickets. We were WOWED by the staff we had encountered this far. We had a waterview room and all I can say is the view was out of order!! The room and view were ridiculous!! It was very,very nice!! The view was gorgeous and the room was beautiful. We ventured down to the 16th floor to see the pool area and have a cocktail at Area 31. I had the Epic Sunset Martine.... to die for. It's a must have for martini lovers!! My husband had a beer. After our sipping our coctails and taking in the amazing view. We went to pay for the bill, and the bartender said dont worry about it. He said welcome to the "40" club!! I thought that was soo nice. At this point, we were just blown away!! Some of you may ask, how did they know my husband was 40? Well, I had a big obnoxious flashing light 40 pin that I made him wear!! Lol. We didnt have dinner at Epic as we went to see a Miami Heat game. We did return later in the evening for cocktails, and the DJ was great at Area 31. We had breakfast in the morning at Area 31. I had the continental breakfast and my husband ordered the omelet. The service and food were excellent. I've visited Miami several times in the past and I've always stayed on SouthBeach at the trendy hotels. After staying at the Epic Hotel, we are SOLD!! All in all, if you are wondering where to stay in Miami, the EPIC Hotel is the place to be!! Thank you Epic for the AMAZING STAY!! We will be back in 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: jrdunf
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel to stay at the night before we left on a cruise for our honeymoon because it was rated the best hotel in Miami. I must say, it lived up to it's reputation. The inside of the hotel was beautiful. The man helping us with our bags was extremely polite and helpful. We stayed on the 25th floor (or somewhere around there, I don't quite remember) and had a beautiful view of the skyline, bay, and the 16th floor pool. Probably the most beautiful view I've ever had from a hotel. The room itself was comfy and spacious. If I had one complaint it would be that I had a little trouble finding it. There is no sign at the top of the hotel with the name and the sign at street level was hard to see. We actually drove past it twice. But we called the front desk and they gave us great directions!

Reviews.Title: “Fanciest place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: AnneEliz95
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel...unpretentious but very chic lobby, eerily smooth elevator to your stunning, modern room. The bathroom is gorgeous - not the most functional, but gorgeous (towel bar hard to reach from the rain shower or garden tub). Comfy bed, huge balcony. Food service is so-so but several decent restaurants are nearby. Far above average fitness room, and they even supply a running map in your room! Top-notch customer service. Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Epic by name, Epic by nature!”
Reviews.Author: Lotusgirl
Reviews.Content: So will "Celebrity Eclipse The Epic"? That was my post on Facebook to friends and family back home in the UK after spending 2 nights in The Epic Hotel from 25th - 27th November 2010 pre-cruise on yes, you guessed it, Celebrity Eclipse! We had a fantastic 1 bedroom suite on the 28th floor, complete with gold fish that we named Bob for our stay and this room was stunning! We had a fantastic view out over the water and the room really was amazing from a space point of view.
