I want a bathroom like that in my house and 1 bedroom apartments in Cities are smaller than this hotel room! We could have been quite happy living there with Bob and the view however we had a cruise to take! The hotel really does have the wow factor about it everywhere. From free coffee and tea in the morning as you leave the hotel to set out exploring Miami to the free wine in the evening between 5 - 6 pm, you couldn't ask for better. The pool on the 16th floor is luxurious and offers stunning views. We did thoroughly enjoy our cruise on Celebrity Eclipse and we had a suite on board however The Epic room did Eclipse Celebrity and we were happy to return to the Hotel on the 4th December this time to another one bedroom suite on the 24th floor with the same stunning views. If you get the chance to stay at this hotel, then do. It also offers free internet in the room which was a god send to us to check in for our flights to the UK and also to catch up with the outside world! Bayside is a comfortable walk along the waterfront and does offer you everything you need. The metromover - once we worked out where we were and where we wanted to go is a fantastic way to get around downtown Miami for free and no trip to Miami would be complete without going to South Beach. The main beach front street is stunning with some lovely buildings and hotels - the on street cafes and restaurants were fantastic and not as expensive as you think. If we sail out of Miami next year, we'll be back at The Epic and hope to see Bob there to! Thank you to all staff, you know who you are :-) for making our stay extra special. You have a great hotel and should all be proud of yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo2001
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i ever stayed at. Nice staff, great room. We stayed in a suite for the price of a regular room and even in the restroom there was a balcony. The balcony by the way was huge. Free internet and computer in the room. Great views from room and pool, wich by the way is on the roof. That is the only downside, because when the wind blows, it is not the best place to be.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Pikutinho
Reviews.Content: Epic is the best hotel to stay in Miami. Beautiful view. Wonderful pool. Great staff The valet is fast Restaurant is nice and the food is very good. ItÂ´s a good place to stay in Miami for shopping because is in the middle of the city so you can go north or south very quickly. And better: you can choose anti-rush hours!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn6586
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time that I have stayed at EPIC hotel for a business trip. Once again, I was blown away by this wonderful hotel. It is truly a little piece of heaven on earth! :o) As soon as you step out of your car, you are treated like royalty from start to finish. The staff, rooms, views are all awesome. I have no complaints about this hotel! I would come to Miami just to stay here. It's about a 10 minute cab ride to South Beach but so worth it. I have stayed at many, many hotels, but this is by far the most luxurious and best hotel I have stayed at! I plan to come back to stay here as a vacation, instead of on a business trip!

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: TripDrug
Reviews.Content: Upon our early arrival (and painless valet parking) the check-in was friendly and professional. Our room was not ready so we were invited to go to the pool area and relax... and the experience was sensational. The pool area is amazing, with views across the city and sea, and we were welcomed and escorted to a private sitting area (outdoor "open" sitting room!) with towels, tan lotion, newspapers and a lovely pool-side menu.) We had the great fortune to be on a high floor (26th) with a sea facing room - just one word - wow. It was luxury - we couldn't take our eyes off the views (day and night), and the room was exceptional - chic, modern, stylish and inviting. The bathroom boasted an open-wall to the main room from the bath (separate WC naturally), so I could bathe and carry on admiring the view - sheer luxury for a bath-loving Brit like myself - I spent hours in the bath :-). Everything was so clean with impecable taste. Free internet in the room was a welcome and modern touch, as was the iPod docker music-centre. Service was helpful and efficient without exception. The location was very good, walking distance to shops and sea-front activities (South Beach a drive away mind-you, but not an issue because parking was easy to find). The only "odd" point for me was an unexpected goldfish in a rather small bowl on a side table by the balcony - I felt quite sorry for the poor little thing, although he / she probably had the best view of any temporary domestic pet in the whole of Miami. We'll be back - it just wouldn't occur to us to want to stay anywhere else in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience....will definately do again”
Reviews.Author: rzmitchell
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to thank Gene, Lucia and Sonyja frome the club level who were very accomodating. This hotel is located in downtown and is easily reachable to the airport and walking distance from Bayside and other point of interest. The room are very clean and the overall service from valet to reception to room service was extremely excellent....I would recommend this hotel to anyone either on business or pleasure and they would not regret it.Thank you very much for the experience and will be surly visiting again. R Mitchell////NY

Reviews.Title: “Epic service!”
Reviews.Author: Bertago
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Epic one night prior to our cruise with RCCL. We came from a tough flight from London to Miami, and was very tired when we got to the hotel. This hotel gave us the rest we needed. The room was silent and the bed was comfortable. This is probably one of the best hotels I ever stayed on. One of the things that really stands out is the extraordinary service that the employees of this hotel show their guests. I have never ever experienced better service than the service I got at Epic Miami! I will highly recommand Epic Miami to everyone - no matter if it is business or pleasure. We asked when we checked out if we could store our luggage when we got back from the cruise, and got a clear yes. When whe got there the following sunday, we was again met by big smile and great service - even not beeing guests at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don'tmlook anywhere else... this is the only place to stay in the whole of Miami!!! We promise”
Reviews.Author: mizbounci
Reviews.Content: Truely holds it ranking as number 1 on this site.... It's such a magnificent hotel we will never stay anywhere else on our trips to Miami!! My husband & i between us have travelled the world 7 times & i can honestly say hand on heart we have never ever had a better hotel stay. All the staff are so helpful & really can't do enough for you. I have to mention Andrew was amazing before we even arrived communicating via email about our stay & we received a fantastic bottle of wine & strawberrires half hour after arriving in our room, which was upgraded by the lovely lady on reception & with Christians help... thanks so much we just smiled from ear to ear the whole holiday. Reuben helped us out on a couple of occassions & was really great, i just really cant say enough about this place, staff are magical, rooms are like a dream, the pool is wonderful & area 31 a real treat... honestly if you miss out on this hotel you have missed the best thing life has to offer!!! Thanks to all the staff you made our hunimoon the best we will never forget it...... The location is within reach of everything u will ever need for a beautiful stay in miami...... go book it now.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kbmarco4
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews here prior to booking and I was sold. Travelling alone for business I was most worried about location of the hotel. I like to be able to walk to the market, pharmacy,etc. this hotel was only 15 minutes from the airport and about 10 minutes from the medical center area where I needed to be each morning. The hotel is beautiful - from the lobby to the rooms and the pool area. Service is phenomenal. Room service is expensive, but it is always expensive no matter where you stay. The food was good, not great, but good. Fitness Center is ok - not a fan of the treadmills but they had a variety of options. Overall a great stay and would definitely recomend to others. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Few Complains...”
Reviews.Author: RTSCampinas
Reviews.Content: My familiy and I decided to take this hotel based on TripAdvisor rank. In fact I do not regret staying at EPIC, in general it was a very nice stay, great room, staff and location. Follow some impressions we had: room: very nice with modern furniture, big bath, clean and spacios. There is a computer in each room with internet access, very good. We had some small issues in the room: the telephone closest to the bed did not work properly and the another one in the desk had a very low volume. The button to control the luminosity of the bathroom was not working. One of the sinks had only very hot water, we could not adjust its temperature. location: very nice just a few minutes from Miami Beach and other areas such as Coconut Grove. You must have a car to go arround. hotel facilities: the hotel has two restaurantes. The one located in tyhe lobby (Zuma) is a contemprary japanese food, very trendy and nice place if you like japanese food. parking: very expensive to park the car overnight. About U$40,00 per night. We decided to leave our car in the public garage two blocks from the hotel and costs U$10,00/night breakfast: our room had an included continental breakfast. For brazilians, the standard f this breakfast is very bad. They donÂ´t have many options, it is included only coffee, juice, toast and a small fruit salad. In my opinion this is the weakest point of this hotel. staff: very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Epic hotel and staff were AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Poolely
Reviews.Content: This is the letter I wrote to the Epic Hotel after my stay. Sincerely, Walter P. ---- I have stayed in a LOT of Hotels. From the $39.95 a night, to the Fairmontâ€™s, InterContinentalâ€™s, Wâ€™s and Marriottâ€™s. But from the time I Valetâ€™d my car, I felt funny. Kind of like I was out of my element. As I found out later, I was. Farah who checked us in, was OUTSTANDING! She relaxed us and made us feel extremely special right off the bat. Her charm, wit and professionalism were so refreshing. She is definitely a keeper! Later we came down to ask the Concierge (Ruben) for directions for something to eat and he was also very knowledgeable and gave us great choices. Unfortunately after we ate my wife became ill. (No fault of the Concierge) While she came back to the hotel, I went to CVS to get her something to help her stomach. This was about 1pm and by the time I arrived back at the hotel, she had a turn for the worse up and continued to do so until nearly 11pm. Inbetween that time, I went back down to the Concierge, (Gene at this time) to ask him if he knew where I could get a small bottle of Club Soda because my wife thought it would make her feel better. I didnâ€™t see any at CVS earlier and I didnâ€™t see any in the Minibar. He made one call and said he would take care of it for me. Shortly after that he came to my room personally and delivered the Club Soda to us. WHAT?!!?!? â€œHEâ€� personally delivered it to us!!! OMG! Ok, so first the Valet, then Farah, then Ruben, then Gene! Ok, I am sad that my wife is ill, but I cannot believe the RIDICULOUSLY FABULOUS Service I am receiving. You WANT great customer service, but generally that is just what it is, a WANT. Anyway, later my wife feels she can hold on to some crackers or toast. So she ask me to call down and see if they have any. I tell her it will be a charge, so I will just walk back down to CVS and get something. She ask me to call anyway. So I call and guess what? Zach from In-Room Dining staff says, sure Mr. Poole, Iâ€™ll bring her some crackers right away. Now donâ€™t ask me why, after the great customer service I have already received, I am still reverting back to the ways of the world and I am expecting to get a charge for the crackers. I get a knock on the door and Zach is there with Crackers, TEA (Who thought of that??!!?!) and Honey. He says he thought the Tea might help! I almost got teary eyed because someone actually took an extra minute to THINK about what might help my wife feel better. Oh, and there was no charge! I was so flabbergasted; I didnâ€™t even offer him a Tip. SORRY! There are literally hundreds of hotels to choose from. Trust me, I have stayed at half of them. But because you guys went the extra mile for me and my family, I assure you I will be staying at more Kimptons in the future. I just want to say THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart. And next time we are in Miami, you will see us again. Hopefully without spending so much time in your beautiful room. Sincerely, Walter and Paulette 10/22/2010~10/24/2010 ---- If you get the chance to stay there, I promise you will love it! WP

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: janetohiovirginia
Reviews.Content: Like just about every person who has ever walked through its doors, I LOVE THE EPIC! I've tried other Miami hotels (incl the Viceroy), but I'm done with looking at others now ... I will always return to t the Epic. Love the club floor -- it's worth the extra money. Pool area is fabulous. Area 31 food is great. And Bonaldo (in the Club lounge) has to be the nicest and most helpful man on earth. The entire staff is fabulous. Thanks to all for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “A really cool hotel! Awesome”
Reviews.Author: clitheroekid91
Reviews.Content: So its not on South Beach. For a pre cruise hotel or otherwise this is a really cool place to stay in Miami. The rooms are large and the bathrooms vast. The pool deck on the 16th floor is stuning overlooking the water and the furnishings are really contemporary. Complimentary wine and DJ between 6 and 7 by the pools is just the ticket and the Concierge was really knowledgable sending us to the best seafood rest'in the city full of Americans not toursists. If you want the tourist stuff bayside shopping and eating is a 10 minute walk from the hotel around the waterfront. The cruise terminal is 15 dollars in a cab and the airport 20 dollars. If youre patient you can get a really good deal here too (under Â£120 a night). Would deifnately go again having also stopped on South beach and dissapointed with the tired overworked look of the hotels there

Reviews.Title: “Epic by name, Epic by nature.”
Reviews.Author: UK2Carib
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Epic for a city break. As we live in a beach town, proximity to the beach was not a priority for us. Our priorities in choosing a hotel were luxury, relaxation, excellent service and amenities such as a pool. We also wanted to stay in a safe area were we would feel comfortable wandering around on foot. The Epic not only met our expectations on all fronts, it completely blew them away! Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a 1 Bedroom suite, which was spacious, comfortable and absolutely beautiful (thanks Sean!). The views from the massive balcony on the 28th floor were amazing both day and night. We also thoroughly enjoyed relaxing by the stunning pool on the comfortable lounging sofas. As many others have mentioned, we too found all staff members to be both professional AND super friendly. We found the downtown location of this hotel to be excellent. We did not have a car but were able to easily walk to a number of great local (not chain) restaurants (Fratelli Milano for Italian, Bali Cafe for Indonesian and Cafe Bastille for French). The (free!) Metromover (less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel) is a great way to explore downtown and we also used it to reach the Arsht Center For The Performing Arts for an evening concert. There is also a good amount of shopping around (for all budgets), for those seeking some retail therapy! Thanks Epic for a wonderfully relaxing and enjoyable stay! You have (unfortunately perhaps for us) set the bar very high for all other hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Simply stunning place absolutely amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: denningr
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal 3 nights for the price of 2 saved $500! Got a free room upgrade 2319 is an amazing room and worth requesting get a water view but didn't pay extra for it! Minor gripe would be $40 a night for valet. But if you can afford $500 a night for a suite then you can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Baget
Reviews.Content: we were in Epic Hotel in our honey moon, we got an amazing suite! big bedroom with full window water view. big bathroom, shower and hot tube. the only problem it is the location, epic hotel is in the downtown Miami, nothing to do, need a car.

Reviews.Title: “excellence in all areas with great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: janis027
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Club level .. Good food presentations and drinks throughout the day and evening. . Well worth the extra. It is the staff here who make the difference.. Everyone is obviously very proud of the hotel and so sets the standard for others to follow. The pool is gorgeous with very fluffy towels and yet again great service with a smile . We dined at 31 but we were a bit tired so only had a small helping but the food was good and the staff were all superb. If you want an hotel that is just a little bit different ,immaculately clean with great views and spacious rooms . This is for you. I will definitely go back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay 10/23-10/27”
Reviews.Author: martinri23
Reviews.Content: Service: It was beyond outstanding and truly 5 star. Every and any request was honored. The staff made sure that everything was perfect. Ask for Bruno or Bonaldo from the concierge staff. Room: Very trendy furniture. Beautiful views from the ocean view. The city view was better at night due to the miami skyline. Everything was clean. Large bathrooms wtih his and her sinks. Location/Amenities The only downside. The hotel is located within the miami business district. So you will need a rental car to get around. Like all hotels in miami parking is expensive: $32 dollars per day. Pool, gym, and spa were all excellent. Likes: I highly recommend paying for the club level rooms (floors 29-30) which give you access to the club level lounge. The lounge has a seperate concierge staff, has a full open (free) drinks. It also serves 5 meals per day including a continental breakfast, and lunch, wine hour, etc... Dislikes: The location can be tough if you dont have a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Audreybella
Reviews.Content: I was able to stay at the Epic for one night while my husband worked in downtown Miami. All I can say is that I was spoiled for the one day I stayed there. The pools are gorgeous. The hotel itself is gorgeous. The room is too die for. You are walking distance to Bayside Marketplace for some shopping and dining. This hotel definitely has the WOW factor. The only downfall was the gym, I used it on Saturday morning and they say its a temporary gym but its very small and gets filled up quite fast. Also there is a complimentary happy hour between 5 and 6, they served red and white wine, definitely take advantage of that. All in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stark design; room features way too complicated”
Reviews.Author: RollCaster
Reviews.Content: I'm a 60 year old frequent business traveler. Although this hotel is new and has helpful staff, its design is starkly modern and room features are not user firendly. Phone design, lighting switches & shower controls are all unrecognizably modern. The latter give no hint of hot vs cold. Dimming the bathroom lights as a night light is not possible. Hooking laptop to internet was much more complicated than at Marriots. Although hotel provides a desktop computer for internet access, there's so much advertising on it, the useable screen size is fairly small. I attended a business function there, and the charge for an undrinkable glass of red wine was $10.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay with everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: love2travL88
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start with this review. Everything during my 4 day stay was more than I expected. This is the first time I stayed at such a luxorious hotel during a vacation and it was worth it. I gave 4/5 for location just because obvously there weren't as many exciting places to go to that were walking distance from the hotel, but you will quickly realize when you get in a cab to south beach that you're happy you didnt stay in a sleazy beach hotel! The Epic was extremely accomodating. They open doors, refil your drink after 2 sips, ask how you are doing/if you need anything, etc. I read previous reviews on it being a little pricey. The room itself i think was reasonable, but breakfast/dinner prices were a little up there. However, it is what you pay for everything you get there and is why the hotel keeps up such high ratings. There were also ways to get around the pricey items. For example, thursday when i arrived I was informed about the complimentary wine hour from 5pm to 6pm and then from 5-10 pm was a ladies drink free happy hour. Also, when i made my reservation I was given the option for a $1 complimentary daily breakfast which consisted of 3 different options and included the pricey coffee/juices. Nightlife was a bit limited for my age group, early 20's, but there are select bars nearby and one club in walking distance, Mia. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting exceptional service and the best accomodations when it comes to hotel rooms and poolside comfort. (they make up your chairs with rolled towel for a head cushion!) Will definitely be back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Miami's #1 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThePinkSuitcase
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Epic on at least 6 occasions for both business and pleasure. I always stay on the concierge floor and it is certainly worth every penny - thank you Bonaldo! The rooms are clean and everyone goes out of their way to make sure all of my needs are met.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashanti107
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a trip to Miami in September 2010 and stayed in the Cityview Junior Suite the room was very clean and comfortable. The people were very friendly and helpful when we needed something they brought it up to us in a reasonsble time. The Epic hotel is a very nice hotal to stay at I will stayed there when I take that trip to Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Chelsie215
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Epic for 3 days to see Miami prior to leaving to Carribean for a week. This hotel was very nice, enjoyed computer with free internet in the room. King bed was very comfortable, good night sleep. Room was very clean and spacious. Bathroom was clean and very large, there was a window from the bathroom to the living space, this was kinda weird to be able to see into the bathroom. View from room was very nice of pool and Miami river. Restuarants in this Hotel were alright, very expensive, a orange juice in the morning is $8 a little ridiculous. Close walking distance to the bay marketplace, a nice walk along the river. Oscar the concierge was very nice, he helped us rent a car for the day to save money in cab fares and directed us to the Sawgrass mills shopping centre. We had planned on going to Dolphin Mall but Oscar directed us to Sawgrass mills instead. We took his advise, i wish we would have gone with what we wanted. Sawgrass mills was a good outlet mall but was very mixed in selection. We will most likely not return to that mall in the future. If we are ever in Miami again we will plan on going to Dolphin mall. Miami beach is very nice, Lincoln road has alot of good stores for shopping and good restuarants. Overall if we needed to stay in downtown miami again we would consider returning to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Mai201010
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. It was very clean and the staff was amazingly friendly. Only minus was the price, very high price but also very high quality. Oh and only one recommendation, be careful with the services you use at the spa, because they charged me a lot more than what I actually used, is good checking your bill twice.

Reviews.Title: “1st day of my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lukegamble
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. the location, the service. My wife and I stayed on the club level of this hotel, and got free drinks made by our own little "suite man". the restaurant was to die for, kinda pricey, but everyone there treated you like I have never been treated... 100x A+

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Meeting”
Reviews.Author: mztanks1
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel and it is very Dog friendly. Beautiful rooms

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: TokyoJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed Club Room on the 26th floor, terrific skyline view of Miami harbour, luxurious and spacious accomodation with large balcony. Terrific attentative staff in every department, particularly Gene and Bonaldo deserves a mention who offer exceptional service in Club Lounge. Bayside a short 15 minute walk for shopping, boat sightseeing tours and eating. Thoroughly recommend staying at this joint for every occasion. The only minor drawbacks were the $32 valet parking /day, unreliable elevator key cards and the main pool was closed for renovation works.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: SunnyD22
Reviews.Content: We debated where to stay in Miami for some time, and opted for EPIC after reading the great reviews. I have to say, we were not disappointed! Simply magnificent, a wonderful hotel with great staff. We had a high floor with a sea view, and to sit on the balcony each evening made me want to move to Miami :) If you can afford this- you will love the place!

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed & unparalleled: gracious, personable, knowledgeable, warm, caring, impeccable. 100% Satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: vtrollingstone
Reviews.Content: The bad news: I'm home now. And spoiled for life. The Miami EPIC hotel has completely recalibrated my expectations for hospitality and service due to the outrageously skilled and thorough people who work there. They acted like they owned the place! In other words, they acted like it MATTERED to them that I had a good time; that I knew all of the perks and treats available, it mattered to them PERSONALLY that my stay was absolutely perfect, and that is what it was. And let's be clear: I'm no Pollyanna glass-half-full starry-eyed optimist; I am a picky, cranky, hard-to-please curmudgeon who ALWAYS gets the room with the last guest's hair in the shower, the snarky front desk clerk, and the unhelpful slack-jawed "concierge." That world evaporated and ceased to exist before I even entered the EPIC. In the unbelievable alternate universe of this hotel, there are only highly competent, sharp, gracious, helpful caretakers who have a passion for both hospitality and for Miami that translates into an incomparable guest experience. Never before have I had glowing, friendly email correspondence with members of a hotel's staff BEFORE a stay, let alone AFTER, but that is the degree of excellence the EPIC inhabits. Bruno, B, Oscar, Rueben, Georgios, Brent, Christian...my new friends deserve all the credit for elevating their individual roles to the highest level and collectively accomplishing the impossible: my complete satisfaction. I left the Miami EPIC feeling like I had made a personal connection with the people and the place, due to their exceptional commitment, warmth, generosity and skill. Spectacular doesn't even begin to cover my experience, and that is before I even mention the facility, which is stunning and very well-cared for. My room was SPOTLESS, containing every amenity I needed. The cleaning staff was also timely, accommodating, smiling and very thorough. I knew that any request I had would be fulfilled cheerfully. From my reservation confirmation email, to the sharp-dressed gentleman who greeted me as I first exited the cab at the front door, all the way to the personal good-bye wave I received from the front desk as I left, I was treated like a superstar and a member of the EPIC family. I would ardently recommend this hotel to anyone, and count myself lucky to have stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “The Epic is wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: amy86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Epic for 2 nights at the end of August. I had read the reviews on here prior to our trip, and all the good reviews are true. The staff is wonderful and really goes above and beyond to make your stay memorable. We let them know that it was our anniversary, and on the first morning we received a call asking if we would like complimentary mimosas to celebrate. They gave us an entire bottle of sparking wine and a pitcher of fresh OJ. It was very nice. Unfortunately, the main pool area was being renovated while we were there (it is reopen now, don't worry), but we had use of the pools normally reserved for the condo tenants, which was just fine (I was concerned at first, but it really was nice). The attendants at the pool area are amazing. We will return for this service alone. They immediately greet you and arrange your chairs with a nice terry cloth cover and roll a towel to use as a pillow. Then they bring over ice water with orange slices, and they have complimentary sunscreen and anything else you may need. We ordered lunch from them to have at the pool, and that was great as well. Exactly what we wanted. We had a waterview room with 1 king, and it was very spacious and the bathroom is amazing. I loved being able to see the bed and the TV from the soaking tub. The shower is wonderful too. And it was incredible to have a computer in the room with free internet service. Amazing! Little touches were very appreiciated. We requested turn down service, and later I noticed that they also adjusted the lighting in the bathroom so when I went to turn on the light over the toilet in the middle of the night, it was set to half-bright (we had it on full earlier in the day, so I know they adjusted it) and this was perfect. One tip - if you become a fan of Kilimpton on facebook, look for the "password" each month. If you give it to them upon check in, you can get an upgrade if available, or else they give you other perks like free drink tickets, etc. Loved the complimentary happy hour each day from 5-6pm - free wine. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “OMG - Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BMR2723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the EPIC over the Labour Day weekend for 3 nights, 4 days. We checked into the hotel on Friday around 10am - no issue with the room being ready (which I always seem to have at other hotels when I want to check in before 3pm) and I did not even request an early check-in - Awesome! The bell service greeted us at the cab, called us by name and escorted us to the front desk, gave us drinks, and brought us to our room. Check-in took us less than 5 minutes and we were on our way. The room - wow - huge and the view was awesome! Free computer/internet service (which came in handy on many occasions). The bed was sooo comfortable, so much so I have put the pillows on my wish list for Christmas - we had great sleeps!! Room was always clean and fresh. Great balcony! The pool, one pool was under construction, but for the amount of guests using the pool it never felt crowded, the temperature of the pool was very nice! But the best thing about the pool area were the staff especially Daniel, he greeted us every morning asked where we would like to sit and set up the lounge chairs with towels and ice water. When it looked like it was going to rain he offered to move us into a cabana (that had a TV) until the storm passed. Ordering food at the pool was never a problem whether it was breakfast or lunch. And the food was great! The Quesadillas (yummo), Hummus (very nice), french toast and belgium waffles - awesome!! And the fruit was so tasty! Besides the staff and the pillows, my favourite thing about this hotel was wine hour where they served the BEST white sangria I have ever had!! During the one wine hour Jose asked us when we were leaving and when we mentioned we had a late flight on Monday night he promptly called the front desk and extended our check-out time, without even asking!! Jose was great - the "story" of this hotel is about heroes and I thought it was appropriate considering Jose and his staff never made you feel that they were being put out by any requests their guests made. I am looking to return to the property very soon, I miss it already!! P.S. Most cab rides to Miami beach area cost $16-17 from the hotel $20-22 to the airport, Bayside marketplace is right around the corner (10min walk) with shopping, cruises, etc. We visited Design District and Miami Beach it is very central if you plan on doing more than the beach! And great location before/after cruising.

Reviews.Title: “There's some room for improvement at the Epic, but we did enjoy our stay...”
Reviews.Author: knotheadusc
Reviews.Content: The Epic Hotel is located on Biscayne Boulevard in downtown Miami. It's not near the beach, but it does border the Miami River and Biscayne Bay. This hotel is the only one in Miami that offers a marina. Our experience My husband and I arrived at the Epic Hotel feeling tired and hungry. We had driven three hours from Key West in traffic and we were really ready for a rest. As we pulled into the hotel's driveway, a very responsive valet approached us and helped us take the bags out of our rented convertible. Then his assistant offered to take our bags for us while we checked in. The lobby was huge, cool, and very modernly styled. I noticed a table with complimentary iced tea and lemonade set up for weary travelers. A cheerful lady in a light blue taffeta suit/uniform checked us into a waterview room on the 25th floor. Since we had already paid for the room through Jetsetter, we just had to leave a credit card imprint for incidentals. The clerk also mentioned that the Epic offers great government rates to military and government employees. All we needed to do was flash ID and we could get that rate, even if we weren't on business. Handy information to have for next time! Once we had checked in, we headed for the elevator. Another staffer helpfully explained that the elevator will only go up with the use of a room key card. It's nice to know that the Epic takes security seriously, although I think that kind of a system is easily bypassed by a determined crook. The elevator went up a floor and two more hotel employees came onboard. They were executive types and very interested in our first impressions of their sleek new hotel. So far, so good. Our room We were very impressed by the huge size of our room, which I think was one of the hotel's basic models. Our room featured a king sized bed, a flat screen television, and two telephones, one on the desk and one by the nightstand. The room also had a computer, which had internet access and could be used free of charge. A large balcony overlooked the hotel's two pools, Miami's skyline, and the Miami River and Biscayne Bay. The view was very nice. We took the minibar key, though we did not partake of any of the booze. I used the room's computer briefly, though the connection was a bit slow. It ended up crashing, so we broke out our laptop. The bathroom Our bathroom in the Epic Hotel was very impressive. It was done in cool, white marble and featured a huge rainfall shower and a deep soaking tub. There were also his and hers sinks made by Villeroy and Boch and a water saving toilet that had a sliding door affording privacy. The bathroom had a large open window next to the bathtub that opened into the room. I think this is for guests who want to watch television while they bathe. There were shades next to the tub that could be pulled down for privacy. I didn't recongize the brand of toiletries that were offered at the Epic, though I did think they smelled nice. The restaurant We were really hungry when we arrived at the hotel. I was feeling especially cranky and didn't feel like venturing out to look for a local eatery. So we ate lunch at Area 31, one of the Epic's two restaurants. It was 2:30pm when we walked into the restaurant and the place was almost empty, although there was a couple ahead of us who had lunch reservations. A very pleasant waitress was working alone and seated us by a window so we could watch what was going on outside. Somehow, my husband ended up with a dinner menu instead of a lunch menu, so that caused some confusion. Then he wanted to order a bottle of wine. When it turned out the wine he wanted wasn't in stock, he chose another. Unfortunately, the second bottle of wine was also out of stock. My husband asked the waitress which wines they did have; she pointed out a white from Austria that she had seen in their wine storage. He ordered it and it turned out to be a very good choice. The waitress was very embarrassed and apologetic about the wine mishap and asked us what room we were in. She said she was going to send us an "amenity". For lunch, I had a club sandwich made with mahi mahi, bacon, spicy aioli, lettuce, and tomato and served with fries. The sandwich was tasty enough, but the fish made the toasted bread a bit soggy. My husband had a Cuban sandwich. Lunch was a little pricey, with my sandwich costing $16 and my husband's costing $14. But we were sort of a captive audience. I supposed we could have also tried the Epic's other restaurant, Zuma, which serves Japanese cuisine. Surprise! After lunch, we went back to our room for a rest and to catch up on the news. The Epic is not really located in an area that lends itself to wandering around. My husband went out to pick up some chocolate and red wine and ran into a few ladies of the night on his way. We decided to just stay in and relax. At about eight o'clock, there was a knock on the door. A young man had brought us a chilled bottle of Pouilly-Fuisse and a personal card with a note of apology from our waitress at the restaurant. Needless to say, we were feeling no pain by the end of the evening! The wine was very unexpected and a nice gesture... and totally unnecessary. We enjoyed it just the same! Room service We decided to get room service instead of going out for dinner. Area 31 provides room service. We noticed the menu prices were slightly higher and there was a 20% service charge as well as a $3 delivery fee. Nevertheless, the choices were fairly inviting. We ended up ordering hummus and chicken satay. The hummus was a red pepper variety served with pita bread and black olives. The satay was a little disappointing, with just three small skewers of grilled chicken on a bed of greens and a cucumber mint dressing. But we weren't that hungry anyway and the food tasted good, even if it wasn't very much for what we paid. Sleep We slept fairly well in the bed at the Epic, although I did get a bit warm in the middle of the night. The room has an adjustable thermostat, but it didn't seem to be very responsive. Breakfast We went back to Area 31 for breakfast and had the same very kind waitress taking care of us. She recognized us immediately and treated us like family, even seating us at the table we'd had at lunch. Our room rate didn't include breakfast, which was a pity, since breakfast was expensive. However, I do have to admit breakfast was excellent; in fact, I think it was the best meal we had at the Epic. I had Eggs Benedict, homefries, fresh squeezed orange juice, and coffee. My husband had scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese grits, toast, juice and coffee. Our feast cost about $60, with the most expensive item being the $6 glasses of orange juice. I will admit, however, that the orange juice tasted fresh squeezed and was delicious. Checking out Checkout was a breeze. Another cheerful lady at the front desk got us all set while the valets brought us our rental car. Valet parking, by the way, runs about $20 a day. While we were waiting for the car, I noticed that Epic staffers had put out a welcome sign for three dogs, complete with pet treats. All Kimpton hotels are pet friendly. The valets handed us bottles of water for the road to the airport. Overall impressions Our one night stay at the Epic Hotel wasn't quite perfect. Most of our troubles stemmed from eating at the restaurant. The food was a bit overpriced for what it was. It's also pretty sad when two bottles of wine are out of stock and the waitress doesn't even know about it. On the other hand, almost every Epic staff member we ran into bent over backwards to make sure we were happy. Everyone had a good attitude, a bright smile, and a friendly personality. My husband and I both thought the waitress's gesture of sending us a bottle of wine was very classy, especially since she also sent us a personalized card. The hotel's facilities are beautiful and immaculate. I didn't get a chance to try either of the pools because I wasn't feeling up to swimming, but the hotel does have a great pool area with lounge chairs, cabanas, and wait staff to bring out drinks and snacks. The hotel has a spa called Exhale that looked promising, as well as a fitness room that I didn't use. The Epic Hotel, like all Kimpton properties, also hosts a one hour wine tasting in the lobby. We tried this out when we stayed at the Hotel Alexis in Seattle, but didn't bother with it at the Epic because we weren't up to socializing. My recommendations I would definitely give the Epic Hotel another shot, particularly if we got another great deal on the room rate. It's a beautiful hotel and the staff is mostly fantastic. The Epic Hotel is definitely not an inexpensive place to stay and there are other Miami hotels that are closer to South Beach and the Miami club scene, but for our purposes, the Epic was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NateKinFL
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed two nights at Epic over Labor Day Weekend. We absolutely loved this hotel as we do all Kimpton properties. When we arrived, I was a little surprised a bell person did not assist us with our luggage going in. Usually this never happens at a Kimpton for us. Besides that we received great service upon check in, but we didn't require much additional assistance while we were there. The room itself was amazing. We had two sinks, seperate tub and shower with rain head faucet. The bed was King Size and was very comfortable. We also had a desktop computer, flat screen tv, and typical great Kimpton storage with the sliding doors which are a space saver. The best part was the very large balcony overlooking the water. There is a small table and two chairs on the balcony. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful. There is a new Japanese restaurant called Zuma that had a beautiful environment although we did not try it. The pool area overlooks the Bay and is awesome. There are private cabanas with all the essentials and plenty of seating space if you want to be by the pool or just relax and look at the view of the water. We would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A success of epic proportions!”
Reviews.Author: ak5668
Reviews.Content: Absolutely everything it's cracked up to be. Attention to detail, superior service, nice location. If I should be fortunate enough to return to the sunshine state, you'll find me here. Don't look any further for a beach close location. Just wish they could import some surf!

Reviews.Title: “The Epic was cool and sophiticated. Outstanding service. Many nice details.”
Reviews.Author: Lilyles46
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at The Epic. We used dock space for our boat and found the service by the dock staff top drawer and especially friendly. The hotel has a very sleek, contemporary Miami atmosphere. It is beautifully appointed with interesting artwork throughout the common areas and hallways. Check in was a breeze and since we are Kimpton In-Touch members, enjoyed the little extras, like complimentary high-speed internet in the room, mini-bar gift and more. Fruit infused water is complimentary, pleasantly displayed and available throughout the day on the ground floor near the elevators. We were greeted at check in with a lovely offering of iced tea and lemonade. In the same location was complimentary coffee and tea in the AM. We found the brown sugar molded into seashells and starfish a nice touch. We had a double ocean room, complete with luxury bedding and a nice size balcony. The bathrooms are appointed nicely. There is a more than adequate deep soaking tub. The shower head was a rain shower style. Nice touch. Two separate above the counter sinks with plenty of counter space. The shampoos and conditioners were just okay. Not very much lather, and the shampoo was somewhat drying. the bed were comfortable. The room got a 4 not a 5 star in my rating for sleep quality only because I was restless and the sound outside from the cars passing over the bridge below was distracting. Many people might not even notice this. Light sleepers might. If you are a light sleeper, ask to be on the opposite side of the hotel from the bridge. We spent the day out by the pool. Nice breeze for a hot Miami day. The service by the pool was OUTSTANDING. Upon arrival, the pool staff set up a lovely cabana with luxury towels and served us cucumber infused ice water. Contemporary 'chill' style music played softly. The pool was cool, not hot, very refreshing. The clientele was a mixture of bikini clad singles, young couples, older couples with a few with babies. We were the only family with teens, but mine didn't seem to care. They enjoyed themselves. We ordered the hummus appetiser ($12) and a Cuban Panini (14) and split them for a pool side snack. Both were tasty, fresh and delivered on a service tray by the pool staff. Some were partaking in some fun tropical drinks. Light partying crowd. Nothing rowdy. Very relaxing. After showers to get set for a night out on the town, we also took part in the Complimentary Wine hour from 5 - 6 pm. Nice selection of Californian Chardonnay and Merlot as well as a specialty sangria. Staff was young, contemporary, young and attentive. We ate once in the restaurant on the 16th floor for breakfast. Very different. Atmosphere and service outstanding. Several of us had ordered the cheese grits to accompany our meal. They were very unusual, creamy not gritty. The apple chicken sausage was delicious with a light herbal flavor. Orange juice is plentifully served by a very attentive staff. Would HIGHLY recommend this property. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Epic for a reason”
Reviews.Author: glowgirl
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a vacation for south beach area, upon reading many reviews of the Miami dowmtown area and many many positive reviews here, I decided to stay 2 nights at the Epic. I was not dissapointed in any way! The hotel itself is beautiful with wonderful amenities. The lobby with fresh coffee in the morn/lemon water available/ the gym was great/ wanted to take a yoga class but time got away on me! The main pool was closed but guest were able to use the facilities on the 16th flr. Everyone was so helpful "Becca and the staff at the pool exceptional!" Bartenders at Zuma great and very friendly . Hi to Lou and Mark! I can't say enough about this hotel..I will definately be back and will recommend the hotel to everyone! The reviews were absolutely correct!

Reviews.Title: “Went back for more fun”
Reviews.Author: steelpanwoman
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to the Epic to take advantage of the Miami Spice travel package that they offered. I found this package on the Ilovemiamispice website, and realized what a good deal it was after I was given a run around on price by one of the Epic's booking agents:(. We were able to stay on the Club level again, and when they ran out of city view rooms, they upgraded us to a water view room at no charge. I was glad they offered two nights parking as part of the package. Oscar, the Club level concierge, and Bruno, the Club attendant were very helpful in getting us dinner bookings at other restaurants also participating in the Miami Spice promotion. The main pools were closed due to pool deck renovation, but the pools that were used by the condo owners were a good substitute. The service again was superb, as well as the service at Zuma and Area 31

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly, and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler27
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Epic. When we got there, we could hear a bit of construction from the pool area (even on a high floor), so they upgraded us to a junior suite on the other side of the tower with views of the city; we could also see the river. The room was nice and had a long wall of floor-to-ceiling windows. Everything about the enormous bathroom was incredible: perfect robes, great bathtub, nice shower. Their restaurant, Zuma, was excellent and the service was very attentive even though they were very busy (my boyfriend wasn't touching his drink and our server noticed and brought him a different drink to his liking). The service in all departments was great - they gave us a hotel credit because one day they had to test their emergency alarm system, which entailed extremely loud siren-like beeps intermittently for hours... but most guests were probably out of the hotel, and they had to do it by law. We were able to use the condo side's pools because they're doing construction on the hotel pools, and the 3 condo pools (in the same building, just as convenient) are gorgeous. We were even able to swim at night, which many hotels don't allow you to do. It's just a short 10-min cab ride to South Beach. The area around the Epic is a business area -- so there isn't a nightlife; most things close early-ish. But we did go to a Peruvian restaurant on the first night just a few blocks away, Ceviche, which is worth a try. I used the spa, and the service was extremely friendly and my masseuse was excellent. Would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly if you can get a deal through a travel site.

Reviews.Title: “Nice architecture -service too relaxed”
Reviews.Author: brausimausi
Reviews.Content: The EPIC is a beautiful, modern hotel. The rooms are up to international standard, it could be anywhere in the world. We had a room on the seaview side but could hear the noise from the bridge. When booking a room request one where you donÂ´t see or hear the bridge! We arrived at midnight our luggage was whisked away but hotel should have a service elevator and not make customers stay in the same elevator with bellboy. but this is happening all over the US. I missed a certain precision in service one can expect from a hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs better oversight and management. It's way too "do it yourself"”
Reviews.Author: CNDYAPL
Reviews.Content: It's very do it yourself. We checked in an had to wait for Valet to see us, then we had to ask for a porter, then the receptionist was a bit confused as to the configuration of our rooms. He also attended us while finishing talking and laughing with another receptionist. Very unprofessional and unwelcoming. I called over a month ago to ensure we had 'connecting' rooms. They said the room doors could be open and we would share a hallway and be able to lock the main door. The problem: the doors are extremely heavy and don't stay open. The other problem: apparantly the unhelpful lady at the front desk 'sara' said there is only one doorstop in the entire hotel. I asked the housekeeping and 10 minutes later they came up with 2 doorstoppers. I asked the housekeeper about them and she said they had plenty. Clearly, someone somewhere is confused. Also, the porter had forgotten some packages from the car when we had asked for everything to be taken down. It would not have been a problem except he said that there was a wedding and everyone was confused. Too bad for hotel guests I guess. Housekeeping did not turn down the beds the first night. The rooms were big but the windows covered with prints and the couch was uncomfortably stiff and dirty. There was a half eaten cooke under it. Room service forgot some items even though I asked them to repeat it and I didn't realize until after I waited for the missing items they had forgotten salt and pepper. This has all been within 24 hours. Hopefully, day 2 will be better. Day 2 our keys don't work for the 4 th time and the receptionist claimed this time it would work and if it didn't we could just walk down again. I said excuse me but it's 10pm and if it doesn't work you can send someone with us to bring the keys to u for the 5th time. They didn't work, the person she sent with us took the keys and never came back. The next day I got the keys from a new receptionist who apologized and sent someone with us to check if they worked. It seems on the weekends the service drops drastically. Bottomline: this is a do it yourself place. What service there is which is minimal does not exist on the weekends. I figured out the managers must not be there during the weekends because the staff wa extremely young, unprofessional and clueless. If you want a place that gives you a large space with minimal comfort and service, epic hotel is your best bet. I chose this place due to their response to travelers critiques. It seemed they took the time to answer back to criticism. I thought that meant they did something about it. Based on my experience, they don't.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkisback
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 12th August for 2 nights pre cruise .We chose the hotel because we were sailing on the new Norwegian Epic cruise ship and having read the reviews we thought lets start off in the Epic Hotel to . We booked a double double room on the club level for 2 adults and our 13 year old son .We were greated by name as we got out of our taxi and were whisked up to the club level lounge for check in free drinks and shown to our room .Big double beds large bathroom and great balcony with views over Biscayne Bay and the cruise port - due to jet lag we even got up at 6am on the Saturday to watch the Epic sail in my son was so excited ! The club level lounge offered free breakfast , not full english but perfect to start the day ,and also several free food offerings 4 other times during the day which included free drinks basically anythying you wanted .The room also had its own computer with free internet access ! The only issue we had was that the pool was being renovated and we were told we could use the facilities at the Epic residencies up the road .I was a bit annoyed because I had seen this on their website but the dates quoted were not when we were staying .It didnt really matter as we spent the Friday at the Bayside shopping centre which is a nice 10 minute walk away .Wedid the tour of the bay by boat and had a great lunch at Hooters- crab legs for $13 were to die for ! We booked the hotel with expedia and paid Â£354 for the 2 nights ( other rooms are slightly cheaper and the suites more ) We can only say that the service at the hotel was truly 1st class and we would stay again without hesitation.Our cruise was brilliant and we are staying for our last few days at the Tides hotel on South Beach.We will review later our 1srt thoughts are they can learn a lot from the Epic Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Epic”
Reviews.Author: brownie72
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel--from check in to check out. Can't wait to go back. Arrival greeting in circle drive and at desk was warm. The suite was fab--had the half-moon shaped sleeping room with the floor to ceiling windows. Bathroom was very cool--I liked the addtl balcony, soaking tub, and enormous shower with "rain" head. Room service breakfast was great, although the coffee was cold (even the second pitcher delivered was only luke warm). We paid for the 29th floor club level priveleges but didn't use them really. My only complaint is the construction workers that were protesting across the street--they woke us up at 7am on Saturday. Also, main pool was closed for renovating.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: manhatten15
Reviews.Content: The Epic hotel is first class in every way. The staff are so friendly but not over bearing. On arrival there was someone there to greet me and valet park my car, he had my details. There was also someone waiting to help with the luggage which arrived at our room before we did. The reception staff were excellent allowing us to check out the next dat at 4pm rather than 12pm as I explained that our flight didn't leave Miami until 8pm so we didn't wanna check out and hang around for hours in the heat. This was free of charge. The room was spotless, big and beautigul. The beds were so comfy and there was free internet. We had dinner in Zuma restaurant, that was a delightful experience, the food and service was amazing and the atmosphere was like that of a swanky new york bar/restaurant. Breakfast was also amazing and the pool area was to die for with complimentary water, cabanas with TV and Wii and the most amazing view of biscayne bay. I really would suggest this hotel and location to anyone planning a trip to Miami. Its close to Bayside Market Place and a short drive to South Beach. I will defo be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dcyogi
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel last weekend with an old friend. This hotel totally exceeded my expectations. The architecture and design was stunning, especially the lobby area. Our room was just beautiful. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. Talk about views!!! And we had TWO balconies, one off the HUGE and gorgeous bathroom. Bed was extremely comfortable. There was even a computer in the the living room for internet use (i don't know if there was a charge). Even the hallways of the hotel were bright, and modern, and didn't feel like an old stuffy hotel - or even a hotel at all for that matter - felt more like a fancy condo building. And everything was SO CLEAN!!! Not only was the hotel beautiful, the service was excellent across the board. From the bellmen, to reception (Seth is awesome and SOO Nice!), the concierge (Reuben was very knowledgeable, friendly and secured us hair appointments in a snap), to the pool boys (accomodated us and visiting friends and their babies with a great attitude and immediately brought us ice waters), to the housekeeping staff and room service (we called at 3:00 am to have the pull-out couch made up for sleeping and they were there in under five minutes; also ordered room service at 3:00 am and they were very prompt and friendly). While this hotel is not on the beach, it is so beautiful with excellent service, great amenities (multiple, beautiful pools with great views, excellent spa - Exhale - and gym), and excellent location if you are going to be traveling to multiple places in and around Miami. I would highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Highly recomend”
Reviews.Author: TMNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic Hotel in Miami for two nights. Although it's located a bit aways from South Beach and the happening scene by the beach, this hotel was nothing short than spectacular. From the front desk to the concierge, to the bell hop to the waiters in the hotel restaurant, everyone was hands down professional and friendly. What also makes this hotel great are the small touches they have in place for their guests. Each day we'd find complementary cool refreshments near the elevator bank when we'd return from being out. The pool area is furnished with comfortable lounge chairs, cabanas and again, complementary cool refreshments. One evening, they had a wine tasting event by the pool which was also complementary. The rooms are gorgeous and equipped with free internet service; desk top and all. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “EPIC experience unparalleled.”
Reviews.Author: blackjeep05
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend with my girlfriend to celebrate my birthday. The hotel had a modern feel in the middle of Miami. The bed was super comfortable and I could have spent the entire day there. However, I we did get out and enjoyed the spa and pool. We were fortunate enough to stay on the Club Levels. Gene and Sonja were very welcoming and made sure my every needs were met. They provided us with tips about the local area and even how to maximize our stay at the Epic. Bonaldo gets extra kudos b/c he was the most happy person I have met in a long while. I think the staff was in cahoots with my gf b/c they kept surprising me with drinks, chocolates, champagne, and even a personalized menu at Area 31! Dinner was a 5 course extravaganza of fresh seafood and a memorable view of downtown Miami. I even got to bring our little boston terrier with no extra pet fee!!! He was so happy when he saw the view from our room. We got a free upgrade to the waterview! I also felt safe running in the area with my dog for exercise. And the gym is awesome too. It is unfair for other establishments, but I will always compare other hotel to the high standards set by EPIC. I would have been content with a warm welcome and small bill. But staff at EPIC made us feel like we were staying at a ultra rich relative's downtown apartment and and still showed us a small bill!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: scorro1
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room for this hotel prior to the hotel actually opening but had read many good things about the plans. When we arrived we were shocked. The view, the environment and the style of the hotel were perfect. The rooms were always clean and the service was impeccable. I would DEFINITELY go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: JohnEdwinI
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel that I have stayed in.... Was very giddy when we arrived. Room on the 26th floor overlooking Biscayne Bay and the skyscapers. What a gorgeous bathroom (Villeroy & Bosch fittings), what a huge bed, big TV and a computer. Looked down onto the Pool deck 10 floors below and that was stunning too.

Reviews.Title: “Its called the Epic for that very reason”
Reviews.Author: kennethevo6
Reviews.Content: Well i stayed there recently for 3 nights on my first trip to the USA, i completely went off the reviews from this site and i am delighted i did. The epic was voted the number one on this site, its a 5 star hotel that is 5 star.. the staff were fantastic and very helpful, the location is very good too with only a short walk to must places, south beach is just across the bridge, a short cab ride only..I traveled with a friend of mine so we had a double room, it was very nice with a great view of the city, your own computer too which id say is rare in the states as its Wi-Fi everywhere now.. Big bathroom with a jacuzzi bath, fantastic rain showers, you could sleep in the beds all day there so comfortable..haha. They also organised a rental car for us as we went onto key west so if your doing the same you can look up my reviews on them hotels....so if i am in Miami in the future i wouldn't be staying anywhere else,Any questions you have i would be more than happy to help...ken...

Reviews.Title: “Great property - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Akrontravelman
Reviews.Content: This was a biz trip that I also made a leisure trip. The staff at the Epic is great and the facility is very nice. The staff really wants to work WITH the guest, I needed a late check out and they were more than happy to accomadate. I will come back here for sure! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels in the US”
Reviews.Author: rmanson411
Reviews.Content: My 4th stay here was just as great as the other 3. Breathtaking property with a picturesque view of Biscayne Bay and the city. The pool is incredible too- something you won't find but at a luxurious resort like Epic. Rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are as nice as you'll find in any hotel. Be sure to hit up Area 31 also- had dinner their twice now and loved it. Can't go wrong with any of the fish or steak selections. The waitstaff is attentive and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Epic”
Reviews.Author: Traveler852000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after a cruise celebrating our anniversary and we had a great time. Our room was so beautiful - a view of the ocean and a huge bathroom. We mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary and the staff sent up a bottle of champage and a congratulations card. It was a very nice touch and made our visit even better. The only downside is it's in the business district so there isn't much to do within walking distance, but you can easily take a cab. Plus, our room was so nice we didn't want to leave anyway. I absolutely love Kimpton Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Magical 3 nights---totally won over to Kimpton brand”
Reviews.Author: LHH67
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Epic. I found it here on Tripadvisor. I corresponded with the hotel to check & see if there would be work going on at the pool (earlier review mentioned it was loud) & to see if they had a pet free floor (they are a pet friendly hotel). I mentioned we were celebrating my husbands birthday & I got a prompt response saying that the pool would not be worked on during our stay, that we would be placed on their pet free floor AND we would be upgraded to a one bedroom suite. My husband was very surprised when we opened our door to our suite--and so was I. It was beautiful!! Floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom, with spectacular views of downtown Miami. Bed was VERY comfortable! An amazing bathroom & a very nice living room---with desk, computer & very comfortable workstation chair. (make sure to sign up for the Kimpton In Touch program on line---that gets you free internet use! Also, look up Kimpton on Facebook to see what their monthly secret word is---to get a free perk at check-in) We had also reserved a room on the "club level" which meant access to a room where there was a full time concierge, who was extremely helpful in helping us choose & dining options. There were 5 different food presentations set out daily. The breakfast was great! Extremely good quality---very fresh fruit! great croissants (I'm very picky!!) and bagels with all the trimmings, cereals, juice--fresh squeezed!, tea, coffee, etc. The items were pretty much the same all 3 mornings but that was perfectly fine with me---as it was all very good. There were tables available on the balcony & inside. We made it to 2 afternoon snacks--yogurt parfaits filled with cut fresh fruit & topped with granola & some very good cranberry bread. Also enjoyed stopping by on our way out to dinner for a drink (several choices of alcohol with mixers). Snacks laid out but we didn't try anything. Enjoyed stopping back by after our evening out for a sweet treat, too. One night Gene---the wonderful concierge even brought a plate of desserts to our room as he heard we had been by a few minutes earlier while he was away. Loved the pool and the very helpful attendants. They were able to set up our loungers so that I was totally in the shade, thanks to an umbrella set just right, and my husband was fully in the sun--as we requested. They were very attentive with glasses of iced lemon water. The spa came out to the pool in the afternoon & I had a 15 minute ($25) cabana massage. I was afraid it would be hard to relax at the pool---but it was great! Only wish I had signed up for an hour! Didn't eat at the hotels restaurant, but did stop by the bar with our free cocktail coupons---had a really good martini & enjoyed the experience. Negatives? Have to look very hard....shower is a rain shower---was ok, but I prefer a regular shower head. But it was a beautiful bathroom! We are used to staying in nice hotels (Four Seasons, Ritz, etc) but are totally impressed with the Epic & are looking forward to trying out other Kimpton hotels in the future

Reviews.Title: “made me and my guests feel like kings...”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute trip to Miami and was given this hotel on a recommendation. Only knowing areas near the beach, I was a bit hesitant about downtown. Boy, was I wrong. This hotel is in a great location in the heart of downtown Miami and the Brickell area. A perfect location to get business done in the Financial district then head out on the town in Brickell for an evening of fun. Everything from the customer service upon check-in, to the service staff at the restaurant and bar to the quality of the food and accommodations. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised at everything the EPIC offered. This was my first stay in a Kimpton property and it certainly will not be the last. I was upgraded to a junior suite and the room was fantastic, very clean and spacious. The connectivity for wireless was perfect and it allowed me plenty of time to get my work done in an extremely comfortable and well thought out, modern room decor. I'm looking forward to having this be my companies primary hotel for business in Miami. I am impressed with EPIC and the Kimpton product. ... now, if they could just move the beach a little bit closer to the hotel... ;)

Reviews.Title: “The most incredible hotel experience we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Missy2010_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many different hotels of all levels throughout US and Europe. The Epic was by far the most wonderful experience we've ever had. We had 4 glorious days as a guest there. The servcie couldn't have been any better, the rooms were to die for, food was fantastic and aminities were outstanding. By the time we left, seems like we knew almost everyone by first names and they knew us, extrememly friendly and helpful staff. The Epic is a must stop for anyone traveling anywhere near Miami. We will definitely be visiting again in the very near future. Kudo's to all the staff at the Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service - Fabulous Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: chupigrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Epic for our anniversary this year. I must say the hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff service was amazing. The room had breathtaking views and A+ accomodations. We had a romantic dinner at Area 31 and the food was delicious. Overall we had an excellent experience and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ncdiva79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic hotel over two weeks ago with my friends for the inauguration of the new ship from Norwegian Cruise Line called Epic. The location seemed great since the hotel is a short drive from the port of Miami. I am usually not one to write reviews but let me tell you, my experience at the Epic hotel was the best that I have ever had at a hotel. The hotel is just beautiful to say the least and the service is top notch. From the moment you pull up on the driveway, you feel as if all the attention is on you. The employees really do a great job making sure each of your needs are taken care of. I'd like to take a moment to recognize Luis the valet/bell boy, Renee and Fara at the desk, Troy at the pool, and Bibi my room attendant. They were all amazing and they did a great job making me and my friends feel right at home as if we were the only guests staying at the hotel. As far as the property is concerned, it features many luxurious amenities such as a fabulous pool deck, on site restaurants, and a wonderful spa. My friends and I only stayed at the hotel for two nights before leaving on our cruise but we cannot wait to go back. This hotel is by far the best that I have ever stayed at and I now understand why it is the top rated hotel in Miami. Keep up the excellent work!

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BTM2010
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend celebrating my birthday at this hotel in downtown Miami. I cannot say enough about how well they treated me and my guest. I had heard many good things about this property but now I can say I have experienced it. I had emailed the hotel prior to my arrival to indicate that I was going to be staying at the hotel for the first time and I was celebrating my birthday. I received a call the day before from the InRoom Dining Mgr. Jose Aguirre asking what type of wine I preferred. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a spacious one bedroom suite overlooking the bay and skyline. The bathroom had a large tub/jacuzzi and a huge separate shower with the shower head in the center of it. The balcony wrapped all the way around the two rooms. The next day Mr. Aguirre delivered a bottle of champagne and fruit to my pool cabana. I must also give thanks to the pool guys who took care of our every need with great enthusiasm. I cannot say enough about how well Mr. Aguirre, the management staff, and all the employees of this hotel took care of me and my guest. I highy recommend staying here for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile place to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: barrettwa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had not taken a vacation in ages and so we decided that this summer we just had to get away from the hectic life of New York and relax with our 4 year old son. It was difficult to spend money we did not readily have on a vacation, but we were feeling burned out, so we decided to throw caution to the wind for a few days and try to enjoy the fun part of life that we felt we deserved. Through expedia, we booked 4 nights at a hotel in Coconut Grove, Miami, but after reading the reviews I quickly cancelled that reservation. I scoured the net and stumbled upon Epic Hotel. I read the great reviews about Epic hotel and even though we were going to spend more than we had budgeted for we decided to take our chances. Those reviewers were right! This hotel is the place to be! The hotel is just as beautiful as it looks on the internet, the suite we took was lovely, but what made this place so special for us was the staff! Every member of the Epic hotel staff was attentive and gracious and helpful and respectful and just simply wonderful! Thanks to Annie the valet parking manager and a really sweet person, who generously assisted us with our parking dilemma ($$$) and to Marcus who, upon our arrival, handed my son a bottle of bubbles to which he happily exclaimed "cooooooool"! My son also had another great surprise on the morning of our second day. You see, we had gone that morning to the restaurant to take advantage of our complimentary breakfast (offered to us the night of our arrival) and my son had asked for crayons and coloring paper when we were seated. The young lady who seated us kindly apologized to him for not having any and he was okay with that. After breakfast we returned to our room and were surprised to hear the doorbell ring about a half hour later. It was a special delivery for our son! A pack of crayons and a coloring book with stickers of trucks! (It is a pity that I have forgotten the name of the young man who delivered it, because every time he saw our son he asked if he was enjoying his book). We were all delighted and that made us fall completely head over heels with Epic hotel and the staff at that moment (and believe me, we had already fallen in love)! I could go on and on and on, because in our short 4 night stay, there were so many other thoughtful deeds done by the staff which made us feel competely relaxed and special and cared for, but I will stop here. We really believe that our vacation was money well spent and we intend to visit again very soon. Thank you, Epic hotel! You certainly exceeded our expectations and we are truly satisfied with the experience we had. You certainly deserve all the compliments that you have been given.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: nadiashahmalik
Reviews.Content: So much to say here but I'll try to keep it short. Amazingly friendly staff. They make you feel special and well taken care of. The nicest person we encountered was Farah. She upgraded us to a Bay view room, gave us two complimentary items from the mini bar (has snacks) since we don't drink and won't enjoy the complimentary wine hour at 5pm. She sent hot chocolate to my room at 11pm when I was craving it and asked where I could find a local cafe. She had this "we can do anything for you" attitude that made us feel heavenly. When I called the front desk about negotiating valet price, the staff member asked me "what do you think is reasonable?" I gave him my answer and he said "okay, it's done." The valet service was great also. We called from our room when we wanted our car and by the time we got downstairs our car was ready. The hotel provides lemonade and ice tea from 2-4pm. The decor is very modern and comfortable. They have a lounge area downstairs w/ this really cool microsoft computer (kind of like a Ipad..not sure what it's called). My husband and I sat downstairs for a bit just enjoying the view and playing on the computer. The pool area was beautiful and relaxing. The staff person set us up on loungers w/ towels and water. The spa is free for hotel guests. The gym is very clean and modern w/ individual tvs for each machine. The spa has a Hammam (kinda weird but nice feeling), a quiet room, and a detox chamber (not co ed). The detox chamber was kinda dingy though and took awhile to heat up. Otherwise, everything was absolutely amazing! Oops, forgot to mention the complimentary continental breakfast every morning (although we slept in and only used it one day).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service & perfect views.”
Reviews.Author: Jezza2010
Reviews.Content: First time to a Kimpton hotel & The Epic didnt let us down. We came here on our Honeymoon & found the hotel to be excellent in service & quality. The only 2 downside were the continental breakfast, very good; but the same everyday. The price of the car park is $32 per night, it's the only thing that's overpriced in the hotel. The food is great from their main resturant Area 31. Drinks are a little over priced, but thats quiet common in Miami. The concierge was great, arranged a hire car, several trips & gave us discount vouchers too. Overall, a great Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: sol1905
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic with my husband & two young children (7 & 4) recently at the start of our summer holiday. None of us could get over how friendly and helpful everyone was & how welcome we were made feel. The kids were asked their names by staff when they first met and from then on were always greeted by name with a smile. Nothing was too much trouble and we truly felt like VIPs the whole time we were there. We had a huge one-bedroom suite, which was amazing! It had everything we could need during our stay and was immaculately clean. Housekeeping was never visible and yet the room was cleaned and turned down each day to a very high standard.
