The pool area was stunning and again spotlessly clean. The choice of two pools meant that we didn't feel our kids slashing around was disturbing any of the other guests. Both were monitored constantly and again anything we needed was to hand. We ate in Area 31 and couldn't fault it. The food was fresh and very well prepared, service was excellent. The kids also found it interesting being able to watch the chefs at work in the kitchen. We have stayed in a lot of hotels but even my husband who travels a lot with work argrees that this is one of the best we have ever stayed in. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “After 6 stays I still choose this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Hello, I have been staying in this hotel till its opening in Dec08. Its has improved in many areas and others are worst, but the fundamental thing itÂ´s that the Management worries about their guests and that its always a good sign. Our last stayed (Jun2010) was very good, the room, the staff, the breakfast, the spa, were perfect, but we found the gym cleanliness a disaster and thatÂ´s why I mark very low the hotel this time. I found improvemnts at Area 31 were weÂ´ve dinner with friends 1 night and Zuma itÂ´s a great restaurant but the kitchen smells a lot. This last time I was hesitating between the Epic and the Mandarin, so we went twice to the Mandarin to visit and to eat and I think we made the right choice. The Mandarin is a beautiful hotel, very well decor, but the location of the Epic is better and the gym and pool are larger. So in downtwon Miami this is my choice !!. Hola, me he alojado en este hotel desde que inauguro en Dic08. Ha mejorado en algunas areas y empeorado en otras, pero lo importante es que al Administrador le importan sus huespedes y eso es un buen signo. Esta vez encontre todo bien, menos la limpieza del gimnasio, que era un desastre. A mi me encanta entrenar y si bien el gimnasio cuento con cleanex para que cada cual limpie los equipos, lo que encontre en muy malas condiciones fue la limpieza en general. Area 31 esta mejor, el menu muy bueno y rico y Zuma me gusto pero la cocina larga mucho olor en el ambiente y eso me molesto. En este viaje estaba indecisa entre alojarme en el Epic o en el Mandarin, entonces fui a conocer el Mandarin. El hotel esprecioso, ubicado con una vista increible a la bahia de Biscayne, pero encontre que en cuanto a ubicacion, gimnasio y pileta el Epic es mejor. Depsues de 6 estadias el Epic sigue siendo mi eleccion en el downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING.....!”
Reviews.Author: stoutyo1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Epic while on honeymoon and from the moment we arrived after a long flight we felt like we were in heaven. The staff were incredibly welcoming and friendly. We arrived just in time for free wine hour which is a really nice touch. contary to other advice about downtown Miami we found it very pleasant and safe and walked to Bayside every evening for drinks and found the Epic to be in an excellant location. Our room had a great view and we can see now what people meant about the comfy beds.We had room serivce for breakfast one morning and it was superb. The Epic was first of four hotels we were to stay during our vacation and it really set a high standard. also the pool area was amazing just like in the pictures and we spent a lovely morning in sun there. We dont have any complaints and wish we didnt live so far away so we could visit there more often....!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Classy”
Reviews.Author: shlvallejo
Reviews.Content: My company set me up at this hotel for three nights and it did not disappoint! I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I was working during the day close by but enjoyed every moment I spent at this hotel. First the front door entry started with a nice hello and smile, check in went smoothly. The room was exceptional, large, clean, amazing decor with a very clean Miami hip style to it. My fiance was with me and we just loved it. We want to remodel our bathroom in our home the same style...we had room service a couple of times the food was awesome! We will definetely be back to enjoy a weekend trip with our little Pom Pom. Kudos to The Epic....

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing hotel ever !!”
Reviews.Author: freddo
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed 2 nights in this hotel as part of a 3 week stay in the USA and a cruise. The hotel reception were absolutely amazing on arrival and even gave us an upgrade to the room we had booked. Once arriving in the room we found champagne and strawberries with chocolate sauce as they knew it was our anniversary. The view from the balcony was amazing. The pool staff were very attentive, even coming round frequently with iced water - there is also a water machine by the pool. Suntan lotion was even available free if needed. The complimentary wine hour each evening was a really good touch and we arrived just after this had finished so we were given 2 vouchers for a free wine each at the hotel bar. The staff in this hotel went above and beyond what I expected for service and made this stay unforgetable. I hope to be back in Miami and able to stay at this amazing hotel sometime in the future. If you are staying anywhere else in Miami then you are missing something truly amazing. If any staff do read this then once again thank you.

Reviews.Title: “EPIC 4th of July at the Epic!!”
Reviews.Author: mforget07
Reviews.Content: Where shall I begin with a review of this GREAT hotel....? We wanted to take a trip back down to the Epic (where my wife and I were married) to "get away" and watch the South Beach fireworks with friends and our dog. Reservations - We booked our stay at the Epic through Christian via email and he was extremely accommodating to our request to be located in a room with a view of the fireworks. He offered us many options and choices for our booking and we "settled" for the Summer Playground Package in a Waterview One Bedroom Suite. Arrival - We were greeted at valet and were immediately surprised to find a special greeting for Goliath (our dog) at the hotel entry. We proceeded to check-in and used the "Secret Password" mentioned on the Facebook page for Kimpton Hotels. The helpful staff member took care of us and gave us our "special" surprise (You have to go to see what it is...and you will not be disappointed). Room - We proceeded up to our 22nd floor room and immediately saw the bay, port and South Beach beyond. We dropped our stuff, our dog got comforatble and we began to relax and enjoy our day. Room Service - All of our requests were granted by room service, and guest services....From the extra blankets and ice to the dog bed and dog food bowls - we had everything that we needed. Surprises - Alexi contacted me prior to our arrival to ask if we needed anything special....I sent her a picture of Goliath (when he was a puppy)- She made sure that his picture was in a frame and waiting for us on arrival. Nice touch! We were also surprised by a greeting from in-room dining with a special summer cocktail sent from Christian. Thanks Christian - The mojitos were outstanding!! Pool - Our large group headed down to the pool for a afternoon of "sun". We relaxed and enjoyed a lunch and cold drinks poolside while we tried to find some sun on the cloudy day. The water in the pool was comfortable and the lounge music playing in the background was a great touch to make the afternoon feel extra relaxing. The pool staff were outstanding and our server was as well. We had all that we needed! Fireworks - We enjoyed the South Beach fireworks from our balcony and were surprised to see that the Bayside fireworks were also right there (slightly blocked from the adjacent buildings) - but visible in the reflections on the building's windows. The location was perfect and it met our needs and main reason for the trip. Area 31- We enjoyed a continental breakfast at Area 31 the next morning which was a perfect way to start the day...good pastries, fruit, bagels and coffee! All in all our trip far exceeded our expectations..our guests also complemented us on how "GREAT" the the hotel was in all aspects. You guys really do make us feel at home! Thanks - and we will see you guys soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Pepper28
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever been to. Great staff, great rooms, confortable, trendy, quiet. Nice pool and restaurant. Definitly worth the visit! I Want to be there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “It's An Experience”
Reviews.Author: NicoleTanika
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at the hotel; it was a one night event with my sorority (semi-formal, to be specfic.) There's nothing semi about this place, it is epic in every way. From the grand entrance, to the chic elevators, to the spacious ballroom - it was a night to remember. The views from the balcony didn't hurt either, I think everybody left a little breathless... definitely the place to be if you're staying in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Epic = Cosmic, Grand, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: qianabb
Reviews.Content: Epic is a must do for Miami. Me and my friends were in town for my birthday and a girls weekend. The Epic Hotel was gorgeous, and everyone on the staff could have not been nicer. Before I arrived, they sent an email to firm up any last minute details, or requests that I may have had. I really liked that personal touch. Upon arrival, swift check in, and a choice of rooms. We stayed with our original room because of the beautiful water view. The rooms were as pictured, everyone knows your name, and no request was too much for them. While I was out and about, I ended up calling in to the hotel several times for directions and phone numbers, and was provided prompt, friendly service. We also asked for a microwave, and a fridge to be brought up, and were accomodated for no additional charges. I think what I really liked the most about Epic is that they did not nickle and dime you for every little thing. They charged a price up front that encompasses everything that you might ask for (within reason) and I appreciate that. I would prefer to pay a little more on the front end, then to have unexpected charges on the back end. And Epic came in a little over in price than a few other hotels, but under in price then some that should have been considered better, but I could tell that Epic's amenities were superior ( and they were). For people who need to stay before a cruise, Epic is about 5 minutes from the Port of Miami, so this is an excellent place to stay before and after. Oh,and even though I dont have a pet, they had the cutest little personal welcome signs for the pets checking in, that included treats and water right out front. That was defintely a personal touch. I can't say enough about the hotel, and I will definitely be returning when I am in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Having a Epic Stay at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: devits
Reviews.Content: It whas my second stay at EPIC HOTEL MIAMI ,7 visits at other hotels Stay 5 nights at a 1 BEDROOM SUITE 970 sqf , large living room ,bedroom & badroom Very clean , stylefull decoration , computer & internet ,balcony.........enz Wonderfull stay , 2 very good resto, helpfull en friendly staff, all you can ask for.it fieel you more dan at home easy acsses to transportation and the beaches and good rates for a ***** HOTEL For me its THE BEST PLACE TO STAY AT MIAMI BEACH DOWN TOWN My sincerly thanks to the team off THE EPIC HOTEL MIAMI MR Patrick Van Acker BELGIUM

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Fathers Day in Miami at THE EPIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: bajathree
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a night in Miami at the Epic Hotel for Fathers Day and we couldn't of been more pleased. Every aspect of the hotel aimed to please....service is top notch, rooms are large and modern....and the facilities didn't disappoint. The view from the 16th floor pool is gorgeous.... beautiful pool lounges and 5pm wine by the pool is just the perfect extra special touch. It's a shame that one of the 2 pools is having a bit of a problem with some of it's tiles coming loose....but these are construction woes and I am sure they will get them fixed....I don't feel it detracted from the pool experience. I also read some prior reviews about food by the pool poor and service slow but our experience was nothing but good....service poolside was WAY above and beyond and food was very good. I did have a bit of an issue with my AC in the room not wanting to turn back on after shutting the sliding glass balcony door....but service was up in the room within minutes of calling to fix the problem. I also had a slight issue with my internet connection...but once again service fixed it within minutes of calling....seriously...I don't think I had to wait more than 5 minutes before they were knocking at the door....that's what I call good service;) You are with-in walking distance to many top restaurants....Capital Grille is right across the bridge.... Chophouse is right down the street....walk over to Bayside and South Beach is only a 10 minute taxi ride....cost was $15 going and right around $18 returning from South Beach. Parking is a bit steep at $32 but I can't complain about the valet service at all. We were so pleased that we already have made return plans.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel and staff ever”
Reviews.Author: HelenRH
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this absolutely wonderful hotel for almost 14 days. During this longer stay I would have seen the good and the bad as it is hard to please anyone every single day for that long a stay , particularly someone as picky as I am. I always stay at 5 star hotels including Waldorf Astoria hotels, and Ritz London and Paris,Sherry Netherland ,Peabody Hotels etc In Miami i have stayed at the Viceroy, Ganesvoort and Mondrian all very nice but not the service level of Epic I stayed on the club level and enjoyed the continental breakfast when i wanted it along with sandwiches at lunchtime and snacks in the afternoon, tapas and cocktails in the evening and desserts before bed , well worth the extra charge I was lucky to get to know their wonderful concierge staf and cannot say enough good things about them including Sonja,Gene,Reuben ,Bruno and wonderful"B" whose cosmos I looked forward to whenever he was working evenings . Every request was greeted with a can do attitude and the hotel should be proud to have such a high caliber of staff although from what i was told when asking how they had such a great staff it appears Epic has a lengthy interview process which shows. The rooms were lovely and serene with comfortable beds, beautiful bathrooms with soaking tubs or bubble jacuzzi tubs in suites.(I stayed in both) I enjoyed both the city and ocean views as i live normally on a vacation island with ocean views. Maids did a great job too , rooms are very clean.I really loved privacy button, no maid ever banging on door at 9 am to wake you up when you wanted to sleep. The large 2 pool area on hotel side is beautiful with views and cabanas. The plasma TVs in the cabanas were the way to watch the World Cup . Staff is great Zach started my stay off with frozen grapes by the pool and i later saw him working all over the hotel Cecil my wonderful pool concierge greeted me every day and made me look forward to each day as did Daniel and Troy and the other pool staff i saw every day The mojitos are addictive, however they also make a mean pina colada The wine hour is a fun way to meet fellow guests and residents from condo side of hotel. As a side note my stay was not really for fun as my husband was in Miami for surgery and was the reason i had to keep extending my stay. However this caring staff made me feel at home even during difficult times and made me smile with cheerful surprises of giant cookies for my birthday and when my husband was able to join me after being released from the hospital, strawberries and champagne to welcome him and wish him well Spa is very nice ,check out hammann and quiet relaxation room. Room service was always happy to meet any special request with a smile All Front desk staff also great as previously mentioned always remembered your name thanks Brent for your kind words To the GM Joe and Resort manager Sean YOUR STAFF ROCKS!!! We will be back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “A memorable weekend”
Reviews.Author: chino921
Reviews.Content: Good Evening Mr. Mckeen, Before you book your stay at any hotel in Miami, I advise you to look into The Epic. It centered in the heart of Miami and you have easy acces to 1-95, the MacArthur Causeway, and other attractive venues in the area. The staff was amazing!! It was my son's 7th birthday and we wanted to get away from it all. Once we had the excellent service at poolside, my son received a enormous dessert compliments of the hotel. That was very touching for us ALL. From the valet, front desk, concierge, pool, kitchen, housekeeping..etc. the employees are very professional and MOST of all friendly..What else can you ask for you?!! Rooms were impeccable. The view was amazing!! Hopefully you will not be disappointed!!! Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel -- skip the club level upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: resinwich
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Miami on our way back from Islamorada. It's an absolutely beautiful hotel -- from the lobby to the pool to our room. The pools are on the 16th floor and overlook the river area. There's a new Asian-style restaurant on the ground floor, which was understandably expensive (it's a 4.5 star hotel, it's Miami) but very, very good. I think they had just opened earlier that week, but they were on top of their game already. Staff was excellent, as we've come to expect as frequent Kimpton customers (we've stayed in Chicago, Baltimore, Philly, New York, etc.). And of course, there's the famous Kimpton happy hour between 5-6pm every night with wine and sangria. Can't miss that. There's another restaurant on the 16th floor and another bar on the ground floor, both of which seemed rather nice. The only downside to our stay was our disappointment with our decision to upgrade to the club level rooms. The room itself was very nice (although all Kimpton rooms are nice), but we were sold on the "club lounge" which was supposed to offer alcohol throughout the day and five snacks, for lack of a better term. The bar was usually understocked and the food wasn't all that impressive. Nitpicking, I suppose, but we definitely won't make that upgrade in the future. It just wasn't worth the extra $80 or so per night for those amenities. Regardless, we're dedicated Kimptonites. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expections for a luxury hotel that is very dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: schiavetta
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff at the Epic in MIami was great! Very cordial and friendly -- everyone from the lobby staff, to the front desk, to the staff in area 31 (where we had breakfast). We had concerns since we were traveling with our dog, Allie. Since they were condsidered a 'pet-friendly' hotel, we were curious how 'pet-friendly' they were....Our worries went away when the staff greeted her when she jumped out of the car! Water and dog biscuits waiting for her at the front entrance. We want to thank Michael Bomba in the lobby for treating Allie like a queen, and also to Marcela at the front desk for helping us out with info/directions. The location is great -- just a short 15 minute ride to South Beach and a short walk along the bayfront to stroll and do some shopping. Amenities were all first class. We will be back in the future! So will Allie!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: SaFot
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is just awesome.The Stuff is friendly and helpful with any kind of request .The room was very clean, with free internet to use all day and we had a great view to the bay. At the entrance is a very nice bar with a lot of people so you don't have to leave actually to have a good time. The parking is a bit expensive for European standards but normal for Miami. We stayed for 10 days and we both loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: arlotka
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Fabulous location. The last day of our stay we just wanted to relax by the pool, but we got showered with glass falling from a balcony above us which was being repaired by obviously not very skilled people. That was the end for us, glass everywhere(in and out of the pool) and we had to leave. Not very good last few hours we wanted to enjoy before going back home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: brittania8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic time at the Epic,with out exception every member of staff we encountered was so pleasant ,helpful,happy and general really nice.Nothing was to much trouble from the flowers .champagne my husband ordered for my birthday ,to cake and wine by the pool and ordering breakfast after hours they were all so nice .The hotel is beautiful ,rooms lovely ,pool etc lovely and the new Zuma resturant is so good .We wouldnt stay any where else and we will definatly be back .Well done Epic it certainly was!!

Reviews.Title: “Epic Miami, great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Mart-Christi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Eic Hotel, Downtown Miami. Concierge Floor. One bedroom corner suite. Great suite, nicely done. Poor lighting in the bathroom. Poor computer, Internet incredibly slow. Very good bed on the soft side. Superb view of the city and the water. Big great windows with huge balcony. Cleaning service just good. We had to call them to reclean the room. Turndown once every two nights. Not so good.... Windy in June but we had great bfast in the morning. Concierge service : so very good. Drinks, wine, some little snack food. All good. Very helpful staff, best i had for a while. The best ; Zuma, great great Japanese style food, sushi, robata. Don't miss it unless you don't like that style of food. Pool : nice setting but with some glitches, pool tiles are falling apart. Food at the pool : so bad it makes a lunch in a two star in Cuba look good. Same for the drink unless you like them very hard on the cheap side. Stick to wine. Some noise from dowtown during the day (construction). Overall : A great great deal if you do not want to be in South Beach in a very nice setting. Will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: thehighplainsdrifter
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite during the first week of June and were happy with the room and the service. We were treated very well. Michael, part of the valet / bell staff was especially welcoming and helpful and did a great job in making us want to return to The Epic, he went out of his way to offer advice and help. The hotel appears very new and the layout is a bit different to what we are used to with high end European hotels. The room was great, the maid service and room service were both excellent. The location is great, easy access to everything, and good views. The pool area is probably the high point of the hotel, day beds, cabanas (some with TV, if you want to watch the World Cup, perhaps?) and great service. We'll be back. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jullisa
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel solely based on its good rating on trip advisor. I was not disappointed. We often travel to Miami to go to concerts at the American Arena. We have stayed in hotels far and close to the site. From now on I will only stay here. It is close to the Arena, metro mover, close to the mall, CVS, downtown eateries etc. Service was excellent from everyone! Oscar checked us in and was very friendly and welcoming, made us feel right at home. A package was supposed to arrive during my stay, but it arrived after my departure. Andres, the concierge, handled the forwarding to me in an efficient and professional manner. The room was super spacious, well designed and comfortably furnished; the carpet was lush and the bed excellent. We loved the double sinks in the bathroom and the temperature regulator in the shower. All features of the hotel and room are very modern. The pools and pool area are fabulous, enjoyed sipping the free wine during the wine hour around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Most luxurious hotel downtown Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Rob0422
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite at the epic and fell in love with the place. Plush deluxe king size bed. Beautiful, well appointed lobby. Extra friendly staff! Gorgeous pool with poolside bar. Staff was somewhat slow on serving drinks there, but everything was top of the line. Travel quite a bit, and will always return there if staying in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ATM72
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Good service. Great location. This hotel still has the new smell. Modern elegance all the way. Lovely rooms with awesome bathrooms! Great bath products also. Good gym. Had breakfast outside overlooking the Miami River! My only problem was that the room did not get cold enough and the duvet on the bed is too warm for Miami! This was a serious problem for me! Could not sleep well!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and go to Miami just to experience Epic.”
Reviews.Author: chocomel911
Reviews.Content: Unparalled service. It's like being in an Asian or European hotel. Consistent helpful friendly. Spacious rooms great amenities. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I've Ever Received”
Reviews.Author: Brimberly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Epic this past weekend for our first anniversary. When we pulled up to the hotel, we were greeted by eager-to-serve bellsmen. Upon check-in we were informed that we had been upgraded to a suite in honor of our anniversary. The room was absolutely phenomenal! Great balcony that wrapped around the suite, floor to ceiling windows overlooking the bay, jacuzzi tub, the works! We thought it couldn't get any better when there's was a knock on our door an hour or so after check-in. We were blown away to see the hotel staff member standing there with a bottle of champagne for us! We were floored! The staff was personable and courteous, the 5 pm wine hour at the pool was quite the treat, and the facility was top notch. All of this for $129/ni. (we booked during a special). Kimpton's service is second to none!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of style and service”
Reviews.Author: ouzolover21
Reviews.Content: We arrived late tired and a little tetchy we were greeted by the most amazing staff they were warm and polite yet understood that we needed a drink a shower and bed. We were efficiently escorted to our suite with the minimum of fuss The suite was beautiful the ambiance was peaceful and relaxing, the views of the Miami night sky were amazing .then as if by magic a glass of wine and a cold beer were delivered to our room what a treat The rest of our stay continued in the same vein the service and quality of this hotel is second to none We have been lucky enough to stay in some of the best hotels in the world but our stay in Miami was enhanced by the wonderful staff, the great location and facilities at the Epic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn6586
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Epic Hotel for a week while on a business trip. I loved it! The hotel was gorgeous and the rooms were spotless. Housekeeping was excellent. I came home from work everyday to an ice tray filled with ice, my lights dimmed to the perfect setting, my pajamas folded with slippers on top and a spotless room. The pool area was also beautiful. It was great to sit on the many couches and sitting areas and enjoy the view of Biscayne Bay from the pool. My room also had a great view of the Bay. Although its a very busy hotel with a lot going on on the weekends, the rooms are very soundproof---I didn't hear anything. The bed was so comfortable and there is a computer in every room with free wifi. There is a nightlcub called River Lounge on the 1st floor as well which was great. The hotel is in an area where there is alot to do. There is a huge outdoor mall called Bayside Marketplace within walking distance. It has tons of shops and restaurants, bars, clubs, live music and salsa dancing. The walk along the Bay outside of the hotel was breathtaking. You can see cruise ships parked in the water. There are also many other convenience stores and clubs within walking distance. All in all a great hotel and I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything....just one problem”
Reviews.Author: sneakypigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for Mother's Day weekend and boy is this a treat. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is above and beyond. However there was one problem...one of their pools is closed and we couldn't get FREE loungers near the pool therefore we couldn't relax on Mother's Day weekend. We had to get in the pool with our kid to watch her. I wish I would have be informed that the pool was closed or maybe they could have given the NON-FREE areas, for free. Please note this is the second time I am posting this review....seems as someone deleted the first one.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays of my career”
Reviews.Author: JimK36
Reviews.Content: My production crew and I were working with clients holding a conference at the InterContinental hotel, just around the corner from the Epic Miami and were all reassigned to the Epic, in an overflow situation with conference attendees. As a group of colleagues that has traveled extensively on business for many years - no one in the group could have been happier! The rooms had great views, the restaurant and bar were very gratifying and the staff was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Miami, for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: deej696
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic for a night before departing on a cruise, and it was in a word, Awesome! We got to the hotel about noon, and had no problem checking in early. We were given a water view room, even though we had booked a city view, which was great. We spent the afternoon at the pool on the 16th floor enjoying sun, drinks, and some lunch. The service at the pool was fantastic, as the attendants were very prompt and helpful in finding us chairs, arranging an umbrella for shade, drink refills, etc. Our room was on the 28th floor, and we had a great view of the Miami River with the Port in the distance. Very clean, spacious bathroom, and of course I slept like a baby. We had room service for a late night snack, and it was quite good also. All in all, its likely we have found our home when we are in Miami, and may even make our visits more frequent!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: kikipearce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two days/nights here in May. This is my 4th or 5th stay at the EPIC as I travel to Miami frequently for work. The prices are great, the rooms are well designed and the service is great. The stylish pool deck (that I actually got to enjoy a bit on this trip) is great fun. The staff out there really took care of my husband while I was at the office - he was in a nice cabana and a great mood when I arrived. The bartender poured me a free frozen mojito to taste and I was hooked, a brilliant drink. Cool and minty, not too sweet at all. My only complaint about the Epic is the room servcie, it is expensive and the menu is really limited. Food is tasty though. Cheap eats are a walk away and for a nice but reasonable dinner - try the Eos restaurant at the Viceroy next door.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but the room service and valet needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: AMB&JAS
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here March 24-26, 2010. It is an elegant hotel with the expected amenities. However its room service needs improvement. One morning it took several phone calls to get my breakfast. Fortunately I had no appointments to get to. But Olga, who served us room service on various occasions, was great and made an unpleasant situation bearable. The valet needs improvement too. Once it took over a half-hour to get our car, for no reason. Other guests arrived at the valet station after us yet they got their cars ahead of us. After we arrived home we received an e-survey from the hotel and in response I included these criticisms. The manager responded offering his apologies but nothing else. I stayed at this hotel because my employer paid the bill and because it was the site of a business meeting. If I ever visit Miami again I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury . . . Yes!! View. . . Exceptional!!”
Reviews.Author: SWD29
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat my wife to a weekend Honeymoon. Just me and her, no kids or childish venues to be thought of, seen or navigated. The Epic hotel was a perfect fit for these expectations. Per my wife, "The time spent away felt like when we were dating without kids to consider." My with and I live in Broward County, which is 30 minutes from Miami. So, i won't mention the airports, shuttle service, etc. However, I can tell you about our arrival greeting to our subsequent departure. Though, if we could afforded it we probably wouldn't leave. On to the review. . . We booked the hotel one week in advance and still obtained a decent rate. I called in advance and confirm that no conventions we scheduled there, which is important if you want some peace, relaxation and no hustle and bustle. Our dates chosen were perfect. Upon check-in we were received by Albert, my Domenican brother from another mother. He took total care of us. Reuben was great too. Up to our room we went but we were put in a room without a view. However, with two rings to the front desk we were moved to room 2701. What an awesome view and space! My wife and I were blown away. Little things we noticed, toilet door lock was loose and door bell face plate fell off. Even so, the ammenities were great. I know I sound picky but this is a review right? At 6pm they have a wine and cheese event on the 16th floor. We enjoyed some fabulous wine and returned to our room to clean up for dinner. The bathroom accomodations are awesome. Just an fyi. . . the shower and tub are great for two adults. . . We did not eat at Area 51 or (31) something like that. Instead we went to EOS, located in the ViceRoy hotel (8 minutes away). We walked there which was cool because it felt like you were in New York. There are alot of restaurants in the area so transportation is not necessary and yes we did feel safe walking around in the area at night. EOS was great. Totally awesome food, portion sizes and food quality. The menu prices are appropriate for the venue and ambience. We would definitely go back. Walking back was a little chillie, so carry a scarf or shaul for the wife. The next day we decided to stay an extra couple of nights. Yes, we liked it that much. I could say more but I think you get the picture. The Epic hotel is a great location for a couple's get away weekend. PS: I forgot to say this. . . If you extend your stay make sure the front desk advises the cleaning people so they do disturb you by accident. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I read was true...”
Reviews.Author: From_Rio
Reviews.Content: I chose the Epic in Miami after reading several reviews in your site. Some said it was the best hotel they had ever stayed in their lives. Quite a statement. Decided to check it out and frankly, test Tripadvisor reviewers as well. The result was extremely satifying. What Kimpton did with the Epic is unique! Great feeling upon arrival, a new format that is very refreshing. The right price and the right attitude towards how they charge. Very correct and appreciated. Above all, however, this hotel offers service. Excellent service. Everyone treated us (and people around us) with the correct measure of familiarity and distance people look for in hotels. People like Gene, Bruno, Jacqueline and others made the difference. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Miami after this experience. I truly hope they keep it up in the future. Congratulations

Reviews.Title: “The Epic gave us a glamorous, boutique hotel experience - bliss”
Reviews.Author: betseybooc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Epic in March on our annual trip to the Sony Ericsson Tennis at Key Biscayne; it was half the price of the Ritz Carlton on Key Biscayne, and twice the fun! The rooms are gorgeous, large, wonderful beds, heavenly huge bathroom with 'window' to the room, fab balcony, lovely helpful staff, proper tea making facilities in room - as requested in advance as, being a Brit, I can't get up without a cup of English Breakfast - stunning pools. The only tiny downside was that, even though we had 3 girls in the room, they kept forgetting to stock up again for 3 and we had to call down every day for more tea/wine glasses/coffee mugs/towels etc. It was fantastic having free computer with internet in the room - absolutely wonderful, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Most awsome pad!”
Reviews.Author: Rob070
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March with a group of us, but would have loved to stay longer as usual! We visit about 4 times a year & alwasys enjoy. A very unique boutique property near pier and excellent location for walk over to Bayside. From check in to check out nothing but friendly service and attitudes with everything (and I mean everything catered for). Everything top notch. This place actually inspired our own furnishings/bathroom back home. Love it and will be returning, actually July I think LOL

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Fabulous Hotel. Would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Epic recently while in town for the Sony Ericsson Hotel tennis tourney in Key Biscayne. The Epic exceeded all our expectations. Quite frankly, this might be the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was wonderfully appointed. The bed (we had a king) was very comfortable with high thread count sheets. The bathroom was huge and probably the biggest of any hotel I have ever stayed. A nice touch were his and hers wash basin's. A lot of nice touches in the room, including a mini PC terminal that allowed us free interest access. The room included a balcony with a nice view of the bay. We tried the pool one day and it was quite nice and was heated. Service at the front desk was attentive and efficient. I would add the restaurant in the hotel, Area 31, was mindblowingly good. If you stay here you are missing something if you don't try this restaurant. They offer some nice outdoor dining. If there is a downside to the Epic is its not particularly well located in terms of walking to anything and is essentially in a business area. It is not difficult to get a cab out front. Was about a 15 minute cab ride to get to South Beach. If you are expecting a hotel in a walking neighborhood this is not your hotel. Nonetheless the amenities of this hotel are second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Schust
Reviews.Content: I've traveled for business for over 30 years and can honestly say I was blown away by this hotel. The room was spacious, clean, very sound proof. The bath ammenities were superb. Loved the in-room computer. After a long day a work, it was a delight to sit out on the balcony and see boats coming down the canal. It was also lovely to dream a bit -- seeing the large yachts that were docked by the hotel each day! The front desk and valet were outstanding! Room service was good too. The only minor complaint was that there was not much of a selection for late night in-room dining. No biggie, but even though I was tired, I opted to eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the Epic to the Loews”
Reviews.Author: Highlander2010
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying 3 nights at the Loews in South Beach, then went on a cruise for a week and stayed 2 nights at the Epic before flying back to the UK. The Epic is better than the Loews and although the bar wasn't open in the lobby, it still beats the Loews beacause it is customer focused. When we arrived at the Epic at 9am our room was ready, how good was that, having just come off the cruise ship! The rooms are nice and spacious, the bathroom is great, lots channels on the the tv for our 15 year old daughter and free internet. The pool area is wonderful with sun loungers, beds, shaded areas and there is no one trying to make a fast buck by getting you a sun lounger by the pool, you walk out choose where you want to sit and the staff immediately come over with towels and iced water, not like the Loews! We were on the 29th floor and had the facilities of the hospitality lounge, which was ideal and Bonaldo is a really helpful guy. There are some quite expensive restaurants nearby, but take a short taxi ride or a 15 minute walk to the Brickell area and you will find reasonably priced restaurants there and the hotel will show you sample menus to help you decide. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Epic and apart from the balcony not being cleaned when we arrived, one phone call and it was immediately cleaned from top to bottom. Highly recommend this hotel and if we come back to Miami, we will definitely stay at the Epic. You don't have to be on South Beach to have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Epic Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Artsguy07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel not sure what to expect. Wow! We were blown away! From the moment we hit the front door, we knew this was no standard Miami resort hotel. The enormous open lobby was bathed in warm neutral tones, and all of the finishes were stone or hard woods. Oh yeah, the huge chandelier was even a natural matrial made of shell. I must also say that the accomodations also blew us away! The bed was, of course, comfortable and the bathroom was huge! There were two vessel sinks, separate spa tub, private toilet and a large walk-in shower with a rain shower head. In our suite, we had two balconys! This hotel is cool, but not too cool for its own good. From the valet parkers to the pool deck waiters everyone we encountered was "five star" gracious and friendly. This is was the best part of the hotel! I plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel - But a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Lena_G33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights just after the Easter Weekend - the Hotel was very stylish and clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The air conditioning was very effective, as was the sound-proofing of the room; there is a rather noisy metal bridge outside the hotel, which we could not hear in our room once the balcony door was closed. We had a view of the water and were on the 28th floor, so maybe that's why it wasn't so noisy. The bed was very comfortable, and bathroom was fantastic, very big, plus I could sit in the bath and look out at the view of the bay and down-town, very cool. Overall really enjoyed our stay here, however, the hotel restaurant was over-priced - we ate lunch and also dinner there once; there are plenty of equally good, but better value for money restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: upstateliving
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Great location and beautifully decorated. The rooms are exquisite with incredible views. The staff was friendly and efficient. We enjoyed a lovely breakfast in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Lost_Weekenders
Reviews.Content: I didn't know hotels could be this great. I didn't know EPIC has residences also, which definitely changed the flavor of the experience. We had a hugely comfortable room with a deck and nice sunrise view. We joined the complimentary wine hour and sauntered poolside even though it was stormy. The staff in the business lounge was attentive and fun (Thanks, B!). The club downstairs kept the drinks coming but we were disappointed there wasn't more dancing. The parking cost was hefty, but an all around good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: Stayed here day and a half (paid 1/2 day rate). Service wasn't good, package was recognized, printer broken in business center, early room service to wrong room. Plus side was the room had it's own computer , fitness center was excellent and the hotel is very clean. Just not up to the standard of advertisement or the price.

Reviews.Title: “Generally very good”
Reviews.Author: whlsarah
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Miami for 6 nights in April 2010- for a relaxing break, some sunshine, shopping and sightseeing. We chose Epic because of it's good reviews and price and in general we were not disappointed. The room was of a good size, the beds were comfortable and our room- city view, got some sun in the early evening, which made it lovely to sit on the balcony at that time. We enjoyed the hotel's facilities- especially the pool- all the staff were very helpful around the pool in setting up the towels and providing water. In fact it was quite breezy round the pool- it is on the 16th floor so they had a knack of making sure your towel did not blow away. Staff were able to make some great recommendations- Balans for breakfast down in Mary Brickell village and Miami Chophouse for bar snacks when we were jet lagged on the first evening. Other reviewers have commented on the location- we enjoyed being able to explore the whole of Miami, and not just SoBe. The only thing that let it down for me was how hard it was to get a good cup of tea! We knew from reviews that there were no facilities in rooms for making tea and coffee, but we also knew that there was tea and coffee available from the lobby in the mornings. On the first day, the only 'black' tea available was earl grey- my husband asked if there was any other tea and they brought out more of the same. On the second day he asked again- this time he was more specific and asked for 'breakfast tea' they went to look but apparently there was none in the whole hotel!! By the third day they had some- hooray! I don't fully function without my morning cuppa, so it was a relief! I find it hard to believe that there was no ordinary tea in the whole hotel- but maybe that is more common in a country full of coffee drinkers. Petty as it sounds the tea thing stopped the experience being amazing- instead it was just very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the price”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Positives in our experience â€“ Good location (right in downtown Miami), great water view from our balcony, chic lobby, clean and large room, comfortable bed, quick valets for parking, good desserts from room service. Negatives in our experience â€“ 1. As a security measure, the hotel requires use of the room key card to access the elevators. Annoyingly, our key cards never worked for our floor in any of the elevators. After punching the buttons for several other floors, we figured out that our room key cards worked for all other floors but ours. We started going to the floor above ours and walking down the stairs for one floor. The key cards worked fine for room access. Other guests on the elevator also tried to help us with their key cards but could not get access to our floor. On one occasion, one of the hotel employees was on our elevator and he also could not get access to our floor with his key card. He suggested we go to the front desk and get our cards reprogrammed, which we did not try. We figured the problem was not with our key cards since none of the other cards (including the employeeâ€™s) worked either. Perhaps we could have got the problem fixed if we had talked to the front desk during our stay, but we did not try. 2. The hotel tries to be environmentally friendly with their towel/linen reuse policies. We did not realize that this meant we would not get new towels every day, even if we needed them. During our stay we hiked in the Everglades, used the gym and the Florida heat required frequent showers. In spite of our efforts to be conservative, we ended up using up the towels provided for the day (1 bath towel, 1 hand towel and 1 washcloth per person) and put them down on the floor for new towels. However our towel replacements got progressively fewer over the 3 days of our stay. On the last of the 3 days, we only had 2 hand towels and 2 washcloths (no replacement bath towels). One of us used the spare bath towel (from the bathroom closet, which we didn't have to use in the first two days) and the other had to use a hand towel for a bath. Again, we did not complain and ask the front desk for more towels. 3. We did not have any breakfast options except for room service. There are no cafes or coffee-shops in or close to the hotel. Similarly, there is only one expensive dining option in the hotel (Area 31). While we were happy to have all our lunches and dinners outside the hotel, we missed having a quick breakfast corner or coffee-shop in or close to the hotel. The inconveniences we experienced were relatively minor in the big picture of the overall experience. We probably could have got the first two negatives fixed; however we were staying at the hotel for a leisurely vacation and were in no mood to complain. An important part of the experience of staying in a luxury hotel is not having to complain/ask for things to be fixed. We decided to give a 3/5 overall rating because our overall experience, while not majorly disappointing, was certainly not worthy of the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good that could be great”
Reviews.Author: Croff1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise and booked our rooms (King deluxe, water view) using a corporate rate, which ended up being about 1/2 the regular rate. (If we had paid the full rate we would have been disappointed, thus the three star review). The hotel overlooks a canal/bridge and, even though we were on the 20th floor, there was a lot of noise from the traffic, so we had to sleep with our veranda door closed. The room itself was stunning - very modern. Loved the complimentary internet. Beds are comfy and the room is well appointed. We loved the cool towel that is offered to you on arrival, but weren't sure what do do with it once it had served its purpose. Check-in was fine, but the card key we were given didn't work in the door, so the bellman had to let us in with his pass key and go get us new keys. Lunch by the pool was lovely, albeit pricey. $48 for a pitcher of mojitos. Overall this hotel is not for the budget conscious. Service was spotty. Check in was good (except for the card key glitch). Service by the pool was good too. Drinks in the restaurant were good but the service was slow and the server forgot 3 of the 6 drinks we ordered. We called the front desk for a bellman the following morning, waited 15 minutes and called again. Waited another 10 minutes and decided to take our bags down ourselves. Ran into the bellman as we were getting off the elevator in the lobby on his way up to us. While the price we paid was excellent, we probably would look elsewhere in Miami in the future. [As a side note: the friends we were traveling with stayed an additional night prior to our arrival and had dinner in the restaurant and said it was one of the worst meals they ever had and caught an overcharge of $85 on their bill.]

Reviews.Title: “Great Balconies”
Reviews.Author: sikiwong
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel with it's pool and balcony is each room. The hotel is in the business district of Miami, so you would not expect any beach to be in walking distance. We rented a car and we travel around city with the car and we had no problem at all. The hotel concierge recommended an italian restaurant nearby and it was just so-so, i'm sure you'll be able to find something better near the beach or in the islands. Each room has a monitor for free internet, it's a great idea and we all loved it! Overall we had a great time, just two other parties in the family experienced something scary at the last night of our stay, which I had no feeling at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: rolfv
Reviews.Content: Just a good hotel. Service at front desk was quick and friendly. Pool is on 16th floor and due to wind we couldn't enjoy it at much as we liked. But pool is beautiful and staff is very friendly. We only had breakfast but that was good too. Location is walking distance away from bayside market place. Besides that not a fancy neighboorhoud, lots of office and appartment buildings. 5-10 min cab ride from ocean drive. Epic is in a high rise building. Rooms are spacious and beautiful large bathroom with big shower and bathtube. And a computer on your room with free internet!!!! I liked that very much and was very helpful when we had to find alternatives due to the weather..

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: slappy1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Epic for a recent conference in Miami. A/C didn't work, and the plumbing sprung a leak so we had to move rooms. Staff had a severe attitude and was less than helpful. But most of all, one of the staff went through my wallet which I left in my room and made copies of all my credit and debit cards. What a nightmare to cancel all the accounts and put them on fraud watch, but not before they charged 4 times at the local Winn Dixie. I'm filing a police report and hope they catch the people involved. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Epic was amazing from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: pacman_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in quite a few 5 star hotels, but the Epic exceeded all expectations. We were both amazed from the moment we entered the property. Everything about the hotel was flawless, the views, the food, the rooms, the service. Kimpton has a winner here. If you are in Miami, this is a DO NOT miss hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Can't Be Beat!”
Reviews.Author: FiFiFranklin
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by the Epic Hotel in Miami. The lobby was ultra modern, our King Room was large and spotlessly clean, and the staff was so friendly and knowledgeable. Also, the pool area was just fantastic. Unfortunately we were only in town for a night, but we would definitely go back in a heartbeat. We had dinner out on the terrace by the pool and it was so relaxing. It was a beautiful night and the pool was all lit up and candles were on the tables. The next day at the pool we lounged in very comfortable chairs and the staff brought us white wine to enjoy. The entire staff is wonderful, but two people that really stood out were Seth at check in and Douglas by the pool. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: fuji680
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami mid January on a photo shoot . I have stayed at many fine hotels throughout the country, "The Epic" ranks as one of my best experiences. My clients and colleagues simply cannot say enough about this hotel! The views of the intercoastal are great, the staff was very attentive, the rooms spacious and well appointed. We all preferred the downtown location to the beach area, for business it was quieter, yet conveniently located. My hats off to the management for meeting our requests and exceeding our expectations. Because of our stay we are looking at the Kimpton properties in Dallas for our next shoot. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding downtown property with excellent staff for business stay”
Reviews.Author: fuji680
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami mid January on a photo shoot . I have stayed at many fine hotels throughout the country, "The Epic" ranks as one of my best experiences. My clients and colleagues simply cannot say enough about this hotel! The views of the intercoastal are great, the staff was very attentive, the rooms spacious and well appointed. We all preferred the downtown location to the beach area, for business it was quieter, yet conveniently located. My hats off to the management for meeting our requests and exceeding our expectations. Because of our stay we are looking at the Kimpton properties in Dallas for our next shoot. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weather not great - Experience Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: smithbenz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Epic in Miami and it was truly an exceptional stay. The pool was the star and so were the employees that ran the area. They treated us very well with service and kindness. My kids 15 and 18 liked the area and hotel much better than the South Beach hotel we stayed at last year. We could walk to restaurants and shopping from the hotel and we went shopping at The Sawgrass Mills Outlet Mall. Thanks for a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Good in many ways, but not great overall.”
Reviews.Author: departingNWK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked our stay for 5 nights at the Epic because of its status as the #1 hotel in Miami on Tripadvisor, and because we were able to find a pretty good flight+room deal online. We didn't realize that we'd be so far from any beach when we booked--if you look at the Epic's website, it deceptively shows pictures of beaches and the South Beach area, when in fact the Epic is a $25 cab ride from South Beach or any of Miami's other nice neighborhoods (Coconut Grove, Coral Gables). The Epic is in downtown Miami, and there's not a lot to do nearby. There is the Bayside Marketplace, but this is pretty much a tourist trap with limited shopping (national chain stores mixed with junky souvenir shops) and food options, and pricy bus or boat tours. One of my main disappointments with the Epic's concierge and front desk staff is that they seemed to have limited knowledge of the options available in the Downtown area. For instance, we asked one evening about good, reasonably priced restaurants in the area for dinner. The concierge told us that "pretty much everything closes at 6pm downtown", except for fast food, expensive restaurants and the Marketplace. However, we ventured onto the mainly deserted streets one night and found a half dozen nice, inviting, reasonably priced places in the area (Ecco Pizzateca is an example). Why isn't the concierge desk on top of this? Granted, this hotel may cater mostly to rich business travellers with expense accounts who don't think twice about dropping $500/meal, but the concierge should be prepared to assist a spectrum of guests with different requests. On another occasion, I called the concierge desk but got no answer, so I called the front desk. I asked the agent who answered if she could suggest any gay nightlife spots on a weeknight. She giggled and stammered that "I don't have any idea about that" and she said she'd have a concierge call us back. After a couple of hours, we didn't receive a personal call from the concierge; instead a list was slipped under our door. This was effective (if tardy), but it lacked the personal touch of the expected phone call. Another example of a lack of sensitivity when dealing with gay/lesbian customers came upon our check-in. We were informed by the front desk agent that we'd been offered a water view upgrade, but she then said there must be a mistake because there was only one king bed in the room. Rather than telling us the room description and allowing us to correct her if this wasn't what she wanted, she assumed that it was a "mistake". Generally, the staff was friendly without being aggressive; they were there to help if you needed them. However, we had some problems with botched room service orders, including missing items. We were also a bit peeved to find out that a large gratuity was already added to the room service charge; although the people who delivered the food tried to resist taking a tip, they still took it when we insisted, and without mentioning that the tip was included. For us, the treat/splurge of our vacation was staying in a five-star hotel, so we were trying to spend within reason in other areas. If you rent a car, the Epic will charge you $35/day to park, and for us this was out of the question. If you want to see a lot of different parts of Miami, the Gray Line tour bus is a decent option; tickets can be purchased at Bayside Marketplace for $20/day. If you are only interested in going back and forth to South Beach, you can catch a $2 public transit bus, the S or the C--it's fast, convenient and reasonably safe. A word about Area 31: the food was only so-so and the portions were tiny. But the worst part of our dining experience was when our server lied to us and told us only the prix fixe menu was available because it was Valentine's Day. Having just gotten to the hotel from the airport, we weren't interested in a four-course menu with wines at $155/person. When we pointed out to this server that an a la carte menu was delivered to our table that said "Happy Valentine's Day", our server reluctantly admitted that a limited a la carte menu was available, but she said "these aren't our best dishes". When we decided to share an appetizer and order two main courses and no drinks, she became brusk and unfriendly. Only later when we ordered desserts and a bottle of wine did she decide to be attentive and friendly again. If we wanted crappy, NYC-style service with attitude, we could've stayed home. All our other experiences with waitstaff at other Miami restaurants were satisfactory to fantastic--our only bad experience was at Area 31. I feel as if I've concentrated only on the negatives, so let me address some positives. The views of the bay are beautiful, and they afford you a view of the Epic's pools below. The pools are every bit as beautiful as they appear on the Epic's website. If the weather had been warmer, I'm sure I would've spent lots of time poolside. The gym is small, but has top-notch equipment in a pleasant setting. Our room was very spacious,although the decor was fairly bland/safe modern. The beds and the bed linens are heavenly and luxurious. The room service breakfast, while overpriced, is absolutely delicious. The complimentary wine hour is a wonderful, unique touch. The housekeeping staff did a great job with turn-down service; even though we spent a lot of time in the room, we were never disturbed and upon our return, the room was always perfectly tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missdai
Reviews.Content: I would stay again if the price is affordable. This is a fabulous hotel, but it is not on the beach, but it is on a "bay." Great service. Restaurant was expensive and location is so-so, so make sure you get a car. Great if you don't want to be too much in the mix of south beach, but just 5-10 min from it.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding downtown property with excellent staff, but disappointing food service”
Reviews.Author: DaveMechanicsburg_PA
Reviews.Content: After staying at another property for a business meeting, my wife and I spent three days and two nights at the Epic because it was ranked #1 by Tripadvisor. The property is first class, and the hotel staff offers superb attention and service. It was obvious to me that the restaurant and bar are operated by an outside concession. The food quality is good but not great, and the restaurant service is relatively inattentive and unskilled, especially in comparison to the superb manner in which the Epic is otherwise managed. The property is a short walk from the Bayside specialty retail area and many other downtown attractions, as well as a short taxi ride to almost everywhere else; so the disappointing food service can be avoided. The mattress was softer than I prefer or expected, but it was not such a problem that I complained or lost sleep. The exercise room offers a variety and reasonable quantity of cardio and weight training equipment, but it felt crowded in the AM. The two pools are beautiful with exceptional service and skyline views; and even though I am a beach lover, they are more comfortable than a beach. Although the Epic is expensive, it is an outstanding property and I have no regrets about staying there. I do hope that the food concession is either changed or forced to improve their standards to better match the overall quality of product and service that I otherwise found at the Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mrperryjr
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended place to stay, comfortable beds, great restaurants, great nightlife on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let-down”
Reviews.Author: Abswim79
Reviews.Content: Epic promised but didn't quite deliver. My husband and I stayed at the Epic for a conference in February and came to Miami earlier that weekend to spend some quality time together before heading back to the cold Northeast. We stayed at The Setai on Miami Beach a few nights before but then moved to the Epic on Sunday afternoon for the conference--making the difference between the two hotels all the more stark--and the Epic turned into a disappointment. We arrived late in the afternoon on Sunday as a few other conference attendees were checking in and pulled up in a traditional Miami Yellow Cab (no need for a car in SoBe). When we got there, the bellhops simply stared at the car pulling into the carpark, looking bored with their lot in life and not making any gesture to come and help us. After struggling with our bags, one bellman finally came over to stand lackadaisically by as my husband pulled our bags from the trunk. He didn't even offer to take the coat or backpack that I had slung over my shoulder. He grunted at us to go into the lobby and followed us in. Later in the trip (after getting bumped from my flight home), I returned to the hotel from the airport and had the exact same experience--the driver had to help me get my stuff out of the car--the bellmen (numerous at this point) stood around looking lost. We checked in with the girl at the front desk who, after telling us that there were no rooms with a single bed left, continued the "bored with my life" vibe and waved us away towards the elevators and up to our room. The room was small and standard with a computer and television and two double beds. To make matters worse, we landed in a handicapped room--with no real way out since the front desk woman was SOOO helpful earlier (at least at this point). We were right off the elevator bay (which mind you, dings all the time, though you couldn't hear it through the door when you were in the room). After getting settled we went and checked out the 16th floor reception (wine for free) as well as the hotel amenities including their restaurant, the new Exhale Spa that just opened, and the pool area. The restaurant seemed to be a pretty typical hotel restaurant--and we glanced at the menu but decided to pass on dinner that night (we were pretty tired and the food didn't look all that appetizing.) Later in the trip we had lunch at Area 31â€”which was ok-typical hotel restaurant fare and prices. I had the Mahi sandwich and substituted the fries for a salad which they were happy to do. The pool area seemed fairly neat but the weather was cold and rainy so there wasn't any opportunity to use it. The pool is raised and there are cabanas around the edges that look like they could be pretty nice, though I am not sure why you would stay here when you could hop across the bridge and get a place on the beach for the same cost. I wanted to check with Exhale to see if they would honor my NY membership (which having traveled to many places that have Exhale outside of NYC, I know they do) but the guy behind the desk had no idea and told me that I would have to pay to take one of the Core classes. I was too tired to argue so I decided to just leave it. My husband and I then returned to our room to relax and I decided to go an track down some ice, only to find that the ice machine on our floor didn't work. I called the front desk to let them know that the ice maker was broken, but didn't get a call back to let me know that it was fixed and the woman on the line didn't even offer to have some ice brought up Since your key gets you to your floor but not others, you can't exactly use it to go to another floor to rustle up some ice so I basically resorted to stalking another guest to another floor with a working ice maker. When I got back I noticed a message light on the phone--and my husband went to retrieve it--only to find that there was some mix up with which room we were actually in and we couldn't actually get the message because according to the computer we were in one room, when in reality we were in another. This wouldn't have been such an issue if we hadn't decided to get room service later that night. (Side note--room service was good--food was pretty decent and sizable). The guy delivering our food ended up standing outside the wrong room knocking for about 10 minutes before the front desk called us to let us know that our room service was ready (but that it was being delivered down the hall). We got it straightened out eventually but it was kind of a disaster. Finally, my husband printed out a boarding pass from the in-room computer--and it simply never showed up--no one brought it up to slide it under our door, and no one called to let us know it had been printed. I wonder if you ever had something really important printed, if it would actually make it to your door. On our second night we were finally moved to a room across the hall (same dinging elevator all night long) but MUCH nicer. This had a bay view and a much larger bathroom and king size bed. If we had been in that room originally my impression of the hotel would have been slightly better. The balcony overlooked the Intercoastal heading out towards the bay and there was a pass through between the bathroom tub and the bedroom which was a neat design element. Again I made an ice run, but was foiled by the same broken ice maker. This time however, I ran into one of the hotel employees in the hallway who saw me standing with my broken (the handle was broken) ice bucket by the elevator. She told me to stay in my room and that she would have someone bring ice up. She was very nice. A few minutes later she re-appeared with a cooler full of ice which she used to fill up my bucket. About 2 seconds later a second employee came with a full bucket of ice as well. The cleaning people and the service folks were great. One other nice thingâ€”the hairdryers that they provide are FANTASTIC. They are ceramic ion hairdryers that do a great, quick and quiet job on your hair without burning it like most hotel dryers do. We also had a lot of trouble with the air conditioners in the two rooms. Both rooms were stuffy and hot and you had to turn the AC down to 65 to get the room to cool down to about 70. Overall however, The Epic leaves you with the distinct impression that its kind of trying but its almost too much of an effort to make it that extra mile. I probably wouldnâ€™t recommend this to someone looking for a good place in Miami as there are others that simply blow it out of the water.

Reviews.Title: “EPIC DISASTER.”
Reviews.Author: invest64
Reviews.Content: Within a half mile of this overrated, and overpriced hotel, are such staples in luxury hospitality as the Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, and Viceroy. For the price that you pay at the Epic, you might as well stay at the Hyatt Downtown across the street. The hotel touts itself beyond its actual deliverance of service. First off, upon arrival, there was an army of valet attendants and bellboys, all of whom seemed less than pleased that they were being paid to stand around and assist guests to the check -in counter, where two clueless girls behind the front desk couldn't offer suggestions to local restaurants. Additionally, they were getting argumentative with a family whose room keys were not working. Room Service arrived forty-five minutes after ordering. It was cold and the order wasn't accurate. I called to have it picked up, because I refused to pay for it. But I might as well have had eaten that cold cheeseburger than go down to Area 31, where the service was terrible start to finish, the food came cold and a smaller portion than what I was expecting, especially considering the price, and there was not a manager to be seen to complain to. No one ever came to check in on how I WASN'T enjoying my meal. The stay didn't get better from there. It seemed as though the hotel was running on a skeleton crew, with the exception of valet, and that no one was in charge of the staff who barely seemed competent in their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: channydwb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for one night following our 8 day eastern Carribean cruise. I wish we had more time (well maybe if it was warm in Florida, brrr!) I have to mention Oscar and Seth, they were fantastic! Superior customer service. In short, we were very early to check in but a room was made ready for us before 11am. The room was gorgeous with the most incredible view and it was very comfortable. The rooftop pools were warm and inviting and the views were stunning. When we arrived back from dinner we had received turn down service. We had drinks at Area 31 and the River Lounge and the service was excellent and atmosphere was very nice. Ordered room service for breakfast and it was great too. Very large portions however! We really enjoyed our stay and can not wait to return in the future. FYI, a taxi is approximately $25 to South Beach but it was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: PartyBoyMarty
Reviews.Content: The Pool area = Great The Resaurant Food and service = Amazing The Room = Fantastic Service = Top Notch Staff = Friendly I stayed here for a few days on my honeymoon -and was sad to leave it to continue on the rest of our holiday. My only Gripe about this hotel was there is no Gym (although they were renovating an area near the pool when we were there that may of been made into a Gym since?).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: Pakk
Reviews.Content: Me, my girlfriend and her parents stayed at the Epic recently. After a long flight from Europe it was very nice to step into the relaxed atmosphere of the lobby. I asked for a high floor and was informed by a very nice man that I had received a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite at the 27th floor. Happy for this we went checking out the room; it had a large flatscreen tv, great views over both water and skyline. We also got a jacuzzi, minibar, stationary computer, free wireless internet and the best bed i've ever slept in. The parents 'only' got a regular room which also was great, and with a even better view than ours. Besides from the great rooms, the pool deck at the 16th floor is pretty amazing both pool and view-wize. This is also where the complimentary wine hour between 5 and 6 p.m. was located during our stay. As I mentioned staff at reception and at the hotel in general were very nice and helpful without being 'in your face'. The cleaners forgot to replenish toiletries a few times though. We had dinner at the Area 31 restaurant one night, and it was allright, even though I expected a little more. Same for breakfast, totally OK food, but not much more than that. If you want to eat out or shop there is walking distance to Bayside Marketplace where you'll find Hooters, Hardrock CafÃ©, Bubba gumps and a few other places. Closer to the hotel there is a Starbucks, Subway, Quisnoz and a few high end restaurants. There's also a cvs where you can buy groceries. As other reviews mentions, the hotel is a little badly situated if you're a tourist. But it is a pretty convenient 10- 15 minute, 25 dollar cab ride to South Beach. The Epic is definitely one of the best hotels i've ever stayed at, and I hope I will be able to stay there again. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Swank.”
Reviews.Author: Jennfer
Reviews.Content: I missed this hotel immediately upon exit!! My friends and I were on the club level for one night. The pampering they provide at this hotel is beyond anything I have ever experienced. We were first greeted by Bonato in the concierge area. He was the nicest, sweetest person and so happy to help you. Big smiles when he serves, being creative with what he gives you, finding drinks that you don't ask for but love anyway. He led you to believe (maybe good acting) that he really was happy to be there and happy to serve you and make your trip fun. Seriously, we were all laughing b/c I said I would take him home and let him live with me for free, if he treated me like this every day. He made our experience so much nicer than we ever expected it to be. The others (Bruno and Vanessa (?)) were super nice too; she put us on the club lists around town for the night scene. It was fun to see all of the swanky bars she suggested. Thank you! We also had fun with the fun table in the club. It's like a giant iPad computer table (photo below). We played checkers, music, looked at the maps you could pull up. I want one! The room overlooking the ocean and pools was perfect. Great city views, pool view, and nice view of the $150 million yacht too. The beds were comfy, the bathroom shower was so nice, and the interior design was sleek and relaxing. The pools and pool service was swanky too. The furniture was super comfy and made the atmosphere even better. Then, the pool service. Towels on chairs w/pillows provided without even asking. Water being served w/out asking. Then, being offered Ebooks, Wii, suntan lotion, and all other sides was so nice. I didn't take advantage of all, but it was nice to know that if I really wanted to lay there all day, I had people there to make it happen so I wouldn't have to be interrupted by needs. Even the bathroom by the pool was super clean and didn't represent the standard creepy pool bathrooms that we all try to avoid. In short, the service, swanky appearance, hospitality, pools, awesome room... and everything else had me beefing up my retirement savings after this trip. I realized that I need to stop working sooner so I can start going to places like this more often. I loved it!! I am, however, still trying to figure out how I can get a Bonato in my home to be smiling with service every day!! He's the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff, Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: OSTexo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Epic when I was on business in Miami the 19th - 23rd of January. I'll start with the positive points first: 1. Exceptional staff - From the front desk staff to the waitstaff at the restaurant, everyone was very professional, neatly dressed and interested in how our stay was and if anything could be done to make it more comfortable. - A+ 2. Cleanliness - The staff did a great job preparing our room, and also did a very thorough cleaning especially on Thursday, we could practically eat off the floors - A+ 3. Room Quality - Tops all around from layout to quality of linens and toiletries. - A+ 4. Convenience - Very convenient to get to places downtown and a short hop away from Miami Beach minus the congestion over there, close and direct to the airport. - A+ Now the negatives: 1. Construction - I was awakened every workday to what sounded like an angle grinder being used above our room. This is not the nicest noise to wake up to and got annoying as the stay progressed.
