I was surprised this fact was not mentioned when the room was being booked as I did so directly through Kimpton. No mention of this was made upon check in, or by anyone at the front desk. When ordering room service I asked the waiter if there was construction in the hotel (since I wasn't fully convinced that I was correctly interpreting the noise I was hearing) and he replied that there was. On checkout I mentioned the construction issue, which was met with a shoulder shrug and a nothing we can do about it comment, which I can understand, but I would have preferred to know this ahead of time at booking. So, for lack of disclosure - F 2. Room service - No problem with staff or promptness, but food quality and value is severely lacking. The only time I got sick was on a turkey wrap that arrived warm, my hunger got the better of me and I paid for it. Insane prices on food, literally halving prices would bring it in line with reality. - C 3. Smells in Hallway - It smelled like Fido lost it in the hallway and it soaked into the carpet before the urine could be extracted. If you are going to be a pet friendly facility rip up the carpet and seal and polish the concrete in the pet rooms. - D 4. Minor Nitpicking - Certain services in the hotel were still being constructed so unavailable, I was not there for pleasure and there is plenty to do otherwise I would have been upset over not having access to all the services stated on the hotel site. We were shooed out of the pool area early (very nicely) so an adjacent area could be setup for a wedding reception, which wasn't too big a deal for me, but did upset the wife a little and rightly so if you come from a cold and cloudy city and want to soak up some rays. - C Overall, an above average experience, but just enough wrong to make me look at alternatives when traveling to Miami. Open and honest communication before the stay would have been great, everything else could have been rectified and are somewhat expected when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerIllinois66
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami the end of January on Business. My University housed many of us at the Epic hotel across from the James L. Knight Center. I simply CANNOT say enough about this hotel! It is simply beautiful, and the views of the intercoastal are breathtaking. The staff was wonderful and the rooms exceptional. We didn't want to leave. Each room is equipped with a desktop computer, marble and granite, flatscreen TVs and balconies with amazing views. The pool is amazing and the restaurant top notch. I would highly recommend this as a "must stay" for anyone traveling to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Epic by name - Epic by nature”
Reviews.Author: SANDAWED
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Epic for 5 nights in early November - we arrived from Mexico on route to Ireland. We have done a lot of travel and we were uber impressed by the standards in the Epic. From the moment we set foot in the door to the day that we left we were blown away by the attention to detail by all staff and in particular Gene. He could not have been more helpful and attended to any need that we had. From the restaurants he reserved for us on a nightly basis, to making recommendations for what to do on a dialy basis to finding us tickets to a Miami Heat game at the last second, he was amazing. Not alone this, he was friendly and down to earth in a professional manner and posessed an unassuming confidence that put us at our ease immediately. Our room was immaculate every time we set foot in it, the area on the Premier Lounge was a den of luxury, the view of the city from the balcony was spectular while the view from our room was amazing. Our stay at the Epic was more than we could have hoped for, it was the perfect end to a special holiday for us. We will return to the Epic very soon & hope to see Gene & all the staff again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: tracers73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic for one night for a quick visit to Miami, after previously staying in the summer for business. This hotel is simply fantastic. Everything about the hotel is beautiful - the lobby, the rooms, the view. Front desk staff was fantastic on this visit in November, noting my membership in the Kimpton InTouch program and upgrading me to a water view room at no charge. The rooms are amazingly comfortable, with plenty of room to stretch out in. Bathrooms are absolutely gorgeous - both stall shower and soaking tub, plus double sinks. Flat screen tvs, personal computers in the room, so no need to drag your laptop with you. View of the Miami River, Biscayne Bay and beyond if you are in the right location. The pool area is gorgeous, up on the 16th floor I believe, with plenty of seating. The location of the hotel is perfect for visiting the downtown area. Nightclub that is situated off the lobby is fantastic as well. The only thing I will caution about the hotel is that both times I stayed here, I had a billing issue related to the mini-bar. Hotel was quick to remedy both times, but I just caution everyone to review your bill at checkout, as well as the final charge on your credit card because that is where I noticed it. Otherwise - this is a fantastic property and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pavacati0ner
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough about this hotel. It's beautiful, clean & the pool is great. My room was fantastic. It was a big, clean room and the maid service was great. They made up the room in the am and then came back in the pm (turn down service). So when I walked in my room around 5pm, relaxing music was playing and the decorative pillows were taken off the bed. Nice touch! The staff was friendly, helpful and seemed sincerely interested in ensuring you were taken care of. And the pool staff was FANTASTIC. They take good care of you at the pool - setting up your chair, bringing drinks...etc.. Honestly, I was very impressed. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL STAY IN 2009....PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: GeckoinDC
Reviews.Content: Saw EPIC on the Top 25 list which jogged my memory that I hadn't sent a review for my stay! (Shame on me!!!!) So, better late than never as they say... Traveled to Miami on two week long business trip with multiple others from my office. (Our team basically spent half of 2009 on the road so we saw a lot of hotels last year.) Hotel had just recently opened and as a loyal Kimpton supporter, I instantly jumped on the opportunity to stay here. After showing others phoos from the hotel during the first day of work, rest of team checked out of where they were staying and moved to the EPIC. From check-in to departure the EPIC Hotel lived up to its name and Kimpton's stringent standards. Rooms were incredible with views of bay even from sitting in the tub at night if you wanted to do that. Sat out on the balcony many evenings after dinner just to enjoy the view and relax. Stylish and comfortable all at the same time with impeccable service from the staff Fitness Center was outstanding! Spent many mornings watching the sun rise while on the cardio equipment facing the bay. If that's not enough to motivate you to workout a bit harder, I don't know what will. Area 31, the EPIC's restaurant, set a high bar for others to try to reach. Sampled just about everything on the breakfast menu and all rated as FANTASTIC. Had several dinners there also and each was outstanding in all aspects. Pool area, while I didn't always make it back from work before the sun went down, was impeccable with fast courteous service on the days I actually got out there while the sun was still up. The hotel's nightclub area had not yet opened when I was there but got a sneak peak near end of stay when they were testing sound equipment...looked like it was going to continue the level of plush excellence I had already experienced at the EPIC. Lesli Vohwinkel and the rest of the staff provided exemplary service to our group and we can't wait to go back to Miami again....we'll be staying at the EPIC!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel but location not great for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Bobby89
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were really lovely- spacious, clean and comfortable, with amazing bathrooms. The pools are warm and have a great view, and the Area 31 restaurant was good. The free internet access and PCs were a great touch. As with any hotel of this size, things do feel somewhat anonymous and business-like, and we couldn't believe that they didn't supply free tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. They offer them for about 3 hours a day in the lobby, but who's going to head downstairs in their dressing gowns to make a brew?! Miami beach, which most tourists go to visit, is quite far away- probably a 20 minute drive, and we'd stay there if we visited again for pleasure, but this is a great hotel for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff were suberb and made us feel like family”
Reviews.Author: Goldsboro
Reviews.Content: Even though we were rescheduled due to the hotel closing for two weeks, staff made our transition to their hotel from a South Beach hotel seamless. Everything was superb: from the biscuits they provided our pet to the sincere friendliness of the staff. The area 31 restaurant food was excellent with personal attention from the staff. Will be going back in February

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: kicking_roks
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Customer service was excellent. I was here on business.The staff was the best. The physical decor of the building is modern and well kept. The bathrooms are really spacious, two sinks, a wide tub and glass enclosed shower.I took my laptop for work but to my suprise they had a PC set up with free service in my room.Its a 10 min cab ride to SOBE at about 21 dollars one way.I would suggest you stay closer if your going for the party scene on SOBE. Although Im sure there is lots to do in Downtown Miami as well.It's a short walk thru the park to Bayside Mall with good drinks and food. Hooters,Fat Tuesdays, and Chilli's. The Port of Miami is less than 5 mins away. The Arena and Convention Center are both within walkin distance. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debmich1323
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night as a romantic getaway. This was quite possible one of the nicest hotels that we have ever stayed in! We have stayed at the Kimpton in NYC, which was also a nice hotel, but we were never expecting such a high-end property. The check-in went very smoothly and the bellhop who brought up our bags was extra-friendly. The design of the room and the overall hotel is breathtaking, especially the bathrooms. We were in a waterview room on the 20th floor with a crazy view of the bay. Great balcony. The pool area is gorgeous, good service from the staff. Unfortunately there was a cold snap when we were there and we couldn't fully enjoy the pool (the pool is heated but not the air!) Unfortunately there are a few hiccups with the service. We had ordered a poolside couple's massage a few days prior via the hotel's concierge. 1 hour after checking in we were told that the hotel couldn't locate any to actually do the massages - ??! Also, we called down for a corkscrew and had to wait over 1 hour, after many phone calls to the desk. And then 2 showed up within 5 minutes..... But all in all, this is a fantastic hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Subpar Service”
Reviews.Author: skik2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel structure itself is great. The rooms are spacious with nice amenities, the finishes are nice, the views great, etc etc etc. My problem was in the service. Everybody was friendly but nobody was too helpful or efficient. We never received 2 champagne glasses that we requested (even after calling twice), the bellmen didn't know where the metro mover station was, the maids did random things and the service @ Area 31 was pretty bad. We had to wait around 40 minutes both times we ate there and we were one of only a few tables at the time. An example is me having asked for the aioli on the side and the guy bringing it when I had about 2 bites left on the sandwich. Or him asking us if we wanted some bread because the entree was taking so long but never actually bringing the bread. One other gripe I have, and I probably took away a star for this alone, is that the bartender made us one of the worst mojitos I had ever had. A $15 mojito in a 4 star hotel in Miami, FL should have an awesome mojito. This certainly wasn't the case. Anyway, the hotel itself is awesome. The service is not up to par hence the "Average" rating. I might be unfair with the "Average" but if you're going to charge $300/night you should have good service.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Epic”
Reviews.Author: mrs-skillbillie
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel .Service is excellent , rooms are clean and new. The views and the pool are are fantastic ! Luisa and Cesso are excellent servers . The restaurant has fantastic food. Overall I would say this place is truly Epic. Can't wait to go back !!!!

Reviews.Title: “EPIC Hotel - terrific staff/ beautiful property!!”
Reviews.Author: DMacki
Reviews.Content: I know that Kimpton hotels pride themselves on their staff but this Kimpton was AMAZING! Such friendly helpful and welcoming people at the front desk/ concierge/ restaurant / front door and Housekeeping. Little touches like the front door staff making sure you have a mini water bottle tucked under your arm when you are heading out on a morning adventure.. the restaurant staff and their good humour making the day start with just enough coffee and the front desk chipping in movie ideas. Nice people made our stay memorable... ..of course having a unexpected upgrade to a mind blowing junior suite with a aluxiourious tub didn't hurt at all. Too bad we didn't get to spend much time around the pool- too busy zipping around the city and Miami beach. The pool area and bar is really something - skyscra[per and peek a boo bay views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Frstdlmncwrd
Reviews.Content: My stay at the EPIC was, without a doubt, the best hotel experience I've had yet. The valet parking staff opened the doors for me and the rest of my family with a smile and a welcome upon our return every time we left. We were greeted by an employee I believe his name was Andy... I can't seem to jog my memory now but he explained every detail from room key function to events of the day. The pools were jaw-dropping and extremely clean, as soon as we put our things down we were offered fresh towels on the poolside lounge chairs and water with lemon slices. The kids played with the wii they had available right next to the pool after they finished with the water noodles also offered by the staff. The lobby was always impeccable (the whole hotel was) and filled with tasteful music. The elevator was always on time, they had six so there was always one close to your floor. The gym was equipped with the latest machines and what seemed to be a pilates or aerobics room complete with mats and an iPod docking station. The view from our room was simply stunning, the only complaint there, is the few hours the construction crew was sounding drills on another building (EPIC staff previously appologized for this). To wrap this very long review up, we lost one of our room keys before checkout. After turning over the whole room we gave up and expected a fee for this. When we informed the concierge she shrugged it off and kindly told us not to worry, it happened all the time, and there was no fee. I took time to write out most of my experience because people deserve to know that the EPIC is the definition of luxury. I live in Miami and plan to go back in February to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday. Thank you for the experience!! -Maria

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was unbelievable - we loved it and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: HomeNette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, I just can't say enough nice things about this hotel. We wanted to come back every year for our anniversary, but it looks like we will be returning sooner.

Reviews.Title: “I do not like the valet assistance attitude”
Reviews.Author: dfajardo
Reviews.Content: I arrived in this hotel and there was a girl named Belen Mejia who approached me first. While my partner was fixing our luggage, i noticed that this girl starring at me with a bad attitude looks. I was wondering what was her problem for her to look at me like that. But as a professional, I did not say anyhting at all. When I started to talk to her, the way she answered me was inappropriate manner. I felt like she disrespect me in front of my partner. My partner wants to tell the front manager but I told him not to. But i realized that we should've done that. I had been customer in this hotel and I never had bad any experience not until this last visit. Everything was still ok and good in terms of the cleanliness and other services except from that girl. Hope the officers in this hotel would be aware from their worker's attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Virginia, there is great, friendly service in a Miami hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ButImRight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic for 8 nights over Thanksgiving and could not have been happier with our choice. I grew up in Miami and go back every year to visit. Hospitality service can be down right indifferent, if not surly in Miami hotels and restaurants. I am used to that, even at expensive, top rated places. So, we were continually thrilled with the friendliness and service we received throughout the hotel: the car attendants, front desk, general and housekeeping staff and particularly the restaurant. By the way, the breakfast is nice, lunch delicious and dinner at Area 31 wonderful. Some of the best prepared fish I have had in years. Look for the private dining rooms overlooking the Miami River. Also, the River Bar in the lobby is right on the water and a hot place on weekend nights. The rooms are stylish, well thought out and fairly large. Computers and flat screen TVs in each room and free internet access was available. The only thing you may not care for is the glassless, open window space between the bedroom and bathroom. While there is a heavy Roman shade to roll-down, noise from the bathroom for a sleeping guest may be off-putting to some. Still, the views of the bay are nice, the pool, a beautiful edgeless place in the sun overlooking the bay, and good rates can be had for those who look and plan ahead. I will be back there for my next visit, and know they will re-open as good as ever, if not better. Well located, even though downtown, with great access to other areas: Miami Beach or Key Biscayne:10 minutes, Coral Gables 15 -20 minutes, airport:15 -20 minutes, depending on traffic, which feels like rush hour most of the time in Miami. Note: valet parking is pretty much necessary if you have a car, as it is downtown and other parking options are at least a few blocks away and have restrictions. Parking was about $32/night OUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown option”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night before flying home and for this it was a perfect option. Location... eeehhh...but it all depends what you are here for an for how long. Downtown like in many US cities is a bit depressing. You can however walk down by the water and there is a shopping centre nearby but it is a few hours distraction, nothing more. It is close to the Historical Museum and Art Museum so for an overnight stay, there was enough to keep us busy. As detailed by others, the rooms are great. I just loved the balcony and the views are fantastic. Service also very good. Free internet in room (always a bonus for us Europeans who are not used of this). Valet parking was about 30 dollars if I remember correctly and on a small sample (having only got the car out once), it was a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: mlms1206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic Hotel for 2 nights in October. When you walk in the front door, you are greeted by staff immediately and made to feel right at home. I got in early, but my room was already ready for me. The rooms are a great size, love the glass shower and separate tub. Very spacious bathroom and plenty of counter space. The beds are super comfy and every room has a balcony! And the views are amazing! Every room also has a computer! Can you believe it! I was able to surf around and find a few different restaurants for lunch and dinner. On the first night, we ate at the hotel. They have a great terrace up on the 16th floor. The menu is priced decent and the food was amazing! On the second day, we had breakfast at the restaurant and then spent the day at the pool. We had lunch poolside at our cabana...the food was amazing again...you definitely don't sacrifice quality for eating at the pool. The pool staff are fantastic, offering fresh water frequently and sun block if needed. For dinner, I called down to the concierge and they made a reservation for us down on South Beach, called a taxi for us, and sent a confirmation up to the room. The staff are amazing. On the third day, we asked for a late checkout (granted) and spent the day at the pool again! Another poolside lunch (delicious again) and then off to the airport. I would stay here again and again. By far, the best hotel and best staff I've experienced in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Epic”
Reviews.Author: thomasgmay
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Epic. Nice sized room with two double beds, balcony, and great bathroom (glass shower and separate tub). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VelvetElf
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Nov 09 and very pleased indeed. Lovely room and good service. Its difficult to know where to stay in Miami and this was a good choice. The rooms are really nice with huge bed and huge shower area! and quiet as well. There is a car park (note there is a daily charge for the valet parking though) You could drive or taxi to the art deco area and we drove to Aventura Mall. In the evening its possible to stroll out to bars and restaurants about 15 mins away. There is a continental breakfast but we paid for something more and it was lovely. The restautant where all the meals are served has a lovely big balcony with city views, which all feels very chic. The restaurant food was pricey, but really very good indeed. The whole restaurant is very smart and feels like a big treat. I will go again when Ive saved up-we did get a good deal for the room rate from one of the booking sites.

Reviews.Title: “An EPIC Deal”
Reviews.Author: prdomm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are beautiful and the service was five star. I was upgraded to a JR Suite that had its own computer and an immense bathroom. I have stayed at many five star hotels, including the nearby Mandarin Oriental, and by far the EPIC is the biggest bang for the buck. Little touches like a hosted wine part every night, Aqua di Parma bath products and a top-notch gym made the stay all the more enjoyable. If you want a gorgeous hotel that is a great value and only 10 minutes from South Beach, stay at the EPIC. (If you want overly-trendy with little substance and no service and want to pay hundreds of dollars more per night, stay in South Beach). I give EPIC a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “EXTRAORDINARY!”
Reviews.Author: shoelee
Reviews.Content: Silvio & Maria Nov 26-30th If you are looking for an amazing place to stay in Miami - home away from home - then the EPIC Hotel in Miami is the place to hang out! Why? The customer service is EXTRAORDINARY! o The staff are patient, polite and friendly o Hotel is absolutely immaculate o Room service is superb o Restaurant â€“ ambiance is incredible and the food is so DELICIOUS, thanks to a great chef! o Club on main floor o Heated pool, gym etc o All this and more for a great price! - South Beach is 10 mins by Taxi - Bayside shopping; 10 mins walking - Hop on the Metro mover itâ€™s fun To the Staff at Epicâ€¦a HUGE heartfelt â€˜thank youâ€™ to ALL of you for making our anniversary so special! Free Champagne at dinner was unexpected â€“ we loved it ..we felt very special indeed.. We will bring the family in June 2010 (when kids are home from University).

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Miami”
Reviews.Author: shinyroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while awaiting our cruise. The hotel was newly opened and I must say the staff went above and beyond in every area. As an example, upon checkout the hotel called us a cab to go to the cruise ship terminal. After 20 minutes and no cab, the doorman got the hotel SUV and took us himself. Upon our return to Miami, we stayed at the Mandarin. A notch up in every respect but almost double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance?”
Reviews.Author: macca19
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Epic The "wow" factor was there when we walked in the room for the first time,the view was fabulous and the bathroom huge!! The flaws for me were the lack of reading lamps at the bedside and also no light switch by the bed, resulting in having to get up from the bed to switch out the lights and then fumble your way back to bed in the dark! The bathroom had no hooks for hanging up towels or robes, and the rain shower pressure was very weak. However we did enjoy our stay, and the positives for us were, breakfast served on the terrace,it was a lovely way to start our day and again those wonderful views The staff are all extremely helpfull,friendly and always smiling ! I would choose to stay somewhere else when I return to Miami as I was left feeling slightly disappointed by the Epic

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: GymFreakRi
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this wonderful hotel in Downtown Miami. The negatives are the construction surround the hotel as well as the resturant/lounge that is being built in the lobby. IT was truly wonderful to see a brand new clean 5 STAR hotel that deserve its rating. We have stayed in numerous hotels across US and seen many on tripadvisor.com and only to be disappointed. This one truly lilves up to its standard as #1 in the Miami area. There are too many overpriced hotel in Miami South Beach Area. This is definitely a true alternative. The view to the Biscayne Bay was unbeatable. We also had a great wine evening reception. They GYM was the best I have ever been in. It is better than Intercontinental, Mandarin Oriental, Hyatt, etc, etc. Many treadmills, cross trainers, sitting areas. Above all, CLEANINESS IS THE NAME HERE. The prices are also much better than south beach area hotels. The concierge including OSCAR was truly helpful. He and the staff really go out of their way to ask and help whatever you need. EVeryone including the doorman smile and greet and ask if you need assistance. That is a rarity in America these days. We always been weary about staying in KIMPTON HOTEL as most of their west coast hotels are OLD AND DESPERATELY need updating. We will stay in EPIC AGAIN WITHOUT SECOND THOUGHTS when we visit Miami again. FINALLY-----FREE COMPUTER AND FREE INTERNET in the room. THAT IS UNBEATABLE. NO CHARGE. COMPLEMENTARY alone with great morning coffee and tea. TIPS: eat at South Beach but dont stay at overpriced hotel. It was radiculous how cheap (relatively) the food at South Beach is. They really work hard with breakfast and lunch specials. Loved the streetside style of eating. Also, taxis is a great way to get around. Not too expansive. TIPS: USe miami tour company and go see Everglades with Gator Farm. You will see nature and the wild as it should. Say hello to SCARFARCE (the alligator ) when you go.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Excellent and friendly service, elegant rooms (on the smallish side, though), exceptional views. Breakfast wasn't top notch. But then again a good value for money choice, if you get a convenient rate.

Reviews.Title: “Service, rooms, food, all top notch”
Reviews.Author: dunstac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Epic for my sons wedding which was on The Biscayne Lady. The boat docked right next to the hotel. What a joy to be able to walk out of your hotel and board and return right back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: akearns
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went for a girl's weekend and were very disappointed. The hotel is a high rise, and we were given a room on the 18th floor. Unfortunately, they failed to tell us that construction was taking place on the 16th floor. Instead of moving us to a higher room, they offered to buy us a meal. The service was hit-or-miss. The restaurant staff could not have been nicer; however, others were less accomodating. The cleaning service basically made the beds and picked up the towels. They'd leave room service trays in the room, didn't wipe down tables, etc. All-in-all, not a great experience for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: bunnyette
Reviews.Content: After a morning fraught with endless line-ups and silly airline delays, after an overly long shuttle ride from the airport - arriving at Epic was heaven. Check in took all of 1 minute. We checked out the beautiful room - with a bathroom to die for! Double sinks, rainforest shower head, deep soaking tub. Ahh. Having a computer with internet in the room was very convenient. We decided to relax by the pool. Even though it was a windy day, staff ensured we were in the sun but out of the wind. After a few hours of lounging and having a nice lunch by teh pool we returned to our room for a short nap - sadly that turned into a 2 hour nap which caused us to miss the wine reception. DH was so comfy he refused to leave. We ended up dining at Area 31 - great food, good service. After a good night's sleep, we decided to explore around the hotel a little. Not a bad walk along the waterway to Bayside market. Check out was great - staff even lent us a stapler to attach our cruise tags to the suitcases! This is the first time I felt I got my money's worth at a hotel. Great service, super staff, very clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Epic, love Kimpton Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we have stayed in several Kimpton Hotels around the country and every time our stay is top notch. Our one-night pre-cruise stay at the Epic Hotel was no different. Originally, I booked through the Kimpton website for a city view room at an AAA rate. Decided at the last minute to check Hotwire to see what was available and save a few $$$$. I was pleasantly surprised to receive the Epic. From our arrival (being given cold water and towels) to the check in, everyone we encountered was extremely friendly and courteous and not in the "I have to" forced sort of way. Loved the decor and ambience of the room and the large bathroom. Also loved the computer in the room. Free Internet if you are an InTouch member. Considering this was book via "Third Party." I expected the good old "Third Party" sort of treatment from the staff and receive an inferior room. Nothing of the sort. We did stay with a city view but what a gorgeous city! I was particularly impressed that the check-in person knew about my allergy to cats and dogs (this is listed on my Kimpton InTouch membership profile and not sure how they were able to cross reference since this was a Hotwire reservation) and made sure that we were placed on a pet-free floor. Very much appreciated! My son wasn't feeling well so we decided to order room service instead of going down to the restaurant. They also made him something that wasn't normally available during that time period, which again we appreciated. Had a chance to view the exercise room and pool areas -- very nice. We have decided from now on whenever we cruise out of Miami, we will be choosing the Epic once again because it was so close to the Port of Miami. That was just the icing on the cake! We are also looking at returning to the Epic for a weeks-long vacation and being able to enjoy the hotel. No problems here. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the EPIC”
Reviews.Author: Cocosun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a terrific two days at the EPIC. The hotel is gorgeous, the staff couldn't have been nicer (not just efficient but genuinely friendly) and the food in Area 31 (we had breakfast there and dinner) was amazing. The place seems very well run. We are already plotting our next trip to Miami so we can stay at the EPIC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel w/ 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: The_Chad_Travels
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the best service I have ever received in any hotel in my entire life. Check in took around 2 minutes, with 1 minute being allocated to having a $100 charge cleared on a credit card for incidentals. We put an order in for breakfast the night before but somehow the order was overlooked. I called down when our order window was up--and was promptly taken care of. In fact, the gentleman comped our breakfast and even threw in extras to make up for the confusion. PROS: Views are breathtaking. Service is top notch. Rooms are very clean and the beds/pillows are sooo comfortable. Pet Friendly. Room service food = very good. Very nice showers! Water is left in room every night. Turn down service. CONS: Location leaves a bit to be desired. No hot tub(huge disappointment for such a nice place and pool). No coke machine or anywhere to get a drink in the hotel. They tell you to walk to CVS(2 blocks). Summary. If you are in town for a cruise, I can't think of anywhere better to stay. Just keep in mind it's a $20 cab ride to south beach. Around $25 from the airport. I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay at a Kimpton property without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: I`Ve read so many good reviews about Epic Hotel that I decided to stay there for 2 nights.The staff at front desk was extremely nice,the room excellent.Everything went so well in the first night.The second day our room was not cleaned.I had no fresh towels,I called three times asking for them and somebody took half an hour to bring them to our room.I decided to check out immediately,loosing the rate of the second prepaid night stay.I had the feeling that Epic Hotel doesn`t really care fot its guests!!!(The room was booked in my husband`s last name,Mr Belliboni).

Reviews.Title: “great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdagrl
Reviews.Content: if you are not looking for the beach, this is a great hotel. rooms are spacious, open, airy. pool is gorgeous, lots of pool ammenities (suntan lotion, plenty of towels, attentive). so cool - computer in your room. exhale spa wasnt open yet, but it looks like its going to be great, took an awesome yoga class

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong ... unless you want to stay on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: ehab_marcos
Reviews.Content: We booked this almost last minute. We traveled with our 13 months old son, and we all had fun. Staff were really friendly and nice from day one ... Nice front desk/guest relation manager, he got a little toy for my son too. They even got us milk delivered to the room for my son for free, as our flight was delayed and we couldnt find a place near by to buy. Rooms are very clean, we stayed at 2803 with an excellent view. You have access to several fast food places and a Starbucks near by too. Things to remember: - for those who have not been to Miami before, this is not on the beach. - there is a parking fee of USD 30 per day. The managed waived it as it was not on our booking sheet/info. - there could be some noise (if you keep your windows open) due to constructions. Don't hesitate, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinRichie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic hotel in october before a cruise and again after the cruise . The hotel itself wa exceptional in every way . I have styed in 5 star hotels all over the world and not one of them will beat the Epic hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 6.45am hoping to leave our bags and then maybe if we were lucky check in in the early afternoon . To our surprise we were told that our room was ready for us straight away. There were 3 couples so 3 rooms. We were trilled as we were wasted after the final night of our cruise. The next day we were allowed check out at 4.30pm because we had a late flight back to ireland at no extra charge. The Epic is in possition 1 for a reason and long may it continue

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: jennieafero
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed in, as simple as that. Fantastic service, facilities and the views are outstanding. Amazing location, really comfortable but totally luxurious. The rooftop infinity pools are out of this world. Would go back any time. Felt completly spoiled here :-)

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: hershey24
Reviews.Content: My freind and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during carnival. From the staff to the room everthing was outstanding. Staff made us feel like we were the most important guest. Our room was 1901. We had a view of the city and the pools which were located on the 16th floor along with the restaurant, Area 31 which served an array of dishes or al fresco by the pool side. I would absoloutely return and recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “A 'first class' weekend”
Reviews.Author: bcwolfe
Reviews.Content: We spent the first weekend in October 2009 at the hotel, as we'd travelled up from the Keys to watch 'The Killers' (on Saturday) and the Bills @ the Dolphins (on Sunday), and we found it absolutely wonderful. We treated ourselves to Sunday brunch, at the Area 31 restaurant, and the food and services was excellent. We also tried the room service, and again the food and services was excellent. The rooms are clean, spacious and very stylish and matched the five star rating. We unfortunately, had a few quibbles. On arrival, the previous guests' used soap and shower gel was still in the shower cubicle. Also, the complimentary toiletries were open and previously used (for a five star I wouldn't expect this to be the norm). These items were never replaced, and we're glad we'd brought our own. We were also disappointed, that the hotel failed to leave us a card to order breakfast on our last morning. I'll assume this was an oversight. Finally, our real problem was the bill pushed under the door, that was twice as much as it should have been (we'd paid some items twice, and charged for the 'honour bar' that we never used). To the hotel's credit, this was resolved immediately. I would recommend this hotel, but would ask you to check your bill carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Would Def. Come Back”
Reviews.Author: gusandbetsy
Reviews.Content: Girls weeekend trip to Miami, we were very conflicted about whether to stay in South beach or at EPIC. I went with EPIC because I liked the more relaxed vibe rather than the frenetic pace of South Beach. Taxi to South Beach is about $25 each way. Our experience was amazing - we had a waterfront room with amazing views. Check-in was easy, rooms were gorgeous, views fantastic. Pools are wonderful, lots of chairs and a very mixed crowd with a very relaxed vibe. Fruit kebabs that they brought around were amazing and a nice treat! Wine hour from 5-6 was wonderful - we also had massages pool-side which the concierge organised for us --- massuese (Olivia) was AMAZING. So worth it. Fitness center was beautiful, and the in-room internet kiosk was very handy when looking for places to eat! The only thing was that the room next to us was adjoining and there was some noise that came through from people talking --- but it wasnt bad enough to make us switch rooms. Thought the sound-proofing could be a little better. We did not want to leave, everyone was so helpful. I would definately stay at EPIC again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & tasteful”
Reviews.Author: Miamiviajera
Reviews.Content: A different view of Miami --literally and figuratively--from this stunning hotel in downtown. South Beach hotels and service pale next to the elegance, the ambience and just the overall chic of this hotel. The views are stunning, and the details make all the differnece. A complimentary book on my pillow? (I got Leila Cobo's Tell Me Something True--great novel) Never saw that before and it's a wonderful little perk. Coupled with wine and a book reading at the terrae t sundown, it made me feel I was in another world. Staff is attentive and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, chic, luxurious hotel with top amenities and breathless views.”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkielb
Reviews.Content: Modern, chic, luxurious hotel with top amenities and breathless views. I cannot say enough about this hotel. It was one of the greatest hotel experiences I had! Beginning with check-in, the front desk wanted to ensure that every need was met and offered us a free upgrade to a water-view room. Our room was huge with incredible views, flat screen tv, in room computer with free internet access, HUGE bathroom, comfortable bed, pristine finishingâ€™s, and high-tech extras. For example, we were able to press a button to ensure privacy. Once pressed, you cannot even here the door bell for the room service you ordered (oops!). The terrace was huge and accommodating for our room service breakfast that was one of the highlights of our stays. The hotel itself is beautiful with a luxurious lobby, huge chic pool, and delicious restaurant. The location was great and walking distance to Mary Brickell Village. There is also a lounge/night club so you donâ€™t have to go far to party. Donâ€™t worry about the party goers. Epic ensures top security. Once the club opened the entrance to the elevators were roped off, and a security guard was on duty to check room keys. The gym was another plus and with high-tech equipment. Overall, this was one of the best accommodations we have had, and we have stayed in great hotel all over the world. You will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherERRN
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel!!! From check in to check-out, the whole stay was exceptional. I am a hotel snob, it wasn't the Ritz but it was very nice. I had a complimentary upgrade. Checked in early, at 10:00 without any question. The room is very nice, free wifi and a desktop in the room for Kimpton members. The normal Luxury bedding/towels. I-pod docking station to charge my phone. Front desk even gave me a $10 credit for the mini bar as a promo they were trying. Great view of the water and the pool, from our balcony. The pool area, amazing! The guys working out there set up my towels in one of the small cabanas, free of charge. There are two other sizes of cabana rooms for fees, and the big one is just amazing. They had complmentary lotions, new magazines, and continued to come around with a pitcher of lemon water and kept our glasses full. I did order one cocktail out there also. Then from 5:00-:6:00 PM they had a hosted wine reception, poolside. Very nice touch. Excellent location for walking around downtown. Several fine restaurants in the area. They have good food in their restaurant as well, excellent salad! There is only valet parking there. My friends came to visit us and were only charged a small fee for the day. They are also a dog friendly hotel, for all those who need to bring their pets and I don't just mean little dogs, real dogs, too!! In the evening a server came by our room to offer items such as bottles of complimentary water. I also saw that if you are charged by your airline for a second bag, that if you show them the reciept, they will deduct the amount off of your bill. Just one great thing after another with this hotel. It is very nice. It was a very nice stay. Wish that I could have stayed an extra day.

Reviews.Title: “The Epic hotel was by far the BEST kimpton hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Emily7587
Reviews.Content: During my stay I there were people every where filling your glass with water and a slice of orange while you lounge by the pools. This was the best time I had ever had at any hotel! I highly recommend the Epic while you are in Miami beach. The service was fantastic and the rooms were beautitul and clean. The view of the water was tremendous! I stayed there for 3 days and I felt like I was at a spa! At the end of my vacation I didn't want to leave. The staff made me feel as if I were at home. I loved all of the little features too! Like the pools, the gym, the food, the staff and every thing in between! i highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mPraneeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, right in the middle of downtown Miami. Its right beside a river and very close to a bay. I had a water view room but the room I was given had a not so great view of water so I called the front desk and they moved to me to a new room immediately. This room had a swimming pool view too and also the downtown view at the same time. Parking was $32 a night for valet (no self service available). There was a desktop with a monitor in my room and internet was free!! Overall, it was a great hotel and I loved my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “EPIC impresses with its customer service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: kennyf1130
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EPIC Hotel in Miami for our pre-wedding and night of the wedding. They were very accomodating in upgrade us to a suite as it was a special stay for us. Although one of the floors were flooded due to a busted pipe, they were able to still give us a room in a very nice location overlooking the water. We had other guests stay there as well and they were very impressed with the hotel too. The pool area, gym, and dining facilities are also top notch. We will not be shy about recommending the EPIC hotel, or any other hotels from the Kimpton chain.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Epic-Keep Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: miami305
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time @ the Epic & I LOVE it! Even though I live in Miami, the Epic keeps me coming back.. Two nights of R&R here are like a week away for relaxation. Food @ Area31 is always fresh & tasty & the chef (John C) always stops by to say hello, making sure you're happy with the meal. Lunch by the pool is fantastic, especially with a bucket of chilled champagne & fresh strawberries- decadent, yet affordable! The rooms are not only beautiful & immaculate- they're sooooo comfortable. Best mattresses-zzzzzzz. Can't think of anywhere else that has beds this comfortable (and with gorgeous Frette linens!) Rooms are spacious with great views. Nice & quiet. Only problem is room service- why can't my food arrive as ordered AND hot? Each visit, had to send it back. Servers were very polite, but it's frustrating to call back, repeat order & wait again. Then, with luck, it arrives as ordered. (Still, it's better service than other Miami hotels) The pool is divine- perfect temperature, in fact, each pool has a slightly different temp, in case you like it warmer (as I do). And tthe pool staff (especially Ting-Ting!!!) is soooo helpful & cheery. The bar staff is super-excellent mixologists, (especially the two blondes). The bar manager is friendly & efficient & makes sure everytrhing runs smoothly- which it does! This is a great hotel to duck into for a few days & take advantage of all of the amenities & never leave. You'll feel totally renewed and be able to eat, drink, play, relax, read & sleep all in one magnificent playground! Do yourself a favor and book a room (or suite) here- you'll be glad you did! My susperb experience here prompted me to become a Kimpton member & now I've also enjoyed other properties- Atlanta/Palomar & Vero Beach & of, course repeat visits to The Epic.

Reviews.Title: “"Wow" is all I can say.”
Reviews.Author: juniormint1111
Reviews.Content: My job consists of practically living on a plane and a few quick nights at various hotels. Usually we check into a major hotel chain because we know what to expect...and therefore are not too disappointed. But my coworker was given a tip to switch our reservations to the Epic hotel a couple days before we left. When I found out that it was a Kimpton hotel I was extremely excited having stayed at one back home (Washington, D.C.). When we first pulled up there was some construction dust that had us a little nervous, but after the valet and doorman came up to our vehicle we were so giddy. They had the cutest/fashionable/sexy little outfits ever! With matching Fedoras!!! I don't think I will ever forget that. They were so nice and friendly. The front desk staff checked us in and informed us of the nightly events such as ice cream and popsicles in lobby. When we went into our room we were immediately blown away. A beautiful sliding glass door led to the grand bathroom with the largest tub I've seen in a regular hotel suit. I would have jumped right in if I wasnt stunned frozen by the huge window cutout thingy that allowed you to see into the bedroom from the tub/pool in the bathroom. Oh, did I forget to mention the twin bowl sinks and rainforest-esque glass encased shower?!?! My bad... So now the room. The bed was great, but I was still gawking at the beautiful bathroom. There was a huge flat screen t.v. on the wall and below it sat...wait for it...your own personal computer!!!!! What the #$*@&?!?! Amazing! I am in love. I would have sat at that computer all day if it wasnt for the beautiful balcony with sweeping views of the water and the two infinity pools below us. The pools were great. The service was even better. They bring you water with citrus fruits cut up in the glasses. Fresh towels. Wonderful seating. Perfect water temperature. I can go on and on and on... Trendy nightlife can be found in the lobby. I think you have to be beautiful in order to enter...or maybe the ambiance of the hotel just makes everyone look beautiful anyway?!? The only semi negative thing I can possibly say is that menu at the restuarant menu tends to run on the exotic side. If thats cool with you then fine, but I'm a meat and potatoes type of person so it wasn't quite cutting it, but the drinks are strong and affordable...and who needs food when you can't see straight after one sip? I am planning on staying overnight in Miami before my cruise next month and I would love to stay there again! Too bad I won't be able to put it on my company credit card!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: joscelyngo39
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you that the hotel has an easy address, but can be a little confusing to find so you might want to call for specific directions before, if you are driving. I am always traveling on a budget and just so you know, the hotel will charge you a $100 hold for every night that you book. This hotel is amazing! We booked a city-view room through the Kimpton rewards program. Upon arrival they gave us a complimentary $10 for the Mini-bar, they upgraded us to a partial view of water-view at no charge, and allowed us to check-in well before 3PM. Our reservation also came with a complimentary beverage or a continental breakfast for each of us, each day. We did have to ask about this, but I think it was only because we were in such a hurry to get into our room upon check in. Breakfast can include eggs, toast, and hashbrowns which is great and so are the drink coupons since they are $13 a pop. We ate at Area 31 once and it was good, but a little pricey. I think you can find other places to eat downtown that are just as good, but won't have the view or the price. If you are spoiled from american fast food like us there is a quiznos, subway, and pizza hut within walking distance. There is also a CVS, a liquor store, and a number of different banks within walking distance, but there is an ATM on the 14th floor for you to use. Rooms are great and conviently come with a computer inside with free internet. Bathrooms come with huge bathtub and seperate walkin shower. View outside is breathtatking! Parking is a little expensive, but it is like that everywhere in Miami. If you are looking to go back and forth to South Beach you will need a car. The drive is not far at all, but in cabs that could add up. The bar on the lobby level seemed to be happening Fri-Sun, but we never checked it out (wish we would have). Pool is the best thing at this hotel. Views are amazing and pool service is great they will set up your chairs with towels, bring your ice water with oranges, they have suntan lotion if you need it, reading materials, cabanas are huge, they bring you fresh fruit, and they keep the drinks coming. The complimentary wine hour is worth the stay at the pool and it is a great touch for the hotel. I never saw any children on our 5 day stay, but the hotel does welcome dogs which I found to be so adorable they even put out welcome signs for them with doggie treats. Too cute! As everyone has said, the service is 5star for sure. Everyone is so friendly and they never make you feel away from home.Overall I would totally go back to Epic. I had a blast and can't wait to go back. There is a reason this hotel is #1. Stop thinking about it and just go!

Reviews.Title: “They deliver everything they promise. Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Paulonascif
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days. We would stay at the four seasons, but I am permanently checking for news, so i decided to try the Epic. We Had a great stay. Very nice staff, extremely friendly and always wanting to please us. We stayed at Club Level and it was even greater. I always check trip advisor before booking, so be sure that my comment is a critic one. Book with no fear. You will love it. Paulo Nascif, Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel! Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: MiaLora77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite a bit and I have to say that the Epic Hotel in Miami is truly epic! We've stayed at other top quality hotels, but this hotel tops our list! We had stayed there for 3 nights about two weeks ago after a week long cruise and staying there was a great way to end our nice vacation. We received an awesome deal from travelzoo and was able to book a king premier room with a balcony. The balcony over looked a part of the waterway and downtown area. Really nice! From the time we checked in, the staff was very welcoming and very pleasant. I was so impressed with how they allowed us to check in at such an early time as we left from our cruise real early in the morning. The rooms at the Epic is a whole other story. Very spacious and very clean equipped with more ammenities than you would expect at other lavish hotels. The bathroom is huge and very modern contemporary. It even has a window looking into the bedroom area. I enjoyed the flat screen desk top computer with free wi-fi (very convenient!), the flat screen tv, and the ever so comfortable beds! The pool area is very nice with awesome views of downtown and the waterway. They have several pool areas to hang out at which is very pleasant as it wasn't crowded at all. When we went to hang out at the pool one day, the workers were always so attentive and so kind to refill our water glasses whenever they noticed it was half full! We also needed some information about renting a car and ended up talking to the conceirge at Epic. Not only was he very helpful and informative, but he also gave us some great tips on where to go and hang out around the dowtown Miami area as well as South Beach. Very helpful! If you plan to be out on the night on the town, the hotel is isn't too centralized. However, they do have River Lounge, a nice classy lounge bar to hang out at for drinks and to mingle as well as Area 31 at the hotel. If you plan to go out somewhere in South Beach, it is about a 15 minute drive and would cost about $25 for taxi ride. . Our last night we decided to rest and stay in. We ordered room service and I was again impressed with how prompt they are. Although the food was very delicious, it was a bit pricey. One plate cost us about $40. Overall, the Epic hotel in Miami is one hotel I would definitely return to. If you're looking for great top quality, great service, and a pleasant experience, Epic a Kimpton hotel in Miami was the hotel that provided that for my husband and I! We look forward to returning back to the Epic in Miami in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks For Service”
Reviews.Author: RichB4Kids
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a weekend stay at the Epic at the end of a 4 week Florida holiday. I travelled with my wife and 3 young children. The main highlight of this hotel are the employees. All staff were polite, courteous & friendly without being overbearing. Management obviously place a great deal of emphasis on customer service and it shows. People underestimate how effective a smile is and everyone who works here is smiling. Being ranked the #1 Miami hotel on Tripadvisor is why I booked and its good to see the hotel being proactive with its management responses to some of the posts here. My only tip if you are planning to stay at this property is to join the free Kimpton In Touch program. You may get lucky and be sent an email with a exclusive member offer (as I did) that can save you hundreds of dollars over normal rates. This is a great hotel for a short break with a great pool area. I highly recommend it. If they read this - here are a few very minor suggestions for the hotel management...... - The pool has several tiles missing on the external walls - these are quite sharp and could be nasty for a child. - You advertise kiddie packs for children....we didn't get any and doesn't look like a reviewer below did either - no biggie, but if you promote it in the room, literature and online - you need to offer it. - You need some new glasswear/plastic wine glasses for the evening reception. You only had a dozen wine glasses and the rest of us drank wine from whisky tumblers each night, which were filthy dirty. I noticed Wal Mart had some nice blue plastic ones for $3 each - a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “We'll probably be back.”
Reviews.Author: rwolfe618
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Epic Hotel over Labor Day weekend, and we were not disappointed. We had previously stayed at the Kimpton's Hotel Madera in Washington DC, and so we purposely stayed at a Kimpton during our trip to Miami. As a member of Kimpton's free InTouch club, we took advantage of a $99/night special, and it was completely worth it. The weather wasn't so great, but the hotel was so enjoyable that we didn't mind hanging out there for the evening. I would recommend Kimpton's hotels to anyone interested in something different than the regular hotel chains. Do yourself a favor, and join their InTouch club. They run specials all the time, and it's a great benefit. Also, I noticed when I was reading reviews on here for the hotel restaurant Area 31, there were some that made me a little hesitant to give it a shot. Well, my husband and I dined there our first night, and it was awesome. The service was exceptional, and the food was diverse and delicious. I can see how anyone that is very picky about their food might not enjoy it, but if you're like me and willing to try anything, I would highly recommend it. One tip: Be prepared to pay the $30/night for overnight parking though. It's valet-only. We weren't expecting that, and didn't have very many small bills.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and trendy, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: imoldgreggory
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all of the positive reviews on this website. I had high expectations going into it, and the experience I had exceeded my expectations. My boyfriend and I stayed here after we got off a week-long cruise. We had to leave the boat early in the morning and decided we'd go on ahead to the hotel with all our luggage around 9:00 am, and we weren't sure if we would be able to check-in yet since check-in wasn't until later afternoon (3:00 I think...). Anyways, we were very welcomed when we arrived extremely early and we were given our room key immediately! This was SO nice since we were so exhausted. The room was very modern and had a great view and a huge balcony; it was very clean, there was free computer & internet access right there, a plasma screen TV, and the bed was very comfortable. It was wonderful. (I did miss the animal towels we were used to seeing from the room stewards on the cruise...) My experience at the pool was also amazing. When I asked if I could get a towel when I first arrived, the pool attendant took me over and set me up with a great view of both the pool and the water with a towel to lay on and one for a pillow. He then brought me complimentary wine from the evening reception in the hotel, and came to check on me often. However, I did not have any cash to tip him - I didn't realize I would be pampered at the pool - so I feel stingy and really regret this. (I believe his name was Roberto, and if any management reads this, please send him my gratitude and note that you have an outstanding employee who would be fabulous with many more customer service responsibilities than just working at the pool! He made my experience at the Epic that much better.) We decided to try the Area 31 restaurant for dinner, but when we got there we were disappointingly turned away because there were so many reservations (it was a Saturday night). The hostess told us to try back in 45 minutes, and we did so without any complaints. We were understanding of the situation. When we returned, we were immediately recognized by the supervisor who was very apologetic and set us up with complimentary champagne and sat us right away. The food we had for dinner was spectacular! It is pricey, but well worth it. Overall, I highly recommend staying at this hotel in Miami. The icing on the cake is that it is a pet-friendly hotel, yet it is so elegant seeming that you would never suspect a dog or cat has ever set foot inside. I did not have my dog with me on this trip, but knowing she could stay here if needed was a bonus. Even though I live in Seattle, I am thinking about staying at a Kimpton hotel here for a special occasion because of my positive experience at Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations, service is sub-par”
Reviews.Author: TSpotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic for 10 days. The hotel is shiny new, the rooms and lobby are very nice and luxurious/trendy. Everything looked sharp clean and service was perfect for the first couple of days. I was excited about staying at this hotel. As days passed however some of its flaws became more evident. On-going cleaning for the room is sub-par, they basically make up your bed and move the things here and there, nothing else. When I needed room service I was treated badly by some of the staff, no wonder I got pissed off. Besides the average service (I was expecting excellence considering you pay for it), the valet parking is $32 and dining options are more than limited in room service. If you are all about partying, a luxury hotel in South Beach may work better for you. If you want luxury in the Brickell area, then go for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff make it one of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: ASTG
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the EPIC Hotel in a waterfront Club Level room from 28-31 Aug 2009. Due to the outstanding experience we had, we would like to take the time to comment on our stay. From a mere factual point of view, the EPIC in itself is already a wonderful place, with sleek and modern rooms, great views of the Miami harbour and Miami Beach in the distance. You could continue with praise for all of the tangibles but that would not reflect nor describe what you really experience here as the characteristics are those of any top-end hotel around the world and reproducable by others. What really makes this hotel stand out among its peers in the area and around the globe are its people. Upon entering the hotel, you can sense a calm and relaxed type of team spirit, which also has a calm and restoring effect on the guests. Out of all the nice people we met at the hotel, we would like to point out some of them who made our stay really special. Arriving from another hotel in Miami Beach, we called up the hotel to arrange a transfer to the EPIC in advance and spoke to the Club Level concierge, who turned out to become our main point of contact in the hotel and club lounge. He won us over with his professionalism, effectiveness and attention to detail. You could feel that he was doing at all times much more than his job to make our stay with you as unforgettable as it was. With good recommendations and an impeccable drive, he arranged and checked several tours for us, all of which we turned down in the end as we did not want to leave the relaxing atmosphere of the hotel anymore. But this positive experience is not only limited to one single person but also applies to all other staff we met. They managed to overcome the distance between employee and guest that is experienced most of the time when travelling. Due to the amount of travelling we do and the focus on many other things, it is rare for us to remember specific names. But be it the young and friendly staff at Club level or the helpful colleagues by the pool, they all turned from face- and nameless employees into real personalities and people we will remember and tell others about. They did so due to their presence, commitment and dedication and by living all the good values advertised on the in-room leaflets. As a small note for improvement regarding our stay, we would note our experience with the Sunday brunch at Area 31. Despite the nice setting, jazz music and some quite good food, the disappointing part was to find the same pastries as at the club lounge the day before on the brunch buffet and then again during the afternoon/ evening the leftovers from brunch re-appeared at the club. All in all, this was one of our most exciting hotel stays ever and we will not hesitate to talk about it to our friends, family and colleagues across Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fabolous Place if you want your money stolen from your room”
Reviews.Author: scottie2985
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the hotel is spectacular and gorgeous..a far cry from the seedy hotels on/in South Beach..the hotel is about 12 minutes away from Downtown Miami..As soon as you walk in you feel like royalty and are treated as such..the rooms are spacious and the waterview is gorgeous especially at nite. The pools are clean, large and the staff is very accomadating, laying out the towels and bringing over fresh water. My only problem with the hotel is that the housekeeping is not allowed to knock on the door they have to ring the doorbell..at 8am, 9 am who hears the faint doorbell?? If you dont respond they just walk right in. I was not keen on that at all..this happened two days in a row where housekeeping walked in on us and woke us up. I called and asked if they could come later in the day they said not a problem...the next day at twelve housekeeping came and said its 1150 if your not out in ten minutes you wont have your room cleaned...rude...but we were headed to the pool anyway..One night we get back to the hotel and i had $108 in my pants threw them in the closet and went to bed...the next day we went to the pool and come back room is cleaned and so were my pockets..while I have no fromal proof I know that it was taken from me. You know when you just have that gut feeling? In any event I didnt want it to damper my trip so I just let it go, it was all i could do at that point..but housekeeping does come in your room at all times of the day and night so for me just a lil creepy..I was looking foward to staying again with girlfriends but am now looking elsewhere...I would recommend this hotel but also adivse people to just be careful

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest hotel - ever!”
Reviews.Author: NSmith1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our tour round Florida - and enjoyed the whole experience so much we stayed again for a further night at the end. Enjoyed both a suite and large room - both overlooking the waterfront. The whole place is just top notch right throughout from arrival to departure and just great rooms and facilities. Very attentive staff and very always happy to make conversation. Okay it's not South Beach, but it's great to escape back to the luxuary of the Epic at the end of each day. Goldfish in the room on arrival for our second stay was a little different.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Hotel is the BEST hotel in Miami! It's truly Epic!”
Reviews.Author: curfew_girl
Reviews.Content: We came by taxi and were greeted right away as the driver unloaded our luggage. A smiling gentleman asked our name and as we walked into the stunning lobby, the front desk staff greeted us by name. We had a wonderful young man whisk us up to our junior suite on the 19th floor. Suite 1920 to be exact. Stepping into our room put a huge smile our faces. It is stylish, well suited, posh and comfortable. Our balcony was small but in a great location and the views at night (and day) were stunning. The bathroom was very large, with a deep soaking tub and separate commode area. Great bathroom! We went to the 16th floor to the pools. Bruno greeted us within the first 30 seconds we were there, putting towels on our chairs and rolling one for our necks. A glass of cold vitality water with an orange slice was placed in our hands (and wow) relaxation set in immediately. The pools were the perfect temperature. Adorable cabana's, chairs and chaise lounges were strategically placed about. We ordered lunch and I can say it was the best hamburger I've ever had. Ever. Ever! That night we had our anniversary dinner at Area 31. Our dinner was wonderful augmented by the wonderful wait staff. We lingered over dinner and dessert and was surprised by a plate of sweet treats brought to our room by the restaurant manager and a hand written note as an anniversary treat. Such wonderful service. In fact, it's the service that really wins you over. Sure the hotel is stunningly beautiful, but it's the smiling faces you encounter everywhere you go. I'd love to spend a week here, not just a pre-cruise night. We have nothing praise for this hotel/resort. Can't wait to come back!! PS: The Acqua di Parma toiletries are worth the stay alone!! And the continental was anything but continental - it was a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton has stepped it up to next level”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the EPIC that concluded a trip all over southern FL. Positives: Place is a real beauty..views of Brickel Key and Water amazing Customer Service: from front desk to valet all smiles and positive vibe Facilites: infinity edge pools(2 of them) great lounge pool area, better than most hotel fitness room give you everyhting you need Location: short walk to Mary Brickell village or Bayside for shops and food Technology: had free internet as Intouch member but flatscreen tv's and minicomputers in every room, ipod hookups as well Rooms: seperate tub and rain shower, huge bathroom, comfortable bed Negatives: none really i tried to find fault but Kimpton really brought their A game..Room was only 99 a night as well! If you can deal with not being right on the beach this is the best combo of luxury and value in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotell I`ve ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: Torbjoern
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure heaven :) We stayed there 3 nights and it was magnificent ! Crisp and delicate luxury room with balcony and seaview :) The staff was extremly friendly ! Everyone seemed to care , from the doorman to everyone working there. Dont think the prices was so bad either :) Great value! I even got free breakfast vouchers for every day :) An extra 50$ value pr day :) :) Highly recommended!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with that will get better with time.”
Reviews.Author: Heandthere
Reviews.Content: Epic Hotel was a nice alternative to the small overcrowded South Beach area rooms. I would have given it a 4.5 if that option were available as we really enjoyed our stay but, as with any new property, there are a couple of areas that they could improve upon but nothing that would cause me not to want to return. The hotel is new with nice decor and was very clean both inside and out including nice new carpets in the hallways and rooms which is a big plus. We had a relatively spacious room that had a large balcony with a very nice view of the Miami River and the drawbridge across Brickell Street. While I wish the television would have been a bit larger, more importantly for me the room was quite and we could not hear the occupants in any adjoining rooms or passersby in the hallways, which for me, will ruin any hotel stay. The rooms also had a great bathroom that had a sliding door to seperate the area for the toilet from the rest of the bathroom, which is great if you are not traveling alone. My wife really liked the 2 large bowl sinks, the great shower and seperate large tub. The staff that we encountered were all friendly and seemed willing to help assist you find whatever it was that you had come to town for which in our case was some latin american dining. My complaints would only be that after two attempts the breakfast cooks were unable to serve an egg done overwell which for a fine restaurant should not be very difficult. The only other issue would be a staff member ringing the bell to the room late at night and then entering the room to see if we needed towels? This was just kind of random and I don't know if it was a mix up or what.....Those are the only small issues that kept me from giving this hotel a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous! Excellent, personable service!”
Reviews.Author: lilchickee14
Reviews.Content: I had such a wonderful experience at Epic. The hotel is nice, luxurious and clean. Spacious rooms, plush carpet, an umbrella for rainy miami days, a desktop computer in every room...loved it all. The staff was very nice; greeted you with every eye contact. They upgraded me to waterview for free, and included continental breakfast. Continental breakfast was more than just fruit and pastries...included eggs and hashbrowns as well. The staff at Area 31 was very nice, always smiling. I loved the complimentary wine reception. The crabcakes at brunch were amazing. The pool and poolside area were so chic. I loved all the seating options. The pool attendants were great. They place seat covers on the chairs, and then roll your towels up into little pillows. They continously provide ice water while you stay. Loved it!!! Oh and one pool is heated. Made a great difference on cloudy days. Oh and the fitness center was state of the art. Clean with TVs on the cardiomachines. Oh and there's a barre for stretching. reminded me of my ballet days. My only complaints are 1-I wasn't a fan of the scent of the toiletries. 2-River lounge, although is very nice, was not enjoyable for me. I went on a saturday and when asked about hiphop the DJ said "They don't let me play it." it was all electronic/house music. Not cool. Chic people like a little hip hop too you know. I wish there were hotels like this in South beach, but there just aren't. Downtown isn't so bad though. It is walkable to The Bayside Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rkvalvaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic with my wife and daughter (age 2) in the last week of July. This was our third and last week of our US vacation (NY, Orlando and Miami). We drove down from Orlando and was welcomed by a very friendly doorman and valet service. The hotel looks very nice and are located near/on the I95/US1, very convinient if you have a car. We had a city view room and was pleasantly surprised of the size and an amazing bathroom. The PC in the room was very nice (great IT-solution with a lot of interesting information) and the internet connection very fast. I've also brought my laptop and could use both Wireless and cabled access to the internet (requires Kimton membership (it's free)). All the staff, from the valet to door-men and cleaning was very friendly and attentive, and it made us feel very welcome and comfortable. My daughter had an little accident in the room (after jumping around) and scrubbed her knee, at the same moment as housekeeping arrived. The housekeeper called security at once and a very nice man came within in minutes with band-aid. He left, but came back again within minutes with a chocolate bar and a rubber duck for my daughter. She got a new hero that day :-) Another day, I forgot to turn off the "do not disturb" light before we left, so the room wasn't cleaned when we got back. I turned of the light, and within minutes housekeeping was on the door (it was after 4PM) and ready to clean our room. The Area 31 restaurant had a nice menu, especcially if you like fish, but they also got some great steaks and lamb. The staff of the restaurant was very serviceminded without beeing intrusive (in short words, we were pampered). The pool area was also very nice, we used the pool almost every afternoon after coming in from the beach, sightseeing and/or shopping. If I'm going back to Miami, either on vacation or business, I will certainly stay at the Epic again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed!!! Amazing”
Reviews.Author: clauotero
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Stayed here for about a week on my honeymoon before I went to Cabo San Lucas. We were upgraded to Junior Suite as a hotel courtesy since it was our honeymoon. The room was simply spectacular, they were huge! I can't say much of the food since we only had breakfast there once. The pool was gorgeous and a very nice view. The service was top nothc, after a day or 2 everyone would call us by our names, it was very nice. I loved loved loved this hotel, will stay here every time I go to Miami. The rate was amazing also!

Reviews.Title: “Got food poisoning; more style than substance”
Reviews.Author: Phil_London2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was rated first in Miami on TripAdvisor and because the Miami hotels in the Hilton, Starwood and Accor chains at which I normally stay were either poorly located or poorly rated on TripAdvisor. It is true that this hotel has a lot going for it. Modern rooms, comfortable beds, sea views (if you pay extra), nice pools, a good gym, free internet (if you sign up to the Kimpton loyalty programme), a business centre where internet access and printing is free, and decent prices. Some staff, notably Elizabeth, the maid on my floor, are lovely. But in other respects, the Epic doesn't measure up. For a start, its location isn't great: it's in the downtown area, so there isn't much around. And while the pools are nice, they don't catch the sunshine for most of the afternoon. In the room, the shower was poor: weak pressure, and the water never got properly hot. The bathtub was uncomfortably squarish, so not conducive to relaxing in.
