But the worst part is the restaurant, Area 31, which is a big pity considering it's pleasant location. The food itself is insipid. The huevos rancheros for breakfast lacked taste, as did the eggs benedict, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese bagel. The service was patchy and often offhand. The prices for dinner are high, yet the food doesn't measure up. Worst of all, I got food poisoning from my dinner there (probably the tuna sashimi-style "crudo"). I woke up at 5am the following morning with stomach cramps and diarrhea, and since I had skipped lunch the day I had dinner at Area 31, it can only have come from the restaurant. I didn't eat for a day afterwards and had diarrhea for several days. To be fair, when I complained, the hotel refunded my dinner and offered me a free dinner. I didn't take them up on the offer (once bitten, twice shy). And being ill put a real dampener on my stay - and my important business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “All we could've asked for and more”
Reviews.Author: Island_Hoppin_Diver
Reviews.Content: The fantastic reviews on TripAdvisor convinced us to spend a weekend at the EPIC Hotel over all the hotels at SoBe. We are happy to say the EPIC Hotel not only met, but exceeded our expectations. My girlfriend and I stayed in a king room on the 24th floor. The bay view was amazing, the room and bathroom immaculate, and the in-room computer and free internet access were a nice treat. The pool on the 16th floor was lovely -- comfortable and cool with a nice bay breeze, cozy chairs, and fabulous view. The staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a pleasant stay. Every one of them wore a warm smile and treated us as though we were old friends -- we felt welcome from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. The continental breakfast at Area 31 featured a delicious basket of freshly-backed pasteries, and the staff there was top notch as well. The hotel is within walking distance to the Bayside Marketplace, which features some nice shops and restaurants and street performers. Note that the hotel is a good bit aways from Fort Lauderdale (a cab cost us $73 + tip). If you don't have a car, you're better off flying into Miami. I'm sure the hotel will consider a shuttle service in the future. We'll definitely be returning and hope to stay longer next time. We would like to thank the staff for their kindness and look forward to seeing them again when we're back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: fryguy1971
Reviews.Content: Wow. This is the best hotel in which I've ever stayed. We stayed at the EPIC last weekend and have already booked a room for next weekend. Can't wait to stay with them again!! This hotel is chic, hip, and immaculate. From the moment we checked in we were pampered and felt a million miles away on vacation. Our room was beyond comfortable. The king bed with such soft and comfortable linens was like sleep in a cloud. The bathroom was ultra modern and stunning - the divider between it and the bedroom was funky. A s if that wasn't enough, the balcony overlooked the water and gave fantastic views. It is hard to say who on the staff was most helpful and attentive since from the valet to reception to waiters, everyone was profession, courteous, and friendly in a way I've never encountered before - even at other 4 and 5 star hotels. But the pool staff deserves particular note (maybe because we spent the most time there...) for their unparalleled service and hospitality. They we truly fantastic, friendly, and fun. We found the hotel because we were looking for a place in Miami that allowed pets. Not only did they allow our chocolate lab, but they absolutely adored her and made us feel right at home staying with her. This isn't the kind of hotel that allows pets, so long as they're tiny lap-dogs. Our dog is 1 1/2 years old and isn't such a small puppy any more. Far from making us feel out of place with a big dog, the staff showered her with affection each time we went out for a walk. It was almost as if she were the celebrity and we her entourage. Incidentally, the pictures of the rooms on the hotel's website are, unlike some other properties I've looked at online, identical to what you'll get when you stay there. So I didn't bother with interior pictures and chose to post some non-room pictures. Like I said, we're already booked for next weekend and counting the days until check-in!

Reviews.Title: “When can we return?”
Reviews.Author: AAAmy
Reviews.Content: After attending an unexpectedly stressful weekend wedding in the Caribbean, we made the best decision to stay at EPIC Hotel during our overnight layover in Miami. A quick, 20 minute, cab ride from the airport and we were greeted by the friendly staff as if they were anxiously awaiting our arrival. Everyone was completely professional, charming and eager to assist in making sure our stay was fun and relaxing. Upon entering our inviting room we quickly decided to stay and have dinner on the 16th floor at Area 31. It was a beautiful, warm evening...just as the sun was setting...we chose outdoor dining, near the pool, overlooking the water. The seafood dishes were savory, the coctails were unique and delicious, and the desserts sweet and satisfying...couldn't have asked for more. Concierge was friendly and helpful in arranging our airport transfer through Aventura Worldwide Limousine - they saw us off and we promised to return. There is so much more I could say, but I'll leave that for you to go and discover for yourself! (Oh, and if you have AAA, don't forget to check for a discount!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wash1604
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because Tripadvisor rated it no# 1. Therefore, we decided to stay there and then stay additional days in SOBE. This hotel is definitely top-notch. Everything was so plush and trendy. The balony view of the bay, the rooms, the bathroom is all that!!! The restaurant and bar was great! The staff was extremely professional and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: JosDup
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks pretty new ans it does have many comforts (free internet connection on the room, bath and spacious bathroom, very comfortable bed as regards what better suits me..). Views on bay and city building were really amazing and staff was very professional and kind. I would sincerely suggest this hotel for those visiting Miami. I would have had some different ideas about the location (not so close to South Beach..) but because of its high quality i would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Very nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: GEORGE92065
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Epic, because it was close to the Port of Miami. The Hotel was very clean and has the most comfortable beds. The balcony's are great and have great views. The staff at the Epic Hotel were very accommodating and gave us a room in the morning when we arrived from a red eye flight. They also have computers in every room for free.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: dctrips
Reviews.Content: Immaculate hotel! We really lucked out with a deal with breakfast we found here through TripAdvisor's QuickChek. The hotel still seems relatively new and we actually had to almost pinch ourselves when we walked in the lobby. This place looks like it's for celebrities. The pool area is something you'd see on TV - ultra modern, private outdoor areas with lounges, bars and televisions behind a curtain. The rooms are very spacious and well-appointed, complete with a balcony overlooking the bay and a personal desktop computer at the desk. The bathroom had his and her sinks, a soaking tub and a separate shower - and is at least double the size of most hotel bathrooms. The staff was more than happy to accommodate us, even giving us a 3pm checkout when we requested it. They were shooting a music video in the lobby on the day of our checkout, which should tell you how glamorous this place is. The breakfast included in the rate was at their Area 31 restaurant and just included juice, coffee/tea and assorted pastries... so we decided to order an omelet as well to have a more balanced meal. The croissants were amazing, but breakfast could have been better overall. Also, parking is $32 a night which we thought was high, but you definitely need a car to go to Miami Beach, see the sites and go to restaurants. Right now, this area is pretty deserted (which might explain the deal we got), but it looks like there will be a Whole Foods, movie theatre, shops and restaurants just across the street. Great place... highly recommended if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “EPIC in every possible way...”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin07
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best looking, finest hotel I've ever been in, period. I have stayed at many upper class 4-5 star hotels and EPIC takes the prize, it is breathtaking and grand in every level, the staff is professional, serviceable, warm and very helpful, the rooms are very zen inspired and the amenities are superb, the restaurant Area 31 was delicious and prices were reasonable, the beds were super comfty, and THE VIEW....?, AMAZING!!! We stayed at a club level room with waterview, and the views are amazing at all hours, but specially at night were you can have a VERY romantic time if you please because everything is so private. I can't wait to go back, this IS MY FAVORITE HOTEL, no just in Miami, but overall!!! Advise; If you are into nightlife, try the lounge at the lobby level of EPIC, my wife and I made the mistake of going out to south beach (which was dead), and when we came back the lounge was ON and a lot of people were there, too bad we were too tired to go that night, but next time were there, we'll definitively try it.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch all the way, book it now!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three day stay at the Epic for our anniversary. I can't say enough about it. The rooms, the staff, the pool...EXCELLENT! The attention to detail and service were spectacular. Our room was wonderful and we had a beautiful view of the water. Our check in was prompt and everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and had great bath products. Now to the best part of all... Andrew the concierge was the best. He had everything set up for a nice relaxing, romantic, anniversary get away with no kids!! Wine in the room, great reservations for dinner, massages by the pool!!!! He got everything right. He had an answer or suggestion for everything and everywhere he suggested for dinner was right up our alley. GREAT JOB! Oscar was great too and always greeted us in the morning and always had my "to go" cup ready for the fantastic coffee! The hotel was close to Bayside, five minutes from SoBe and the club at the Epic was packed on Friday night. Thanks again to the staff at the Epic for making our get away one to remember for a long time. I can't wait to go back! I looked at a lot of properties before booking this, and I will be sure to go back! Look no further, the EPIC it is!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: Bought a package with airfare and hotel and chose the Epic Hotel. It is located right on Bay Biscayne. It is beautiful at night. The hotel is located in downtown Miami, so after business hours, there really is not any lifetime immediately around the hotel. Though if you walk a couple of blocks, there are plenty of restaurants and lounges. The restaurant Area 31 is pricey, but not as pricey as South Beach and the food is good. We received complimentary appetizers and glass of proseco for dinner. Daily cocktail hour has wonderful sangria. The service was exceptional...whatever we wanted it was provided. Our room had a computer with free internet, which you can print from and your documents are hand-delivered to your room. Recommend this hotel highly!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: kruggr
Reviews.Content: Have stayed with different Kimpton hotels before and was excited about the new property in Miami. The location is decent, employees are eager to help but the club that they have is a mess. We wanted to check out the lounge but was refused because we weren't dressed appropriately so we went to Mary Brickell Village (good alternative for the Brickell area). The worst part was when we returned late at night and saw a man throwing up in front of the lounge. Seems like they would rather service a guy who was not only dressed down but apparently with no class either. Wouldn't recommend this Kimpton hotel for a family oriented guest or business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jellybeans527
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my two nights at the Epic. The rooms were nicely decorated and spacious. The hotel was very quiet. I did not try any of the restaurant options. The gym was great. The pool area was pretty windy the whole time I was there, so I did not go out to it. The locations is not the most exciting, but you can easily get somewhere more fun in a cab. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: OzEnigma
Reviews.Content: Loved the spacious, well designed rooms, balconies and luxurious marble bathrooms with a big bath, rain shower and double basins. So much more value for money than staying in SoBe. I loved the sleek decor throughout the public areas. The service makes you feel like the staff really care. The 2 big pools surrounded by lovely day beds and cabanas are fantastic, as are the very pampering staff. It's so nice that they bring around fresh fruit and waters etc.. The whole hotel has lovely extra touches, including free drinks and nibbles in the evening. The bed was really comfortable. It cost about $25 in a taxi to get to SoBe, which we did each evening, but it was nice to stay away from the hustle and bustle. It was great as a couple as the hotel felt quite secluded and the pool was not very busy, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend it if you want to meet people. It may get busier once it has been open longer. However, the bar seems to get very busy on Friday and Saturday nights with a dressy crowd, presumably of locals. The rooms facing the water have mixed water and city views, but in fact the city views are quite interesting. We paid around $180 for the ocean view room on the net, but I believe the hotel would have matched any internet price and also given us loyalty program points and free wireless (which we didn't need given the computer in each room). The breakfasts were great - fluffy good quality croissants and divine chocolate buttermilk pancakes. The rooms service menu is wonderfully healthy. The food was good, but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KenGermany
Reviews.Content: Absolutely outstanding service and accommodations. The whole staff from the valet service to the room service personnel really made us feel like we were very special. Not one person gave us the feeling that we were in their way or were bothering them. The accomodations were one of the best I have ever seen. The food was excellent. If I could give this hotel a rating of 6 I would do it without hesitation. Thanks for making us feel special! Ken and Carmen S.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Trendy Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ob1reddmann
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a relaxing weekend stay at the Epic... what a beautiful, trendy, clean hotel! The staff were awesome. The drinks were amazing from the complimentary wine reception that featured sangria to the mojito I ordered poolside...the pool staff very helpful and friendly. Great conceirge staff! Thanks to everyone for making my stay a memorable and enjoyable one!

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like about the Epic?”
Reviews.Author: CAPTampa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Epic last weekend as part of their anniversary promotion for Kimpton In Touch members. This was an opportunity for us to take advantage of a great rate at an awesome hotel! I am familiar with the Kimpton level of service, but I have to say that the staff at the Epic far exceeded my expectations. Everything from check-in to the wine reception to the quality of the room was top notch. I am looking forward to my next stay in Miami and will definitely stay here again! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable style”
Reviews.Author: scuz01
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Epic for a one night stopover in Miami on the strength of the Trip Advisor reviews. It was great! From the friendly smiling staff who didn't bat an eyelid at our two jetlagged children dashing into the pool at night to the wonderful bathrooms - loved the open plan wall which allowed one to lie in the bath and watch tv! We were all too tired to dine in the restaurant so ordered a few dishes to snack on by the pool - these were fresh and delicious. Breakfast on the terrace was great - fab eggs benedict - before another swim. The cabanas by the pool are stylish and relaxing - we would have liked to have stayed longer. Would definitely recommend this place, both to couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “pampered in luxury”
Reviews.Author: jermlass
Reviews.Content: totally loved it, didn't want to leave but the $81/night deal was only good for 3 nights and i wanted to get at least 1 day & night on the beach. There's alot of construction closeby and a drawbridge but the rooms are the most soundproof that i've ever stayed in. The restaurant staff messed our order twice but the manager was reading my mind both times and personally delivered the food and put it on his tab. the pool deck attendant (tingting) is great. she showed us the free cabana that has a wii for hotel guests to entertain themselves during the 3 rainy days we had. they also gave us complimentary fruit kabobs poolside. the pool had several types of cabanas ranging from $200/day to free. the restaurant was very tasty and surprisingly cheap for a hotel restaurant. the room was huge, the bedding was amazing quality, the balcony was huge and clean, There was a free desktop with free wireless in the computer. The maid service brought us the NY Times, Miami Herald, free bottled water and apples everyday. the mini bar had alittle extra space to store some leftovers...Did i say the bedding was super soft, high quality and crisp. The standup rainfall showerhead was effecient and blissfull. the soaking tub was large enough for two. The lobby was amazing a day & night. The lounge was a hot spot on Fri & Sat nights so you don't really need to leave the hotel. But if u'd like, Little havana, Downtown and Bayside are w/in walking distance. The Midtown Mall and Sobe are short busrides away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, nice hotel, very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: roxanne07
Reviews.Content: I received a fabulous rate on the Epic and by looking at the reviews on here we choose to stay here for Memorial Day weekend. The hotel was very very nice. The rooms are big and comfy. We had a nice balcony, huge bathroom and the service was impeccable. If we needed anything, it was there within minutes from a pizza menu to when our key no longer worked because of a later than usual check out, to retrieving our car. The pool attendants were happy to cater to your every need, even filling your water without even asking - better than most restaurants. I am always impressed by the exceptional staff at Kimpton hotels and this was no exception! I have already recommended this hotel to friends. A+

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Epic truly is Epic!!!”
Reviews.Author: preciosa919
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for two nights prior to leaving on a cruise. The hotel is located a short drive from the Port of Miami and South Beach! We loved this hotel! The service was amazing! The staff was so attentive and professional. Even down to calling you a cab, and bringing you cold water as you waited outside - there was always someone nearby to make sure your needs were being attended to. The hotel also has a great "happy hour" each evening with free red and white wine and sangria, which was a great way to wind down after a long day at the beach! Our room on the 25th floor was spacious, beautiful and clean! The bed was so comfortable, and it also had a terrace with a great view of the city and the water! Also, the rooms have free internet access. I could go on and on about how much we loved this hotel. Our only regret is not staying longer! We had an amazing experience here, and we will definitely be returning to this, and other Kimpton hotels in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy, but desolate”
Reviews.Author: gingerwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kimpton for one night after a long flight from the UK (about a 15 minute drive from the airport). The hotel is amazingly plush and glamourous, but the location in the heart of the business district leaves it feeling a little bleak and impersonal. I would definitely recommend it for a one or two night stay, but not for a longer holiday - all the action is down on South Beach, which unfortunately is not walking distance from the hotel. On the plus side, the rooms were beautifully decorated, spacious and comfortable with free internet access , amazing views and a lovely bathroom. The 16th floor swimming pool is wonderful, again with stunning views across the bay - however, it can get very windy so worth bagging one of the private pool cabanas to shelter from the wind. Cocktails from the bar were large and expensive - we didn't eat in the hotel, but walked to a local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patty_T_S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!! I stayed there for two days and the experience was unique. The room was huge and clean, with a great view of the bay and the pool (18 th floor). Also it had a computer with free internet an TV plasma. The bathroom was stylish and had a glassless window through to the bedroom, had a rain shower and a tub. I didn`t go to the restaurant so I didn`t have the opportunity to try the food. I defintely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “If a picture says a thousand words, the service you get at EPIC is an story album”
Reviews.Author: DcRets
Reviews.Content: Fantanstic. Every person has a smile on their face. Every person has a desire to service you. Every person wants to make a difference in your stay. This hotel tells a great story. It is the BEST. Great location, Great views, Great food, Great service, Great people, Great rooms This location has it ALL---

Reviews.Title: “Epic Bliss!!”
Reviews.Author: TIBeachBrat
Reviews.Content: When my husband was booked on the Heat basketball gig and we got our confirmation for the hotel booking, I said "The Epic? What is an "Epic"? I've never heard of them." So I checked out the website. It sure looked nice, but I had not been and I didn't know anyone else that had been, so I really didn't know what to expect. From the moment we arrived, tired from the 5 hour drive, we were truly treated like royality by every staff member we encountered. Valet, Bell and Check-in were smooth, swift and friendly. Before we knew it, we were in our gorgeous room with a bucket of ice and a breath-taking view. We cleaned up in the soaking tub and spacious shower and then sat on our balcony to take in the cool Miami night. It didn't take long until the bed called to us to sink into it's luxurious softness. I have to say it was one of the best nights sleep I have ever had!! The next day as we left to walk down to the Arena, we asked directions from one of the staff. As he walked us down to the street to see us in the right direction, he asked us how our room was. We told him how lovely we thought it was and he asked if we had a coffee-maker. I told him we didn't and that we would love to have a coffee-maker in the room since we had already had to order two pots of coffee...it being one of our favorite drinks. A couple of hours later, after we had gotten back from our walk, our coffee-maker arrived - along with a lovely hand-written note and a plate of fruit. We were so stunningly touched by this. We are both well traveled and we travel quite a bit with my husband's job - but we have never had such friendly and personal service at any of the other hotels we have stayed in. The staff at the Epic really go above and beyond - and are the reason we will make a point of returning. While the hotel itself is really beautiful, it is the staff that sets it apart from all of the others. It was an absolutely Blissful week-end that we spent at the Epic. There IS still at least ONE hotel that understands that SERVICE makes all the difference in the world in a time when so many other hotels seem to have forgotten this important fact. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably trendy, contemporary, and serene”
Reviews.Author: SpotlightSP99
Reviews.Content: We decided to branch out from our usual hotel chain and try the EPIC. We were amazed from the lobby. This hotel is very contemporary, with great accents that make it different yet refreshing. The bathroom was stunning with an amazing shower and a tub I would actually consider getting into. The room itself was tasteful with a great balcony and view of downtown Miami, the pool and the river. We were on the 28th floor. The only drawback was a limited room service menu and limited hours of room service available in our opinion. The computer with free internet access was great. Great, quick valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Elegant, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Akba
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel. Quick valet service and check in. If you are taking a cruise like I was, this hotel is really close to the Port of Miami. The front desk staff (Ferah) was exceptional. The hotel itself is right on the ocean (no beach) in the center of Miami. The front desk was out of welcome gift bags for my kids so they went out and purchased some really cool robots and gave them to my kids on check out. We had a suite which was really nice and adequate for the entire family comfortably. The room was modern with a large flat screen TV, computer with internet, IPOD clock, very comfortable bed, etcâ€¦ The bathroom and amenities were great. If you can afford this hotel (or think you can afford this), I would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris32NY1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Epic Hotel from 4/14 â€“ 4/17 based primarily upon the reviews that were posted on this website. The prior reviews do not accurately reflect my visit to the Epic Hotel. First, DO NOT expect a five star hotel â€“ DO NOT expect a four star hotel. The Epic Hotel is a solid three star hotel that is located in the middle of a massive construction area. There is construction of a new Marriott Hotel next to the Epic Hotel, and there is an office building being constructed behind it. Construction noise permeates the premises from 7 AM through 6 PM. DONâ€™T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THE CONCIERGE FLOOR I stayed on the Concierge Floor. Again, DO NOT expect the same â€œconcierge serviceâ€� that exists on the Concierge Floor of a Ritz Carlton Hotel. No, this is ghetto concierge. Let me give you some examples -- In the â€œconcierge loungeâ€�, according to Epicâ€™s website and in-room brochures, there are supposed to be light snacks and drinks served throughout the day. You are even given a schedule of particular offerings in the concierge lounge. The â€œcontinental breakfastâ€� in the concierge lounge was standard fare â€“ bagels, cream cheese, lox, a few pastries, fruit and yogurt. Very much like what youâ€™d find at a Best Westernâ€™s â€œcontinental breakfastâ€�. There was also a lunch snack â€“ turkey sandwich finger food. There are wine and cocktails put out from 6 PM â€“ 8 PM. The one that intrigued me was â€œSweet Dreamsâ€� from 9PM â€“ 11PM. I asked the concierge, Gene, what â€œSweet Dreamsâ€� was â€“ he answered that there were lots of dessert treats and after dinner cordials for guests to enjoy. Here is a list of the â€œSweet Treatsâ€� that I saw when I went to the Sweet Treats on 4/15 â€“ No after dinner cordials (there were nine bottles of hard liquor â€“ vodka, gin, scotch, etc. â€“ that had been out all day.) There were two bottles of white wine that had similarly been out all day. The â€œsweetsâ€� were two bags of Doritos Tortilla Chips that had been opened and put on plates, six mini cookies on two plates (lined up three to a plate), pretzels on separate plates, and two mini-dark chocolate Milky Way Bars. That was the â€œSweet Treatâ€� on April 15. Simple answer, if you are going to stay at this hotel, do not waste your money on the Concierge Floor (almost triple the price of a standard room in the hotel). ROOMS In my estimation, there were about 60-75 guests in the hotel when I stayed there. Clearly, the hotel was pretty empty (since there are 411 guest rooms). The room that I stayed in had two double beds and a â€œwater viewâ€�. The view was actually of Biscayne Boulevard (US Route 1), but if you look through two buildings that are under construction, you can see a part of Biscayne Bay. There was a draw bridge on ground level (twenty nine stories below my room), but you could hear the warning bells ringing every time the draw bridge went up or down (approximately every Â½ hour). There was no dresser in the room. The only drawers to store clothing or personal belongings are in a night table between the two beds. The bathroom was very nice, but it is still a question to me why there is an open window and a curtain shade between the bathroom and the bedroom instead of a solid wall. There was a huge balcony overlooking Biscayne Boulevard that was approximately 6 feet wide and 15 feet long. Surprisingly, for a balcony that big, there is no lounge chair â€“ there are two chairs and a square table that take up about 3 feet of the balcony. Without any substantial furniture on the balcony, it is very desolate to stand out there and stare at the road below. During my stay, as with many of my hotel stays, I placed the loose change that I accumulate in a glass that I place near the telephone. After my first day, there was probably three to five dollars of loose change in the glass. The glass and the change were gone after the first time the maid cleaned the room. Buyer beware. Also, be careful of the staffâ€™s cleaning â€“ on my first night in this high end room, my foot was stabbed by a toe nail that was left in the carpet by a prior guest. AREA 31 DINING By far and away, the Dining Services offered at the Epic Hotel were the most disappointing. There is one restaurant named Area 31. The restaurant has an incredibly limited menu. Moreover, the bar in the restaurant has a very slim selection of cocktails. (During my stay, â€œThomasâ€� a member of the restaurant staff told me that â€œhe does not want to air the Hotelâ€™s Dirty Laundry, but there was a party over the weekend that used up most of the Hotelâ€™s liquor and the Hotel could not yet restock.â€� Why couldnâ€™t the hotel restock after nearly a week?) Now, I ordered several drinks that are common, but not that common to be used up by a single party â€“ Brandy Alexander (hotel had no more brandy), anisette (hotel out of that), sambuka (hotel out of that), crÃ¨me de menthe (either clear or green)(hotel out of that). When ordering, I was immediately told that the hotel was out of escargot â€“ not a big deal for me since I do not care for escargot. No other changes were noted on the menu. There were five fish dishes on the restaurant menu. I ordered Mahi Mahi at the suggestion of my waitress. About a half hour later, the Sous-Chef, Steven, came out of the kitchen and told me that there was no Mahi Mahi left. (By the way, I was the first person who came in for dinner at 6:05 PM. The restaurant opened at 6 PM for dinner. When did they run out of Mahi Mahi since I was the first guest for dinner?) I ended up having a grilled swordfish dinner that was dry and difficult to eat. In recognition of the immense screw ups by the restaurant staff, the Maitreâ€™d did not charge me for this dinner, but invited me back the next night when he was sure that all of the problems would be resolved. I went back the next night to try the only restaurant one more time. This time, I did not order any drinks from the bar, and stuck with water and iced tea. I ordered only what was recommended by the waitress after confirming that there was an ample supply of the selected food. There were no less than five staff people (some of whom I did not recognize) who continually interrupted the meal to have discussions about the prior nightâ€™s disaster and whether this night was any better. I ended up being more annoyed by the constant interruptions than anything else. I finished my entre, paid the bill, and left without any dessert. NOTE: The dessert menu is also extremely limited at Area 31 (four desserts in total). There are no â€œtraditionalâ€� desserts â€“ no cake of any kind, and no pie (except key lime pie). As a second note, if you order the chocolate moose, you may wish to make certain that you leave the whip cream topping off since it is grapefruit flavored, and sours the rest of the dessert. Finally, the charges for the food at this restaurant are not commensurate with other restaurant charges in the area. Dinner for a couple with a couple of glasses of wine/drinks will be approximately $200-$225. EATING AT THE POOL From 3 PM â€“ 5PM, the restaurant kitchen is closed, but you are supposedly able to get something to eat at one of the tables around the pool. (Now, this all comes from the same kitchen mind you.) I ordered a salad with a sliced chicken breast. My travelling companion ordered tuna salad. It took one hour and fifteen minutes for these two salads to arrive. After the extreme wait, I was expecting something extra-ordinary â€“ but, it was just a few field greens that you can get pre-packaged at any local food store, with oil and vinegar and a chicken breast cut up on top. By the way, I was not alone in the wait â€“ another person in the pool area arrived at the same time I did, and he had to wait the same time period for his salad to arrive. Due to the delay, the waitress ended up giving a complementary round of drinks to compensate for the delay in receiving food. STAFF Most of the reviews on this site talk about how wonderful the staff is. The staff constantly asked if there was anything that they could do to make your individual visit more special. While generally speaking, it is true that the staff is pleasant, they are extremely slow in responding. It is my belief that the staffâ€™s pleasant behavior is used as a cover for the many short comings of this hotel. Financially, let me give you an idea about the cost of this hotel -- three nights at this hotel cost me $1500. There is no doubt in my mind that my money could have been better spent at any number of other hotels in Miami or nearby Fort Lauderdale. It does not make sense for me to endure the frustration of staying at the Epic Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Great alternative to Miami Beach hotels”
Reviews.Author: VegasMiamicouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in mid April one night. I used to live in Miami Beach and travel there frequently. This place is better than the beach hotels that charge double. Would rather stay there and take the short cab ride to the beach. Value for the money is absolutely outstanding. Booked a basic room and was upgraded to water view, meaning of the port and all the way to Miami Beach. Generous balcony with table and chairs. Really cool spot. I have paid several times more in town for much less. The room service menu is limited and they could use a few more TV channels, but other than that the place is perfect. Staff is more like one would expect at the Beverly Hills Hotel or Plaza thenee in Paris than something at these prices. Next time I go to Miami I will take my wife there and book a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable in every way...”
Reviews.Author: clauner28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely wonderful!! Very modern and trendy. Great if you are looking to stay in downtown Miami rather than the beach scene. Although the beaches are only a quick drive away if that is what you are looking for. i did not eat in the restaurant at the hotel but there were a ton of restaurants in walking distance. However, we did partake in the room service breakfast and my husband is still talking about the delicious bagel and lox he ordered. It came with like 8 huge pieces of lox! The food was delicious! The service was unbelievable- quick and incredibly friendly. They give you what you want before you even ask for it!! The service at the front desk when we arrived was superb and by the pool they were on top of everything without being in our face. And the infinity pools were refreshing and even heated. And the views!! WOW!! We had a balcony that overlooked the Biscayne Bay and it was unreal. We ate our breakfast out there every morning. And the goldfish in the room was a very cute and unique touch. We also loved that each room had a computer with free internet access. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bath tub in the bathroom with the partition looking into the bedroom was very cool to relax in! Would definitely visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, annoying staff”
Reviews.Author: juanio
Reviews.Content: The Epic is a very modern and pleasantly looking hotel. The facilities are very nice, the views are great, etc. However I found the staff VERY poorly trained. It seemed that just by smiling and repeating my surname every second word, everything would be fine. Great service needs to be seamless and professional. Unnoticeable. It annoys me when people prettend to know me after 2 mins of hadnling my credit card, and be artificially nice. If I was going there every second week, I would expect the people at the reception to know me and treat me accordingly. But not having stayed there before, I just want professionalism. After already a few months open, there are many things staff does not know or is not trained for. An example of this was patent during breakfast. We had booked continental breakfast and were given coupons at check in to be presented at the restaurant. Apparently no one knew how things worked, since we were presented with an "a la carte" menu. We insisted that we just wanted the continental breakfast and our server mentioned that we could have anything a la carte for a value of $25. Nowhere could I find anything like that mentioned (neither in the coupon nor in the menu itself). Finally some manager came and explain that we could have continental breakfast. However when asked what items we could choose from she just said: "coffe, juice, toasts and pastries". She said it in a way implying that continental breakfast was the "spartan option just to get along with people coming with coupons to her restaurant". She did not offer the chance to choose what pastries we wanted to have, how many, etc. The breakfast at Fairfield Inn was definitely more varied. It was obvious to me that either they didn't know what to do (which I doubt) or they do not mention anything about continental breakfast in hope that people would just order a la carte and spend over $30 for breakfast. Worth to mention is that service was poor to average for us, but we noticed that the 3 tables closest to us had problems with their orders and seemed very unpleased (a family of 4 was looking very unhappy with the food/service, another table of two were sending dishes back for getting something they hadn't ordered, and some others were muttering about the sluggish service as well). To top is off, the night before we asked the concierge for a good seafood restaurant and she recommended Quinn's (in South Beach), which turned out to be a very bad choice indeed. Overall a nice hotel. I don't know if I would stay there again. I usually stay at Marriott owned hotels, I'm a gold member and no one tries to patronize me by repeating my name over and over. Appreciation is demonstrated by actions, not by words. When back in Miami I would probably shop arround again for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Peaches0422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Miami for our 20th wedding anniversary and the Epic Hotel was the perfect place to stay. Andrew, the concierge at a bottle of chilled champagne in the room as requested by my husband and there were cocolate covered strawberries and truffles also present along with a very nice note. Andrew could not have been nicer and our interaction with EVERY single person on staff was incredible. Not a grumpy or "short' one in the entire group. They called us by name and frequently inquired about our stay. The room was perfect with the most comfortable bed in the world. My husband's laptop's keyboard was malfunctioning so having a PC in the room was fabulous. We had a beautiful waterview and a lovely balcony where we sipped our champagne and watched the boats. The room was very trendy and chic with high end toiletries and great linens. The 5pm wine hour was delightful and my new favorite beverage is now Prosecco!! YUM! What a nice way to meet fellow guests and other members of the staff. After a day at the beach, we were too tired to go out and had a delicious room service experience. We had the Cuban Panini and the Mahi Mahi sandwhich with bacon and a spicy aoli. Even the fries were hot and tasty. We also attended the Sunday Brunch (it was Easter) and enjoyed it immensely .Of course, the all you could drink Mimosa, Bellini's and bloody Mary's could have had some thing to do with that! They also had a lovely jazz band playing on the balcony where we sat. The pool staff were also great and kept our water with fresh slices of fruit cool and tasty. It's nice that they have two different pools set at different temperatures. There are many nice restaurants close enough to walk to and we just hopped the C bus to go to South Beach. It was a wonderful stay and the Epic is now the ONLY place we would ever consider staying. Thank-you to such a nice staff!!! I can only imagine what it will be like when the Spa opens. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jstarks03
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with my recent stay at Epic. I have never been to Miami before, but am already thinking about a return trip. The room was large, clean and had a tremendous view of the bay (23rd floor). The room had all of the amenities you would expect plus a computer, large balcony and the most comfortable bed. My wife and I ordered room service each morning and ate on the balcony which was amazing. The highlight of this hotel is certainly the pool area. The 16th floor opens up to two large infinity pools (which were heated at different temps) and a ton of choices to relax in. There were cabanas, lounge chairs, couches, love seats, ect. We were at the hotel for 3 days and pretty much tried each spot once. There are pool attendants who are quick to refresh your towels and waitresses coming around often for drinks. The best part of being out there is the little extras that really made the trip for us. They brought us a complimentary fruit plate, came around with sun tan lotion and had fresh towels at your location before you even came out of the pool. This seemed to be the "go above and beyond" attitude throughout the staff at the hotel, from the concierge to the valet staff. I would certainly stay here again and would recommend it friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Virtually faultless”
Reviews.Author: mb9099
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in March 2009. I booked it through hotwire so didn't really know what to expect. It's near the Bayfront park which has shops and restaurants built around a marina. I was really wowed by this hotel. It's not just that it's plush, the service was also exceptional. When we arrived, as our car was taken to be parked ($32ish per night), we were offered a cool facecloth and a drink of water. The room was great, and had a view over some of the pools on a lower floor (perhaps the ones belonging to the apartments). I was impressed that as well as having wi-fi, there was also a PC in our room. The bathroom was very stylish and had a glassless window through to the bedroom although there was a blind you could pull down for privacy. On our way out at around 5pm we were offered a free glass of wine in the lobby. I think we probably had most of a bottle between the two of us. When we returned, our bed had been turned down and we had a weather forecast for the next day. In the morning we went to the outdoor pools on the 16th floor. There were two heated infinity pools and a variety of sun loungers/seating. Towels were also available. The staff really stood out. They seemed genuinely committed to ensuring guests had everything they wanted. I would never normally be willing to pay full price for this class of hotel but this one might just be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Hotel - other hotels take note!”
Reviews.Author: kecoco
Reviews.Content: The Epic Hotel recently opened in Miami at the corner of Brickell Avenue and 3rd on the Miami River and is an easy walk to downtown or the Brickell corridor for a large selection of restaurants and bars. The hotel is beautiful and extremely well designed. Car valet and check - in went smoothly and quickly. Without knowing it the front desk upgraded us to the club level - nice surprise that was unexpected. The club level is the 29th and 30th floor of the hotel with the club lounge located on the 29th. Hallways and rooms are beautifully decorated. Our room was furnished with king bed, inroom computer system, large balcony and great bath with double vanity, shower and separate tub. Bath amenities were Acqua de Parma which I have never seen at any hotel other than the Four Seasons in Milan. Quite an extravagance. Dining at Area 31 the inhouse restaurant was really good including the staff. I travel to Miami quite frequently and stay at alot of differenct hotels and never have I met a more professional consistently nice group of people. It truly was amazing! Whoever does the employee training at this hotel should be hired by their competitors for training. One downside - there is a problem with noise in the rooms coming from the hallway, adjoining room and the river bridge. My recommendation would be to request a non adjoining room unless your family has both rooms and ask for a room either on the downtown side of the hotel or away from the Miami River Bridge as far as possible. But, I repeat .........this is a really nice hotel for Miami.
